column8:
Most of the reviews about this game are around having to make an account to launch and play, it's 2025, every major publisher requires this. It's daft, but them's the breaks.

I have chosen to leave a negative review of this game for a few reasons:

1. When you want to change the graphics settings, the game will crash. It doesn't just hang and take a minute to change them, it straight-up CTDs. So you're stuck playing the first mission in 800*600 and minimum graphics, even if you change them using driver suite software.

2. The new mechanics force you to choose a class. Support, Offence, or Defence, and build units. Wouldn't be an issue but you only have a limited number of swaps per instance. So if you're playing solo and are new to the game, this will get you caught out at least once.

3. Camera zoom is way too high. This is personal preference, of course, but it doesn't allow you to really see much going on outside of the immediate zone of control, severely hampering tactical awareness.

4. Story writing is bad. Just poorly written, badly acted, and not immersive in the way the older games were.

Overall, pick this up on sale, have a laugh for nostalgia's sake, then forget you own it. Never buy at full-price.

1. When you want to change the graphics settings, the game will crash. It doesn't just hang and take a minute to change them, it straight-up CTDs. So you're stuck playing the first mission in 800*600 and minimum graphics, even if you change them using driver suite software.

2. The new mechanics force you to choose a class. Support, Offence, or Defence, and build units. Wouldn't be an issue but you only have a limited number of swaps per instance. So if you're playing solo and are new to the game, this will get you caught out at least once.

3. Camera zoom is way too high. This is personal preference, of course, but it doesn't allow you to really see much going on outside of the immediate zone of control, severely hampering tactical awareness.

4. Story writing is bad. Just poorly written, badly acted, and not immersive in the way the older games were.

Overall, pick this up on sale, have a laugh for nostalgia's sake, then forget you own it. Never buy at full-price.

column8: This game is awful. First you have to enter you EA account password twice every time you switch in on and then you're playing something that is called Command & Conquer and has Kane in it, but it nothing like C&C. No tiberium, not refineries, no structures to build anything. You get a crawler, that spews out units (5-6) until it reaches limit. Enemy usually has several crawlers and they spit out units quicker than you can kill them... C&C was all about building your base, slowly builidng up defences and units and then killing off the enemy. There is none of that here.

I couldn't do it. I bought the complete C&C collection during a steam sale and have been slowly making my way through the other games, but this one was just......why? The acting felt forced and sub-par, who the hell is Gideon, why are we changing up the MCV and unit deployments on the supposedly last game of the series when it has been (mostly) the same for the whole series? Seriously, different classes for MCV and only able to have one at a time? Yeah, sure it speeds things along but that's just forcing everyone to play a rush/blitz style. I made it through the GDI campaign, but I can't go through with the nod campaign. Everything feels so wrong and I need to just uninstall and move on to Red Alert 3.

Let's put it this way: the Command & Conquer series is a classic, with Red Alert being a classic among classics, and then Red Alert III completely killed it.

Tiberium Wars is also a classic, especially CC3, but CC4 not only killed CC, but also nailed 16 mammoths to the coffin, making it impossible to pull out.

A bunch of gameplay mechanics with a bunch of poor entry mechanics.

column9:
It's 2025:
- Forced to log in when launching the game, the "create account" button leads to a page that doesn't allow you to create your account.
- After finding my login details, I log in, and the game launches (in 800 x 600 lol)
- Cutscene
- Login screen in the game, with the same login details... why?
- I go to the options to change the resolution: the game systematically crashes.

EA is showing its true colors once again with this production that simply won't launch.

column8:
Back in the day I purchased the physical version of the game, and played a lot.

I can't deny that this entry in the game series differs a lot from the classic C&C formula. I can't deny it and I'll not attempt to deny it. If you can't stand such difference, then go away. This game is not for you.

I can recommend this game, however, because I liked it. Yes, it's different, but in some twisted way, I liked what I saw. I played and finished the physical version of the game a couple of times. That's why I can recommend it even when I haven't played much in Steam.

column8:
[h1] Command & Conquer™ 4 Tiberian Twilight[/h1]

[b]I know it's not you Commander, but whoever is responsible for this treachery will feel my wrath! In the meantime, obliterate what remains of GDI. Nuke them, if you wish![/b]
Kane Lives Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars.

[b]Once again the world is quick to bury me... How could my own brothers believe what transpired at Temple Prime did not unfold exactly as I planned. 
Of course I could not have planned for an ambush BY MY OWN FORCES! Of all of Kilian's offenses, and they are legion, her proclamation that the Visitors are a greater enemy than GDI is an affront for everything. 
I have planned for the Brotherhood! 
For this sin she must be punished, you will take a team of your best soldiers and storm our Australian base. Kilian is dug in there, capture her alive if possible but spare no one in her charge.[/b]
Kane Lives Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars.

[b]I still can't believe we're helping GDI.[/b]
Nod units

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3538291522

[b]Face what, Prophet? I don't fear the empty words of yesterday's man.
Gideon Anti-Kane Nod Separatists[/b]

[h2]História[/h2]
[b] Cerca de 15 anos depois Tiberium Wars e 10 anos depois dos eventos de Kane's Wrath.
Em 2062, o Tiberium espalhou-se de forma descontrolada e ameaça a vida na Terra, com previsão de tornar o planeta inabitável até 2068. 
A humanidade encontra-se à beira da extinção..
Kane líder Brotherhood of Nod (Nod), chega à sede da GDI com uma proposta irrecusável, com o artefato Tacitus e os recursos da GDI para construir uma rede que controla o Tiberium.
Assim juntos criaram: Tiberium Control Network (TCN), com o objectivo de controlar o Tiberium e transformá-lo numa fonte de energia barata. 
A campanha em si começa 15 anos após a formação da aliança, quando a Rede de Controle de Tiberium se aproxima da conclusão.
No entanto, extremistas de ambas as facções GDI & Nod começam a causar agitação, o que desencadeia a Quarta Guerra de Tiberium.
O jogador assume o papel do Comandante: Parker, oficial militar da GDI que recebe um implante óptico após ferimentos em batalha que teve uma perca total da visão. 
O jogador tem a possibilidade de ajudar os extremistas da GDI da Coronel Louise James ou as forças leais a Nod de Kane na Quarta Guerra do Tiberium.[/b]

[b]Commander, you are quite a adapt leader, but you should know there is much more to this war and to this Tiberium Network than what's has been revealed to you. 
Let me show YOU the truth.
Join me and leave the ignorance of GDI behind you.
Kane[/b]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3537585999

[h2] Pontos Positivos: [/h2]
[list]
    [*][b]Live‑action cutscenes incluem novamente Kane interpretado por Joe Kucan.[/b]
    [*][b]Som das unidades e tropas continua com a sua qualidade esperada.[/b]
    [*][b]Pela 1 vez [spoiler]sou casado em C&C com Lillian Parker finalmente sei o que é estar casado.[/spoiler][/b]
    [*][b]Jogabilidade simples e fácil utilização, menus acesso rápidos.[/b]
    [*][b]Cada faction, GDI & NOD tem 3 tipos The Crawler (officially named the "MCV Mk VII) pode oferecer diferentes tipo de combate e táticas: Offense Class, Defense Class & Support Class.(nada de especial podes alterar a tua estratégia durante o combate a qualquer momento.)[/b]
    [*] [b]Worldbuilder para quem quer construir o seu próprio mapa.[/b]
[/list]

[b]You are all so... fragile.
Kane[/b]

[h2] Pontos Negativos: [/h2]
[list]
    [*][b]Renovação total e o abandono da base building agora temos The Crawler que constrói só unidades & defesas, depois somos acompanhados por um progresso de XP para desbloquear novas tropas que funciona para a Campanha & Multiplayer.[/b]
    [*][b]Star Wars tão simples quanto isso as unidades parecem quase todas equipadas com lazer,(ridículo) para parecer mais futurista do que nunca depois mesmo os sons e movimentações,[u]parece uma cambada de trapalhões com lazer por todo o lado[/u].[/b]
    [*][b]Outra em relação as unidades e o seu tamanho são muito maiores do que os anteriores jogos devido ao facto de ser menos e poder ter menos unidades, visualmente não e atrativo nem em design, os avatares (NOD) são tão estúpido para dar um exemplo.[/b]
    [*][b]Estruturas, sem sentido visualmente não são atractivas assim como as unidades um dos problemas graves neste jogo.[/b]
    [*][b]Ambientes & Cenários: vira o disco e toca o mesmo não tem animais selvagens ou pessoas muito vazio e repetitivo, não há diversidade entre cenários.[/b]
    [*][b]Enquanto a banda sonora mais fraca de sempre parece muito espacial do universo Star Wars.[/b]
    [*][b]Skirmish pela primeira vez podes ganhar só a controlar as Tiberium Control Network até fazeres um limite de pontos.[/b]
    [*][b]Outra em relação as unidades que demorar muito mais tempo a disparar a realizar disparos e tem algumas unidades que tens de fazer reload mas  automático claro.(parece que estas a jogar em Slow motion.[/b]
    [*][b]Resources não há, agora tens de controlar o Tiberium Control Network (TCN) controlas estas zonas ou torres como quiseres chamar Tiberium Control Network (TCN) [/b]
    [*][b]Always-online: sim está aqui tens de fazer login antes de abrires o jogo e dentro do jogo, depois se te acontecer perderes a ligação durante uma missão da campanha (offline) e não salvas-te antes de acabares a missão podes perder tudo e voltar a fazer, mas atenão es avisado que perdes-te a ligação.[/b]
    [*][b]Cutscenes são fracas comparado com os antecederes os actores não tiveram a altura do desafio e não deixam a sua marca e são genéricos, Louise James acaba por ser a personagem por detrás da lendária fação GDI sem caráter sempre com a mesma atitude não cumpre o seu papel só procura vingança e faz de tudo para alcançar, depois temos do outro lado Gideon Nod Separatists que também querem se vingar contra o falso Profeta kane e por se juntar a GDI, não consegues te simpatizar com ninguém a não ser kane porque ninguém os outro só passam no ecrá rápido e fui embora, outra coisa os cenários das cutscenes não mudam só as cores de fundo nada mais e os logotipos nas roupas GDI o fundo e azul e Nod é vermelho, roupas básicas e maus atores e mal penteados (exemplo: Chavra NOD) com falhas nos pequenos pormenores.[/b]
[/list]

[b]He was not yours to take!
Kane[/b]

[h3] Nota: [/h3]

[b]Aconteceu várias vezes situações de loop comigo e não saia daquilo era até um desistir daquela posição e abandonar depois tinha uma unidade contra mim [u]Cyborg Commando[/u] que tinha o poder de apoderar-se de uma unidade tua e assim sucessivamente, tornava-se complicado elimina-lo devido a distancie e as unidades demorava tempo as disparar.[/b]

[b]You looking good. Here, see for yourself.
Kane[/b]

[h3] Resumo: [/h3]
[b] Infelizmente não respeita o nome nem a honra do Command & Conquer depois do Red Alert 3 veio está coisa.
Levei anos e foram várias as tentativas para o jogar, mesmo só pela história que não e nada de especiais.
Devido ao facto de ser um jogo triste e inacabado, não é digno do seu nome e legado.
Tenho e vou ter sempre respeito por C&C o meu 1 jogo na sega saturn e um dos melhores jogo de estratégia ainda nós dias de hoje difícil de igualar, uma franquia lendária no coração dos fans.[/b]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3533322453

[b]I miss you when you are on duty.
Lillian Parker[/b]

[h3][b]Final grade[/b][/h3]
[spoiler][b]Splatter
★★☆☆☆[/b][/spoiler]
column9:
[h1] Command & Conquer™ 4 Tiberian Twilight[/h1]

[b]I know it's not you Commander, but whoever is responsible for this treachery will feel my wrath! In the meantime, obliterate what remains of GDI. Nuke them, if you wish![/b]
Kane Lives Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars.

[b]Once again the world is quick to bury me... How could my own brothers believe what transpired at Temple Prime did not unfold exactly as I planned. 
Of course I could not have planned for an ambush BY MY OWN FORCES! Of all of Kilian's offenses, and they are legion, her proclamation that the Visitors are a greater enemy than GDI is an affront for everything. 
I have planned for the Brotherhood! 
For this sin she must be punished, you will take a team of your best soldiers and storm our Australian base. Kilian is dug in there, capture her alive if possible but spare no one in her charge.[/b]
Kane Lives Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars.

[b]I still can't believe we're helping GDI.[/b]
Nod units

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3538291522

[b]Face what, Prophet? I don't fear the empty words of yesterday's man.
Gideon Anti-Kane Nod Separatists[/b]

[h2]História[/h2]
[b] Cerca de 15 anos depois Tiberium Wars e 10 anos depois dos eventos de Kane's Wrath.
Em 2062, o Tiberium espalhou-se de forma descontrolada e ameaça a vida na Terra, com previsão de tornar o planeta inabitável até 2068. 
A humanidade encontra-se à beira da extinção..
Kane líder Brotherhood of Nod (Nod), chega à sede da GDI com uma proposta irrecusável, com o artefato Tacitus e os recursos da GDI para construir uma rede que controla o Tiberium.
Assim juntos criaram: Tiberium Control Network (TCN), com o objectivo de controlar o Tiberium e transformá-lo numa fonte de energia barata. 
A campanha em si começa 15 anos após a formação da aliança, quando a Rede de Controle de Tiberium se aproxima da conclusão.
No entanto, extremistas de ambas as facções GDI & Nod começam a causar agitação, o que desencadeia a Quarta Guerra de Tiberium.
O jogador assume o papel do Comandante: Parker, oficial militar da GDI que recebe um implante óptico após ferimentos em batalha que teve uma perca total da visão. 
O jogador tem a possibilidade de ajudar os extremistas da GDI da Coronel Louise James ou as forças leais a Nod de Kane na Quarta Guerra do Tiberium.[/b]

[b]Commander, you are quite a adapt leader, but you should know there is much more to this war and to this Tiberium Network than what's has been revealed to you. 
Let me show YOU the truth.
Join me and leave the ignorance of GDI behind you.
Kane[/b]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3537585999

[h2] Pontos Positivos: [/h2]
[list]
    [*][b]Live‑action cutscenes incluem novamente Kane interpretado por Joe Kucan.[/b]
    [*][b]Som das unidades e tropas continua com a sua qualidade esperada.[/b]
    [*][b]Pela 1 vez [spoiler]sou casado em C&C com Lillian Parker finalmente sei o que é estar casado.[/spoiler][/b]
    [*][b]Jogabilidade simples e fácil utilização, menus acesso rápidos.[/b]
    [*][b]Cada faction, GDI & NOD tem 3 tipos The Crawler (officially named the "MCV Mk VII) pode oferecer diferentes tipo de combate e táticas: Offense Class, Defense Class & Support Class.(nada de especial podes alterar a tua estratégia durante o combate a qualquer momento.)[/b]
    [*] [b]Worldbuilder para quem quer construir o seu próprio mapa.[/b]
[/list]

[b]You are all so... fragile.
Kane[/b]

[h2] Pontos Negativos: [/h2]
[list]
    [*][b]Renovação total e o abandono da base building agora temos The Crawler que constrói só unidades & defesas, depois somos acompanhados por um progresso de XP para desbloquear novas tropas que funciona para a Campanha & Multiplayer.[/b]
    [*][b]Star Wars tão simples quanto isso as unidades parecem quase todas equipadas com lazer,(ridículo) para parecer mais futurista do que nunca depois mesmo os sons e movimentações,[u]parece uma cambada de trapalhões com lazer por todo o lado[/u].[/b]
    [*][b]Outra em relação as unidades e o seu tamanho são muito maiores do que os anteriores jogos devido ao facto de ser menos e poder ter menos unidades, visualmente não e atrativo nem em design, os avatares (NOD) são tão estúpido para dar um exemplo.[/b]
    [*][b]Estruturas, sem sentido visualmente não são atractivas assim como as unidades um dos problemas graves neste jogo.[/b]
    [*][b]Ambientes & Cenários: vira o disco e toca o mesmo não tem animais selvagens ou pessoas muito vazio e repetitivo, não há diversidade entre cenários.[/b]
    [*][b]Enquanto a banda sonora mais fraca de sempre parece muito espacial do universo Star Wars.[/b]
    [*][b]Skirmish pela primeira vez podes ganhar só a controlar as Tiberium Control Network até fazeres um limite de pontos.[/b]
    [*][b]Outra em relação as unidades que demorar muito mais tempo a disparar a realizar disparos e tem algumas unidades que tens de fazer reload mas  automático claro.(parece que estas a jogar em Slow motion.[/b]
    [*][b]Resources não há, agora tens de controlar o Tiberium Control Network (TCN) controlas estas zonas ou torres como quiseres chamar Tiberium Control Network (TCN) [/b]
    [*][b]Always-online: sim está aqui tens de fazer login antes de abrires o jogo e dentro do jogo, depois se te acontecer perderes a ligação durante uma missão da campanha (offline) e não salvas-te antes de acabares a missão podes perder tudo e voltar a fazer, mas atenão es avisado que perdes-te a ligação.[/b]
    [*][b]Cutscenes são fracas comparado com os antecederes os actores não tiveram a altura do desafio e não deixam a sua marca e são genéricos, Louise James acaba por ser a personagem por detrás da lendária fação GDI sem caráter sempre com a mesma atitude não cumpre o seu papel só procura vingança e faz de tudo para alcançar, depois temos do outro lado Gideon Nod Separatists que também querem se vingar contra o falso Profeta kane e por se juntar a GDI, não consegues te simpatizar com ninguém a não ser kane porque ninguém os outro só passam no ecrá rápido e fui embora, outra coisa os cenários das cutscenes não mudam só as cores de fundo nada mais e os logotipos nas roupas GDI o fundo e azul e Nod é vermelho, roupas básicas e maus atores e mal penteados (exemplo: Chavra NOD) com falhas nos pequenos pormenores.[/b]

column8:
tl;dr: Is it worth to play for the story? barely yes, just because of Kane's existence, though there is no new revelation. Otherwise absolutely no, not worth it. Don't expect new lore details, everything is new and unrelated to previous lore.
---
Finished the campaign recently on both sides. I was about to uninstall twice during that, but i really wanted to at least see the "story". I finished the campaign without using high end tech like super weapons because it's all locked behind rank ups. It's just bad. For anyone who is wondering if it's worth playing just for the story, i'd say "barely yes" and that's mainly just because of Kane, might be nostalgia, idk.

There is nothing interesting about the story, no new relevant lore pieces or discoveries except the portal, which is sadly totally out of place, in it's appearence and it's purpose in the story (no purpose). Everything that appears in C&C 4 is "new" and absolutely has no ties to previous lore, again, except Kane.

column8: Like many others have said, this game has had everything that made C&C what it was gutted from it.  Even looking at the gameplay itself, removed from all the baggage of being an incredible letdown to the end of the Tiberian Timeline, it's just not fun.  The XP system sucks, the gameplay is no fun, the story is nonsense, and it still remains the only C&C game I've played that I have decided to not finish.  I just couldn't do it, it is devoid of the ability to entertain.

column8:
I want to kill myself after seeing the bug that kept the game running while it bugged out and I can't close it with Task Manager or even trying to AltTab back to the game. This is definitely suicidal...
The Command Screen, they don't even let me zoom out to the better angle we have in the past series where we can see a larger portion of the map. Every time you play, you have to log in and play online even for a single player campaign...Nope, I want to kill myself when I see the bug where the unit stuck in middle of nowhere with nothing around it...it just stuck. I PRESS DELETE TO KILL IT and myself.

Absolutely killing my passion for RTS games. This is an amazing disaster that kills passion and dream. I am calling my local suicide hotline, thanks EA.

column8:
我很少骂一款游戏
我更少因为想骂一款游戏而专门买了这款游戏
但是C&C4做到了
作为命令与征服中泰伯利亚系列的完结之作，其成功的把这一个最伟大的RTS系列之一，和魔兽争霸，星际争霸，帝国时代等经典系列并列的经典IP彻底钉死在棺材板里了
作为命令与征服的作品，删去了资源采集加上了人口限制，我玩命征就是冲着你没有人口上限来的，再说命征的电力系统不也是另外一种博弈手段？你命征4直接不伦不类的，我玩的不是星际争霸，是泰伯利亚
EA这群家伙是怎么想出来的？作为2010年的游戏，质量甚至没2008年的红警3与2007年的C&C3泰伯利亚战争，甚至是2003年的命令与征服:将军强
我真的想不明白，我真的想不通为什么EA总是能做到取其糟粕去其精华的
致敬传奇IP毁灭者EA
column9: I rarely criticize a game. Even more rarely do I buy it specifically because I want to criticize it. But Command & Conquer 4 nailed it. As the final installment in the Tiberium Wars series in Command & Conquer, it successfully nailed one of the greatest RTS series, a classic IP that stands alongside classics like Warcraft, StarCraft, and Age of Empires. As a Command & Conquer game, it removed resource gathering and added a population limit. I play Destiny simply for the unlimited population. Besides, isn't Destiny's power system just another way to play the game? Destiny 4 is completely out of place. I'm not playing StarCraft, I'm playing Tiberium Wars. What on earth did these guys at EA come up with? As a 2010 game, its quality isn't even as good as Red Alert 3 (2008), C&C3 Tiberium Wars (2007), or even Command & Conquer: Generals (2003). I really don't understand. I really can't understand why EA always manages to take the bad and discard the good. A tribute to the legendary IP, Destroyer EA.

We can only hope for a rebirth of the series in the form of a reboot or a remake, but unfortunately, we are unlikely to see this.

column8: C'est le moins bon des command and conquer. Les qualités du jeu sont les cinématiques et sa bande son qui restent très bonne même en 2025. Les défaults sont les animations des unités et le gameplay: système de redéploiement de crawler raté, limitation en supply et suppression de la récolte de tiberium. Le manque de contenu sur le jeu est également à souligner (7 missions nod + 10 missions gdi)
column9: This is the worst of the command and conquer games. The game's strengths are the cinematics and its soundtrack, which remain very good even in 2025. The weaknesses are the unit animations and the gameplay: a failed crawler redeployment system, limited supply, and the removal of tiberium harvesting. The lack of content in the game is also noteworthy (7 Nod missions + 10 GDI missions).

column8: This game is ridiculously complicated to start. Mostly EA's fault. Signed into my EA account after having a difficult time installing and getting it to run in the first place. I was forced to make a username for multiplayer before I could play the campaign, then I was prompted to sign in again after it randomly closed. I made a username again and was prompted to sign in yet again but this time I was told the password was incorrect. After all of this and the fact that it was super wonky after install in the first place I decided it wasnt worth the effort. What a disgrace to the as a follow up to Tiberium Wars. Dont even bother. As a side note, companies should be sued for forcing you to make an account or sign into it in order to use a product you already purchased AFTER you purchased it. You should have to go through the effort of making an account so its clear that is a requirement for the use of the product. Its making me question ever buying an EA game. This might be the final straw. I dont know if I could possibly recommend a game less.

column8: Hahahahaha, this game is no good at all. It's such a shame, really, that something like this exists. Now I understand why Electronic Arts bundled the entire Command and Conquer series. Why does the UI color blend so badly with the game world? That’s a rookie mistake. And to make things worse, I didn’t even realize you have to level up to unlock units—previous C&C games just gave you access to everything from the start. On top of that, it has classes, and it locks you out of everything. And the worst of it all, besides accepting the EULA, you also need an EA Account, hahahaha. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! You have to log in every single time you start the game app, and log in once more in-game. Another thing I've noticed: I think the game was meant to be a mobile game. I don't have anything to back it up, but that UI and those character models give off that vibe.
column9: Hahahahaha, this game is no good at all. It's such a shame, really, that something like this exists. Now I understand why Electronic Arts bundled the entire Command and Conquer series. Why does the UI color blend so badly with the game world? That’s a rookie mistake. And to make things worse, I didn’t even realize you have to level up to unlock units—previous C&C games just gave you access to everything from the start. On top of that, it has classes, and it locks you out of everything. And the worst of it all, besides accepting the EULA, you also need an EA Account, hahahaha. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! You have to log in every single time you start the game app, and log in once more in-game. Another thing I've noticed: I think the game was meant to be a mobile game. I don't have anything to back it up, but that UI and those character models give off that vibe.

column8:
Esto se siente y se juega como un juego movil, nada de la sensasión típica de un RTS de toda la vida, para un juego movil esta muy entretenido, pero para un juego de PC deja mucho que desear. 

No hay extracción de recursos
Una cantidad limitada de construcción
Ejercitos enanos
Unidades con un sistema de armas y armaduras tipo RPG que complican la jugabilidad.
column9:
This feels and plays like a mobile game, none of the typical feel of a traditional RTS. For a mobile game, it's very entertaining, but for a PC game, it leaves a lot to be desired.

No resource extraction
Limited building capacity
Dwarven armies
Units with an RPG-like weapon and armor system that complicates gameplay.

column8:
Only rating the single player campaign

“Tiberium Twilight” is the last instalment of the famous Command & Conquer real time strategy series. Officially dubbed “C&C 4”, it’s actually number 9 if counting all the main games bearing the title (including the first-person shooter “Renegade” and excluding add-ons). Looking back at a long history and tradition of fast-paced base building, resource gathering and amassing big armies, at least in the 2D isometric games. The latest ones were trying to bring more of the “rock-paper-scissors” mechanics into the gameplay, with C&C Generals Zero Hour and Tiberium Twilight as the highest form of it. That also meant reducing or even eliminating the base-building and resource-gathering components. Generally speaking, C&C 4 is hence somewhat the last (yet in my view unfinished) step in a journey to adjust the series to a different play style with a potential reboot that was being discussed around the time of the release in 2010. The latter was dropped quickly after the commercial failure of C&C 4 and the demise of RTS in general.

The plot of the game continues and concludes the alternate future time line in which the world was dominated by two factions, Nod and GDI, picking up right after “C&C 3 - Tiberium Wars” quite well. Otherwise, unfortunately, the game itself feels incomplete and unbalanced on several accounts as well as falling short again on long-needed improvements on year-old problems such as a limited graphics engine and very low unit AI. Additionally, all the fans of the series who have loved the game especially because of the traditional mechanics might have their issues because of the new play styles. 

After about 13 hours of play time in a normal approach, here’s my pros/cons list:

Pros: 
+ seamlessly continues story after C&C3 and its add-on
+ high quality cutscenes and good quality actors
+ last and final appearance of Kane
+ interesting conclusion of the timeline, Tiberium infestation, the Nod cult and the legendary figure of Kane
+ great graphics
+ new strategic elements of mobile bases (= crawlers)
+ mutant area mission level design well done and detailed
+ interesting story in general
+ 3 tactics styles to choose from (offensive, defensive, support)
+ great unit detail
+ generally kept look & feel of C&C series

Cons:
-	Game mechanics feel like they were geared towards teams of up to 3 players cooperating in multiplayer matches against others, especially since some units and tactical advantages are missing when playing as single player
-	Kane by now definitely had many more lives than a cat
-	Apart from Kane, his cult and Tiberium conclusion, the plot remains shallow and rather bland
-	Rock-papers-scissors mechanics not working in single player missions due to missing variety in units available by only being able to choose 1 tactic at a time, limiting options drastically
-	Level-up to unlock higher units in most cases unobtainable and hence a player would choose a different approach --> balancing issue
-	Stealing big units from the enemy NPC can become main tactic in winning the single player campaign
-	Command points (= max unit number) limitation too low in single player missions to be able to stand a good chance against the enemy early on in many cases --> balancing issue
-	Missing option to tilt crawler position --> unfinished game element
-	Many missions are trail & error of each of the 3 tactical choices --> balancing issue
-	Unfair nuclear rocket behaviour in last GDI mission --> balancing issue
-	Super overpowered Arcus GDI enemy unit in last Nod mission making it nearly unbeatable --> balancing issue
-	Very unfair Nod pre-order bonus mission “Night Moves” --> balancing issue
-	Game is missing explanation of what the advantages are to capture some buildings on the map, players need to find out by themselves
-	Graphics engine is fixed to 30 fps due to necessary internal game speed regulation
-	AI of units still super low which requires lots of micromanagement (they can’t even pick the enemy which they are the strongest against or move in formations without blocking each other all the time)
-	Micromanagement of units decreases real tactical orders and behaviours to be expected of a modern RTS
-	AI still has wayfinding issues on the map
-	Despite resource gathering and base building eliminated, funny enough, the gameplay feels much slower compared to predecessors
-	Campaign missions rather boring and uninspired which is very sad compared to the super fun, varied missions of Red Alert 3
-	Tedious campaign missions, especially because of re-spawning crawlers (= mobile bases)
-	Soundtrack without any C&C characteristics, sounds more like a mix of Star Wars, Indiana Jones and psychedelic Japanese singing
-	Missing detailed explanation of 3 tactics, including differences in units etc.
-	Graphic bugs appeared several times, persisting throughout whole missions
-	Some game crashes
-	Annoying double login forced on player before game start and just before the main menu without option to save login information
-	Story ending of Kane somewhere between stupid (GDI part) and well done (general conclusion)
-	The protagonist’s wife is such a silly damsel in distress, unlike all the other strong women in earlier instalments

Conclusion:
Although C&C 4 wraps up the Tiberium timeline quite well, the plot is very shallow and boring. The new mechanics introduced appear to be unfinished and badly balanced, making many missions very tedious and sometimes even highly frustrating. I generally liked the look & feel of the game and was eager to try out a new tactical approach to the game play, but the downsides tainted my experience quite a lot. Hence, I can only recommend the game to anyone who wants to know about the conclusion of the series from a plot standpoint. From an RTS perspective, the game is rather disappointing, especially after an amazing Red Alert 3. 

Rating: 4/10 points

column8:
[h1] DO NOT PURCHASE - UNPLAYABLE DUE TO BUG [/h1]

I bought the C&C Bundle with the interest of trying out the classics and C&C:4. 

I tried to boot up C&C4, same problems as other C&C games thanks to E.A scuffage of the IP - requiring online access and an EA account at all times with no offline option. Requires 2 separate login screens - the 2nd login screen is where the game-breaking bug occurs.

According to the Community, C&C4's 2nd login screen only accepts E.A Account passwords under 7 characters. Passwords over 8 characters will fail, and there is also a Character limit of about 14 characters.

There is no known bypass or fix for this bug.

I hope there is a fix, because I doubt this is the only C&C game affected by E.A's blasted logins and online-only enforcement.

Maybe a cracked version somewhere on the high seas exists without the Online requirement and E.A's nonsense.

[h1] DO NOT PURCHASE - UNPLAYABLE DUE TO BUG [/h1]

column8:
Опыт игры в 2025.
- запустил стим
- запустил игру
- зашёл в учётку ЕА
- создал себе профиль игрока в этой учётке
- запустил игру. 
- игра свернулась, потому что запросила сетевые разрешения в Windows
- игра не развернулась...

Попытка 2, это же мой любимый CnC
- запустил игру (стим же не убивал через диспетчер)
- залогинился в учётку
- выбрал персонажа
- зашёл в игру
- залогинился в учётку ЕА в самой игре
- ушёл в настройки, чтобы поменять разрешение на нормальное (по дефолту выставилось 800 на 600)
- игра применила разрешение, свернулась, не развернулась...
10 говна из 10.
интересно, почему пиратки так любят?...
column9:
Gameplay experience in 2025.
- Launched Steam
- Launched the game
- Logged into my EA account
- Created a player profile in that account
- Launched the game.
- The game minimized because it requested network permissions in Windows
- The game wouldn't load...

Try 2, this is my favorite CnC
- Launched the game (I didn't kill Steam through the game manager)
- Logged into my account
- Selected a character
- Launched the game
- Logged into my EA account in the game itself
- Go to settings to change the resolution to a normal one (the default was 800x600)
- The game applied the resolution, minimized, and wouldn't load...
10 out of 10 crap.
I wonder why people love pirated games so much?...

column8: Hru jsem chtěl zkusit, protože jsem velký fanda této série. Bohužel po nainstalování je povinná registrace, což by mi tolik nevadilo (na druhou stranu proč vůbec s tím hráče obtěžovat, že?), kdyby normálně fungovala. Nejdřív jsem zkusil registraci přes steam, což se přihlásilo, vyskočila mi reklama na další hry od EA, ale přihlašovací údaje do hry jsem nedostal. OK, pokus č.2 přes email. Registrace přes email již existuje - fajn, zadám heslo, to je dokonce správně, nicméně raději budeme posílat ještě kód na email (který nepřišel). Říkám si OK, je mi vlastně jedno na jaký email to budu hrát, tak jsem dal novou registraci na nový email. Tam jsem se (po cca 30 minutách zbytečného registrování) dostal k "hádankám", že jsem člověk. Pochopit lámanou češtinou (nejlepší je, když AI generuje ověřovač, kterým ověří, že jsem člověk, to považuju za opravdový gól), co je vůbec cílem mi chvíli trvalo, po odkliknutí jsem musel absolvovat další dvě podobné hádanky a nakonec jsem se dozvěděl, že nejsem člověk. Inu, taky nemusím hrát všechno. V EA jsou fakt tragédi, až se tomu těžko věří. :-( Poslední hra od EA, kterou jsem zakoupil (byť to bylo v bundlu).
column9: I wanted to try the game because I'm a big fan of this series. Unfortunately, registration is mandatory after installation, which I wouldn't mind so much (on the other hand, why bother the player with it at all, right?) if it worked normally. First I tried to sign up via steam, which logged in, I got an ad for other EA games, but I didn't get the game login. OK, attempt no. 2 via email. Registration via email already exists - fine, I'll enter the password, that's even correct, but we'd rather send the code to the email (which didn't arrive). I think OK, I don't really care what email I play it on, so I put a new registration on a new email. There (after about 30 minutes of useless registration) I got to the "riddles" that I am a person. It took me a while to understand in broken Czech (the best thing is when the AI ​​generates a verifier that verifies that I'm human, I consider that a real goal), what the goal is, after clicking off I had to go through two more similar puzzles and finally I learned that I'm not human. Well, I don't have to play everything either. There are so many tragedies in EA that it's hard to believe. :-( Last EA game I bought (albeit in a bundle).

column8: I started playing it because I wanted to see why it was being called such a terrible game.  After about six hours of playing it, I said to myself, "I have only played a few levels, how has six hours gone by already?" Turns out that I was taking multiple breaks because playing this game was almost like working.  I felt like I was just playing it, just to get through it.  It has fairly good graphics seeing as how it came out 15 years ago but unfortunately, they were just wasted.  I was trying to enjoy it but to no avail.  I literally realized that mid-way through doing the dishes (during one of my breaks) that I was enjoying doing dishes more than this game.  Unfortunate.
column9: I started playing it because I wanted to see why it was being called such a terrible game.  After about six hours of playing it, I said to myself, "I have only played a few levels, how has six hours gone by already?" Turns out that I was taking multiple breaks because playing this game was almost like working.  I felt like I was just playing it, just to get through it.  It has fairly good graphics seeing as how it came out 15 years ago but unfortunately, they were just wasted.  I was trying to enjoy it but to no avail.  I literally realized that mid-way through doing the dishes (during one of my breaks) that I was enjoying doing dishes more than this game.  Unfortunate.

column8:
This entry in the Command and Conquer series is just a boring slogfest that has either taken away or worsen every element  C&C is comprised of.

- The FMV-scenes are even shlockier than Tiberian Sun, at least that entry had charme.
- Ressource management is non existent, Tiberium is no a power up to be collected in individual crystals.
- Your choice of Crawler (HQ) only gives you a subset of units, so adapting to your enemy is a hassle as you have to scrap you HQ to build a new one.
- It's just boring, boring, boring. Even the level design is mediocre at best.

column8:
Leider nicht spielbar. 
Es gibt nur 1en Vollbildmodus. Die Auflösung von 800x600 auf FhD umstellen ist glücks sache.
Wenn man raus tabt kommt man nicht mehr in den Vollbildmodus. ALT+TAB funktioniert nicht. Taskmanager bleibt im Hintergrund weil die Anwendung das überschreibt obwohl der Taskmanager auf (immer im Vordergrund) eingestellt ist.
Nach der Videosequenz zur 1. Mission bleibt das Bild einfach schwarz.

Kurz gesagt: Es ist nicht möglich C&C4 zu spielen.
column9:
Unfortunately, it's unplayable.

There's only one full-screen mode. Changing the resolution from 800x600 to full-screen is a matter of luck.

If you tab out, you can't get back into full-screen mode. ALT+TAB doesn't work. The task manager stays in the background because the application overrides it, even though the task manager is set to (always on top).

After the cutscene for the first mission, the screen simply remains black.

In short: It's impossible to play Command & Conquer 4.

column8:
Estamos ante otro de los RTS hechos por EA Los Angeles (que tomo la continuacion del antiguo Westwood Studios) mas concretamente con la ultima entrega tanto de EA LA como de los juegos de esta indole (hubo otros 2 Command &Conquer pero que no tenian mucho que ver con este) y desde ya no incluyo la remasterizacion de Petroglyph del 2020 porque no es nueva.

Que nos ofrece el titulo? Algo un poco mas en la linea de jugabilidad similar a un Warhammer 40k Dawn of war 3, tiene elementos de RTS pero mas simplificados en lo que respecta a construir bases.
mantiene si el estilo visual ya marcado en la ultima entrega, que se aleja de la guerra tradicional para ir a un enfoque mas futurista, Estilo Starcraft, Dune y en menor medida Warhammer.

Tiene 2 Campañas, la GDI y NOD, cada una progresa de acuerdo a como va la historia del C&C, podes hacer misiones cooperativas, lo cual esta bastante interesante Y tiene workshop y editor de niveles.

Lamentablemente no posee ni logros ni Cromos y tiene algunos temitas para poder loguearse, pero sacando eso es un gran titulo, hay que saber disfrutarlo.

6.5/10 - Pudo ser mejor claramente, pero da sus horas de diversion.
column9:
This is another RTS made by EA Los Angeles (which took over from the former Westwood Studios), more specifically the latest installment of both EA LA and games of this ilk (there were two other Command & Conquer titles, but they didn't have much to do with this one). I'm no longer including the 2020 remaster of Petroglyph because it's not new.

What does this title offer? Something a little more in the vein of Warhammer 40k-like gameplay. Dawn of War 3 has RTS elements, but more simplified when it comes to base building.
It maintains the visual style already established in the last installment, which moves away from traditional warfare to a more futuristic approach, in the style of Starcraft, Dune, and, to a lesser extent, Warhammer.

It has two campaigns, GDI and NOD, each progressing according to the C&C story. You can do co-op missions, which is quite interesting, and it has a workshop and a level editor.

Unfortunately, it doesn't have achievements or trading cards, and there are some issues with logging in, but other than that, it's a great title; you have to know how to enjoy it.

6.5/10 - It could clearly have been better, but it's still hours of fun.

column8:
Wasted Potential, Poor Execution

★☆☆☆☆ (1/5)

Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight had the potential to be something unique, but the execution is missing something crucial. Instead of refining classic RTS mechanics, it replaces them with a limited, shallow system where strategy takes a backseat. The removal of base building and resource management leads to restrictive, small-scale battles that lack depth. The mobile base (Crawler) concept could have been interesting, but in practice, it makes everything feel constrained rather than dynamic.

The campaign doesn’t help. The story is rushed and unsatisfying, and the characters are bland with lifeless performances. Even Kane, usually a commanding presence, feels dumbed down and uninspired. There’s no real emotional weight to the narrative, and none of the characters leave a lasting impact.

I have tried the multiplayer, but it made the game a bit less boring. If the core gameplay is this flawed, no amount of online play can fix it.

This game could have been something fresh and exciting, but instead, it feels incomplete and uninspired. Even on its own, it just doesn’t hold up as a good strategy game.

A good game, but with a lot of bullshit from EA.

You launch the game.
You have to enter your EA login details.
The game launches.
You're asked for your EA account password again once you're in the game.
And this happens every time you start the game (it's really annoying).

+ A small addition: if you change windows in the game, you can't go back to it for unknown reasons. The game no longer displays, and you only have the sound. It's so awesome.

The worst part is that the game isn't really bad, but this is bullshit. A 2010 game is more secure than my banking app.

column8: O na minha opinião esse é o pior jogo da franquia C&C. A jogabilidade mudou completamente em relação aos outros títulos da franquia, sem contar que mesmo para se jogar off-line é necessário logar no servidor do EA, algo que requer muiiiiiita paciência, pois mesmo inserindo login e senha correto o servidor retorna um erro (General System Error) por varias tentativas, o que acaba frustando o jogador. Após muita persistência e paciência consegui logar e joguei exatas 4 missões no modo campanha; não valeu a pena, estou desinstalando o C&C 4. Só não fico mais decepcionado pois o jogo foi adquirido junto com um pacote com +17 jogos da franquia. Recomendação final: Não vale aprovado.
column9: In my opinion, this is the worst game in the C&C franchise. The gameplay has completely changed compared to other titles in the franchise, not to mention that even to play offline, you need to log in to the EA server, which requires a lot of patience. Even entering the correct username and password results in a General System Error after several attempts, which ends up frustrating the player. After much persistence and patience, I managed to log in and played exactly 4 missions in the campaign mode; it wasn't worth it; I'm uninstalling C&C 4. I'm only not more disappointed because the game was purchased with a pack of 17 more games in the franchise. Final recommendation: Not worth the approval.

column8: E' una vergogna, sapevo che questo gioco è molto odiato perchè non alla pari con gli altri esponenti della serie, ma me lo volevo giocare lo stesso per vedere come si concludeva la storia. Il gioco ti richiede di effettuare il login all'account EA anche se vuoi giocare offline e dopo la prima volta non mi fa loggare più dandomi un messaggio di errore e rendendo il gioco completamente ingiocabile. Non è accettabile che sia presente sullo store un gioco al quale è impossibile giocare indipendentemente se sia bello o brutto.
column9: It's a shame. I knew this game was hated because it wasn't on par with the other entries in the series, but I still wanted to play it to see how the story ended. The game requires you to log in to your EA account even if you want to play offline, and after the first time, it wouldn't let me log in again, giving me an error message and making the game completely unplayable. It's unacceptable that a game is available on the store that's impossible to play, regardless of how good or bad it is.

column8:
This is by far one of the worst Command & Conquer games that is in existence, besides the garbage that is the mobile games. The way this plays is like anything but the previous titles that came before this abomination. It is fully deserving of having the negative review score that it does along with just never being mentioned about in the C&C fan base as an official game. Allow me to list as to why this is one of the worst RTS games I have ever played.

The leveling progression system:
Unlike the previous titles, where the way you unlocked more units and structures throughout the campaign, the way the progression system works is what I would expect to see in a MMO RPG game like World of Warcraft, not in a RTS game. In order to unlock more units, structures, and upgrades, you have to earn XP in game and level up to unlock more. Which makes this game outrageously difficult starting at the beginning. Especially in the campaigns, where AI enemies are absurdly strong having everything unlocked in the first missions, while you're stuck with the most basic of units that can barely do anything. This ultimately turns the game into a grind fest for the campaign missions and skirmish matches, just to be able to unlock more units and tech to make the game easier. And of course, levels you gain through NOD and GDI are earned separately, so you're having to grind as each faction to unlock more tech.

Unit cap and game play mechanics:
The unit cap in this game is absolutely obnoxious and unnecessary, especially since none of the prior titles ever had unit limits integrated into them (except for the console versions of RA3 and Tib wars 3 & Kanes Wrath due to hardware limitations on Xbox and Playstation), which makes the game feel smaller since you're now commanding only small squads of units instead of whole armies. The most you'll ever get for unit cap is around 50-60 unit points for campaign, and up to 90 unit points in skirmish or online matches. And it is horribly small, especially since a lot of the units take around 6-8 unit points, so you don't get to really build much of an army, as much as you get more of just a large squad of units instead. Of course, this can easily get broken if you get the husk repair upgrades while playing as Offense crawlers.

Speaking of which, instead of MCVs, you get a production unit/structure called a "crawler" instead. These just build all your vehicles, infantry, and aircraft instead of traditional productions buildings in prior games. This mechanic is one I hate the most, as I enjoyed having like 8-10 barracks or war factories just pumping out a massive army of units. Instead, you only get to build one unit at a time, with a max of five being able to be stored in your crawler while it's mobile. And the only crawler that can even build any sort of structures is the defense crawler, but that only builds bases defenses and nothing else.

Game play experience:
The fact that C&C 4 is an always online game means that you have to log into an EA account in order to get online and play this game. It doesn't matter how or which platform you use to play this, you still need an EA account just to be able to even fully launch this game. Even then, good luck trying to get on, as I've had multiple times where I'd randomly get forced out of a game due to connection issues and be forced to log back in, losing any experience that I gained during the middle of a match or campaign mission.

Overall summary:
I wouldn't consider this even an official C&C game. The way it plays and functions strays so far away from the C&C game series that it shouldn't even classify as one. The game play mechanics aren't enjoyable and generic at best, the level progression system makes this game grindier than it ever needed to be, and there's so many technical issues that it makes it honestly difficult to play. This is a game I would honestly recommend any C&C fan to steer clear from.

TL;DR
If I was given the choice to watch grass grow for a week or play this game for an hour, I'd rather watch grass grow.

column8:
Spiel via Sammelbox im Angebot erhalten.

Nach der Installation musste ich mir erstmal einen EA-Account erstellen.

Nachdem ich nach ca. 2 Stunden endlich schaffte über den Launcher hinaus das Spiel zu starten,
durfte ich mich erstmal 4 mal hintereinander mit beträchtlichen Ladezeiten bei EA anmelden.
Dazu kam, dass das Spiel danach mehrere male abstürzte.
Das 4 malige Anmelden bei EA war jedoch nicht vergänglich und musste bei jedem Neustart erneut durchgeführt werden.

Die Lösung des START-Problems liegt mir übringens nicht vor. Kurz bevor ich es aufgeben wollte versuchte ich es noch ein allerletztes mal ohne jegliche Änderungen. Das Spiel selbst lässt sich übrigens ohne Internet-Zugang nicht starten.

Als ich dann zum allerersten mal das Menü zu sehen bekam,
erinnerte es mich ein wenig an eine komplett abgespeckte Version von C&C-Generals, nur in richtig billig.

Ein riesiger trostloser Chat, permanent aktiv, am unteren Bildschirmrand, angebliche Spieler die darin durchgehend angezeigt werden, aber keiner schreibt noch reagiert.

In den Optionen musste ich erstmal die Grafikeinstellungen hoch drehen.
Denn das Spiel schien mein FullHD-Display mit einer Auflösung von 860x640p und komplett minimalen Einstellungen als empfehlenswert zu betrachten. Danach wurde es aber auch nicht schöner.

Um rein zu kommen wollte ich zuallererst mal ein Gefecht gegen die KI starten,
bis ich die Option fand vergingen Minuten. Die Struktur des Menüs wechselte plötzlich von Hoch/Runter nach Links/Rechts.

Es gibt augenscheinlich keine richtigen Einstellungen für Gefechte,
ist aber auch egal, denn mehr als einen 3 Minuten "Bitte Warten" Timer bekam ich über eine Stunde Wartezeit nicht zu sehen.
Gefechte gegen die KI lassen sich einfach nicht starten.

Also startete ich den Story-Modus,
bei dem die ersten 3 Missionen scheinbar das Tutorial sind, waren mega schlecht, und waren gleichzeitig eine Einleitung in die Geschichte. Die Zwischensequenzen kommen in der gesamten Breite in Qualität nach C&C-1.

Die Grafik des Spiels ist absolute Katastrophe und schaut aus wie an C&C-Generals angelegt,
aber um mehr als 80% reduziert. Die Effekte und Bewegungsanimationen der Einheiten sehen so dermaßen schei...., billig aus, dass niemals das Gefühl aufkommt man würde mit schwerer Kiregsmaschinerie über das Schlachtfeld ziehen.

Wie bereits bekannt der nicht existierende Basisbau,
Gott sei dank gibt es keinen Basisbau, ich glaube ich hätte bei dieser schlechten Grafik/Animation das kotzen bekommen.
Nein ernsthaft... WO IST DER BASISBAU ???

Da es keine Bau-Voraussetzungen via "baue DIES und bekomme Zugang zu DAS" mehr gibt,
müssen Einheiten jetzt im gesamten Spiel, wie bei einem Multiplayer-EgoShooter, via Prestige-Ranking freigeschaltet werden.

Zusatzoptionen wie Untertitel funktionieren auch nur Just for Fun.

Ich hab nach nicht mal 3 Stunden das Spiel wieder aus gemacht.
Davon habe ich rund mehr als die Hälfte im Menü, in den Optionen, am meisten in Warteschleifen und ein wenig im Chat verbracht in dem ich hoffte mal jemanden zu erwischen der auch mal auf meine Fragen reagiert.
Bis auf eine Hand voll fragwürdiger Reaktionen auf Englisch, gehe ich davon aus das es sich wohl möglich um Bots handelt.

Fazit: Absolut kein bisschen zu empfehlen, nicht einmal ansatzweise. !!!!!!

PS: Ich suche immer noch die Funktion das Spiel wieder auf normalem Wege vom Rechner zu DEINSTALLIEREN.
column9:
Received the game via a collection box.

After installation, I first had to create an EA account.

After about two hours, I finally managed to launch the game from the launcher,
I had to log in to EA four times in a row, with considerable loading times.
On top of that, the game crashed several times afterward.
However, the four-time EA login wasn't temporary and had to be repeated with each restart.

By the way, I don't have a solution to the START problem. Just before I was about to give up, I tried it one last time without making any changes. Incidentally, the game itself won't start without internet access.

When I saw the menu for the very first time,
it reminded me a bit of a completely stripped-down version of C&C Generals, only really cheap.

A huge, dreary chat, constantly active, at the bottom of the screen, supposed players constantly displayed in it, but no one was writing or responding.

I first had to turn up the graphics settings in the options.
Because the game seemed to consider my Full HD display with a resolution of 860x640p and completely minimal settings to be recommended. After that, things didn't get any better.

To get started, I first wanted to start a battle against the AI.
It took minutes until I found the option. The menu structure suddenly changed from up/down to left/right.

There are apparently no proper settings for battles,
but it doesn't matter, because I didn't see anything more than a 3-minute "Please Wait" timer after waiting for over an hour.
Battles against the AI ​​simply won't start.

So I started the story mode,
where the first three missions seem to be the tutorial, were incredibly bad, and at the same time served as an introduction to the story. The cutscenes are, across the board, of C&C 1 quality.

The game's graphics are an absolute disaster and look like something from C&C Generals,
but reduced by more than 80%. The unit effects and movement animations look so crappy and cheap that you never feel like you're roaring across the battlefield with heavy war machines.

As already mentioned, the nonexistent base building.
Thank God there is no base building. I think I would have vomited at the terrible graphics/animation.
No, seriously... WHERE IS THE BASE BUILDING???

Since there are no more building requirements like "build THIS and get access to THAT,"
units now have to be unlocked throughout the game via prestige ranking, like in a multiplayer first-person shooter.

Additional options like subtitles only work for fun.

I turned the game off after less than 3 hours.
I spent more than half of that time in the menu, in the options, mostly in queues, and a little in the chat, hoping to find someone who would actually answer my questions.
Apart from a handful of questionable responses in English, I'm assuming they're probably bots.

Conclusion: Absolutely not recommended, not even remotely. !!!!!!

PS: I'm still looking for the function to uninstall the game from my computer the normal way.

column9: I just finished playing the CNC trilogy recently. Although I have heard that the fourth generation is disgusting, I didn't expect it to be so disgusting after playing it for dozens of minutes. This game is just like a pseudo-human wearing the skin of CNC. In some places, you can see the shadow of the previous game, but it is just a poor imitation of the previous game. The entire game system has been castrated and sentenced to death. In addition, the unit models are cartoonized without improving the recognition at all. The units are so big that it is impossible to fit several units on the same screen. The road recognition is also a mess. Once you get stuck in traffic, you can't even unlock the manual control. You have to enter your account and password twice to play the single-player game. After playing for forty minutes, it suddenly popped up and asked me to log in again. I really have nothing to say to EA for making a game so disgusting and stuffing it into such a classic series as an orthodox sequel. This game is an insult to my library.

column8: Kal, eto ne C&C

Do I have to say anything about why this game was the worst? Besides completely changing how the game is played, how this was supposed to be a spin off game but EA made the decision to make it a Triple A game, how they ruined the story of the Tiberium series with one of the worst CnC stories along with one of the  weakest endings to a series/ franchise ever, from ruining Kane's character, from having to level up to get better units, from having to log in and play online even on single player. From even releasing a broken version of the game on Steam that you have to find a workaround to even play the game. There's a reason as to why people don't acknowledge this game nor ever mention it, this game is the embodiment of EA, greedy ba****** who ruin any franchise they acquire for making quick cash. Taking something that was successful and running it into the dirt for what? A little more profit? In the end they lose more money for making this POS rather than making a real CnC 4. With the steam workshop update along with the source code being released, maybe, just maybe EA will attempt to make a proper CnC game after all these years but never hold your breath for EA.

column8: вилітає

This game is bad, the launcher is a mess and getting the game to work/start was a huge hassle between it not starting, it took at least five tries, plus having to register and you have to log in twice through the launcher, then again login in-game which at any point either logins could fail to connect to the server. Once or if you finally get to play, it requires an online connection at all times including single player, even if you have excellent internet, the server may fail at any given point in which your progress will not be saved. The worst is yet to come, there is no real skirmish, it is all based on sort of missions that are beyond boring and basic. the server lost connection on mission 2 and even though I completed it, I would have to redo it. This game is not fun and no wonder it was the final straw to killing the Command & Conquer franchise.

column9:

If you want to try an RTS with gameplay that's different from the classic base build, give it a look, perhaps taking advantage of a discount.

column8: I have played this and all the series games for years but i can say this one is by far the worst.  they have taken away the ability to produce nearly infinite units and base structures. as well added the whole horrible triple MCV thing (certain units need a certain MCV) which in a combat RTS is a huge waste of programming typically in a real world combat the factories on base produce all you need if not it is sent over from your home country. column8: Chyba trzeba być "graczem" mobilnym, żeby dać pozytywa tej nędznej abominacji. I spokojnie. Ja już lata temu ogrywałem trójkę jak i czwórkę poza steamem, ale postanowiłem niedawno wrócić do tej serii właśnie tutaj. Trójeczka wraz z dodatkiem to było coś pięknego. Przez ostatnie dwa tygodnie, przy ogrywaniu trójki czułem jak bym wrócił do wspaniałych czasów gamingu...no i przyszedł czas na to coś. To nawet nie jest RTS. To jest nędzny kliker dla ludzi z poziomem IQ na poziomie mojej śmierdzącej, tygodniowej skarpety. Nędzne ograniczenia limitu jednostek, ograniczone do minimum jakiekolwiek zarządzanie bazą jak i tymi jednostkami, marne cutscenki itd. Ja naprawdę się zastanawiam co kierowało ludzmi projektującymi to coś, a tym bardziej tymi którzy to puścili dalej po weryfikacji "jakości". Nawet gratis to za dużo jak na tą grę. Nie marnujcie swojego czasu ani miejsca na dysku.
column9: I guess you have to be a mobile "gamer" to give this miserable abomination a thumbs up. And don't worry. I played both the third and fourth installments off Steam years ago, but I recently decided to return to the series here. Third and its expansion were truly wonderful. For the past two weeks, while playing Third, I felt like I'd returned to the glory days of gaming... and now it's time for this. It's not even an RTS. It's a lousy clicker for people with an IQ as high as my stinking, week-old sock. Poor unit limits, minimal base and unit management, poor cutscenes, and so on. I really wonder what motivated the people who designed this thing, let alone those who released it after verifying its "quality." Even free is too much for this game. Don't waste your time or disk space.

column8:
Keiner mag den Teil und das auch Zurecht. Nach dem geilen Teil Tiberium Wars und Red Alert 3 ist
das hier einfach Traurig. Wenig Missionen, Gameplay langweilig und diese starke Neuerrung suckt.
Missionen haben ein Zeitlimit, Zwischensequenzen eher Cringe. Auch wenn hier eigtl. alles
falsch gemacht wurde, die Endsequenz hat irgendwie was. Daumen hoch, da Spiel ohne Fehler läuft
und für nicht Veteranen Spaß sein kann. Für mich persönlich trotzdem eine Enttäuschung.
column9: Nobody likes this game, and rightly so. After the awesome Tiberium Wars and Red Alert 3, this one is just sad. Few missions, boring gameplay, and this major innovation sucks. Missions have a time limit, cutscenes are rather cringeworthy. Even though everything was basically done wrong, the ending sequence has something special. Thumbs up, because the game runs flawlessly and can be fun for non-veterans. Still a disappointment for me personally.

Yes, i mean Lockdown campaign.

为什么玩家需要连续登入两次你那逼EA账号，尤其是对那些想独自玩战役模式的玩家？甚至还不如RA3和CNC3
好不容易登进去了，单人战役玩着像是玩中国国内三流作者的图，对手用玩家四倍及以上的兵力无脑冲击玩家部队，玩家几乎没有操作空间。没错，说的就是你，”封锁“战役。
column9:
Why do we need to log in twice to play this game, especially for those who only want to play the campaign solo?

Also, the campaign is rubbish. How can I prevail over dozens of GDI enforcers while I only have four?

Yes, I mean the Lockdown campaign.

Why do players need to log in to your EA account twice in a row, especially for those who want to play the campaign solo? It's even worse than RA3 and CNC3.

After finally logging in, the single-player campaign feels like playing a map created by a third-rate Chinese author. The opponent uses four or more times the player's troops to mindlessly attack the player's forces, leaving the player with almost no room to maneuver. Yes, I'm talking about you, the "Lockdown" campaign.

column8:
Причины покупки 
1 Вы хотите узнать концовку серии игр.
На этом всё

Минусы
1 Это сам геймплей теперь у вас нет денег все войска бесплатные но всё завязано на лимите войск
2 Нужен интернет при чём входить нужно дваждый при каждом запуске к игре! 
3 1 день зашёл играл норм, 2 день выбило какую то ошибку но игра зашла день 3 игра выдала ошибку несоответствие непонятно чего и решила больше не запускаться! Заебись! Виндовс 11 официальный 
4 Однообразный сюжет  Фактически мы играем в одни и те же миссии но по разные стороны, а концовка для главного героя одна.... То есть для нас а также для сюжета в целом... (У нас типо есть тело а сюжет это История тиберия и побелитель он не изменен!)
5 Вы не захотите играть в это онлайн да и врядли найдёте соперников. Игра в онлайн это захват точек и всё. (По скрипту игру проходил всю на пиратке на старом ПК лет 10 незад.) 

Худшая игра в серии игр!
column9:
Reasons for purchasing

1. You want to know the ending of the game series.

That's all.

Cons

1. The gameplay itself: now you have no money, all troops are free, but everything is tied to a troop limit.

2. You need an internet connection, and you have to log in twice each time you launch the game!

3. I logged in on day 1 and played fine. Day 2. I got some kind of error, but the game launched. Day 3. The game returned an error about an inconsistency and decided not to launch anymore! Awesome! Windows 11 is official.

4. Monotonous plot. We essentially play the same missions, but from different sides, and the ending for the main character is the same... That is, for us and for the plot as a whole... (We supposedly have a body, but the plot is the History of Tiberius and Whitewasher, it hasn't changed!)

5. You won't want to play this online, and you're unlikely to find opponents. Online games are just capturing points, that's all. (I played the entire game using a pirated version on an old PC about 10 years ago, according to the script.)

The worst game in the series!

column8:
Many users report issues with the EA login system, such as "General System Error." This could be due to server problems, outdated compatibility settings, or restrictions on password formats, Some players speculate that EA may have shut down servers for the game, making it unplayable for both single-player and multiplayer modes.
The game may not run properly on newer operating systems like Windows 10 or 11. Adjusting compatibility settings or running the game as an administrator has helped some users. Beyond technical issues, the game itself has been criticized for its departure from traditional Command & Conquer gameplay, which has left many fans disappointed.....

column8: Habe das Spiel im Bundle gekauft und hatte so meine Zweifel, ob man es tatsächlich spielen kann. Es wird tatsächlich ein EA Konto verlangt, welches ich allerdings aufgrund diverser anderer Spiele besitze. Ansonsten muss man über die EA Game Homepage halt ein Konto anlegen. Meine Zugangsdaten wurden sofort akzeptiert, allerdings kam es bei der Anmeldung immer wieder zu einer Meldung "systemfehler". Nach gefühlt 5 - 10 Versuchen hintereinander, ließ sich das Spiel starten. Einstellungen alle auf Ultra gesetzt und die Auflösung meinem Monitor angepasst. Mit etwas Geduld und Ausdauer bekommt man das Spiel zum Laufen und die negativen Kritiken diesbezüglich halte ich für überzogen.
column9: I bought the game as a bundle and had my doubts about whether it would actually be playable. It does require an EA account, which I already have because I've played several other games. Otherwise, you have to create an account on the EA Games website. My login details were accepted immediately, but I kept getting a "system error" message when logging in. After what felt like 5-10 consecutive attempts, the game finally started. I set all the settings to Ultra and adjusted the resolution to my monitor. With a bit of patience and perseverance, you can get the game running, and I think the negative reviews are exaggerated.

column8:
I bought this game on major discount and I payed too much for the opportunity to confirm the validity of the poor reviews for this game.

What kind of game dev decides that instead of playing into all the things that make a game franchise fun and popular they would rather remove and minimize all of those great qualities to leave buyers with a game no one wanted to play from the start.

Mission design is terrible.  Graphics feel worse than C&C3.  Unit pathing is worse than Starcraft ONE.

And did you enjoy resource extraction, unit build ups, and base building?  Well this game has none of that.

Did you enjoy being able to starve your enemies of resources and steal their buildings?  Yeah, cant do that in C&C4.

I've never seen such a huge miss on such a simple assignment.  Check out the end story on youtube.  Its not that good either.

column8:
I played this game when it was first released back in 2010

Steam would only allow me to review it once i installed and try to play the game.  I bought the C&C collection as I don't have to use a cd/dvd to play any of the games.

I forgot you had to login twice to play this game.  I just remember playing this game for 2 weeks, completing it and never playing it again.

so from C&C 1 to C&C 3 and generals, the games basically got better and the best game I found was the Red Alert series, but this game was so bad there was no C&C 4 Red alert.

so back in 2010 when I had bought this game, I was angry, I had completed this game, never wanted to play the game again and at the time, it was possible to sell games on the 2nd hand market, but this game I was stuck with.

All I remember this game was a completely new concept at the time, it was a shame it was not tested, but it was no longer building a base, but having a mobile control station and having a defence and offence command post and you no longer had to build a base, or gather resources.

so one of the best C&C games was generals and this game basically was the sad death of command and conquer.

If it was a good game, I might have been able to tolerate the digital rights management, but I basically played it for 2 weeks from release.

The only reason I have this game on steam is because it came with the complete C&C collection.

this game in the series is universally hated.

It is a real shame that EA did not go back to the tried and tested C&C, but just stopped the franchise dead.

I can't remember in 2010, if I had to install the physical game from DVD and there was a massive update that was needed to be installed before I even got to play the game and I think I needed to have the disc in my pc drive, log in to the EA account and maybe a further login, well this was at the time of really slow broadband.

The positive I can say about the game is, I managed to complete it and if I played it now, I probably still hate it, but my new pc would be able to run it at full graphics.

I still play Command and Conquer Generals and Red Alert 3, it is just disappointing that the multiplayer has been switched off due to the games age, but I have not played this game after completing it when it was first released.

column8:
优点：
素质OK、美术OK、音乐OK、完全是3A标准做的。

缺点：其他都是。
1.优化一坨翔。分辨率愣是没整明白，各种进不了游戏，搞个窗口化简简单单，或者弄个启动器设置选项。别整钥匙在宝箱里了行么？
2.游戏性总的来说，是一个让人拼操作的伪高玩游戏。让你迅速凑十几个相生相克的飞机坦克，然后搭配各种属性的技能，占塔或者搬宝石+比微操。太小众，入门难，没2个月别想玩明白，劝退99%的人。
3.最搞笑的是，兵种和技能要你升级经验才能获得，真TM搞笑中的搞笑，不然你就机枪兵VS对面各种战舰和要塞吧。
同样RA2，一个公司，你看看生命力。真别瞎作，创新是双面刃，创新创死的公司，远比一成不变被淘汰的公司多。
当然差评如潮也不是随随便便能得到的，而这个游戏就是那个王中王。
column9:
Pros:
The quality is decent, the art is decent, the music is decent, and it's built to AAA standards.

Cons: Everything else is just as bad.
1. The optimization is a mess. The resolution is completely messed up, and I can't get into the game. I'd rather simplify the windowing or add a launcher settings option. Can you please stop putting keys in treasure chests?
2. The gameplay, in general, is a pseudo-high-level game that demands skill. You quickly assemble a dozen or so mutually exclusive planes and tanks, then combine various skills with various attributes to capture towers, move gems, and even micromanage. It's too niche and difficult to get started. Don't expect to master it for less than two months, and it's a turnoff for 99% of people.
3. The funniest thing is that you have to level up experience to gain units and skills. It's hilarious! Otherwise, you'll be a machine gunner versus all the enemy ships and fortresses.
Same with RA2. Just look at the vitality of a company. Don't mess around. Innovation is a double-edged sword. Far more companies die from innovation than those that perish by simply sticking to the old ways. Of course, it’s not easy to get a lot of negative reviews, and this game is the king of kings.

column8:
This game isn't in itself very bad, but it should have never been marketed as a singleplayer game and given the name of C&C4. It should have been a spinoff like Generals etc.

It's a really interesting attempt at RTS without base-building and with a class-based approach. It's very far from being a great RTS, but there's something fun here. It takes a very rock-paper-scissors approach to the problem and you can have a decent skirmish match in this game.

The game was initially conceived as an esports title called C&C Arena and was built off C&C3, and you can tell. The campaign, the story and the FMVs are disastrously bad. This is weird, because RA3 had great FMVs and a fun story. It seems like there was a fundamental problem with the singleplayer design, probably not enough time was given to the team.

Unfortunately this game ended up killing the franchise. That honor normally would go to Generals 2/C&C2013, but if I'm being honest, the hit this game did to the credibility of EA C&C (until 2020) was absolutely horrible. The team transitioned to doing browser/mobile C&C and Generals 2 was arguably as poorly managed as this game. It's a shame. Anyway, try this game out if you're curious.

column8:
EA made ASTONISHING work to make sure you won't enjoy it:
1. You need EA account to play this "game".
2. You need to enter EA account credentials TWICE, EVERY time you launch the game.
3. Changing game screen resolution is a quest!
4. If you alt+tab, say good buy to your game session. You can't restore game window and have to kill the process in Task manager and restart it (Enjoy second point again).
5. On startup, game occasionally goes into alt+tab state by itself (hello fourth point!).
6. In average, after single mission, next mission you will enjoy solid pink textures flooding your screen (issue with loading textures properly). (You must be already a top EA fan if you still wish to continue..)
7. After completing campaign missions you see the panel of obtained EXP, which is... always(?) zero! You know why? Game never tells you. Hint: but be so kind and go play skirmish to get EXP.

So, after playing for ONLY 2 hours I formed a well-based opinion that the ones who praise this game (all 2.5 people) and say the game would be great if it weren't a direct C&C series follower, must be smoking some serious stuff.

Horrendous!
After 15 years of this game being launched and it having the recent source code release (Feb 2025), this game is still a PITA to get running.

It STILL expects you to log into an EA account to play it, multiple times, then tells you that your credentials are invalid! I can't even get to the main menu! Instant uninstall, no game is worth this amount of pointless and arbitrary hoop-jumping.

I hear that it's also only online, not that I'd know!
Until someone mods out the EA Login requirement, which I doubt is possible, avoid this 'game' like the plague!

column8:
You have to make an EA Account and login to play at all. No offline mode with optional online login. 

The 'Skirmish' mode you can't turn off the time limit or adjust things as freely in the options.

They basically turned it into some mishmatch of Mechwarrior Online or CoD but in C&C where you unlock things and have a profile that has performance history.

I don't like it. And i had to go through trouble to play it since it wouldn't run without a specific dot net runtime.

on top of that, asides from my personal opinion of the game itself, this also is another negative for EA, who won't even let me login with my own password to change my email and they want bank info that i dont have to change the old email.. it's trash. straight burning garbage of trash. i hope their company collapses in 2025 so i can dance on the grave of it's failures.
column9:
You have to make an EA Account and login to play at all. No offline mode with optional online login. 

The 'Skirmish' mode you can't turn off the time limit or adjust things as freely in the options.

They basically turned it into some mishmatch of Mechwarrior Online or CoD but in C&C where you unlock things and have a profile that has performance history.

I don't like it. And i had to go through trouble to play it since it wouldn't run without a specific dot net runtime.

on top of that, asides from my personal opinion of the game itself, this also is another negative for EA, who won't even let me login with my own password to change my email and they want bank info that i dont have to change the old email.. it's trash. straight burning garbage of trash. i hope their company collapses in 2025 so i can dance on the grave of it's failures.

Paying for nostalgia, the game is flawed, and the negative reviews are a call for attention.

We need Westwood Rez, the gameplay, control, and interface are compatible with modern computers. We need Chinese, cloud saves, and achievements. EA all games sell cheap, and EA and Steam company mergers to Steam. Ubi and Gog too. We need Westwood Rez, the gameplay, control, and interface are compatible with modern computers. We need Chinese, cloud saves, and achievements. EA games sell cheap, and EA and Steam company mergers to Steam. Don't have two accounts on two platforms. This will make it easier to organize and switch between collections, and more convenient for all players. The same goes for PS, Nintendo, Xbox, Ubi, and Gog.

Love your neighbor as you love yourself. That's all for now, I'll follow up with a review later. Brothers, I strongly recommend not buying YU from small stores on third-party platforms. Buying through accessories and other scams on the Steam Marketplace has a high probability of receiving a red letter or even a ban, so cherish what you have.

I forced myself to log in, but it often failed to connect.

Although it was released after Red Alert 3, the graphics feel like a step backward; even the live-action cutscenes aren't as good as Red Alert 3.

The textures are buggy, with buildings either not displaying or only partially displaying.

Other than buying a ticket back then, it's completely worthless.
