column8:
[h1] A Bold New Direction [/h1]
[h2] Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5) [/h2]



As a long-time fan of the Command & Conquer series, I approached Tiberian Twilight with a bit of trepidation, given the mixed reviews it received upon release. However, I was pleasantly surprised by what the game offers and found it to be a unique and engaging experience that deserves a positive nod.

Innovative Gameplay:
One of the most striking aspects of Tiberian Twilight is its shift away from the traditional base-building mechanics that defined earlier titles in the series. Instead, the game opts for a more dynamic, mobile approach to gameplay through the use of ‘Battlefield Commanders’ and a focus on unit-based strategies. This fresh take encourages players to adapt to the rapidly changing battlefield and think on their feet, which keeps the experience exhilarating and fast-paced.

Compelling Storyline:
The narrative in Tiberian Twilight ties up many loose threads from the Tiberium saga, providing closure to long-standing story arcs involving familiar characters. The voice acting and cutscenes are engaging and well-produced, immersing you in the conflict between GDI and Nod. It’s thrilling to see how the game integrates its lore into the gameplay, making decisions matter in the context of the overarching narrative.

Rich Multiplayer Experience:
The multiplayer component is another standout feature. With comprehensive co-op missions and competitive modes, the game brings a sense of community and competition that can be incredibly rewarding. Forming alliances and strategizing with friends adds layers to the gameplay, making it an ideal choice for those who enjoy team-based tactics.

Visuals and Sound:
On a technical note, Tiberian Twilight boasts impressive visuals for its time. The environments are detailed, and the unit designs are striking, reflecting the series’ signature aesthetic. Coupled with a robust soundtrack and sound effects, the game creates an immersive atmosphere that draws players into the conflict.

While Tiberian Twilight may depart from the classic C&C formula, it introduces innovative mechanics and a rich narrative that have left a lasting impression on me. If you’re open to new gameplay styles and appreciate a compelling story within the C&C universe, this title is worth diving into. It may not be perfect, but it certainly stands out as a worthy installment in the legendary franchise.



[b] -Level Up For the Epic Conclusion of the Tiberium Saga. [/b]

column8:
Managed to get ingame after reducing password character count to slightly below 16 and only after copying my password, quickly pasting it in for insistent login. The EA Launcher's server refuses to acknowledge the new password limits (imo should have been easy to solve but I guess someone doesn't want to pay their programmers). The moment you can input an ingame username, your game will then be recognized by the EA server and launch without aforementioned headache.

The artwork is great all-over, but the story quickly degenerates to a sudden and unsatisfying open closure. 

Gameplay is similar to DOW 3; base building is limited in favor of mobile deployment. Your hero unit is your transformer HQ (one of three niches). You have a unit cap with no worries about resources or gathering. Units have relatively similar response patterns when it comes to pathing to previous games, all while divided into rigid tiers. They can be upgraded and provide different responses, but are severely limited by a rock/paper/scissors system.

I would not recommend for a full playthrough. The entire Tiberium-based technology isn't used as an axis for developing either the artwork or the mech-technology seen in the artwork above. It's just mech and tank units for days. Fun for a while, but the initial limitations and hiccups make for a poor desire to return to play again.

Menus are as primitive as they could be for 2010. If not for the EA launcher, you could have easily hosted LAN parties with third party software. Very unfortunate choice for them to make.

RIP C&C.

column8: 这代也许作为CC3的一个多人对战子模块可能还能行。但这作是作为正传终章出现的，这就罪大恶极了。本来泰伯利亚的故事很长很大，结果到了这代极为仓促的结束。这种行为加上RTS这个类型本身已经弱势，出这么一个低质量作品基本宣判了泰伯利亚整个大系列的死亡。所以这作的失败影响很远、很恶劣。DC的漫画能重启，如今将近20年过去了，希望泰伯利亚4也能重启一下，把这作的单机故事删了，再出下代。
column9: This game might have worked as a multiplayer sub-module for CC3, but its inclusion as the final chapter to the main series is a grave offense. The Tiberium story was originally long and extensive, but it was brought to a drastically abrupt end in this game. This behavior, coupled with the already weak RTS genre, and the release of such a low-quality title essentially doomed the entire Tiberium series. Therefore, the impact of this game's failure was far-reaching and devastating. DC Comics could reboot, and now, nearly 20 years later, I hope Tiberium 4 will do the same, deleting this game's single-player story before releasing the next game.

column8:
Das fulminante Ende einer der beliebtesten Echtzeit-Strategie-Reihen mit atemberaubender Grafik und dem befriedigenden Ende der Geschichte um GDI, der Bruderschaft von Nod und deren Anführer Kain... ist C&C4 leider nicht geworden.

Stattdessen bekommt man ein Spiel das ständig abstürzt oder mit steigender Anzahl von Objekten auf dem Spielfeld (nicht im Bild!) immer langsamer wird, bis es völlig unspielbar wird - auf einem System mit Ryzen 5800 X3D, Radeon RX 6900XT und 16GB RAM wohlgemerkt. Schon lange vorher fangen alle Texturen an zu flackern oder komplett zu verschwinden. Dann ist ein Neustart des letzten Savegames angesagt,

Das sich auch das Spielprinzip geändert hat, sollte sich schon herumgesprochen haben. Es gibt keinen Basisbau mehr und auch kein sammeln von Ressourcen. Das hätte dennoch Spaß machen können, wenn alles andere gepasst hätte.

Inhaltlich bietet C&C4 eine hauchdünne Story mit überwiegend einer einzigen Cut-Scene-Kulisse für GDI und NOD. Von den coolen Zwischensequenzen der Vorgängerspiele ist nichts mehr übrig. Man hat nicht mehr das Gefühl in einen globalen Konflikt um das Überleben der Menschheit involviert zu sein. Selbst die einzelnen Maps wirken wie ein beengter Sandkasten in dem man mit einigen wenigen Einheiten herumspielt.

Auch der Sound ist kaputt. Bei mir waren keine Kampfgeräusche zu hören. Keine Schüsse, keine Explosionen, nur Musik. Die Nod-Kampagne hat ein wenig mehr Charakter durch die atmosphärischere Musik, aber das kann auch nichts mehr retten.

Aktuell kann man das Spiel nicht mehr kaufen, sollte sich das aber wieder ändern: Es ist absolut rausgeschmissenes Geld!
column9:
C&C 4 unfortunately didn't deliver the brilliant ending to one of the most popular real-time strategy series with breathtaking graphics and a satisfying conclusion to the story of GDI, the Brotherhood of Nod, and their leader, Kain.

Instead, you get a game that constantly crashes or slows down with increasing numbers of objects on the playing field (not pictured!) until it becomes completely unplayable – on a system with a Ryzen 5800 X3D, Radeon RX 6900XT, and 16GB of RAM, mind you. Long before that, all textures start flickering or disappear completely. Then you have to restart the last save game.

It should have been clear by now that the gameplay has also changed. There's no more base building or resource gathering. It could still have been fun, if everything else had been right.

In terms of content, C&C 4 offers a wafer-thin story with mostly a single cutscene setting for GDI and NOD. Nothing remains of the cool cutscenes from the previous games. You no longer feel like you're involved in a global conflict for the survival of humanity. Even the individual maps feel like a cramped sandbox where you play around with a few units.

The sound is also bad. I couldn't hear any battle sounds. No gunshots, no explosions, just music. The Nod campaign has a bit more character thanks to the more atmospheric music, but that can't save it.

The game is currently unavailable for purchase, but if that changes: It's a complete waste of money!

Don't make a new account or password if you have a EA client account already. 

Once in, you can bring all the graphics up to acceptable levels.
There is good graphic details to the game models once you up the resolution to max. 
Then the graphics appear to be quality.

In the lobby you will find only a handful of player names:
And no one will respond to you. Probably died at their computer :(

Your best bet is organize a game on DISCORD find some C&C servers there. Discord  desktop app web app or cell phone your preference. And first google some Tiberian Twilight discord servers you can find people and organizing matches with perhaps. 

I suggest Don't buy this game. Not even for the D L C Unless you always have internet access.  
If for the near future always have Internet, then by all means get it if you want.

PS TheShepherdsChapelChannel Youtube.

The Shepherds Chapel Channel youtube official with Arnold Murray and Dennis Murray .

column9: What a rubbish RTS! No mining, just free troop production, even though there's a population cap. There are three types of bases: offensive ones with tanks and mechs, defensive ones with bunkers, and support ones with aircraft and base abilities. They even incorporate Battlefield's point capture mechanics, and neutral buildings can be captured. I've only just finished the tutorial, and I haven't seen any buildings other than base vehicles...

column8:
Always online requirement and a double login check ruin the game before you even start it. If I hadn't gotten the game in a bundle for so little money, I would have immediately demanded a refund. I would even go so far as to assume that EA Games is deliberately fraud its players in order to squeeze even more money out of them.

And another thing, what genius came up with the brilliant idea of ​​introducing a character cap on the password for the second login and thus forcing its players to create a second account? I certainly won't change my secure password for my account just to play this disgrace for the Command and Conquer franchise.

I wish I could say something about the gameplay, but it never even got that far. However, judging by the other reviews and comments in the forums, the gameplay itself was or is probably not the real thing either.

column8:
The game is a huge disappointment for me. An ugly ending to an iconic game series. Maybe I just had high expectations, but after C&C 3, this game can be a big disappointment for true fans.

In terms of gameplay, it broke with the excellent mechanics of the previous 3 parts. It reminds me more of a mobile game. Can't be built, infinite resources, units are unknowable. For the biggest fans, it's a very crappy gameplay at first, which is very difficult to get used to, but that doesn't make it any better.

Campaign history after C&C 3 is very poor. The actors in the walkthrough videos are very weak. Costumes have also changed, they have become more modern, but they are less suitable for this post-apocalyptic future.

I only played through the campaign. On easy difficulty to get over it as quickly as possible. One of the positives of the game is that the campaign is short, even this is a lot from this game ☹ The entire storytelling was weak, as was the ending.

The fans didn't deserve this...

简直烂到爆炸，重复账号登入游戏，明明密码正确还会提示输入错误，游戏中途断网整局获得经验归零等于白玩一局，游戏上少到可怜的人口上限，高级单位占用人口动不动就10个，虽然后期能用支援基地技能免费工程师占高级地面单位残骸卡人口上限，但没啥大用，连隔壁大主教的一根都不如，剧情也是一坨，真要玩还是建议玩cnc3或cnc3凯怒，你问我为什么玩cnc4快50个小时，我只能告诉你我是找“屎”达人
column9: It's so bad that it explodes. When you log in to the game with the same account repeatedly, you will be prompted with an input error even if the password is correct. If the network is disconnected in the middle of the game, the experience gained in the whole game will be reset to zero, which means you played the whole game in vain. The population limit in the game is pitifully small. Advanced units often occupy 10 people. Although you can use the support base skill to give free engineers to occupy the population limit of advanced ground units, it is of no use. They are not even as good as the archbishop next door. The plot is also a bunch of crap. If you really want to play, I still recommend playing CNC3 or CNC3 Kainu. You asked me why I played CNC4 for almost 50 hours, and I can only tell you that I am a "shit" expert.

column9:
I'm going to feed your horse, Sima EA. Which RTS game requires a full internet connection? Forget about the internet connection, the servers are more awful than the pig's trotters my grandma spent an afternoon stewing. And then there's the fucking double-login issue. Even playing the single-player campaign, I keep getting disconnected and losing progress.
You're on Steam, and all you care about is making money, with no regard for the gaming experience a modern game should and must have, right? No optimization or improvement at all, right? You treat players not as people, but as cash cows and money-making tools, right?
And you're still forcing bundled sales. If it weren't for Red Alert 2, I wouldn't buy your defense-based game for free.
Oh my god, EA, you damned EA, you idiot. You're just like Activision Blizzard. You two are the crappiest of the world, with all the top IPs and no real work. You're the two worst game companies in the world. Tencent and NetEase are a million times better than you! Ubisoft's canned games are a hundred million times more interesting than this pure industrial garbage!
Buying this crappy thing of yours will only pollute my inventory and my computer!

column8:
This was loathed on release and where some games actually redeem themselves with time and effort or just don't feel as controversial in retrospective, this one still sucks, to this day.

For starters, to start *enjoying* this, you need to login with your Origin or whatever EA has to this day, twice, first in launcher, then ingame. Next up, you'll be met with music and cinematics whose tone doesn't match previous CnC games at all but does match the EA's executives at the time ideas of what people would like, the faction conflict of GDI and Nod is being diluted by personal drama of main character who gets to loose a wife that previously showed up for ten seconds but she's a woman saying a nice thing in your face so I guess gamers will forever remember her, and then troopers you serve with get pretty emotional too except the actors aren't the best at it so it comes off goofy and pathosy, and the forst first person perspective with neural network UIs is just over the top with it's flashyness. The art direction in particular seems very influenced by at that time EA's most successful Mass Effect series, you can see it in UI in particular. Music is also way more orchestral and pompastic than anything ever delivered by Frank Klepacki.

Now, the gameplay, it gets a lot of hate. I must say, but as a team-based, online RTS with focus on dynamic shift of frontlines and no preset bases it's kinda sound, conceptually, plus three distinct types of "crawlers" the mobile bases in a single unit, with one being able to push trough with best armored unit, another getting to deploy defenses and infantry that can garrison structures, and yet third getting mostly aerial units and special abilities. It feels kinda like a sci-fi take on World in Conflict, more gamey, but with defined player roles and sides constantly harassing and pressuring each-other. Problem is, the online scene never lasted with how badly this game was received, there's this absolutely insulting grinfingg mechanic where you need to complete missions, skirmishes or online battles to unlock new units, not as some alternative loadouts but as part of core progress, demanding many more games to be played than just going trough a campaign, and all unified for both online and single play, and finally, this gameplay just doesn't translate to as very enjoyable experience in singleplayer, you get to have a small, very modest array of like 8 to 16 combat units at a time, there's some situational additions like husks of wrecked heavy units like in CnC4 to capture if you can afford engineers for it, but ultimately you're just pumping samey units and treating it all like some micro-intensive small squad breaktrough thing even though your units don't have any micro-intensive abilities or benefit from taking cover or something, plus unless necessity dictates you need to defend a single point or need to cover impassable terran with aerial units, you'll be playing all missions with Offensive crawler, so you won't use the free occupyable structures the game has, nor will you be using special ability most of time - and since you'll often deal with more numerous enemy forces that replenish as fast as you, it usually all boils down to building the exact units that counter enemy's forces, collecting veterancy upgrades dropped by enemies, and keep pumping reinforcements while hoping you can hold up. Even repairs don't feel worth it when performed by your easy to destroy engineers, takes too long, so you're better off ordering new units that microing back for repairs, and let me tell you clicking one or two unit buttons endless is a downgrade for CC, going way back to tank spam days.

And going back to presentation, I must say levels look pretty nice, the supermassive industrial construction sites and futuristic green cities make for nice arenas, but the structures and units you get? They range from way more toyetic takes on something you've seen in CnC3 or even earlier games, to genuinely embarrassing, goofy designs. The developers had to even replace the pre-release Nod engineer because it looked like a goofy cartoon worm with a jetpack - and yet, many other designs in this one could have used similar reworks back in the day. And the story? Yeah, Command and Conquer cinematics always felt cheap and hard to take seriously but this one really feels like a new low with team just filming "citizen interviews" with dev team members on streets of LA, blatantly modern day LA without a single postprocessed-in thing all while ingame cities look radically different from modern urban environments. Oh and the very last cinematic is just a white void.

People say this one killed the CnC series and harmed the RTS as a genre for years. I agree. I don't think it's worth your time, if you grabbed the CnC collection you should have a whole load of great games, don't hesitate to pass on this one even if you're a true penny pincher.

column9:
Well, I thought the online and EA registration requirements were really crap, to be honest, it really should have gotten a thumbs down for that, then it should get a thumbs up for "so-so" because it really has nothing to do with C&C anymore and I was very disappointed to see that this is the last Command & Conquer. After Kane's Wrath was released, I still thought it was okay and great, but then the fact that everything went downhill in Command & Conquer™ 4 Tiberian Twilight was really crap.

I can say that the game is fun, but only if you don't expect it to be part of Command & Conquer, even though I was happy to see our Kane in action again!

column8:
I only bought this as part of a pack for the Command & Conquer series.

C&C has some of the most iconic RTS titles of all time. This, sadly, is not one of them.

C&C 4 took everything great about the series and just sort of tossed it aside and went in a completely different direction. Instead of building a traditional base, you have this strange mobile command vehicle, where you recruit all your units and do everything. It's sort of like an all-in-one base. And BOY is it not fun at all. A big part of RTS games is building a base and managing your resources, but this game is like "nah, we don't need that."

Furthermore, there's also no resource gathering. You just gradually earn points that allow you to recruit more units. The unit limit, by the way, is incredibly low. This game seems to want you to micromanage just a few units, which I don't personally find nearly as fun. This also means, that there's no "worker" or "harvester" unit, and there's no way to attack your opponent's economy, other than gradually taking control of the map to earn your points faster.

If this had been a standalone game, people might have been mildly interested. But calling this abomination a "Command & Conquer" game was just a giant slap in the face to fans. You want to play Street Fighter with no punching? How about Super Mario Brothers with no jumping? That's what this game feels like to people who love the series. 

There's honestly no point in picking up this game, not even to laugh at how bad it is. The whole thing is just so dull that it fails to leave any impression on you other than wanting to play a better game.

Go play an actual RTS and don't waste your time on this schlock.

column8:
Never played it.  Never will.
Trying to get this game to run makes running C&C 3 look and feel like a cakewalk!

You can't play this game without an EA Account and to make matters worse, it throws out the same damn "General System Error" regardless of what you do to fix it (whether you log in and play by the rules or try to sneak past the "Bouncer").

From what I have seen of others playing this and uploading videos to YouTube...

Here's my limited impression of Tiberian Twilight: (In Short) Forgettable and not worth remastering, way too easy to retcon the whole damn thing...
(2 Cents) Shame, to see waste of the A-Grade performances from the story content that was ACTUALLY good and worth caring about.  If you never played this one, you can easily let the Tiberian Saga ride off into the sunset with C&C Tiberium Wars and Kane's Wrath.  C&C 4 and the mobile games are evidence the Command & Conquer franchise means absolutely nothing to Electronic Arts beyond another golden goose the C-Suite can take turns "Riding" (like the village bicycle that it is) until it inevitably croaks.

If you're buying the C&C Ultimate Collection - Don't let this game become a blemish on an epic purchase...  Save the HDD/SDD space and click "Hide".
Otherwise, if you're thinking about about buying this lemon as a standalone purchase (assuming you can)...  DON'T!

If EA EVER DO green light a redux of the Tiberian Saga, Twilight is so unforgettably bad few are going to miss it if it's retconned for something better.

Je crois qu'il n'existe pas de mot pour qualifier ce jeu tellement il est mauvais. Je ne connaîtrai jamais la suite de l'histoire, car franchement même avec les meilleurs volonté du monde, même si on me paye pour y joué, je ne peux pas joué a un jeu aussi mauvais. j'ai à peine réussi a lancer la première mission et tenu 5 minutes, qu'il a fallut que je quitte et que je ferme le jeu définitivement tellement qu'il était pourri. Il y a rien à garder, tout est a mettre a la benne. 
De l'histoire du jeu vidéo je crois ne jamais avoir vu une suite de saga aussi raté.
column9:
I don't think there are words to describe this game, it's so bad. I'll never know how it ends, because frankly, even with the best will in the world, even if I'm paid to play it, I can't play a game this bad. I barely managed to launch the first mission and last 5 minutes, before I had to quit and close the game permanently because it was so rotten. There's nothing to keep; everything should be thrown away.
In the history of video games, I don't think I've ever seen a sequel to a saga that was so bad.

The first time you log in with your EA account, after completing the first step of logging in, you will enter the game and will be forced to log in again in the game. The problem is that you cannot log in again in the game because the server has been shut down. So you cannot log in. You cannot start the game if you cannot log in.

Excellent, I've bought the game. The game is definitely playable, and there are no login issues, no technical skills required. The only downside is that you have to log in to EA twice: once when the game starts, and again after watching the cutscenes. To fix this, you can download a login-free patch.
The entire CNC set cost less than 80 yuan, so I could just buy it.

没买的注意，这个游戏，你买了和没买一样，买了也玩不了。下面我来为你解释为什么玩不了，这个游戏开始后需要登录两次，第一次用EA账号登录，需要登录好多次才能登录成功。OK，你完成第一步登录后，会进入游戏内，在游戏内呢，会强制你再次登录。问题来了，游戏内的再次登录，你无论如何都无法登录。为什么？因为服务器已经关闭了。所以无法登录。登录不进去就无法开始游戏，注意哦。这是个单机游戏，需要你登录两次才能开始，而且第二次根本不让你登录，哈哈哈。开心不？惊喜不。所以你花这钱干嘛呢？
column9: Attention, if you haven't bought this game, it's the same whether you bought it or not. You can't play it even if you buy it. Let me explain to you why you can't play it. After starting this game, you need to log in twice. The first time you log in with your EA account, you need to log in multiple times before you can log in successfully. OK, after you complete the first step of logging in, you will enter the game. In the game, you will be forced to log in again. The problem is, you can't log in again in the game no matter what. Why? Because the server has been shut down. So you can't log in. If you can't log in, you can't start the game, please pay attention. This is a stand-alone game. You need to log in twice before you can start, and you won't be allowed to log in the second time, hahahaha. Happy? Surprised? So why did you spend this money?

column8:
Fino a quando questo gioco non otterrà 2 cose:

1) La possibilità di essere giocato totalmente offline, senza autenticazione o altre menate varie
2) La possibilità di essere moddato a dovere

La mia recensione resterà negativa. L'ho provato e avrebbe avuto un vago senso, se fosse stata una modalità di gioco in multiplayer, quella che hanno proposto, e non l'intero gioco. Così com'è messo... non va.
column9:
Until this game achieves two things:

1) The ability to be played completely offline, without authentication or any other bullshit
2) The ability to be properly modded

My review will remain negative. I tried it, and it would have made a vague amount of sense if it had been a multiplayer game mode, like they proposed, and not the entire game. As it is... it's no good.

column8: Nonostante le recensioni pesantemente negative su questo gioco, ho deciso di acquistarlo comunque e mi sono reso conto che non è pessimo come (quasi) tutti scrivono. Sì, ammetto che anche io avrei preferito che questo capitolo avesse avuto il classico gameplay RTS come i precedenti Tiberium Wars e Kane's Wrath, ma complessivamente mi piace. Il gioco è molto incentrato sulla cooperazione e si basa su un concetto di 'azione/controllo' in cui si sceglie il proprio ruolo sul campo di battaglia (attacco, difesa o supporto). Un concetto che probabilmente, nel 2010, era ancora nuovo e poco concepito. Il Tiberium è sempre presente, anche se qui non è la risorsa usata per costruire le unità, ma serve per acquistare i relativi potenziamenti. Personalmente, lo consiglio.
column9: Despite the overwhelmingly negative reviews for this game, I decided to buy it anyway and realized it's not as bad as (almost) everyone says. Yes, I admit that I too would have preferred this installment to have had the classic RTS gameplay like the previous titles, Tiberium Wars and Kane's Wrath, but overall I like it. The game is heavily focused on cooperation and is based on an action/control concept where you choose your role on the battlefield (offense, defense, or support). A concept that was probably still new and poorly conceived in 2010. Tiberium is always present, even though here it isn't the resource used to build units, but is used to purchase their upgrades. Personally, I recommend it.

column8:
Este juego es UNA PORQUERÍA. Solo he jugado unos 20 minutos, pero ya me ha puesto enfermo. 

En primer lugar, el estilo de juego ha cambiado totalmente, ya no es un RTS clasico de construir tu base y dessarollar tus tecnologías, sinó que vas con un solo edificio y sacas unidades desde allí. Además, ya no hay "campos de Tiberio", de hecho ni siquiera hay recursos, las unidades son gratuitas. 

En segundo lugar, hay poquísimas opciones a la hora de hacer estrategias variadas, solo hay creo; unas 11 unidades. Además, (aunque esto sea quizás cosa mía) la interfaz a la hora de hacer una escaramuza, no se entiende muy bien, oséase: no sé como cambiar la facción y otras cosas varias.

En tercer lugar: el juego no está en Español, aunque cierto es que eso quizá haya que mirarselo en la configuración. Yo lo he mirado muy por encima y no he descubierto nada relacionado con el idioma.

En cuarto y último lugar: necesitas crearte un perfil de E.A. para jugar, pero a mí al menos, me ha dado muchísimos problemas, en el sentido de que daba un error extraño cuando iniciaba sesión, estando bien la contraseña y el nombre de usuario. Es más, de los 28 minutos que sale que he jugado, 7 son porque mientras intentas iniciar sesión te cuenta tiempo de juego.

Conclusión: no te lo compres a menos que te cueste menos de 000,00 euros, y aunque así sea, dudo que lo vayas a jugar más de 20 minutos, como yo y las pobres millones de almas perdidas que compraron esto pensando que era un C&C solo por el título. Espero que te haya sido útil, aunque casi todas las otras reseñas dicen cosas parecidas.
column9:
This game is CRAP. I've only played it for about 20 minutes, but it's already made me sick.

First of all, the gameplay has changed completely. It's no longer a classic RTS of building your base and developing your technologies, but rather, you go with a single building and deploy units from there. Also, there are no more "Tiberium fields"; in fact, there aren't even any resources; units are free.

Secondly, there are very few options when it comes to creating varied strategies; there are only, I think, about 11 units. Also, (although this may be just me) the interface for starting a skirmish isn't very clear; I mean, I don't know how to change the faction and other various things.

Thirdly, the game isn't in Spanish, although it's true that you might have to check that in the settings. I've looked at it very briefly and haven't discovered anything related to the language.

Fourth and last: you need to create an EA profile to play, but for me, at least, it's given me tons of problems. It gave me a strange error when I logged in, even though my password and username were correct. What's more, of the 28 minutes I've played, 7 of them are because it counts your game time while you're trying to log in.

Conclusion: Don't buy it unless it costs you less than €1,000.00, and even if it does, I doubt you'll play it for more than 20 minutes, like me and the poor millions of lost souls who bought this thinking it was a C&C just for the title. I hope it's been helpful, although almost all the other reviews say similar things.

column8:
[h1]ХОТЕЛИ МОБУ, А ПОЛУЧИЛИ ЖО...[/h1]
Худшее завершение культовой франшизы и придумать сложно. Осталось всего две стороны конфликта, три МСЦ (оборонительный, наступательный и поддержка) для производства войск и горстка юнитов на карте, поскольку теперь появился лимит. Графика стала хуже, звуковая составляющая тоже. Сюжет шит белыми нитками, количество миссий слишком скудное, дизайн карт и юнитов безыдейный, безвкусный и не вписывается в общий лор вселенной. К тому же типы войск не соответствуют пилотам, сидящим внутри, а общие размеры машин огневой мощи. Ресурсы теперь добывать не надо, лишь удерживать точки интереса, прямо как в Company of Heroes. Зеленые и красные кристаллы тиберия подбираются только в специально отведенных местах и нужны для прокачки характеристик юнитов. Даже Джо Кукан в лице любимого всеми Нодовцами Кейна не вытягивает своей харизмой проект.
Это очень примерный образец того, что если маркетологи берутся за что-либо, то получается пятикратно переваренная субстанция. Поэтому можно сказать, что финал истории открыт, ибо эта часть неканон.
Брать только ради помещения данного образца в игрокунсткамеру!
P.S. Во славу Кейна!
column9:
[h1]WANTED A MOBA, BUT GOT ASS...[/h1] 
It's hard to imagine a worse ending to the iconic franchise. There are only two sides to the conflict, three MSCs (defensive, offensive, and support) for troop production, and a handful of units on the map, thanks to a new limit. The graphics have deteriorated, as have the sound. The plot is thinly woven, the number of missions is too meager, the map and unit designs are bland, tasteless, and out of sync with the overall lore of the universe. Furthermore, the troop types don't correspond to the pilots inside, and the overall size of the vehicles doesn't match the firepower. Resources no longer need to be mined, only points of interest need to be held, just like in Company of Heroes. Green and red Tiberium crystals are collected only in designated locations and are needed to upgrade unit stats. Even Joe Kukan, played by Kane, beloved by all Nodovites, can't carry the project with his charisma.

This is a prime example of how, when marketers take on something, the result is a substance that's been overcooked five times over. Therefore, one could say the story's ending is open-ended, as this part is non-canon.
It's worth picking up only for the sake of placing this example in the player's chamber!

P.S. For the glory of Kane!

column8: Command and Conquer: Tiberian Twilight marks the conclusion of the iconic RTS series with mixed results. While it attempts to innovate with new gameplay mechanics and a persistent multiplayer experience, it deviates too far from the franchise's roots, alienating some long-time fans. The game's graphics and sound design are solid, but the restrictive unit cap and simplified base-building mechanics limit strategic depth. Despite its shortcomings, it still offers some enjoyable moments for those willing to adapt to its changes. Ultimately, Tiberian Twilight serves as a bittersweet finale to a beloved series, showcasing both its strengths and its shortcomings.

Despite its shortcomings, it still offers some enjoyable moments for those willing to adapt to its changes. Ultimately, Tiberian Twilight serves as a bittersweet finale to a beloved series, showcasing both its strengths and its shortcomings.

column8: 没买的注意，这个游戏，你买了和没买一样，买了也玩不了。下面我来为你解释为什么玩不了，这个游戏开始后需要登录两次，第一次用EA账号登录，需要登录好多次才能登录成功。OK，你完成第一步登录后，会进入游戏内，在游戏内呢，会强制你再次登录。问题来了，游戏内的再次登录，你无论如何都无法登录。为什么？因为服务器已经关闭了。所以无法登录。登录不进去就无法开始游戏，注意哦。这是个单机游戏，需要你登录两次才能开始，而且第二次根本不让你登录，哈哈哈。开心不？惊喜不。所以你花这钱干嘛呢？
column9: Attention, if you haven't bought this game, it's the same whether you bought it or not. You can't play it even if you buy it. Let me explain to you why you can't play it. After starting this game, you need to log in twice. The first time you log in with your EA account, you need to log in multiple times before you can log in successfully. OK, after you complete the first step of logging in, you will enter the game. In the game, you will be forced to log in again. The problem is, you can't log in again in the game no matter what. Why? Because the server has been shut down. So you can't log in. If you can't log in, you can't start the game, please pay attention. This is a stand-alone game. You need to log in twice before you can start, and you won't be allowed to log in the second time, hahahaha. Happy? Surprised? So why did you spend this money?

How can there be such garbage in the world!

column8:
Это было отвратительно. За 4 часа я прошёл одну компанию. Вторую ветку сюжета посмотрел на ютубе.

В этой игре плохо абсолютно всё.

Сюжет плох. От третьей части идёт абсолютно нелогичный скачок, зачем-то вставили бесполезную любовную линию. Кейн потерял харизму, на видеовставках тоже видно экономили. Сюжет начинается с ничего и заканчивается максимально вяло.

От игрового процесса тянет закрыть игру поскорее. Строительства баз нет, добычи ресурсов нет. Теперь это МОБА. После шедевральной третьей части и дополнения к ней это выглядит как плевок в душу. От скриннов есть только упоминания в сюжете, играбельную фракцию выкинули на помойку.

Графически игра тоже стала хуже. Стилистика третьей части потрясающая, и когда включаешь после неё четвёртую, задаёшься вопросом, а это вообще та серия игр?

В общем, в этой игре абсолютно ничего не стоит внимания, сюжет проще посмотреть в записи за 15-20 минут. Ради геймплея играть в это точно не надо.
column9:
It was disgusting. I finished one campaign in four hours. I watched the second storyline on YouTube.

Everything about this game is absolutely bad.

The plot is bad. The jump from the third game is completely illogical, and they somehow inserted a useless love story. Kane has lost his charisma, and they clearly skimped on the cutscenes. The plot starts with nothing and ends in a completely sluggish manner.

The gameplay makes you want to close the game as soon as possible. There's no base building, no resource gathering. It's a MOBA now. After the masterpiece of the third game and its expansion, this feels like a slap in the face. The screenshots are only mentioned in the story, and the playable faction has been thrown out.

The game's graphics have also gotten worse. The style of the third game is stunning, and when you play the fourth game after it, you wonder, is this even the same game series?

Overall, there's absolutely nothing worth paying attention to in this game; the story is easier to watch in a recording in 15-20 minutes. You definitely shouldn't play it for the gameplay.

This game is a step back from the roots of C&C to casual mane stream mobile online games.

column8:
本来不想给差评的，但我玩着是真糟心。
首先就是麻烦的联网，还要自己下补丁才能稳定（ea账号好久以前注册过但几乎不用）。再就是这一代有点脱离CNC了，限制单位是哪个离谱策划搞出来的？你要说像救世主之类的史诗单位限制也无所谓了，普通单位还有点数设计。再就是战役锁科技，人家能出乳齿象或者寡妇，我呢？谢菲尔德坦克，复仇者坦克。拿t1打t3，什么离谱设定。我就是为了玩战役的，结果战役这么恶心人。这一代战役真就是我玩过CNC里体验感巨差的一代。
gdi已经肝20级了，nod直接开修改器刷等级。另外nod战役到吉迪恩引爆基地就崩溃，不知道是我的问题还是都这样。
column9:
I didn't mean to give a bad review, but playing this game is truly frustrating.
First, the connection is a hassle, and I have to install patches to get it stable (I registered an EA account ages ago, but rarely use it). Then there's the fact that this generation seems to be moving away from CNC. What insane developer came up with these unit restrictions? If you're talking about epic units like the Savior, that's fine; regular units still have point-based design. Then there's the campaign lock. Others can build Mastodons or Widowmakers, but me? Sheffield tanks, Avenger tanks. Using a T1 tank against a T3 tank—what a ridiculous setup. I came here just to play the campaign, and it's just so awful. This generation's campaign is the worst CNC experience I've ever had.
I've already reached level 20 in GDI, but NOD is just using a mod to level up. Also, NOD's campaign crashes when Gideon detonates the base. I don't know if it's just me or if it's the same for everyone.

column8:
Fiquei surpreso com o que encontrei de forma não muito positiva, muito diferente do que costuma se encontrar em Command & Conquer...
Sem bases onde um MCV se resume em tudo, não podendo acelerar a construção de unidades sendo um fator importante para repor as tropas principalmente na campanha;
Não tem recursos para coletar, pode treinar a vontade desde que tenha células populacionais, e uns cristais de tiberium espalhados pelo mapa, só se pega isso algumas vezes para melhorar as unidades...
Tropas muito limitadas no fator quantidade, ai eu me pergunto como passo uma fase em que tenho no máximo 15 unidades contra 4x mais do inimigo, é uma missão inicial ainda então resumindo não tem muita coisa para treinar ou melhorar... Infelizmente desbalanceado;
Não gostaria de dizer isso sobre o game mas para mim é um jogo bem fora de C&C e ruim também, é jogável mas tem momentos que irritam o jogador...
Se você quer um C&C bom que tenha bons gráficos com certeza é o C&C 3 de longe o melhor nesse caso, ou até mesmo vale a pena tentar os clássicos também muito bons mesmo, até o C&C 2 que ficou dividido entre amor e ódio...
Meu amigo C&C 4 foi o pior que já joguei, no caso se enjoar de todos o C&C aí sim jogue esse pois encontrará um experiencia diferente que para mim foi estranha e desagradável, mas pelo menos é algo diferente para tentar aliviar a mente das batalhas frenéticas dos outros jogos da franquia!
column9:
I was surprised by what I found, which wasn't very positive, very different from what you usually find in Command & Conquer...
No bases, where an MCV is all that matters, and you can't speed up unit construction, which is an important factor in replenishing troops, especially in the campaign;
There are no resources to collect, you can train as much as you want as long as you have population cells, and some tiberium crystals scattered around the map, which you only collect a few times to improve your units...
Troops are very limited in terms of quantity, so I wonder how I'll get through a level where I have a maximum of 15 units against 4x the enemy's. It's still an initial mission, so in short, there's not much to train or improve... Unfortunately, it's unbalanced;
I don't want to say this about the game, but for me, it's a game far removed from C&C, and bad too. It's playable, but there are moments that irritate the player...
If you want a good C&C with good graphics, C&C 3 is definitely the best, or even the classics, which are also very good, are worth trying, even C&C 2, which I divided between love and hate...
My friend, C&C 4 was the worst I've ever played. If you get tired of all C&Cs, then play this one. You'll find a different experience, which for me was strange and unpleasant, but at least it's something different to try and take your mind off the frantic battles of the other games in the franchise!

column8: J'ai du créer un compte EA donc ne pouvait pas jouer de suite. Puis s'est posé le problème de la connexion donc je ne pouvais pas jouer non plus. Puis j'ai été déconnecté donc perdu ma progression (mission 1 que j'ai du refaire deux fois). J'ai refait la mission 1, arrivé à la 2, j'ai cherché pendant 5 minutes comment déployer une tourelle de défense. Et franchement je ne vais pas me fatiguer davantage, si pour une action de construction simple dans les précédents opus n'est pas retrouvé ici, j'abandonne c'est bon, ils m'ont découragé, j'ai quitté le jeu. Un message aux développeurs: votre salaire sur cette saga est illicite puisse dieu vous mettre au chômage.
column9: I had to create an EA account so I couldn't play right away. Then the connection problem arose so I couldn't play either. Then I was disconnected so I lost my progress (mission 1 which I had to redo twice). I redid mission 1, arrived at 2, I searched for 5 minutes how to deploy a defense turret. And frankly I'm not going to tire myself out any more, if for a simple construction action in the previous installments it isn't found here, I give up, it's fine, they discouraged me, I left the game. A message to the developers: your salary on this saga is illegal, may God put you out of work.

column9:
The worst part of the franchise, and here's why:
1. Constant authorization! (During and after launch! It's a real travesty!)
2. Optimization is completely nonexistent! (The game crashes at every opportunity, every key press and that's it!)
3. After playing on a pirated version, since the Steam version crashes, I realized that this is the worst part. It doesn't have the same mechanics and combat as the older versions, and old-timers will know what I mean!
The developers have ruined everything that made the community happy!

column8:
Tiberian Twilight
Due to the influx of players, the C&C4 servers are having some problems with initial login. If you receive a General system error message, the only option is to keep trying.

You can skip the initial launcher by putting the following in your Steam launch options: cmd /c ""PATH-TO-GAMEFOLDER\Data\CNC4.game" -config "..\CNC4_English.SkuDef" %COMMAND% and change the path to match the actual path to your game, and change the English SkuDef to whatever language you're using. This option will NOT work if you do not already have an EA account--the game will boot but you will be greeted with the second login screen without a create account option.

The following files can be renamed or deleted to skip the startup logo:

CNC4Logo.vp6
ea.vp6
EALogo.snd
EALogo.vp6

column8: General System Error.

Tiberian Twilight es un título con luces y muchas sombras. Como secuela y epílogo de la saga Tiberian puede resultar decepcionante, pero como juego en sí mismo es medianamente pasable y entretenido. A título personal, está lejos de ser el desastre que la crítica general apuntó allá en el 2010, año en el que se estrenó. 

El principal problema -si exceptuamos las comparaciones con otros juegos de la misma saga- radica en que 
replantea todo su sistema jugable que tradicionalmente consistió en gestión de bases de combate y unidades a favor de un sistema orientado al multijugador -no hay control de bases, solo un número limitado de unidades y un sistema de puntos-, así como defensa y conquista de torres. La jugabilidad que plantea es cómoda, más o menos se aprende rápido pero carece de profundidad porque apenas deja al jugador opciones para enfrentarse a los desafíos. El tono es lineal y de escasa maniobra. Es decir, es un título de estrategia RTS pero sin estrategia, solo dejando la parte de acción.

A día de hoy los pocos alicientes que un jugador puede encontrar para jugarlo es... la campaña, el modo historia porque el multijugador está poco más que muerto. Si eres fan de la saga Command and Conquer vale la pena jugarlo -aunque genere sentimientos encontrados-. Su modo historia tiene un planteamiento interesante -dramático, seria y con cierto carácter épico-; el gran inconveniente es su escasa duración y la falta de un mayor desarrollo. 

Un último apunte, solo necesitas introducir tu cuenta de EA/Origin para iniciar el juego -puede surgir algún error de inicio pero se solventa fácilmente volviendo a introducir los datos o esperando un rato-. 

Recomendado para el fan de la saga Command and Conquer. Por lo demás, un título pasable y jugabilidad anecdótica.
column9:
Tiberian Twilight is a title with many highlights and many shadows. As a sequel and epilogue to the Tiberian saga, it may be disappointing, but as a game in itself, it's moderately passable and entertaining. Personally, it's far from the disaster that critics generally pointed out back in 2010, the year it was released.

The main problem—if we exclude comparisons with other games in the same series—lies in the fact that it rethinks its entire gameplay system, which traditionally consisted of combat base and unit management, in favor of a multiplayer-oriented system—there's no base control, only a limited number of units and a points system—as well as tower defense and conquest. The gameplay is comfortable, more or less quick to learn, but it lacks depth because it leaves the player few options to face challenges. The tone is linear and limited in maneuverability. In other words, it's an RTS strategy title without strategy, leaving only the action aspect.

As of today, the few incentives a player can find to play it are... the campaign, the story mode, because the multiplayer is practically dead. If you're a fan of the Command and Conquer series, it's worth playing—even if it generates mixed feelings. Its story mode has an interesting approach—dramatic, serious, and with a certain epic quality; the major drawback is its short length and lack of further development.

One last note: you only need to enter your EA/Origin account to start the game. Some startup errors may occur, but they're easily resolved by re-entering your details or waiting a while.

Recommended for fans of the Command and Conquer series. Otherwise, a passable title with mediocre gameplay.

Obviously it's a failure of a sequel to a well-established series, but if you're like me, you probably wonder, "How does it stand up on its own merits?" And honestly, story aside, it's not a /terrible/ game... In fact, I'd even say it's quite good!

For mobile.

This is basically a mobile game on PC. If it WERE on mobile, I actually think it might've been decently liked, with more of its flaws overlooked in favor of accessibility.

Most other reviews are tinged with disappointment at what this game represents in the series, but very little as to what the game actually is. There are definitely much worse games out there, and I still squeezed some hours out of this one, it's just not a very memorable game either. I'm only giving it a positive because it's cheap, but it's tenuous considering you have to jump some hoops to even make this emblem of mediocrity playable.

column8:
Command & Conquer 4 wird seinem schlechten Ruf nicht gerecht - es ist alles noch viel schlimmer! Man hat den Eindruck, eine halbherzige Mod für Warcraft 3 zu spielen. Die Modelle, deren Texturen und Animationen stammen aus der Hölle (warum hat man nicht einfach die bereits vorhandenen genutzt?!). Das Gameplay ist völlig verändert und nicht einmal mehr im Ansatz mit dem der vorherigen Teile zu vergleichen. Man fühlt sich an einfache Handyspiele erinnert. 

Desweiteren wird die wirre Story, die man in Tiberian Sun begonnen hat, konsequent schlecht und unnötig umfangreich (also von der Videolänge her, nicht inhaltlich) weitergesponnen. 

EA sollte dringend einen Idiotentest für Manager einführen. Mir ist völlig unverständlich, wie solch ein miserables Laienwerk durch die Qualitätskontrolle kommt.
column9:
Command & Conquer 4 doesn't live up to its bad reputation—it's all much worse! It feels like you're playing a half-baked mod for Warcraft 3. The models, their textures, and animations are from hell (why didn't they just use the existing ones?!). The gameplay is completely different and doesn't even remotely compare to that of previous installments. It reminds you of simple mobile games.

Furthermore, the confusing story that began in Tiberian Sun continues to be consistently poorly and unnecessarily extensive (in terms of video length, not content).

EA should urgently introduce an idiot test for managers. I completely fail to understand how such a miserable amateur piece of work makes it through quality control.

column8:
I played this when it came out as I was a huge C&C fan and would play all the titles. remembered some small details from it when I played it back then in 2010, but couldn't remember how it felt playing. I installed it again as I wanted to finish the C&C storyline regardless of all the negative reviews, the story was only interesting to me to finish and never play it again.

To summarize - I played 2 missions and the game is so awful and such a horrible deviation from all the C&C titles and I was severely demotivated to further go through it and I was okay with not finishing the story which was never the case.

I simply couldn't go through it further as the gameplay is so repulsive comparing to the 90% rest of the C&C titles (I am looking at you Red Alert 3).

I thought I had a valid excuse to go through this game, but there is not a single one to go through and learn the gameplay if you played the previous titles. It deserves that it ends up forgotten and and never mentioned again.

Loved the C&C franchise and the RTS games and I am sad to see that it was concluded like this with current sole focus on the embarrasing mobile games that pulls the people in for microtransactions solely on the nostalgia and its former glory.

Peace through power !

General System Error.

Even if it wasn't a fucked mess that relied on always online DRM to even function (thanks EA)

https://www.stopkillinggames.com/

it feels like some exec heard that MOBAs were the hot new thing, and tried to pare down everything until it was an easily digestible slurry for the league of legends crowd. If you wanted the small scale fleet, with a powerful unit you use as a base, go pick up deserts of karak, because some idiot also decided to lock the entire tech tree behind grinding

to elaborate, imagine having the ability to deal with certain units completely walled off to you until you sit down and grind 20 hours of their godawful capture the flag minigame to progress

it feels like they took a perfectly serviceable RTS, dissected it, and reassembled it wrong
forget smashing through defenses to deliver the killing blow to your opponent, that dumbass can just respawn
forget making a hilarious unstoppable death ball, you got 30 population cap, and the smallest unit takes 3 pop
and even then, everything but the most basic units are all locked behind tedious grinding.
go fuck yourself EA

Der Grabstein einer ansonsten großartigen Serie. Das bisherige Spielsystem wird vollkommen auf den Kopf gestellt und von einem RTS mit Basenbau in eine MOBA Variante verwandelt. Hierzu kann ich das Video von Gamestar zum Niedergang von Command and Conquer empfehlen.

Das Spiel ist so sinnvoll wie ein Kropf.
Zudem muss man sich mehrfach anmelden, was teilweise auch noch fehlerhaft ist. Für ein 14 Jahre altes Spiel echt nervig.
Spielt lieber Teil 2 oder 3
column9:
The tombstone of an otherwise great series. The previous game system has been completely turned upside down, transformed from an RTS with base building into a MOBA variant. I can recommend the Gamestar video on the decline of Command and Conquer.

The game is as useful as a goiter.
You also have to log in multiple times, which is sometimes buggy. Really annoying for a 14-year-old game.
Better play part 2 or 3.

column8:
Okay, so i'm joining the overwhelmingly negative review squad here, and there are three main reasons for this.

1) the login headache - yep everyone and their mothers is yapping on about this and to be honest i'm joining them, it took me about 30 mins or so to brute force this sodding thing to finally let me cause of the fact they shut the servers down for the ea login in thing. like i said i did eventually get the thing to work but honest i dont need that kind of headache when all i want to do is play a sodding game.

2) played a few missions and then i got to this gdi one called cold hard truth, good god that one is annoying as hel cause the secondary objective requires you to stop this excavation teams from pulling up some old tanks from a previous war. okay i thought do that and nab them for myself no problems, only there is the sodding problem right away cause it goes one of two ways - either the ai bottles you up in a corner until they can nick these things or if you do actually bum rush them and get the tanks guess what, the ai spams these commando drone things that run up, disable and then out right nick them from you. oh and did we mention that these little buggers have an insane health/armour pool on them .... yeah have fun numbnuts cause if you do actually manage to kill the thing they just nicked, no biggy for them cause they will just run over and nick another tank in like 5 seconds. so your playing 5 mins of "WILL YOU BLOODY KILL THAT IDIOT ALREADY".

3) final point - tiberium is now pretty much useless what the heck, what i mean by this is in the previous game tiberium was everything. if you didn't have it your weren't building/upgrade/training anything so it was pretty much a necessity and i loved that cause it made me be strategic about what the heck i was doing and helped me control my enemies cause they too were bond to the need for tiberium but in this game is just a temporary power shiny thing and thats it. you want units oh no probs just use command points instead oh and your enemies have that too so good luck with the constant army spamming.

Yeah at this point i just went "fluff if, i'm uninstalling and never playing this abortion ever again".

column8:
Der mit Abstand schlechteste Teil der Serie und ein Stück Datenschrott, das den Titel „Command & Conquer“ nicht verdient. Habe es nur gekauft, weil es im Bundle „Command & Conquer™ The Ultimate Collection on Steam“ enthalten war und man es nicht einzeln abwählen konnte … man muss es mitkaufen.

Besonders ärgerlich ist, dass das Spiel dann aber nicht einmal funktioniert, weil man sich zum Spielen mit deren Server verbinden muss und das schlichtweg nicht möglich ist, weil die den vermutlich schon vor Ewigkeiten eingestampft haben.

Pro-Tipp: Ihr könnt unter https://help.steampowered.com/de/ das Spiel wieder zurückgeben. Und zwar tatsächlich auch nur dieses eine Spiel aus dem Bundle (hier ist es dann plötzlich möglich, einzelne Spiele auszuwählen). Ihr könnt euch so zumindest 1,99 € zurückholen, welche das Game eh nicht wert gewesen wäre, selbst wenn es funktionieren würde.
column9:
By far the worst installment in the series and a piece of junk that doesn't deserve the title "Command & Conquer." I only bought it because it was included in the "Command & Conquer™ The Ultimate Collection on Steam" bundle, and you couldn't deselect it individually... you have to buy it with the game.

What's particularly annoying is that the game doesn't even work because you have to connect to their server to play, and that's simply not possible because they probably shut it down ages ago.

Pro tip: You can return the game at https://help.steampowered.com/de/. And only this one game from the bundle (there you suddenly have the option to select individual games). At least you can get €1.99 back, which the game wouldn't have been worth even if it worked.

column8:
So, first of all, you can't login. Maybe you could if you have an existing EA account, but I created a new account and I can't freaking login. Did all that password, link steam account, still can't login. So you have to keep trying after "general system error" messages. Same as inside the game. Well, I don't understand why do I have to login again inside the game which require authentication to start. 

After dealing with login issue(s). Just played first mission. The opening movie made me feel like I was watching ptube. That creepy ass wife/girlfriend chills me out. Where did they find these ppl FFS. There is a difference between real crews and movie casts. Unlike movies in Red Alert 2 which were fun to watch. These are just bunch of embarrassment. 

Those vehicles look like made of paper. Sliding/jittering on the ground. Promping you to use q or box to select all units then what? With all that babysitting of highlight and message boxes, you have to tell me what to do. You want me to move the selected units to some place or do something? Hello? 

During the mission, you have to do exactly what they want you to do. You just can't scout ahead. At certain unmarked check points, you must have your unit stand beside the tranport you need to protect. I mean this game was released in 2010 yeah? were level designer interns too? Considering it's EA, it could be true.

column8:
我不明白EA是带着怎样的一种精神状态，在拿出CNC3这种史诗级佳作之后做出了CNC4如此不堪的一坨shi，除了背景故事和世界观设定之外，把前作所有的东西甚至包括游戏机制统统砍掉，拿出一款战役只能用三分之一兵种的三分之二科技树来完成、人口上限60但一辆坦克占6、甚至连多生产序列都没有全靠基地生产所有单位的令我震惊的“神作”，你TM居然有脸声称“你可以指挥的单位比任何其他《命令与征服》游戏都要多！”，《英雄连》能控制的单位都比CNC4多，Kane一个邪教教皇都不如一个连长有实权。这还只是游戏本身的shi，游戏之外则有更大的shi：EA你是不是SB，一个单机游戏你搞NM臭B的全程联网，需要登录两次就算了居然还有必须去官网改密码才能用新密码登录的BUG，真NM有你的。
FXXK YOU EA!!! YOU FXXKING AXXHOLE FXXK CNC UP!!!
column9:
I don't understand what kind of mindset EA had. After delivering such an epic masterpiece as Command & Conquer III, they made such a horrible mess like Command & Conquer IV. Aside from the story and world setting, they completely ripped out everything from the previous game, even the gameplay mechanics. They delivered a "masterpiece" that shocked me with a campaign that can only be completed with two-thirds of the tech tree and a one-third of the troops, a population cap of 60, but one tank accounts for 6, and there's not even multiple production lines, with all units produced entirely at bases. And you have the nerve to claim, "You can command more units than any other Command & Conquer game!" Company of Heroes even has more controllable units than Command & Conquer IV, and Kane, a cult pope, has less power than a company commander. And that's just the game itself. There's an even bigger issue beyond the game itself: EA, are you idiots? For a single-player game, you've made it all online, requiring you to log in twice, and even have a bug where you have to go to the official website to change your password before you can log in with the new one. You're fucking idiots!
Fuck you EA!!! You fucking axe! Fuck you CNC UP!!!

column8: Un bodrio total, para jugar necesitas conexión online, un RTS en donde tienes en PvP tienes que juntar puntos para ganar. Y si crees que tienes todas las unidades desbloqueadas en PvP noooo, tienes que juntar experiencia en el juego para desbloquear unidades y armas. De hueva total.
column9: A total mess. You need an online connection to play. It's an RTS game where you have to collect points in PvP to win. And if you think you've unlocked all the units in PvP, no, you have to collect experience in the game to unlock units and weapons. Totally boring.

column8:
Being an avid fan all RTS games, but the C&C games in particular, I was really excited to try this out. Boy was i wrong...
if it wasnt part of a bundle id curse steam for not giving refunds. the name C&C and the genre of RTS are the only things that even resemble the original games or even the genre in general. it plays nothing like any of the previous titles or pretty much any RTS ive ever tried for that matter and not in a good way.

i can understand making adjustments or adding/removing features or whatever devs gotta do to stay relevant and keep things fresh. but they took a well known and very much liked idea, strapped it to a rocket intended to propel a ship to another galaxy and drove it straight into the ground from orbit. if i didnt know any better id say this was either released as an actual attempt to bankrupt the company for some reason or whoever was in charge was recently replaced by a chimpanzee. 

this game is the equivalent of combining fallout and fallguys and calling it the next call of duty. with this title the C&C you want, you aint gettin and the C&C you gettin, you dont want.

column8:
I tried my best, but unfortunately every method of accessing the game led to failure. Kept hitting a wall at every turn.
I like testing bad games to see what good can be brought to the surface, to be positive on something and find enjoyment in the badly executed, but this game literally blocks me at its entrance. 
It is a shame that I will not be able to try this game again since years ago I found some fun moments in its campaign and, no doubt, with this new more positive view on bad games I would have come out of the experience with a decently positive review. (and I say this as a fan of the Command&Conquer series)

I, with all honesty and care, can not recommend a game that does not even allow players to go past the login screen ( the first of two login screens to be precise ).  It is a dice roll at each step and the house has full advantage with their rigged dice.

column8:
So funny enough. This game is not compatible with the EA launcher.
If the EA launcher is open when I try to log into this game it gives "General system error"
Close it out completely (like from the taskbar too), log in twice to an ancient game no one seemed to like, and I find myself escorting Kane on the opening transport mission.
But in a world with games that require multiple launchers in order to run this is what your going to get.
I'm sure this won't fix everyone's problems. And I can't recommend this game just on the basis that it is crippled by software made by it's own publishers. Software that one could expect to be open upon launching this game.

column8:
C&C: Tiberian Twilight:

It is time we ascend my brother!

What is up with the spelling mistakes? Tiberium/Tiberian? WTF to that!

It received a lot of bad reviews on release, but I quite enjoyed it! The only thing worse than ''Origin'' are the insanely stupid login into the server. Sigh! Come now EA.

At a glance: ?/100
______________________________________________________________________
Graphics:__________Still nice
Gameplay__________Strategy is fun
Audio_____________Good
PC Requirements______Your rig will do. The game is old
Difficulty___________We play on HARD. Always!
Grind_____________None. Just fun
Story_____________Those live-action movies are the best. They never get boring
Game Time________Well I invested a lot of time back in the day....Does that count?
Price_____________SALE!
Bugs_____________EA, What is up with your login procedures? It's dumb, take it away!
Verdict____________I Recommend this one

Sincerely
Bromst0ne

column9:
[h1]
I've never seen a game with a character limit on the password field. My password is too long and I can't type it in full, which prevents me from logging in. That's awesome! EA, your Xiao Shao Bi can't stand your father's big Ji Dam, so just say it straight up. Limiting the number of characters is like your mother's death. You can still dictate how long a user's password should be, right? Fuck you! When your mother passed away, the coffin wasn't long enough, so you had to chop your mother's body into two pieces, bury half and throw the other half away, leaving it to stink and rot, right? A stupid game with a stupid company. What a shame! CNC's title, a great start but a weak finish? The snake's tail is like a snake pulled out of the anus! [/h1]
(P.S. Thanks to everyone who pointed out the error, oops)

column8:
Played through the first few missions and this game made me feel depressed. It seems unfinished and extremely unpolished. The basic idea of this game itself isn't all bad. Mobile bases are an interesting idea imo, the execution, however, is horrendous. That's not all. The story and presentation of the scenario is god awful like a cheap, nonsensical B-movie. 
My diagnosis: EA attempted to jump on the MOBA hypetrain, failed miserably and ruined a franchise along the way.  Why? Corporate greed? Misguided understanding of what strategy gamers really want? It seems to be a combination of different reasons - a proper clusterfuck.

column8:
【原创】免联网运行+中文汉化方法：
1.Steam游戏库右键属性，语言改为“繁体中文”，等待下载完成（下不动换美国节点）
2.去3DM下载《命令与征服4：泰伯利亚的黄昏 繁体中文版离线破解补丁》
3.右键管理员身份运行补丁，安装到游戏主目录
4.Steam游戏库右键属性，验证游戏完整性，等待下载完成
5.打开游戏主目录，运行CNC4SERVER.exe（游玩期间不要关闭这个程序）
6.使用主目录/Accounts/邮箱/account.xml里的账号在游戏里面登录（外置启动器仍需登录你的正版EA账号）
7.在游戏中勾选以下设置：选项/一般/显示字幕

（详细教程链接：zhuanlan.zhihu.c和谐om/p/689964118）

【注意事项】
1.外部启动器依然需要登录你的EA账号
2.离线补丁会修改系统hosts文件，如需恢复联网功能，请清空hosts文件
3.本作解锁单位需要经验，account.xml里可修改经验值，改大可解锁所有单位。但数值不能太大，否则无法进入游戏（此时改小即可）
4.请使用存档/读档功能，因为离线补丁会让关卡进度无法保存到EA服务器上，你只有读档才能接着上次的进度继续玩。

【修改器】
修改器请下载MrAntiFun的版本，其他版本不兼容。
column9:
[Original] How to run without an internet connection and with Chinese localization:
1. Right-click your Steam game library, change the language to "Traditional Chinese," and wait for the download to complete (if it doesn't work, switch to a US node).
2. Download "Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight" from 3DM. Traditional Chinese Version Offline Crack

3. Right-click the game and run the patch as an administrator to install it in the game's home directory.

4. Right-click the game in your Steam library, go to Properties, verify the game's integrity, and wait for the download to complete.

5. Open the game's home directory and run CNC4SERVER.exe (do not close this program while playing).

6. Log in to the game using the account in your home directory/Accounts/Mailbox/account.xml file (the external launcher still requires your legitimate EA account).

7. In-game, check the following settings: Options/General/Show Subtitles.

(Detailed tutorial link: zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/689964118)

[Notes]
1. The external launcher still requires your EA account.
2. The offline patch will modify your system's hosts file. To restore online functionality, please clear the hosts file.
3. Unlocking units in this game requires experience. You can modify the experience value in account.xml. Increasing it unlocks all units. However, the value cannot be too high, otherwise you will be unable to enter the game (you can simply reduce it in this case).
4. Please use the save/load function, as offline patches will prevent your level progress from being saved to EA servers. You will need to load a save to continue playing from where you left off.

[Modifier]
Please download the MrAntiFun version of the modifier; other versions are not compatible.

column8:
Man braucht ein EA-Konto zum spielen. 
*!-Wichtig-!* für den Ingame-Login, hier herrschen Unterschiede zu den heutigen Passwortrichtlinien  von EA!

Man braucht ein EA-Konto zum spielen, was eigentlich nicht erklärt werden muss. Benutzt dazu ein Passwort mit mindestens 8 Zeichen (aber nicht länger als 24 Zeichen), Groß- u. Kleinbuchstaben, eine Zahl und ein Sonderzeichen. Ich musste mein komplexeres längeres Passwort anpassen, da ich damit auch nicht ins Spiel kam. Viele schreiben hier, dass man nicht mehr auf den EA-Server kommen würde, aber wenn man das mit den Passwort beachtet, sollte es reibungslos mit dem einloggen klappen.

Mir persönlich macht der vierte Teil von C&C keinen großen Spaß. Hier wollte man wohl damals das Spiel für E-Sports Events anpassen, was nicht sonderlich gut funktionierte. Kein echter Basenbau mehr, sondern mobile fliegende Bauhöfe, hektischeres Gameplay und strategische Kartenpunkte die man zeitlich mit Einheiten besetzen muss. Das seltsame Skillsystem passt auch nicht wirklich in die Reihe. Ein absoluter Bruch mit der ursprünglichen C&C - Formel.

Wenn man das C&C-Bundle erworben hat, ist es halt dabei. Von einem Einzelkauf dieses Titels würde ich persönlich auf jeden Fall abraten, auch wenn Kane eine coole durchgeknallte Socke ist.
column9:
You need an EA account to play.
*!-Important-!* for in-game login; this differs from EA's current password policy!

You need an EA account to play, which doesn't really need explaining. Use a password with at least 8 characters (but no longer than 24 characters), upper and lower case letters, a number, and a special character. I had to adjust my more complex, longer password because I couldn't get into the game with it either. Many people write here that you can no longer access the EA server, but if you pay attention to the password, logging in should work smoothly.

Personally, I'm not having much fun with the fourth installment of C&C. They apparently wanted to adapt the game for e-sports events back then, which didn't work out particularly well. No more real base building, but mobile, flying construction yards, more hectic gameplay, and strategic map points that you have to occupy with units at a certain time. The strange skill system doesn't really fit in with the series either. A complete break with the original C&C formula.

If you've purchased the C&C bundle, it's included. Personally, I would definitely advise against buying this title individually, even though Kane is a cool, crazy character.

column8: I know it's an unpopular opinion, but I like this game a lot. Sure, it was boring at the beginning, but you have to go past that and give it more time to kind of settle. Over some time I realized it's fun just cause it's different. The concept is kind of a nice refreshment from the typical boring RTS concept. There is a lot of strategy involved in the capturing and holding nodes. Sure it's simplified. But sometimes you need that in an rts game. And it's not that simple if you just give it a chance and get into it. Also I love the visual effects (explosions, battle flares, tracer bullets etc. ) it just adds to the overall realistic experience.

column8:
PLEASE READ!!

Everyone who is complaining about not being able to log in, this game was very recently re-released on steam. Steam compensates for the lack of servers for most games. I had to log in 4 times in launcher before i could start the game, but i assure you, it works. Anyone who says otherwise is either only trying once, or has some kind of bug. I had no issue with it. I mean yeah its annoying to log in 4 times just to start the game, but it DOES work. I know the gameplay is nowhere near as exciting or interesting as the other C&C's, however I still love it.

column9: We all know by now that you ruined C&C. It's been out since 2010, but I've never played it until now, and now I know why. What you've done here isn't C&C, it's some cheap load of crap... how can you set a limit (50) on units that's quickly reached when some cost 1 unit and others about 5, meaning you only have a handful, and then there's this lousy single-player mode where you're the only one allowed to compete against two crawlers (construction yards). Even on easy difficulty, it's not easy. One thing I know for sure: when the game was being developed, nobody was sober. The cool thing is that you have to have an EA account, then log in twice at the beginning, and then you lose the server in the middle of the game, so you have to start the whole thing all over again. EA stop developing games, you don't have what it takes... let the pros do it.

Thought I'd see what all the fuss was about. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me..had to create a new password. 

Created a new password. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me. General system error. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me. General system error. 

Tried to log into EA, wouldn't let me. General system error. 

Logged into EA. 

Watched an into scene that was made using 1994 level graphics. 

Entered a username. 

Screen went black. 

Game playing in background but wouldn't open. 

Used task manager, didn't work. 

Tried to navigate to other programmes, PC stuck on desktop. 

Wrote this review, then went for a cup of tea with a renewed and more profound hatred for EA gnawing at my shrivelled soul.

IT'S IN THE GAME!

column8:
The game is alright. It's really spongy though, like nothing dies. One mission you can literally just unpack your base and just run to the goal and win, lol. 

It has a lot of good concepts, but the balancing isn't there. This game is also hard to stream on, as when I have ULTRA everything, the game crashes, so I ran it on low.

Overall, it's a really unique game with good concepts, but again, the balancing wasn't there at all. Units deal no damage, some units are insanely tanky, some units are insanely squishy. The story is also confusing and ends on a crap note.

column8:
Ich Bin wirklich  der Größte C&C Fan Seit Anbeginn der Reihe, aber dieser Teil ist das Aller LETZTE...
Der Sarg Nagel der Command & Conquer Reihe...  Jeder Billige abklatsch wäre besser als dieses Spiel,

Der Erste Grund ist der Online Zwang.. beim starten muss man einen Account haben bei EA und sich  einloggen, aber nein nach dem starten Direkt nochmal einloggen und Passwort eingeben bevor man ins Hauptmenü Kommt.. Welcher Geistesgestörte Vollidiot hat sich  so ein scheiß ausgedacht???? Der müsste sofort ein Berufsverbot bekommen.
Als wenn das nicht schon Schlimm genug wäre, Bricht das Spiel Sofort ab wenn auch nur eine Sekunde mal das Internet abbricht, und schon darf man sich  wieder neu Einloggen..... Das Ist das Aller Letzte....

Zum Spiel Selber der Basis Bau wurde abgeschafft und es gibt ein Radikales Einheiten Limmit, Also Das Kern und Herz Stück der Reihe wurde einfach Herausgerissen,.  Dieses Spiel ist überhaupt eine Schande, Es Ist eine Schande das es überhaupt Command & Conquer heißen darf. Es Hat diesen namen nicht verdient,
Warum Hat man Nicht Lieber  C&C Generals 2 Gemacht den Generals ist eine meiner Lieblings Teile mit Alarmstufe Ror 2 und 3.

Hätte man dieses Furchtbare Spiel gleich im Keim erstickt gäbe es heute vllt noch  Die Command & Conquer Serie, aber mit dieser Schande wurde Die Reihe Begraben.

Die Story ist mega Platt und Langweilig das Ganze Spiel Prinzip macht keinen Spaß da man weder Gebäude Bauen kann noch viele Einheiten.

Ich Kann nur abraten dieses Stück Schande der Geschichte zu Kaufen....

Ich Hoffe  sehr das nach dem Remastert der ersten Beiden teile auch  weitere Folgen vor allem Tiberium Sun - Renegade und Alarmstufe Rot 2 und ganz Wichtig Generals mit Stunde Null....... 

An Die Entwickler dieses Spiels Schämt euch das ihr so etwas überhaupt auf den Markt gebracht habt und dafür auch noch Geld verlangt... Selbst als Geschenk ist dieser Teil eine Bestrafung...     Wascht euch rein und macht endlich  wieder gute Teile und Remakes der Alten Reihe, dann bekommt die Reihe Hoffentlich  wieder neuen Aufschwung.
Mir Blutet bei diesem Spiel wirklich  das Herz :-( Ich trauere heute noch um das Geld was ich  Damals zu Release dafür ausgab.....
column9:
I'm truly the biggest C&C fan since the beginning of the series, but this installment is the absolute last straw...
The nail in the coffin of the Command & Conquer series... Any cheap rip-off would be better than this game.

The first reason is the online requirement... When you start the game, you have to have an EA account and log in, but no, after starting, you immediately have to log in again and enter your password before you can get to the main menu. What kind of demented idiot came up with this shit???? They should be banned from their profession immediately.
As if that wasn't bad enough, the game crashes immediately if the internet drops for even a second, and then you have to log in again... This is the absolute last straw....

About the game itself: Base building has been abolished, and there's a radical unit limit. So, the core and heart of the series has simply been ripped out. This game is a disgrace. It's a disgrace that it's even allowed to be called Command & Conquer. It doesn't deserve that name.
Why didn't they make C&C Generals 2 instead? Generals is one of my favorites, along with Level 2 and 3.

If this terrible game had been nipped in the bud, the Command & Conquer series might still exist today, but the series was buried in this disgrace.

The story is incredibly flat and boring, and the whole gameplay isn't fun since you can't build buildings or many units.

I can only advise against buying this disgraceful piece of history....

I sincerely hope that after the remastering of the first two installments, there will be further installments, especially Tiberium Sun: Renegade and Red Alert 2, and most importantly, Generals with Zero Hour.......

To the developers of this game: Shame on yourselves for even bringing something like this to market and charging money for it... Even as a gift, this installment is a punishment... Clean up yourselves and finally make good installments and remakes of the old series again, then hopefully the series will get a new lease of life.
This game truly makes my heart bleed :-( I still mourn the money I spent on it back when it was released.....

column8:
To be honest, the game has a really solid gameplay and its own charm. That's if it was not a Command and Conquer game. No base building, no gathering resource, no anything that makes the series great. Not to mention the horrible campaign, the worst, ever.
With that being said, I quite enjoy the game, not the campaign of course. The game would be more successful if they got rid of the campaign and released it as a spin off, an alternative universe, a mobile game or simply unrelated to C&C at all.
Yes, I know it deserves a thumb down but I've seen enough. Therefore, one blue hand.

[h1][b]MERHABALAR[/b][/h1]
Anlamıyorum, nasıl güzel bir oyun serisi yaratarak, iyi bir iş çıkarıp sonra bu kadar kötü bir şey üretebiliyorsunuz, AE firması iyi şeyleri yok edip parçalama konusunda gerçekten bir harikan.
[h1][b]HELLO[/b][/h1]
The AE company seems unable to refrain from burning down and destroying the good work they've done for some reason.

To all of the ones leaving negative reviews, all you have to do is make an EA account & it lets you login to play the game. I had no trouble loading a new solo game earlier today(March 18, 2024).

It is very different from all other C&C games but I like it, I played through the campaign several years ago. I'll try another play through soon if my schedule allows it.
