column8:
[b]Отличнейшая игра[/b], для демонстрации того, как делать не надо.

Возможно, будь данная прекраснейшая "четвертая" часть, не "четвертой" для легендарной серии C&C, а первой для какой-нибудь новой вселенной, ВОЗМОЖНО (но это не точно), было бы хоть немного понятно почему всё так плохо (первый блин комом и все дела).

Игра совершенно не пригодна для мультиплеера и сражений с ботами, да и впринципе какого-либо вида соревнований между игроками. Она, скорее, заточена под "Пройди сюжет и забудь что ты это проходил", хотя и сам сюжет какой-то рвано-рашно-непонятный. Всё происходит очень быстро, то мы тут, то мы уже там, то всё плохо, то вроде бы жить можно, то Кейн хороший, то плохой...
Уже не говоря о том, что совершенно не рассказывается что же произошло и почему Братство обозлилось на Кейна и почему вдруг Кейн решил отдать Тацит ГСБшникам и вообще как он вышел на сотрудничество с ними. Огромная дыра в сюжете с момента окончания 3-ей и до начала 4-ой части.
[hr][/hr]
Говоря же про сам ГЕЙмплей. Моей любимой частью серии является C&C 3: KW и, думаю, все кто играл в неё и в своё время решили попробовать сей продукт, почувствовали ужасную пустоту внутри, а именно:

* Скринов нет от слова совсем, только ГСБ и НОД (в сравнении с 9 фракциями (3 основные +2 подфракции для каждой) в KW);

* Строительства базы нет - один краулер (типа МСЦ) и тот по сути даже  и не постройка. Их 3 вида, что тоже немного угнетает. Хочешь играть от авиации - вот тебе краулер под это, но нормальные наземки сделать не сможешь. И впринципе это разделение ролей на Танк, Саппорт и ДД убивает какое-либо желание относить эту игру к стратегии. Добро пожаловать в RTS версию Team Fortress, Господа (ну или Overwatch, отзыв всё же в 2022 пишется);

* Экономика, которая в мультиплеере всегда являлась основной целью и по сути побеждал тот, кто лучше построит свою и испортит вражескую? Не - держите кристальчик тиберия, который надо кое-как доставить на спавн, чтобы вкачать свой краулер, чтобы делать войска посильнее и прокачивать те что уже есть.

* Динамика боя? Попытки скрытно подлезть и что-то сделать? Да, как бы, никто не запрещает, но зачем? Захват точек зависит от войск внутри зоны, а не от того, у кого там жива турелька на спавне;
Да и сама механика захвата точек. Я блин играю в Battlefield или в RTS? Моей целью должно быть уничтожение вражеских сил, а не захват и удержание каких-то непонятных точек, особо даже не понятно зачем. Я был бы совершенно не против, будь это частью геймплея, аля "Будешь держать эти точки - будет тебе преимущество", т.е. чтобы это было компонентом (как те же Тибериевые Вышки (спайки) в третьей части или Центр управления ЭМИ) для достижения какой-то более крупной цели, а не самоцелью боя;

* Разные стили игры? Макро и Микро? Не, не слышали. Ты можешь быть бесконечно крутым игроком в макро, но какой в этом смысл, если у тебя лимит на юниты? Поспамить не выйдет - да, отчасти это добавляет "тактики" в игру - нельзя втупую наспамить юнитов и громить все подряд, это бесспорно плюс такого решения, но, при этом, если мы говорим про чуть более высокий уровень игры, чем совсем нубский, даже при игре от спама, без микроконтроля и тактики ты не выиграешь, а получается мы "победили" проблему которой, собственно, и не было, а только лишь ограничили свободу действий игрока, потому что ему, чтобы "законтрить" бюлд врага, надо буквально отправить свои войска на фарш, чтобы тебе дало сделать новые.
Сама механика "контра" войск тоже сделана прям максимально не комфортно и не понятно на что расчитана. Было всё просто: есть пехота, техника, авиация и постройки. Вот тебе для каждого из этих видов юниты, которые эффективны против них, причем, было достаточно очевидно, кто против кого (пули - пехота, ракеты - техника и авиация, гранаты/огонь - постройки) и отсутствие каких-либо ограничений позволяло быстро отреагировать на то или иное решение противника. 
Сейчас же: легкая, средняя, тяжелая броня и ты смотришь на юнит и не понимаешь кто против него эффективен. Как по мне довольно смешно, когда танк с двумя огромными пулеметами буквально щекочет пехоту врага, потому что у них броня не того типа, против которого пули эффективны - да, можно привыкнуть и придр**читься, но это усложняет и запутывает то, что, как раз таки, лучше оставить максимально простым и интуитивно понятным, дабы в бою ты был сконцентрирован на более важных вещах с точки зрения тактики;

* Опять же, до жути не хватает разнообразия самих юнитов. Если в старой части 9 фракций имели достаточно неплохой набор каждого из типов юнитов (хотя, конечно, кто-то скажет что в сравнении с другими стратегиями их было мало, но лично я считаю, что "больше" не значит "лучше", особенно для RTS - их было ровно столько, сколько "достаточно"), то в этой части, мало того, что по сути мы, в основном, получили перерисованные модельки тех же самых с точки зрения механик юнитов, так ещё и без особого их разнообразия. И вот здесь действительно чувствуется отсутствие третьей стороны конфликта в виде пришельцев, слишком однотипными получаются бои, ОСОБЕННО если учесть, что теперь нельзя воевать например НОД vs НОД, каждый матч - это НОД vs ГСБ, что окончательно добивает малейшие надежды на разнообразие.

* Самое ужасное - прокачка. Если в старых частях прокачка отсутствовала и механика блокировки юнитов была только в Кампании и сделана была лишь для того, чтобы преподносить сюжет корректно и ты не громил первые миссии тир 3 войсками, то в этой части, даже для мультиплеера и сражений, тебе необходимо получать уровень, который открывает тебе юниты. Т.е., говоря простым языком: хочешь пойти поиграть против других людей - сначала часов эдак очень много погоняй ботов, чтобы получить ранг, кстати, для НОД и ГСБ он отдельный, т.е. получаем в сумме (эдак очень много)х2 гоняний ботов. Причем, когда ты получаешь ранг, тебе эти юниты становятся доступны и в кампании, что превращает изначально достаточно не простые миссии, в легкую прогулку, если ты достиг максимального уровня. Данную механику я совершенно так и не понял зачем вообще было вводить, ведь эти ранги абсолютно не отражают насколько ты опытен в этой игре, а лишь делают твой "старт" в ней более болезненным и долгим, с одной стороны да, продлевая игровые часы в ней, но с другой, эти часы удовольствием явно не наполнены.

* А ещё, запустив сие чудо вновь и буквально зайдя в сражение с ботами, я осознал насколько здесь ужасный интерфейс. Он огромен и занимает почти весь экран (при разрешении 1920х1080 на минуточку), куча кнопок разбросано по разным углам, причем эти кнопки можно было сделать маленькими, либо вообще вынести в хот-кеи и не занимать мой экран ими...

В общем, подытоживая, хотелось бы верить, что разработчики никогда не займутся ремастером этого "шедевра", а если и займутся, то скорее сделают из него совершенно другую игру, действительно достойную звания 4 части культовой серии.
column9:
[b]An excellent game[/b], demonstrating how not to do things.

Perhaps if this wonderful "fourth" part were not the "fourth" for the legendary C&C series, but the first for some new universe, MAYBE (but I'm not sure), it would be at least a little clearer why everything is so bad (the first pancake is always a flop, and all that).

The game is completely unsuitable for multiplayer, bot battles, or any kind of competition between players. It's more geared toward "Complete the story and forget you even played it," even though the story itself is disjointed and incomprehensible. Everything happens so fast: one moment we're here, the next we're gone, one moment everything's bad, the next it's ok, Kane is good, the next he's bad...

Not to mention the complete lack of explanation of what happened, why the Brotherhood got mad at Kane, why Kane suddenly decided to hand the Tacitus over to GDI, and how he even ended up collaborating with them. There's a huge plot hole from the end of Part 3 to the beginning of Part 4.
[hr][/hr]
Speaking of the GAMEPLAY itself. My favorite part of the series is C&C 3: KW, and I think everyone who played it and decided to try this game felt a terrible emptiness inside, namely:

* There are absolutely no screenshots, only GDI and Nod (compared to 9 factions (3 main + 2 subfactions for each) in KW);

* There's no base building—just one crawler (like the MSC), and that's not really even a building. There are three types, which is a bit depressing. If you want to play with air power, there's a crawler for that, but you can't build decent ground forces. And basically, this division of roles into Tank, Support, and Damage Dealer kills any desire to consider this game a strategy game. Welcome to the RTS version of Team Fortress, gentlemen (or Overwatch, I'm writing this review in 2022, after all);

* The economy, which in multiplayer has always been the main goal, and the winner is essentially whoever builds their own better and ruins the enemy's? No—here's a Tiberium crystal that needs to be hauled to spawn to upgrade your crawler, make your troops stronger, and upgrade the ones you already have.

* Combat dynamics? Attempts to sneak up and do something? Yeah, no one's stopping me, but why? Capturing points depends on the troops inside the zone, not on whoever has a live turret at spawn.
And the point-capture mechanics themselves. Am I playing Battlefield or an RTS? My goal should be to destroy enemy forces, not capture and hold some obscure points, and I don't even really understand why. I wouldn't be against it at all if it were part of the gameplay, like "Hold these points and you'll have an advantage," i.e., if it were a component (like the Tiberium Spikes in the third game or the EMP Control Center) to achieve some larger goal, not the end of the battle itself.

* Different playstyles? Macro and Micro? No, never heard of them. You can be an infinitely skilled macro player, but what's the point if you have a unit limit? Spamming isn't an option—yes, it adds some "tactics" to the game—you can't just spam units and smash everything, which is definitely a plus. However, if we're talking about a slightly higher level of play than a complete noob, even spamming, without micromanagement and tactics, you won't win. So, we've "solved" a problem that didn't actually exist, but merely limited the player's freedom of action. To counter an enemy's unit, they have to literally send their troops to the dogs, allowing you to create new ones.
The counter-troop mechanics themselves are also extremely awkward and unclear. Everything used to be simple: there were infantry, vehicles, aircraft, and buildings. Here you have units for each of these types that are effective against them, and it was fairly obvious who was against whom (bullets - infantry, missiles - vehicles and aircraft, grenades/fire - buildings), and the lack of any restrictions allowed you to quickly respond to any enemy decision.

Now: light, medium, heavy armor, and you look at a unit and have no idea which is effective against it. I find it rather funny when a tank with two huge machine guns literally tickles enemy infantry because their armor isn't the type that bullets are effective against. Yes, you can get used to it and become picky, but it complicates and confuses what is best left as simple and intuitive as possible, so that in battle you can focus on more important tactical matters.

* Again, the lack of variety in the units themselves is terribly lacking. While in the old game, the 9 factions had a fairly decent selection of each unit type (although, of course, some might say they were underpowered compared to other strategy games, but I personally believe that "more" doesn't mean "better," especially for an RTS—there were just enough). In this game, not only are we essentially getting redesigned models of the same units in terms of mechanics, but there's also little variety. And here, the lack of a third side in the conflict in the form of aliens is truly noticeable; battles become too repetitive, ESPECIALLY considering that you can't now fight, for example, Nod vs. Nod; every match is Nod vs. GDI, which completely destroys any hope of variety.

* The worst part is the leveling. While the older games lacked leveling and the unit locking mechanic was only present in the Campaign, designed solely to convey the storyline correctly and prevent you from crushing the first missions with Tier 3 troops, in this game, even for multiplayer and battles, you need to level up to unlock units. Simply put, if you want to play against other players, you first have to spend a lot of hours chasing bots to gain a rank. Incidentally, there's a separate rank for Nod and GDI, meaning you get a total of (likely a lot) x2 bot chasing. Moreover, once you reach a rank, these units become available to you in the campaign, which turns what were initially quite challenging missions into a breeze once you've reached the maximum level. I still don't understand why this mechanic was even introduced, as these ranks don't reflect your experience in this game at all. They only make your "start" more painful and time-consuming. While this extends the gameplay, it's clearly not enjoyable.

* Also, after launching this marvel again and literally jumping into a battle with bots, I realized how terrible the interface is. It's huge, taking up almost the entire screen (at a resolution of 1920x1080, mind you), with tons of buttons scattered all over the place, even though these buttons could have been made smaller, or even placed in hotkeys so they wouldn't take up my screen...

In short, I'd like to believe the developers will never remaster this "masterpiece," and if they do, they'll likely make it into a completely different game, truly worthy of being the fourth installment in this iconic series.

column8:
This game departs from the traditional C&C RTS you've grown to expect from the previous games.

1. Mobile bases. Literally just one structure per mode (Defense, Offense, and Support) instead of building your war factory, infantry building, power plants, etc. Just one vehicle that can switch between modes to build different things. Ugh. This was the worst part of the entire game imo, at least let me build a base.
2. No more harvesting minerals. You accumulate "resources" overtime.
3. Outfits in the cinematics are more basic than past games. E.g. soldiers wear basic army armor compared to Tiberian Sun where the NOD Light infantry in the cinematics wore armor that looked like how they should as their pixel self.

This game is not a great addition to the Command & Conquer franchise - and it should get retcon'd / made non-canon.

column8:
A bloody disgraceful successor to the Tiberium Wars series. This game makes me want to be successful just so I can contact Joe Kucan in the future about a possible reboot of this so the series can have the final game it deserves. Thanks to this piece of shit for a game, the Tiberian saga went out with a whimper instead of a bang. 

If you're truly a fan of the saga and want to find out how it all ends, I recommend you read the plotline on wikipedia instead of wasting your time and money trying to play this game. Seriously, after the beautifully crafted units of CNC3, the units and gameplay of this "video game" make me want to break my laptop. Prime example of EA trying to fix something that was the farthest thing from broken.

column8:
Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight' ~ 2/10

"Twilight? More like Twi-shite!"

---

I remember playing this game when it first came out. I first started playing games from the C&C franchise with Tiberium Wars, and from that day, bought every single one the day it came out. I decided to rebuy Twilight on Steam because I'd since lost the DVD and thought "maybes its not as bad as I remember". Wow, that was incorrect.

The game-play is shoddy, and a complete departure from previous C&C games (change isn't a bad thing, but EA made some pretty horrendous changes to the format). The soundtrack is completely unmemorable, and completely lacking in any memorable tracks! Its just got no spirit.

Now, let's talk about a stable of the C&C franchise; the hammy F.M.V. cut-scenes. Well they are certainly hammy, but you can really tell that literally nobody is enjoying the scripts they've been handed - in fact, I'm shocked Joe Kucan didn't walk off set demanding a better set of lines... which leads me onto a bigger issue. The story!

The story has got to be the most boring, lazy waste of space in the history of the franchise, and that's really saying something, since Generals and Zero Hour were just a generic war thriller. What I will say, is that at least those two games had functional stories; 'Twilight' plops you into GDI command and introduces you to your character's wife who does nothing except cry and get sentimental. Its like the writers clearly want you to care about her, but they give you no reason. You feel absolutely no sympathy for her - I thought it was just my issue cause she's not my type, because I'm as gay as a bloody West End musical! But most people seem to hate her character.

Do I recommend this game? No, not even to the hardcore fans of the franchise. I mean if you're really, genuinely curious then feel free to watch a YouTube play-through because its not worth wasting your hard earned cash.

column8:
12 minutes. Seems unfair, right? Well, couldn't even get past the login - game wouldn't accept any information I put in that was valid and the online only crap was poorly done and unnecessary. Still, from what I have seen... I will try to somewhat criticize the aspects that I dislike.
No base building whatsoever. Major departure that could've been executed better. Specialization of crawlers is a decent concept on its own, but seems a bit dry and EA didn't really hit any marks with the audience they were trying to please, and missed the niche that their fanbase is used to.

Back to mobile bases for a second... it's genuinely a decent idea that has been executed in other games with success. EA didn't do that. No resource gathering, but a limited number of buildable units? Yeah, that's a pass.

I've seen the cutscenes. Just no. The new characters are unlikable. The cutscenes themselves look very drab and meh.

In short, just... no. This was not a fitting end to the Tiberian saga. The Tiberian saga deserved a far better ending. Only positive is that you can't get this shitpile on Steam anymore.

column8:
[b]Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight[/b] is an RTS that ditches base building in favor of more dynamic action. Instead of a regular base you get choice between the three walking tanks - crawlers, that can produce units, build defenses or call up support abilities, like bombing the area or laying down mines. While the concept might sound fun on paper and there are a lot of games built around similar ideas, the game pulls it off completely wrong. Now that your base is walking around the map, there’s no need to collect resources, so you can build whenever you want, but your maximum number of units is limited. This makes the campaign so much harder, because your enemies usually have multiple crawlers and so the bigger unit limit. At times I felt like I was deadlocked into a stalemate, because the enemy produced units at the same time as I destroyed them. However, the stupidness of the AI helps very much in such cases. If you focus your fire on the enemy base, AI will not notice it most of the time and will keep destroying your units, but you can keep replacing them almost at the same rate as they can.

I won’t go into story details here, first of all because it requires at least some knowledge of previous games. Second of all, it’s so bland and generic in this game, that you will probably forget it as soon as you close the game. The graphics look ok, doesn’t feel like they’ve changed much since previous game and it still has a 30 FPS lock, that no one in the modding community bothered to remove, so you’ll be stuck with that if you decide to play it. The FMV cutscenes have changed for the worse, it feels like they cut the budget in half. The original costumes are gone, now soldiers wear the same outfits as in our world, other characters wear plain clothes. A quick reminder that the game takes place in the year 2077 and the cities in the video reports they show you throughout the game look the same as in 2010. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ A new take on the C&C formula

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Unbalanced campaign
- Story feels shallow and boring
- FMV cutscenes are very low budget
- Very short (around 8-9 hours)
- You have to enter your Origin login and password every time you launch the game

I didn’t think it could be that bad. Now I know, and I think you should not waste any time on it. Thankfully, it was removed from the store, hopefully to be replaced with the true sequel to [b]Tiberium Wars[/b] and [b]Kane’s Wrath[/b].

While the concept might sound fun on paper and there are a lot of games built around similar ideas, the game pulls it off completely wrong. Now that your base is walking around the map, there’s no need to collect resources, so you can build whenever you want, but your maximum number of units is limited. This makes the campaign so much harder, because your enemies usually have multiple crawlers and so the bigger unit limit. At times I felt like I was deadlocked into a stalemate, because the enemy produced units at the same time as I destroyed them. However, the stupidness of the AI helps very much in such cases. If you focus your fire on the enemy base, AI will not notice it most of the time and will keep destroying your units, but you can keep replacing them almost at the same rate as they can.

I won’t go into story details here, first of all because it requires at least some knowledge of previous games. Second of all, it’s so bland and generic in this game, that you will probably forget it as soon as you close the game. The graphics look ok, doesn’t feel like they’ve changed much since previous game and it still has a 30 FPS lock, that no one in the modding community bothered to remove, so you’ll be stuck with that if you decide to play it. The FMV cutscenes have changed for the worse, it feels like they cut the budget in half. The original costumes are gone, now soldiers wear the same outfits as in our world, other characters wear plain clothes. A quick reminder that the game takes place in the year 2077 and the cities in the video reports they show you throughout the game look the same as in 2010. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ A new take on the C&C formula

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Unbalanced campaign
- Story feels shallow and boring
- FMV cutscenes are very low budget
- Very short (around 8-9 hours)
- You have to enter your Origin login and password every time you launch the game

I didn’t think it could be that bad. Now I know, and I think you should not waste any time on it. Thankfully, it was removed from the store, hopefully to be replaced with the true sequel to [b]Tiberium Wars[/b] and [b]Kane’s Wrath[/b].

column8:
I literaly can't even play it thanks EA, the CD key is completly broken I don't remember C&C 3 asking me for anything 
The story revealed something in the most garbage way ever, I only know this cuz I watched the campaign on youtube to even know what I would get into, 
Firstly the tiberium is gone, it's just gone, no longer plot relevant I guess even tho from 1-3 it was literaly the thing that made this game interesting and it's the entire plot point of all 3 of these but no just remove it. 
Than we got something we never asked for, where is the base building asset gone to, WASN'T THAT LIKE WHAT WE LIKED ABOUT IT EH? BUILDING A BASE? EXPANDING? No give us this armored walkers that work as an entire base, no tech to research, no tech, no make us level up to unlock new units, instead of building a high tech building to unlock the top tier shit, get to level 30 or something and the combined arms aspect? nah we don't need that shit, heres offense, defense, support because you have been used to using your firehawks to bomb the living hell out of NOD while charging in with your zone troopers an mammoth tanks, no heres only one for you, your either infantry and defenses, aircraft only or heavy vehicles cuz fuck you
Next up we have this being an online game, AI? goodbye, online only, no fun trying to work your ass of trying to be brutal AI for that dam platinum cuz that shit wasn't fun nooo we all just hated it you know?
Also now you just have unlimited money because we can longer mine tiberium which was very important having to expand your area to get other tib fields so you can get more money so you can get more units, just give us a unit cap because yes
No more trying to get that giant tiberium field, no more aquring that blue tiberium, no more getting those silos, no more getting those towers.
Defense is literaly the most useless MCV ever, next being support and offense being the only one you should ever pick
Also we added the scrin into the storyline even tho they never appear in the game despite it being clear that the first apearence was just an Expeditionary force, we couldev gave them a second comming with literaly more firepower than ever but nah man just add some random scrin guy or whatever his name was I don't remember the story it's boring
Also good way to kill the whole mystery of Kane being literally immortal by telling us, hey this dude ain't human his an alien. Way to kill the mood

经过了11年，这游戏终于下架了。

本身质量什么的就不提了，这游戏临下架前是个什么状态呢？服务器经常出错，上EA论坛发贴询问，社区经理要么完全不知道，要么只会丢出几个屁用没有的“解决方案”。

这次下架意味着，玩家的单位解锁进度、对战记录都会烟消云散，而更为重要的是，由于单人战役也需要全程联网才能存档，即便剧情战役是烂到姥姥家去的屑作，CNC泰伯利亚系列以后再想去体验这一故事线将变得不可能以正版渠道来实现。系列正作用纯联机游戏的形式来体现，其不可靠性不言自明。

现在Steam商店页面甚至把多人联机标签撕了，那看来EA算是主动放弃售卖了。如果EA就是这种态度的话，我建议TTF的下架麻烦也搞快点。

12.02更新:TTF真下架了？那没事了。
column9:
After 11 years, this game has finally been removed from the shelves.

Forget the quality issues themselves. What was the state of the game before it was removed? Servers frequently crashed. Posting to the EA forums to inquire about it, the community managers were either completely clueless or offered useless "solutions."

This removal means that players' unit unlock progress and battle records will be lost. More importantly, since the single-player campaign requires a full internet connection to save, even if the story campaign is abysmally awful, it will be impossible to experience this storyline in the CNC Tiberium series through legitimate channels. The series is being presented as a purely online game, and its unreliability speaks for itself.

Now that the Steam store page has even removed the multiplayer tab, it seems EA has voluntarily given up on selling it. If this is EA's attitude, I suggest that TTF's removal be handled swiftly.

12.02 Update: Is TTF really removed? That's all fine.

column8:
Je suis un fan de la toute première heure de C&C. ​Oui, j'ai joué au tout premier en 1995. C'était dans son temps un jeu révolutionnaire. Le FMV, la musique cultisime, l'ergonomie intuitive... les cinématiques étaient magnifiques.
​Je savais que ce dernier command and conquer n'était pas fort brillant. Mais, je me devais de le jouer, juste pour l'histoire et revoir le célèbre Kane une dernière fois...

Ça fait longtemps que j'y ai joué, mais, il est tellement présent dans ma mémoire que je me dois d'en faire un commentaire ! 

Ceci est probablement l'un.... si non, le PIRE exemple de la fausse "bonne idée" dans l'histoire du jeu video!

A la place d'une base, on a un constructeur mobile.

Le jeu se distingue par un côté pierre/papier/ciseaux prononcé. Qui peut avoir de bons côté, mais est totalement ridicule par moment. Ou des véhicules antichar avec quasi aucun blindage sont capables de résister à des obus en pleine face sans problème.

Bref, un constructeur mobile en tant qu'unique base, et on gagne en multi avec des points de capture, parce qu'on n'a pas de resources à gérer.

C'était sûrement pour rendre le jeu plus nerveux et révolutionner le RTS ???
Non ??? Je pari que c'est EA qui voulait investir le minimum possible. Pas de base, pas d'équilibrage à prévoir. Et jeu accessible à plus grand nombre (les non joueurs de RTS).

Sérieusement, pas de base à construire et à GÉRER ? Ceci est la pire idée qu'ils pouvaient avoir.
Resultat, on vadrouille dans la map à l'aveugle, pour capturer des points de contrôle et éviter si possible d'exposer son seul QG.
En plus, si l'ennemi a construit un build "contre" le votre, l'effet pierre/papier/ciseaux très prononcé fait que vous ne pouvez tout simplement pas gagner. On sélectionne toute des unités et les supprime lol. Pour construire un nouveau build. Oui, parce qu'il n'a pas de ressources, juste des points de population. Vous pouvez vous débarrasser de vos unités sans remors.

Les unités aérienne sont OP. Et le QG volant l'est tout autant. Il permet d'éviter indéfiniment les ennemis. Ce qui vous permet jouer au petit parasite toute la partie ! Yay ! Le plaisir !... (oui l'équilibrage de ce jeu est horrible)

Même si on joue la campagne, il faut grinder de l'XP pour déverrouiller des unités. Vous obligeant à rejouer des maps solo. Comme si le jeu n'était pas assez mauvais et inintéressant comme ça...

Le multi était mort dès la première semaine.

Enfin, parlons de l'histoire. Sans grand intérêt, voire stupide. Triste final...
Petit spoil :
Kane utilise le portail alien du 3eme volet pour partir définitivement. Fin, et point final à la saga. Tout ce que vous accomplissez au cours de l'histoire ne sert pas à grand chose. Vous avez servi de garde du corps à Kane et vous activez le portail.
Argggggg ! Et ils sont où les aliens ?

Graphiquement c'est... Euh... Pareil que le 3 ? En moins détaillé ???

Bref "press F" pour cette franchise, honteusement humilié et massacrée dans ce C&C 4.
Je pense sur c'est le pire jeu, de ma bibliothèque Steam........ Rien que ça....
Et c'est 20 euros! Vraiment ? A ce prix on a des alternatives bien... Bien... Bien meilleures.

Par conte, je vous conseille sans hésitation le C&C remarsterd. Aussi bien que l'original, avec les cinématiques d'optimisées pour les résolutions actuelles. Le gamplay est veuillo mais toujours excellent,  particulièrement pour un nostalgique qui y a joué à l'époque comme moi 😄
Ne prenez pas le 4, l'une des pires déception de l'histoire. Sa note steam est amplement merité.
column9:
I'm a fan of C&C from the very beginning. Yes, I played the very first one in 1995. It was a revolutionary game in its time. The FMV, the iconic music, the intuitive design... the cutscenes were magnificent.
​I knew this latest Command & Conquer wasn't very brilliant. But I had to play it, just for the story and to see the famous Kane one last time...

It's been a long time since I played it, but it's so vivid in my memory that I have to write a review!

This is probably one... if not the WORST example of a false "good idea" in the history of video games!

Instead of a base, we have a mobile constructor.

The game is distinguished by a pronounced rock/paper/scissors aspect. Which can have its good points, but is totally ridiculous at times. Or anti-tank vehicles with almost no armor are able to withstand shells directly in the face without any problem.

In short, a mobile builder as your only base, and you win in multiplayer with capture points, because you don't have to manage resources.

Surely this was to make the game more responsive and revolutionize RTS?
No? I bet EA wanted to invest as little as possible. No base, no balancing required. And the game is accessible to a wider audience (non-RTS players).

Seriously, no base to build and MANAGE? This is the worst idea they could have had.
As a result, you wander around the map blindly, capturing control points and, if possible, avoiding exposing your only HQ.

What's more, if the enemy has built a build "against" yours, the very pronounced rock/paper/scissors effect means you simply can't win. We select all the units and delete them, lol. To build a new build. Yes, because it has no resources, only population points. You can get rid of your units without remorse.

The air units are OP. And so is the flying HQ. It allows you to avoid enemies indefinitely. Which allows you to play the little parasite for the entire game! Yay! The fun!... (yes, the balancing in this game is horrible)

Even if you play the campaign, you have to grind XP to unlock units. Forcing you to replay single-player maps. As if the game wasn't bad and uninteresting enough as it was...

The multiplayer was dead in the first week.

Finally, let's talk about the story. Not very interesting, even stupid. Sad ending...
Small spoiler:
Kane uses the alien portal from the third installment to leave for good. The end, and full stop, to the saga. Everything you accomplish throughout the story is of little use. You served as Kane's bodyguard and you activate the portal.
Arggggggg! And where are the aliens?

Graphically, it's... Uh... Same as the 3rd? Only less detailed???

In short, "F" for this franchise, shamefully humiliated and massacred in this C&C 4.
I think it's the worst game in my Steam library........ Just that...
And it's 20 euros! Really? At that price, we have much... much... much better alternatives.

However, I unhesitatingly recommend the C&C Remastered. As good as the original, with the cutscenes optimized for current resolutions. The gameplay is shabby but still excellent, especially for a nostalgic who played it back in the day like me 😄
Don't get the 4th, one of the worst disappointments in history. Its Steam rating is well-deserved.

column8:
Худшая из стратегий которые я встречал;
Максимально тупая механика, это даже не стратегия это какой-то цыганский цирк! Ты просто кочуешь со своей базой (которая является единственным зданием в игре, окромя 2х пушек и бункеров если выберешь деф модуль). 
Приличных ресурсов нет, привычных зданий нет. Привычного и знакомого хоть чего-то нет! Это не c&c. Может кто есть такой же старый как я и помнит на PS1 стратегию Z. Вот она же только карты сильно меньше
Кампания при прохождении даёт отворот-поворот уже к 3-4 миссии. Без прокачки навыков пройти почти невозможно, а качать оные или прохождением кампании или долгими сражениями в режиме сражения.
Режим сражение особое дно. Выбрать сторону нельзя - вот ты GDI и хоть усрись. Видимо возможность играть за НОД надо открывать как-то но блть это сраный режим сражения! Везде и всегда это было  - выбрал карту, стартовые условия, соперников/союзников и поехали.
Это не тот случай где отличная задумка да плохая реализация. Это случай когда просто ущербнейшую задумку реализовали максимально близко к задуманному.
К покупке не рекомендую, даже бесплатно если давать будут - не берите. 
Оцениваю в 1 из 10 и желаю что б в дом каждого, кто причастен к разработке, наведался араб
column9:
The worst strategy game I've ever encountered;
The mechanics are incredibly stupid; it's not even a strategy, it's some kind of gypsy circus! You just wander around with your base (which is the only building in the game, aside from two cannons and bunkers if you choose the defense module).
There are no decent resources, no familiar buildings. At least nothing is familiar! This isn't C&C. Maybe someone as old as me remembers Strategy Z on the PS1. It's the same, but the maps are much smaller.
The campaign, when played, gives you a complete shambles after the 3rd or 4th mission. It's almost impossible to complete without skill upgrades, and skill upgrades are achieved either by playing the campaign or through long battles in Skirmish mode.
Skirmish mode is a complete bummer. You can't choose a side—it's like GDI, and you can't even stand a chance. Apparently, the ability to play as Nod needs to be unlocked somehow, but damn, this skirmish mode is a lousy one! It's always been like this: choose a map, starting conditions, opponents/allies, and off you go.
This isn't a case of a great idea with poor execution. This is a case of a truly flawed idea executed as closely as possible to the original.
I don't recommend purchasing it, even if they give it away for free, don't take it.
I rate it 1 out of 10 and wish an Arab would visit the home of everyone involved in the development.

column8:
Poniendo en una balanza lo bueno y lo malo, lamentablemente cobra mas peso lo MALO. 

-Como C&C es malo, como juego de estrategia también. Y digo "estrategia" por decir algo, porque es casi nula. Cada pantalla se basa en un "toma y daca" entre tú y la cpu "defecando" unidades infinitas sin parar hasta que una aplasta a la otra.

-La historia es la peor de la saga, ya no solo por el sinsentido del argumento si no por lo pésimamente malos que son todos los actores de los vídeos, ni el propio Kane se salva, es su peor papel de lejos. 2 campañas, una larga y la de NOD cortisima que parece un "pegote" puesto de relleno y ambas con el mismo final.....

-Tiene ideas que podrían haber sido medio buenas pero si se hubiese planteado de otra forma, lo único salvable es el uso del motor gráfico de Red Alert 3, que este último sin ser perfecto ni mucho menos es bastante mejor juego y más disfrutable.

+Resumiendo: Solo puede interesar a alguien que quiera terminar la saga y saber como se cierra la historia, dejandole el sabor agridulce de lo que podía haber sido y lo que nos han dado. Una lástima ver como esta gran franquicia acabó así de mal.
column9:
Weighing the good and the bad, unfortunately, the BAD outweighs the bad.

- As a strategy game, it's bad, and as a strategy game, it's bad too. And I say "strategy" for the sake of it, because it's almost nonexistent. Each screen is based on a back-and-forth between you and the CPU, endlessly "defecating" units until one crushes the other.

- The story is the worst in the series, not only because of the nonsense of the plot but also because of how awfully bad all the actors in the videos are. Not even Kane himself is spared; it's his worst role by far. Two campaigns, one long and the very short NOD one that feels like a "sticky" filler, and both with the same ending...

- It has ideas that could have been halfway good, but if it had been presented differently, the only redeeming feature is the use of the Red Alert 3 graphics engine. The latter, while not perfect by any means, is a much better and more enjoyable game.

+In short: It's only interesting to someone who wants to finish the saga and find out how the story concludes, leaving them with the bittersweet taste of what could have been and what we've been given. It's a shame to see this great franchise end so badly.

column8: I have to say this came as a nice surprise since virtually everyone is trash talking this game... But I actually loved it. I really enjoyed the balance between strategic planning and live action, I think it comes pretty smooth and natural. Besides, the graphics and sounds are really enjoyable. Much better than the previous Tiberium release, or the really disappointing Red Alert 3. One negative note though, it is quite hard to understand what type of units you are creating - or should create - before seeing them behaving on the battlefield. Their name and visual are hardly helping (especially for Nods units), and their summary is poorly written.

column8:
Скачал я как-то давно С&C TW и KW... Редко когда так сильно влюбляешься в игру... Глубокий сюжет, отличная динамика, графен для своих то годиков, оооооооо эта харизма и игра Джозефа Дэвида Кукана (Кейна), благодаря его игре я полюбил Братство НОД и верю в светлое будущее тиберия!... И тут я решил купить "Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight", сказать что полная хер, ничего не сказать. Как можно было одним релизом убить то что полюбилось игрокам за долгие годы, нет привычных механик и геймплея, за которым модно было сидеть часами... Эта мультяшная графика, а-ля мобильная игра... аж до тошноты. 
Если вы не хотите разочароваться в данной серии и не хотите вызвать рвотные позывы... даже не пытайтесь в нее поиграть.
Можете, конечно, но люди предупреждали... Те люди кто писали отзывы со слезами на глазах.
column9:
I downloaded Command & Conquer TW and KW a long time ago... It's rare to fall so deeply in love with a game... A deep story, excellent dynamics, graphics for something its age, oh, the charisma and performance of Joseph David Kukan (Kane). Thanks to his performance, I fell in love with the Brotherhood of Nod and believe in the bright future of Tiberium!... And then I decided to buy "Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight." To say it's complete crap is an understatement. How could they kill something players have loved for years with one release? The familiar mechanics and gameplay that made you spend hours playing are gone... These cartoonish, mobile-game-like graphics... it's nauseating. 
If you don't want to be disappointed in this series and don't want to make yourself vomit... don't even try it.
You can, of course, but people warned you... Those people who wrote reviews had tears in their eyes.

column8:
Contras:
-Te pide iniciar sesión 2 veces en EA, caso contrario no podrás jugar
-El serial puede no funcionarte y hasta podrías tener que instalar Origin para correrlo
-Ya no se arman bases, cosecha tiberio ni existen las bombas nucleares ni cañón de iones
-Ahora cada unidad tiene un tipo de arma y blindaje: si no dispones del arma adecuada para destruir a cierto blindaje, casi que no podrás destruirla (por ej. destruir Mammoths con lásers)
-Las unidades son gratis, se construyen rápido y son limitadas: ahora existe un sistema de puntos parecida a la comida en Warcraft III. Esto provoca que entres en un loop contra el rival donde cada unidad destruida instantáneamente es reemplazada
-Todo se hace desde un Crawler, una base móvil que cae del cielo (literal)
-La campaña tiene 7 misiones por facción y se terminan en 5 horas
-Los Scrin nunca volvieron a pisar la Tierra, a pesar de haber prometido una invasión total
-El hilo argumental no sigue para nada C&C3 ni KW, todo el ejército cyborg de Legión prácticamente no existe
-Su apartado gráfico es inferior a su precuela, con un tono ligeramente caricaturesco
-El diseño de los vehículos es demasiado genérico, casi que no existen unidades míticas de toda la saga más que el Mammoth tank, la nave Venom y la moto de ataque
-Al no haber base, la condición de victoria se reduce a capturar nodos de tiberio, algo así como construir maravillas en Age of Empires pero más aburrido todavía

Pros:
column9:
Cons:
-It asks you to log in to EA twice, otherwise you won't be able to play.
-The serial may not work, and you might even have to install Origin to run it.
-You no longer build bases, harvest tiberium, or use nuclear bombs or ion cannons.
-Each unit now has a weapon and armor type: if you don't have the right weapon to destroy a certain armor, you'll almost never be able to destroy it (e.g., destroying Mammoths with lasers).
-Units are free, build quickly, and are limited. There's now a point system similar to food in Warcraft III. This forces you into a loop against your opponent where every destroyed unit is instantly replaced.
-Everything is done from a Crawler, a mobile base that literally falls from the sky.
-The campaign has 7 missions per faction and is completed in 5 hours.
-The Scrin never set foot on Earth again, despite having promised a full-scale invasion.
-The plot doesn't follow C&C3 or KW at all; the entire cyborg army of Legion is practically nonexistent.
-Its graphics are inferior to its prequel, with a slightly cartoonish tone.
-The vehicle design is too generic; there are almost no iconic units from the entire saga other than the Mammoth Tank, the Venom Ship, and the Attack Bike.
-Since there's no base, the victory condition is reduced to capturing tiberium nodes, a bit like building wonders in Age of Empires, but even more boring.

Pros:

column8: cc4颠覆了cc系列的概念，改的不成功。感觉就是把贴图换一下，把原来建造项分成三个mcv完成，以此提高难度。和cc3相比也没加入什么新建筑和单位，就我自己来讲还是想看到新兵种和建筑、有更复杂的克制关系这些。说实话也不值这个价，仅仅和mod差不多。
column9: CC4 completely overturns the CC series' concept, but the changes aren't successful. It feels like they just remapped the textures and split the existing construction items into three MCVs to increase the difficulty. Compared to CC3, it doesn't add many new buildings or units. Personally, I'd still like to see new units and buildings, more complex counter-traits, and so on. Honestly, it's not worth the price; it's barely more than a mod.

column8: Certainly not the best CnC game. U could say a "unique" system. However the grinding for exp to unlock the full army potential is just annoying. Campaign itself doesn't represent much. On the topside u could say there a few "old time units" coming back from games like tiberian dawn and CnC 3. But that's about it, also the unit limit is annoying, you could say it adds to the tactical element so the player needs to overthink what units to use. But not really fitting for those that know the franchise. It's a bit of a mixed feeling for me. I got it simply out of nostalgia after playing the other games in the series. Would say try it if you haven't played any other games in the franchise, otherwise you may get dissapointed.

column8:
As a long time C&C fan who played all the others back to the original when it came out, I knew this was bad, but saw it on sale and wanted to "complete the collection".  This game feels like it was designed by executives in a conference room who never saw any C&C game.  They completely killed the playstyle and themes that made the franchise what it was. There is no base building in the sense of past C&C games, everything is done by your headquarters. And you have 3 types of HQ you switch between all that do completely different things.  To switch is not a button on the building to toggle. Oh no, they chose a much more logical option. You destroy it and call in a new HQ! Thought Tiberium was cool? There is no resource collection/management, you just stay under a low cap for units and defensive structures.  You'll see a bit of Tiberium on the map sometimes, take a screenshot for the memories. 

Oh yeah, and you need to have an EA account to play it. Even on sale, your cash is better spent by lighting it on fire. At least then you won't waste hours of your life you can never get back.

column8:
[h1]自1995年的[b]“黎明”[/b]以来，CNC系列迎来了它最终的[b]“黄昏”[/b]。[/h1]
[h1]真可惜没有介于“推荐”与“不推荐”之间的选项，游戏并不是特别差，只可惜被经营到一个半死不活的状态。[/h1]
[b]《命令与征服4：泰伯利亚黄昏》[/b]可以说是对该系列进行了一次大胆创新的变革。突破了传统的RTS玩法，也打破了曾经的CNC的游戏模式。但是变革也必将伴随着痛苦与质疑，尤其是顶着[b]“《命令与征服》”[/b]这一沉重而辉煌的名号。
[h1]【“王八大战”的利与弊】[/h1]
巨大的变革都在于此。
没有了前系列作的扩张基地建筑群的满足感；也没有了在同等时间大量堆兵的碾压快感；更没有了建造超级单位和武器的激动心情……
取而代之的是3种不同功能的移动MCV；双方共同被限制的单位人口；以及地图上固定时段刷出的升级资源……
基于种种改变，游戏的玩法也发生了巨大的变化。在本作中则更注重于不同MCV的功能与机动[spoiler]（因为其灵活性差与体型庞大，被称为“王八”也不足为奇）[/spoiler]，并且玩家也需要在人口资源的限制之下决定在不同的时段应该怎样分配单位的生产与作战时的组合，再者就是该怎么利用手上现有的力量来完成升级资源的抢夺或者是达成任务目标等等目的。
由此可见，这一作更注重的是单位与功能的组合与资源分配，并且也大大提升了其网游化的程度，更推崇玩家之间的合作与对抗，尤其在团队对抗时，不同玩家选择不同的MCV也会有不同的分工与搭配，使得游戏性有了质的飞跃。
但是从反向来看，这样的改变也是带来了很多不利因素。头一个就是老派的CNC玩家可不一定认账，从内容上看则是有太多的简化，而且玩法上的差异也并不会让人立马适应而觉得玩起来会很舒服。而且地图的设计也变得更加死板，几乎是清一色的竞技向地图，大大减少初始站位的偶然性，使得其过度电竞化。最大诟病的因素之一就是糟糕的人口限制，虽说在一定程度上抑制了人海堆兵，但也减少了单位组合多样化的可能性，降低了战术尝试过程中带来的容错率。
总的来说，针对如果真的是找不来朋友，或者不能快速适应新模式的玩家来说，这一系列的改动则是失败的。
[h1]【旧碗装新饭】[/h1]
一个[b]“4”[/b]字[spoiler]（宣传视频甚至还给了特写）[/spoiler]可以说是正传的正统延续，但制作组却并没有因此去使用新的引擎，而是沿用了CNC3的老引擎来制作CNC4，所以不论是在界面操作，以及游戏内的操作都透漏着一种没什么进步的感觉，甚至会让玩家觉得这是用旧的东西改出来大型官方模组。一度还夹杂着赶工与减料的嫌疑。
[h1]【平淡却不得不叙说的故事】[/h1]
作为最终章来说，故事内容是合格的，最大的缺点就是短小急促。但因CNC3和《凯恩之怒》的素质就已经摆在那里，所以本作作为最终章能做到这个程度也是实属不易。演员的演技似乎只有凯恩和妻子在线，其他演员略微有些尬演，而GDI司令弄一个黑人大妈来扮演多少有点zzzq的味道，而且整体看来显得相当违和。拍摄布景虽然显得简略，但表演者的镜头感则是相当的不错，也算是对此有另一方面的弥补。
故事依然是GDI 和NOD之间的对抗，但随着全球环境的恶化，人们也不得不在不同的理念中做出抉择。而主角“指挥官”就是其中重要的一位。他曾解救GDI的上司与其一同起义来阻止敌人的野心；也曾为NOD铲除叛党替身凯恩实现升天大计。终于信徒们去往新的世界，而地球也结束了战乱的循环。
如果说伴随着长达15年的陪伴最终要以这一作来画上句号，那应该就是在升天传送门打开时，凯恩对玩家说的那句包含了诸多意义的：
[b]“谢谢你”[/b]。
[h1]不想完全压死这个游戏，只能说：[/h1]
[h1]好玩，但并不耐玩[/h1]

column9:
Since its 1995 debut, the Command & Conquer series has reached its final twilight.

It's a shame there's no "recommended" or "not recommended" rating. The game isn't particularly bad, but it's been left in a state of near-death.

"Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight" can be considered a bold and innovative transformation of the series. It breaks through traditional RTS gameplay and shatters the traditional C&C model. However, change is always accompanied by pain and doubt, especially with the weighty yet glorious title of "Command & Conquer."

[The Pros and Cons of "The Battle of the Turtle"]

This is where the huge changes lie. Gone is the satisfaction of expanding bases and buildings from previous games; gone is the thrill of overwhelmingly amassing troops in a given period; and gone is the excitement of building super units and weapons...
Instead, there are three mobile MCVs with different functions; a population limit shared by both sides; and upgrade resources that spawn on the map at fixed times...
With all these changes, the gameplay has undergone a significant transformation. This game places greater emphasis on the functions and maneuverability of different MCVs [spoiler] (given their limited mobility and large size, it's no surprise they're called "turtles") [/spoiler] Players must decide how to allocate unit production and combat combinations at different times within population resource constraints, and how to utilize their existing forces to seize upgrade resources or achieve mission objectives.

This clearly demonstrates a greater emphasis on unit and function combinations and resource allocation in this game, significantly enhancing its online gameplay and fostering greater cooperation and competition between players. Especially in team battles, different players' choice of MCVs allows for different divisions of labor and teamwork, resulting in a substantial leap in gameplay. However, from a different perspective, these changes also bring a number of disadvantages. The first is that old-school CNC players may not appreciate them. The content is overly simplified, and the gameplay differences don't make it easy to adapt and feel comfortable. Furthermore, map design has become more rigid, almost exclusively competitive, significantly reducing the chance of initial positioning and making it overly esports-oriented. One of the biggest criticisms is the poor population limit. While it somewhat inhibits large-scale troop build-ups, it also reduces the potential for diverse unit combinations and reduces the margin for error when experimenting with strategies.
Overall, for players who struggle to find friends or adapt quickly to the new mode, these changes are a failure. [h1][New Rice in an Old Bowl][/h1]
The number [b]4[/b] [spoiler] (the promotional video even gives it a close-up)[/spoiler] could be considered a legitimate continuation of the original series, but the development team didn't adopt a new engine, instead using the old CNC3 engine for CNC4. As a result, both the interface and in-game controls feel largely unchanged, even leading players to believe it's a large-scale official mod repurposed from outdated software. There's even a tinge of rushing and cutting corners.
[h1][A Plain, But Unavoidable Story][/h1]
For a final chapter, the story is passable, its biggest drawback being its brevity and rushing. However, given the quality of CNC3 and Kane's Wrath, achieving this level of performance is truly remarkable for a final chapter. The acting seems to be limited to Kane and his wife; the others' performances are a bit awkward, and the casting of a middle-aged woman as the GDI commander is a bit jarring, and the overall effect is rather awkward. While the filming sets appear sparse, the actors' camerawork is quite impressive, compensating for the lack of context.
The story continues with the conflict between GDI and NOD, but as the global environment deteriorates, people are forced to choose between differing philosophies. The protagonist, "The Commander," is a crucial figure in this conflict. He rescued his GDI superiors and joined them in an uprising to thwart the enemy's ambitions; he also helped NOD eliminate the traitorous double, Kane, and realize their Ascension plan. Finally, the believers journeyed to a new world, and Earth's cycle of war ended.
If this game is the final culmination of 15 years of companionship, it would be Kane's words to the player as the Ascension portal opens, which are filled with so much meaning:
[b]"Thank you"[/b]
[h1]I don't want to completely criticize this game, but I can only say:[/h1]
[h1]It's fun, but not very playable.[/h1]

column8:
[b]You only buy this to play the story campaign & when it's discounted, more info below[/b]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW BEFORE PURCHASING[/b][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700]──────────────────────[/url]
EA doubled down on DRM for this game. The first problem I encountered was logging in. When you buy this off Steam, you need to make sure you have an Origin account and register your new cd key on Origin. There are two logins in this game. When you start the game, you start the launcher first and it requires you to enter your Origin credentials. Now there’s another login screen in-game, you will enter the same credentials. HOWEVER, compared to the launcher’s login, if your password is MORE THAN 16 CHARACTERS the game will not log you in. The [b]in-game password field cannot go past 16 characters.[/b] I had to shorten my password, making my account less secure. Now, this game has another problem and it’s a major one.

It appears that the multiplayer features of the game are locked; the servers supporting the multiplayer must have shut down. Attempts to host a lobby will give you an error. [b]There’s no way to know if auto-matching works, but it’s safe to say that all three multiplayer features--lobby hosting, co-op campaign, and auto-matching--do no longer work.[/b]

The only features you have access in this game is the campaign and skirmish against computer AIs. And who knows when this game’s remaining servers, for logging users in, will shut down.

So, if you’re interested in only playing Command and Conquer 4’s story campaign, I recommend you buy it when it is heavily discounted. I got this for $5.


[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]PUBLISHER REVIEW[/b][/url] 👎
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700]─────────────[/url]
Electronic Arts double downed on DRM for this game, making it always online. Prior to this game’s release, the publisher killed some interesting projects for the franchise. They shutdown Tiberium, a squad-based shooter that takes place after Tiberium Wars that looks like Halo and is a spiritual successor to C&C Renegade. They shut down a sequel to Generals that had a story that sounded similar to Homefront games. Command & Conquer 4’s Tiberium Twilight started its life as an MMO which explains why there is a class and leveling system. The game was forced to be salvaged into a triple AAA rts game, retaining many gameplay mechanics that fans definitely would dislike. Furthermore, they forced the franchise's future games to be browser and mobile games. They killed Generals 2, which is trying to return to its RTS roots.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]DEVELOPER REVIEW[/b][/url] 👍
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700]─────────────[/url]
They tried their best salvaging this game when it started as an MMO and faced heavy pressure from Electronic Arts’s higher ups. There are some bugs, but the production quality is still good. These guys did their best and I wouldn’t fault them.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]ACCESSIBILITY & OTHER REVIEW[/b][/url]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700]─────────────[/url]
So I usually supersample the older games I play. Playing on 4k resolution in C&C4 in 1080p monitor is fine. The game looks a little better and sharper, but the cursor does not scale up. It's incredibly tiny, so it's hard to select buttons or icons.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]GAME REVIEW[/b][/url] 🤷‍♂️
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]AS A RTS GAME[/b][/url] 👍
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700][b]AS A COMMAND & CONQUER GAME[/b][/url] 👎
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/TITLEplayer/recommended/47700]──────────[/url]
So this is a review of the current state of the game, meaning it will keep in mind that the multiplayer features are unavailable. Out of all the command and conquer games, this one has the worst story and campaigns. It is also very short. The GDI campaign is the worst one, and doesn't really explain the little details that's going on in the story. That's left to the NOD campaign, but is a bit better. Few of the Normal missions are hard to complete because your arsenal will be incomplete, your profile is under-leveled, and you can't play coop with another. You will have to play the campaign twice if you want to complete your arsenal. By then, it would be fun to play the campaign on the hardest difficulty with your full arsenal, but would it be worth the replay though?

This game reminds me of End of Nations and feels like a real slim down version of Red Alert 3. Even some of the unit designs feel as silly as the Red Alert 3's. Take, for example, the scorpion tank between C&C 3 Tiberium Wars and C&C4. In the previous game, it's sleek and looks like it's designed to be fast. In C&C4, it just looks more like a robotic scorpion. Or GDI's wolf tank looks like a little brother of the apocalypse tank.

The crawler system is interesting. You are given three types: offense, defense, and support. It makes the game almost feels like a moba and a beginnings of a MMORTS. Some units would have one or two abilities. Unit commands are carried over from Red Alert 3 and C&C3 Tiberium Wars and this game emphasizes a bit more on micromanagement. Although, I found the max population to be low and wished it was a tad higher. To upgrade, you have to level up your profile and right now, the fastest way is probably through the campaign. In the game, you will need to use your engineers to collect Tiberium crystals to be able to do upgrades (once you unlocked them through leveling). Furthermore, there are buildings that serve as control points which can be captured by your surrounding units. These grant further defense or extend deployment/building area. It feels similar to Dawn of War 2 or Company of Heroes, but worse. The defense crawler will be the closest thing to base building. Support crawler is focused a lot of building aerial units and using support abilities. I think the game shines a bit when you're playing 5 vs 5 with the AI, so you can have different crawlers supporting each other with their different unit compositions. Too bad multiplayer doesn't work anymore.

So as a C&C game, it's the worse but it's better than the recent mobile/browser C&C games. As a RTS game, it's okay.

column8:
Seul point fort: la qualité des cinématiques, et retrouver Kane.
Pour le reste, ça n'a RIEN A VOIR AVEC Command & Conquer. 
Pas de gestion de base, pas de gestion de ressources, et le nombre d'unité sur le terrain est limité à une petite dizaine. On ne dispose que d'un seul bâtiment orienté attaque, défense, ou soutien générant une gamme d'unités différentes. Du coup, impossible de les mixer pour adapter sa stratégie (dommage pour un RTS) comme par exemple des unités aériennes et de l'infanterie par ; Ou des tourelles (oui ça non plus) et des tanks... Absurde. 
Et ces limitations amènent au point négatif centrale selon moi, à savoir: les boucles de gameplay. 
Faire pencher la balance d'un côté ou de l'autre est devenu tellement fastidieux, que l'on se retrouve refaire cent fois les mêmes actions en espérant gagner un peu de terrain sans succès ... ... mais sans que l'adversaire ne parvienne non plus à nous battre ! Même avec les plus fortes unités! 
Tout est long, répétitif, et donc extrêment ENNUYEUX.
Et je ne parle pas de la difficulté à activer le jeu sur Steam à cause d'EA, ou encore de l'obligation d'être connecté pour jouer !
En bref, c'est un plantage totale de la part d'Electronic Arts pour un titre qui se voulait être le dernier d'une belle saga. 
ENORME déception, énorme gâchis.
column9:
The only strong point: the quality of the cutscenes, and finding Kane.
As for the rest, it has NOTHING TO DO WITH Command & Conquer.
No base management, no resource management, and the number of units on the field is limited to a dozen or so. There's only one building available, oriented toward attack, defense, or support, generating a range of different units. As a result, it's impossible to mix them to adapt your strategy (a shame for an RTS), such as air units and infantry; or turrets (yes, that one too) and tanks... Absurd.
And these limitations lead to the central negative point, in my opinion: the gameplay loops.
Tipping the scales one way or the other has become so tedious that you find yourself repeating the same actions a hundred times, hoping to gain a little ground without success... ...but without the enemy managing to beat you either! Even with the strongest units!
Everything is long, repetitive, and therefore extremely BORING.
And I'm not even talking about the difficulty activating the game on Steam because of EA, or the requirement to be logged in to play!
In short, it's a total failure on the part of Electronic Arts for a title that was supposed to be the last in a great series.
A HUGE disappointment, a huge waste.

+ Balance, fast match endings, enhanced unit control.
- Huge bugs, the level of which would burn the asses of those who don't like farming, an old ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ engine, a low-budget company, and the game as a whole.
Conclusion: If you're willing to tolerate bugs and an old engine where units feel frozen, but still pride yourself on balance, this game is for you.
I'd give it a positive rating, but even though I was given this game as a gift, I have no idea whether it's worth the pain I've suffered because of the aforementioned downsides.

column8:
If you're looking to play this game as a sequel to the Command and Conquer Tiberium series, you shouldn't buy this game. It holds almost no connections to the original trilogy gameplay-wise and the overall plot isn't all that well supported. Now if you were looking to play this game without knowing what Command and Conquer is, then you might find some enjoyment in this game. It offers a sort of new concept of a moving base, and is very different from the base building RTS games that everyone is fond of. While the Unit Cap is quite annoying, it's understandable because for many people, commanding a limited amount of units while doing the same with the mobile base is easier than say, 200 units. 

There's a lot wrong with this game, one being that it was supposed to take the mantle of the Tiberium series, but failed catastrophically, and another being that there's many gameplay mechanics that are very dumb, like the unnecessary grind-y element of the game. Who would want to willingly grind out about 10 hours just to get the mastodon, or kodiak? They could have just restricted those unit access in the campaign, not in the Skirmishes. Or take the aformentioned unit cap; I said it was understandable, but that doesn't mean it was a very dumb thing to do. Most of the RTS players are perfectly fine with commanding a very large amount of units, that's the whole appeal of it.

With the story, I genuinely don't think it was alright. I will try not to spoil anything (though I doubt anyone would care even if I did,) but the way the campaign did the cutscenes, just no. I don't hate the actors that had to go through that, it's everything else about it; bland lines, decent-but-not-good enough emotion, the effects were alright, and definitely felt like it was made back in 2010. The story line did match up with the gameplay, but almost none of it made sense when you think about the other games in the franchise. There were plot holes like "how did GDI magically find a way to fight back against the Tiberium spread?" or "For what reason did Kane show the Tacitus to GDI?" that were never explained, even after pretty much a decade of radio silence. You should really not count this game as being canon to the story, sticking to C&C 3: Tiberium Wars is much better than this.

TL;DR, game not command and conquer, but decent RTS.

整了个盗版体验了一遍gdi战役，剧情很一般，两方的故事差不多，还有最后那个传送门看起来像是直接画在墙上的，太糊弄了。刷经验可以开PvE5v5我方4个残酷敌方两到三个残酷，尽量打就行，反正我们这边人多，就是经验有点少，打三盘才能升一级。打剧情倒是升级快，就是有点难，打不过就去打打PvE练练级。
游戏体验前期及其痛苦，级别高一些游戏体验就上来了，单位还挺好看，勉强玩玩打发时间也不是不行。最后说两句，steam上的别买，资源网上到处都是，玩不了下齐必备运行库，关了杀毒软件再试试，不然文件CNC4.dll可能被删掉。

Fuck EA! They're selling you an unplayable game!
————————————————————————————————————
I played through the GDI campaign on a pirated copy. The story is mediocre, with both sides sharing similar stories. And the portal at the end looks like it was painted directly on the wall. It's so cheesy. To gain experience, you can play PvE 5v5. Four Cruel enemies on your side and two or three Cruel enemies on the other side. Just fight as hard as you can. We have more people, but the experience is a bit low. It takes three rounds to level up. Leveling up in the story is fast, but it's a bit difficult. If you can't beat it, try PvE to level up.
The early game is extremely painful, but the experience improves at higher levels. The units are pretty good, and it's okay to play for fun. Finally, don't buy it from Steam. Resources are everywhere online. If you can't download the necessary runtime libraries, try disabling your antivirus software before trying again, otherwise the CNC4.dll file might be deleted.

I hate that it's so hard to get working, but it still works. Eleven years after the fact, if you register your game on EA's website, login twice and then run in admin mode on Windows, you too can play CnC4. That's all it takes.

For the game itself, it's ok. If it wasn't a legacy game, I'd say it's a solid 6.5/10. If you liked this game on release, something was wrong with you. But if you like the nostalgia, and the $4 price tag, it's a good game.

column8:
Hat mit den vorhergehenden Teilen nichts mehr gemein. 
Die Aufbaustrategie, das Sammeln von Tiberium und sämtliche Themen die das spiel ausgemacht haben sind verschwunden.
Bauen von Basen ist nicht mehr möglich und die Ressourcen quasi nicht begrenzt. 
Lediglich die Mannschaftsstärke wird reguliert.
Als Fan der Reihe bin ich hochgradig enttäuscht, auch wenn hier neue Herausforderungen gestellt werden.

Sehr sehr schade, ich hoffe man kommt irgendwann auf das alte System zurück.
column9:
It has nothing in common with the previous installments.
The building strategy, the collecting of Tiberium, and all the themes that defined the game are gone.
Base building is no longer possible, and resources are virtually unlimited.
Only the crew size is regulated.
As a fan of the series, I'm extremely disappointed, even though new challenges are presented here.

It's a real shame. I hope they return to the old system at some point.

column8: Killed the franchise

This game is STILL plagued with issues regarding redeeming the CD key ...after you PURCHASE  the game! When trying to play the game thru steam you will get an error after trying to use your legit CD key and won't be able to play the game after entering the CD key. What isn't mentioned is you can still redeem the CD key on the Origin website if you get this error. I purchased this game years ago and never got to use that other CD key. Back then I had gotten no help from EA on the offical forums. I even had the original box and receipt for the game back then but didn't even get a response on official forums from EA games (was a different email etc for me). This is the last EA game I will purchase, no reason to buy games from a company that doesn't even bother to make minimal effort to insure you can play the game you paid for. They could have easily remedied the issue by including a link to the Origin website when launching the game advising to redeem the CD key there if you get an error message when trying to use your CD key after launching the game.

Я бы поставил положительную оценку но даже за то что мне подарили эту игру я понятия не имею стоит ли это тех мучений что я получил из за выше перечисленных минусов.
column9:
+ Balance, fast match endings, enhanced unit control.
- Huge bugs, a level that would burn the asses of those who don't like farming, an old, crappy engine, a low-budget company, and the game as a whole.
Conclusion: If you're willing to tolerate bugs and an old engine that makes units feel frozen, but still pride yourself on balance, this game is for you.
I'd give it a positive rating, but even though I was given this game as a gift, I have no idea whether it's worth the pain I've suffered because of the aforementioned downsides.

column8:
This is not Command & Conquer.
You don't build bases, you don't farm Tiberium and spoiler, at the end;  Kain Lives. 
There's no Intel to give the story depth, the cut-scenes are parents-basement budget level and like ET, the Scrin have gone home. 

However; in place of base-building/resource farming mechanic, units are recruited through a mobile command centre that levels up as the game progresses. There's no limit to how many units you can field but you are limited to how many can be deployed at one time. 
The upside is; you are thrown into combat immediately and the intensity of the battle doesn't letup as you endlessly order more troops into the flesh grinder of combat. 

The objective based RTS is familiar and GDI/NOD maintain their traditional eagle/scorpion airborne/guerrilla antagonistic combat styles. You will lose a few games so its not a walk in the park.

I would give it 2/5. It's easy to play but loyalists will be woefully disappointed and there are better RTS' on the market. Play only if you want to see the series through.

The upside is; you are thrown into combat immediately and the intensity of the battle doesn't letup as you endlessly order more troops into the flesh grinder of combat. 

The objective based RTS is familiar and GDI/NOD maintain their traditional eagle/scorpion airborne/guerrilla antagonistic combat styles. You will lose a few games so its not a walk in the park.

column8:
[i]I thought I can't launch the game, after doing some steps I managed to launch the game with no issue[/i]

Good game, enjoyable and very good quality in 4K even the game was released 10 years ago, might be the worst game on Steam due to the game support on CD Keys, errors, and such (and EA).

Login twice wasn't an issue to me, the story is just kinda back to zero again if you did played CNC3, however I'am not. Game features of using one unit (crawler) to create units is very enjoyable (able to go mobile, escape, and such). There is co-op on the game, which gave more availability to do campaign a lot easier, or even skirmish together.

AI is just a bit drag to deal with on skirmish. On solo, Easy is actually Medium, FYI the AI on skirmish is actually 1-3 level higher than you (unfair was it?), I'm not even gonna try higher than Medium cuz I lack of hotkeys and multitasking (need lots of practice).

Had to disagree to the limited command points on both campaign and skirmish, I would prefer without it just like RA3.

column8:
If this was a free to play game and had no connection to Command & Conquer, I may say give it ago... but it's not...

C&C4TT follows one of the best RTS series I've played. I would highly recommend playing any of the other C&C games in the series but this one. The reason this game got a overwhelmingly negative reviews is because (and I know this will be hard to believe) EA banged this out as a quick cash grab that ended up killing the franchise. You want the full story check youtube, many have covered this slap in the face.

If this game had no connection to C&C and free to play it would be okay at best. Unfortunately compared to it's predecessors its a turd...

column8:
Thanks for Korean support!

# 꿀잼 3가지
1. 전혀 다른 게임 시스템: 기존의 전략 시뮬이랑은 많이 다른 새로운 시스템
2. 캐주얼한 게임 플레이: 거기다 친절히 유닛 상성까지도 보여주어서 좋음
3. 나쁘지 않은 그래픽: 2020년에도 꽤 봐줄만 한 그래픽

# 노잼 3가지
1. 자원이 없음: 자원이 없기 때문에 전략적인 면이 많이 없어지고 유닛이 별로 아깝지가 않다
2. 개성없는 유닛들: 기존의 C&C의 개성 넘치는 유닛이 없어지고 다 비슷비슷하게 보임
3. 유닛 생성 제한되어있는 게임 시스템: 전략 시뮬인데도 불구하고 레벨을 올려야지만 유닛을 뽑을 수 있는 이상한 시스템

# 총평
모바일 게임 C&C 라이벌의 토대가 된 듯한 시스템이 많이 보인다. 좋게 말하면 시대를 앞서간 게임이라 할 수 있겠다. 기존 C&C와 일반적인 전략 시뮬레이션이라고 생각하지 않고 플레이하길 추천
column9:
Thanks for the Korean support!

# 3 Fun Things
1. Completely Different Game System: A new system that's quite different from existing strategy simulators.
2. Casual Gameplay: It's great because it even shows unit compatibility.
3. Decent Graphics: Even in 2020, the graphics are quite acceptable.

# 3 Boring Things
1. No Resources: Because there are no resources, the strategic aspect is largely lost, and units are not worth spending much on.
2. Uninspired Units: The unique units of existing C&Cs are gone, and they all look similar.
3. Limited Unit Creation: Despite being a strategy simulator, the system requires leveling up to unlock units.

# Overall Review
Many of the systems seem to be the foundation of the mobile game C&C Rivals. To put it bluntly, it's a game ahead of its time. I recommend playing it without thinking of it as a typical strategy simulation or C&C.

column8:
Bought this when it came out 10 years ago. It didn't take long for me to question all of the things they changed but I finished the game out of a sense of seeing the ending. If you're a big C&C fan I'd say it's worth 5 bucks just to experience how easy it was for them to both end and ruin an entire franchise at the same time.

I really just can't comprehend how this game made it out of testing. If they had ANYONE testing it who had played the previous games they would have been laughed at for wanting to make this. You know how base building, creating massive armies and everything else worked so well in the previous games? Yeah throw all of that out the window here. Your base is basically one building that does everything and you can only have a hand full of units at a time. This game is the perfect example of "Don't fix what isn't broken". Imagine if Blizzard released the next WoW expansion as a turn based browser game and this is how you end up with C&C 4.

Хоть игра вымерла, но я хочу вернуть в неё жизнь! Всё зависит от вас! Да, игра для фанатов этой франшизы вышло не особо хорошей. Но геймплей этой игры с 2010 года, он идеален. Игра показала себя с хорошей стороны и поиграть её с друзьями будет приятно и не забываемой.
К чему я всё виду? Есть дискорд канал куда я приглашаю всех вас мои друзья! Давайте вернём этой игре то времена.

Когда мы играли бок о бок и сражались за точки тибериума.

Когда мы кричали от побед и получения новых боевых единиц
.
Когда мы старались открыть первыми очки улучшения и прокачать свой краулер.


Добавляйтесь ко мне в друзья, и я добавлю вас в наш дискорд канал!
column9:
Even though the game is extinct, I want to bring it back to life! It all depends on you! Yes, the game wasn't particularly good for fans of this franchise. But the gameplay of this game since 2010 is perfect. The game has proven itself to be a great success, and playing it with friends will be a pleasant and unforgettable experience.
Why am I getting at all this? I have a Discord channel where I invite all of you, my friends! Let's bring this game back to those days.

When we played side by side and fought for Tiberium points.

When we screamed with victories and new units.

When we tried to be the first to unlock upgrade points and upgrade our crawler.

Add me as a friend, and I'll add you to our Discord channel!

column8: Игра отвратительна! Постройки базы нет, юниты все однотипные и ты их не различишь когда они в одном месте скомканы. Графика упала на уровень по сравнению с предыдущей частью. Сюжет убогий на пол страницы поместится в 3-4 предложения. Вам дается выбор между двумя фракциями какую выберешь такая и концовка игры. Скринов из C&C 4 убрали в игре вы даже намека на них не увидите. Сражения скучные неинтересные! У вас 3 МСЦ на выбор и все они разбалансированные! Игра вне кампании отвратительна и выглядит вот как: садятся два жука и смотрят друга на друга кто-кого переспамит юнитами. Экономическую составляющую в игре полностью убрали вместо ресурсов у вас командные очки которые ограничивают вас в наборе юнитов. 10 юнитов всё - очков командования у вас нет поэтому идите нафиг и воюйте этими 10 юнитами! Сидишь задрачиваешь этот 1 отряд из 10 юнитов... За тиберий, который кстати надо еще до зоны высадки дотащить, используется в качестве улучшения ваших юнитов. На последних этапах игры когда вы всё прокачали тиберий вам больше не нужон и все что вы имеете в игре это ваш долбанный жук и ваш отряд с 10 юнитами. Игра что на высокой сложности что на низкой одинакова и собственно вопрос "а в чем прикол?" Типа у вас есть выбор, но от этого выбора у вас ничего не зависит. Кстати компания проходится за 3-5 часов, а их там 2. Чтобы разблокировать весь контент вы должны набрать кучу опыта на 1 фракцию по 15-20 часов дрочни одними и теми же юнитами. Итого игра с 2 фракциями у вас на 40 часов максимум дальше в игре делать нечего. Соревновательного интереса в игре как такового нет из-за вырезанной экономики все что вы можете это спамить юнитами. ВОТ ВСЯ ЭТА ИГРА ВОТ СВОДИТСЯ К ОДНОМУ ЛОГИЧНОМУ ВЫВОДУ - "ДРОЧНЯ ЮНИТАМИ" которых между прочим аж целых 10 штук. Пасьянс и то интереснее будет... Не тратьте время на нее
column9: The game is terrible! There's no base building, the units are all the same type, and you can't tell them apart when they're all crammed together. The graphics have dropped a notch compared to the previous game. The plot is pathetic, taking up half a page in 3-4 sentences. You're given a choice between two factions, and the one you choose determines the ending. They've removed the screenshots from C&C 4; you won't even see a hint of them in the game. The battles are boring and uninteresting! You have three MSCs to choose from, and they're all unbalanced! The game outside of the campaign is disgusting and looks like this: two beetles sit down and stare at each other to see who can outspammed whom. The economic component has been completely removed from the game; instead of resources, you have command points, which limit your unit selection. 10 units is all you have—you have no command points, so go and fight with those 10 units! You're sitting there, grinding away at that one squad of 10 units... Tiberium, which, by the way, you still have to get to the landing zone, is used to upgrade your units. In the later stages of the game, when you've maxed out everything, you no longer need Tiberium, and all you have is your damn beetle and your squad with 10 units. The game is the same on both hard and easy difficulties, and the question is, "What's the point?" It's like you have a choice, but that choice doesn't affect you. By the way, the campaign takes 3-5 hours, and there are two of them. To unlock all the content, you have to gain a ton of experience with one faction, grinding away at the same units for 15-20 hours. So, playing with two factions gives you a maximum of 40 hours of nothing to do. There's no real competitive edge to the game because of the cut economy; all you can do is spam units. THIS WHOLE GAME BOTTOM LINES UP TO ONE LOGICAL CONCLUSION - "UNIT WANKING," of which there are, by the way, as many as 10. Solitaire would be more interesting... Don't waste your time on it.
