column8: 看到好多人说 不会激活的 我在这说一下吧  网页搜索origin 去  这个官网后注册或者登陆你的账号后点击我的游戏库-新增游戏 然后使用这个游戏运行时，出来的呢串激活码 激活游戏 然后选择一个 你需要的语言的版本就好了 ，其他都一样 好像是我也没有尝试，然后在steam运行游戏 第一行输Email，第二行密码（这个账号密码 就是你的origin账号的 ）。他下面有两个按钮 第一个按钮注册账号第二个登陆。登陆后化名随便写个 然后你就能 游玩了  游戏本身只有繁体中文 在steam-游戏右键属性能更改  。游戏愉快
column9: I've seen many people say they can't activate it, so let me explain. Search for origin on the web, go to the official website, register or log in with your account, click My Game Library - Add New Game, then use the game to run, and the activation code will appear to activate the game. Then select a version in the language you need, and everything else is the same. I haven't tried it, and then run the game on Steam. Enter your email on the first line and your password on the second line (this account password is your origin account). There are two buttons below it. The first button is to register an account, and the second is to log in. After logging in, just write a pseudonym and you can play. The game itself is only in Traditional Chinese, which can be changed in Steam-Right-click Properties. Have fun playing.

column8:
+ runs well on older computers
- too shallow for an MMO game
- too shallow for a C&C game

TL,DR: just leave it alone. Really, don't bother

This game is marred by bad design from the start.
 
It forces you to play online, YET it won't start, unless you log onto Origin, and add your CD key. Even after that, you must make numerous login attempts to play.

It forces you to play single player campaign, YET the story is a complete mess. I never felt so disappointed in my life playing a C&C campaign. Reading the reviews I thought it can't be that bad. Guess what, it's worse... Just watch the outro video on YT, and you'll see what I mean.

It tries to be c&c only in its name. It is basically a small-squad-tactics game, sprinkled with minimal special abilities for units. Oh, and said units are boring as HELL. I have 12 hours behind my back, but I couldn't tell the difference between a Zone Trooper and a Zone Enforcer with a gun at my head.

It attempts to be the herald on the MMO era with its "fast" pace, but it also falls flat. Dammit, who designed the hotkeys? SHIFT+F5 for a unit construction? Geez... Also, even basic design attempts are failing. Like, I delpoy a Zone Lancer gunner, and then select a new one by double-clicking on it. If I press the deploy hotkey, the newly selected ones deploy, while the deployed ones undeploy... good luck managing that in the midst of battle.

All in all, be glad if you couldn't start that one - nothing can give you back the time you would've wasted on that garbage.

column8: Игра хороша в смысле, вложенном локализатором посредством художественного перевода: эпилог. По скидке в виде завершения истории серии Command and conquer игра смотрится отлично. Сама по себе, пожалуй, сравнима с Dawn of war 3 концептуально (MOBA-вский дух, IceFrog-ом пахнет; к счастью, ареноподобные карты  - единственное сходство с дота-семейством, в остальном похоже на серию Dawn of war - контроль за точками победы) и Dawn of war 2 по содержанию (небольшой лимит юнитов, одно здание производит все войска) и графике. Красивые эффекты взрывов, великолепный дизайн  и огромное разнообразие юнитов, немаленький набор построек, но всего один режим мультиплеера на горстке в целом однотипных карт. P.S. Поражаюсь, почему люди на utube жалуются, мол, не раскрыли все тайны серии в этой игре. Дальше - максимальные спойлеры. Если кто не догадался: портал скриннов был сломан, а сеть контроля тиберия лишила инопланетян стратегического преимущества (хотя ясно, что разработчики просто поленились придумать игру, в которой уникальной внеземной расе вновь нашлось бы достойное место); Кейн - бывший император скриннов в изгнании либо ещё более мощное существо, уже его имя позволяет догадаться, что библейский Каин, сына Адама и Евы, первый убийца (жертва-родной брат Авель) - самое раннее описание главы братства НОД. Перед финальной миссией Кейн намекает главному герою, что ему надоело несколько тысяч лет сидеть на планете Земля (началось всё в пустыне) и развлекаться с людьми, пытаясь управлять развитием их технологий, поэтому он запускает портал в башне скриннов и вместе с братством уматывает домой  по своим делам.
column9: The game is good in the sense intended by the localizer through literary translation: an epilogue. Considering the discounted price of concluding the Command and Conquer series story, the game looks excellent. On its own, it's perhaps comparable to Dawn of War 3 conceptually (it has a MOBA feel, reeks of IceFrog; fortunately, the arena-like maps are the only similarity to the Dota family; otherwise, it's similar to the Dawn of War series - control of victory points) and Dawn of War 2 in content (a small unit limit, one building produces all troops) and graphics. Beautiful explosion effects, superb design and a huge variety of units, a considerable set of buildings, but only one multiplayer mode on a handful of generally similar maps. P.S. I'm amazed why people on YouTube complain that all the secrets of the series weren't revealed in this game. Major spoilers follow. In case anyone hasn't guessed: the Scrinn portal was broken, and the Tiberium control network deprived the aliens of their strategic advantage (though it's clear the developers were simply too lazy to come up with a game that would once again give this unique extraterrestrial race a worthy place). Kane is either a former Scrinn emperor in exile or an even more powerful being; his name alone suggests that the biblical Cain, son of Adam and Eve, the first murderer (his victim being his brother Abel), is the earliest description of the leader of the Brotherhood of Nod. Before the final mission, Kane hints to the protagonist that he's tired of sitting on planet Earth for several thousand years (it all started in the desert) and messing around with humans, trying to control the development of their technology. So he launches a portal in the Scrinn tower and, along with the Brotherhood, heads off home to do their own thing.

column8:
- I know it is different from any other game of the franchise. I know that you cannot build vast armies and play the classical RTS. I know this game was the black sheep of the franchise and that it practically killed it.
- Well, after almost 10 years of bad RTS games or no RTS games available at all on the gaming market, I replayed all the series of Command & Conquer and I must say I truly enjoyed playing them for like the seventh time. I could never get from any other recent RTS the same exceptionally good feeling I got in the C&C or Starcraft series.
- If you played the rest of the games in the franchise, you will find this one disconcerting and strange, because the game mechanics are not at all what are you used to.
- Nevertheless, once you master the new mechanisms and accept the fact that spots holding and points counting will make the game shorter than expected or desired, you can still have fun in the game.
- The joy I received from the franchise over the years is the only reason I gave C&C 4 a thumbs-up, since this game had a very unfortunate fate due to the mixed-up system they changed instead of keeping the good old (and proved) game mechanics in the series.
- Still, for an RTS fan, the game was  a must-play marker and can still be enjoyed even in 4K.

column9:
I'd heard a lot of bad things about this game, of course, but after a series of playthroughs, I finally decided to take a chance and check it out for myself. But it didn't work out: the game refuses to launch without an internet connection. No online means no campaign. And you can't even connect online, even if you have a proper account—all the servers have been shut down by the developers. Simply put, they're selling us NOTHING for 900 rubles. At least I managed to get my money back.

And the Steam moderators should be ashamed of themselves for selling a completely non-functional game.

column8:
好玩好玩好玩好玩好玩，真滴好玩，连续进EA服务器50次之后终于进克哒，进克之后玩联机真滴好玩，C&C4还有服务器，很阔以哒，

其实这款游戏做的很好，音乐非常好听，手感也不错，节奏很快，一打起来非常的热闹

玩法像是命令与征服和英雄连抢点玩法的结合，防御组的玩法很像红警3的TR战术，支援组的飞机也很帅气，后期的大战舰非常的霸气，游戏的血量可以自己设置，游戏其实很好玩。

新玩家不要听信那些所谓的“命令与征服老粉丝”的话，这款游戏很值得一玩，我每一部命令与征服都很喜欢，并且命令与征服全系列的对战我都仔细玩过，真正喜欢命令与征服的玩家是不会跟风黑这款游戏的。

虽然很多年前我第一次在网吧打开这款游戏也是满脸的不解和疑惑，但是多年后想起这款游戏，发现这款游戏意外的好玩。

喜欢命令与征服和RTS以及英雄连的玩家一定要仔细玩玩这款特别的竞技场风格的RTS游戏。
column9:
It's fun, fun, fun, fun, fun. It's really fun. After logging into the EA servers 50 times in a row, I finally got in. Playing online is so much fun. C&C4 even has servers, which is great.

This game is actually very well made. The music is beautiful, the gameplay feels good, and the pace is fast. It's really exciting once you get going.

The gameplay is like a combination of Command & Conquer and Company of Heroes' point-grabbing gameplay. The defense team's gameplay is very similar to the TR tactics in Red Alert 3. The support team's aircraft are also very cool. The late-game battleships are very impressive. You can customize your health bar. The game is actually very fun.

New players, don't listen to the so-called "old Command & Conquer fans." This game is worth playing. I love every Command & Conquer game and have thoroughly played all the battles in the series. True Command & Conquer fans won't follow the trend and criticize this game.

Although I was confused and puzzled when I first opened this game in an internet cafe many years ago, I think back to it many years later and find it surprisingly fun.

Players who like Command & Conquer, RTS, and Company of Heroes should definitely play this special arena-style RTS game carefully.

column8:
Tiberian Twilight ist ein nettes, solides Echtzeit-Strategiespiel, auch wenn mir persönlich das klassische Prinzip mit stationären Basen, aus Tiberium Wars, besser gefällt.

Mit dem Produktschlüssel, der in der Bibliothek einsehbar ist, kann man das Spiel auch bei EA Origin aktivieren, herunterladen und spielen.

Mir ist nicht klar, womit das Spiel so viele negative Reviews verdient hat. Habe unter Windows 10 Pro keinerlei Probleme.
Kann man im Sale definitiv mal mitnehmen.
column9:
Tiberian Twilight is a nice, solid real-time strategy game, although I personally prefer the classic concept of stationary bases from Tiberium Wars.

With the product key, which is available in the library, you can also activate, download, and play the game on EA Origin.

I don't understand why the game has earned so many negative reviews. I haven't had any problems with it on Windows 10 Pro.
Definitely worth picking up during the sale.

column8: Мне ,как фанату прошлых игр c&c эта чать савсем не понравилась. Больше нет ресурсов ,тиберия и той напряженности ,когда тебе на базу ворвались воиска противника . Здесь есть 3 вида (мсц или хз чего): 1-ый выводит ограниченное кол-во войск ,2-ой защитные сооружения тоже ограниченные ,3-ий самолеты и верталеты и тоже ограниченные. Не осилил и забросил  на 2-ом задании, видеоролики чекнул в инете .Ты  можешь хоть час сидеть выпускать войска из мсц перед мсц противника ,ведь скорость создания войск одинакова ,вот и война)
column9: As a fan of previous C&C games, I didn't like this part at all. There are no more resources, Tiberium, or that tension when enemy troops break into your base. There are three types (MCC or something): the first one deploys a limited number of troops, the second one deploys defensive structures, also limited, and the third one deploys planes and helicopters, also limited. I couldn't handle it and abandoned it after the second mission; I checked videos online. You can sit there for an hour releasing troops from the MCC before the enemy MCC, because the troop creation rate is the same, that's what war is all about.

column8:
The game has some sort of copy protection where you need to stay connected to the EA games server.
Needless to say, it doesn't. 
A popup message will say that further progress (while in the middle of a level), will be saved and you need to reconnect and reaload. 
If you don't, progress is not saved. And yes, this is single player I'm talking about.

You could see this as an added difficulty, but for me this was the last C&C I have bought from EA Games.
..kinda only bought it for the Westwood memory anyway, which I knew already is long gone.

Oh, the game itself isn't that great either. I'd rather re-buy Red Alert 1 and I would've had more fun.

Do not buy.

column8: 一分给nod战役的bgm，一分给剧情完结，剩下的全部差评给这游戏操蛋的强制联网机制和根本不知道是啥玩意的游戏模式，妈蛋不能随意造兵造建筑的C&C还能叫C&C吗？！搞这么复杂的克制系统是在恶心玩家吗？！打到一半断网然后打完发现就要从头开始才能解锁剧情你玩你妈呢！！果然EA就是个IP毁灭机，好好的最后一作被弄得不伦不类，建议想玩的下个盗版好了，别在这种玩意上花钱
column9: One point for the nod campaign background music, one point for the storyline ending, and the rest of the bad reviews go to the game's fucked-up forced internet connection mechanism and the game mode that's completely incomprehensible. Damn, can C&C still be called C&C if you can't build soldiers and buildings at will?! Are they trying to disgust players by having such a complicated restraint system?! You lose the internet connection halfway through the game, and then after you finish, you find you have to start from the beginning to unlock the storyline. What the hell are you doing?! EA is indeed an IP destroyer. They messed up the last game so badly. I suggest that if you want to play it, just buy a pirated copy and don't spend money on this kind of stuff.

column8:
While the game looks and sounds great, it's not Command & Conquer, not on any level is this a C&C game. Feels more like a RTT then a, RTS. I got it on sale for $4.99USD and I still feel let down... 

The sad part is, this was the end to our beloved Tiberium universe and it's a shameful display of EA's greed and bloated gluttony. Shame on you EA, shame on you for doing this to fans that have been following Command & Conquer since 1995 and then try to pose this crap as a Command & Conquer game.

Feel free to leave comments below on what you think should be done about C&C 4.

column8:
时隔多年回来做个测评。
EA的帐号注册是真的不友好。
新游戏模式不是不能适应，也确实有他的亮点。但是真的不！好！玩！
画面说不上比3进步到哪里去，相比之下至少红3都还有游戏性弥补。
剧情……没认真玩，时间都用在遭遇战练级上了，不做评价。
绝大部分时候有3就不想搓4，3玩得腻得不行了后才会考虑玩4换换口味，然后光速后悔。
因为玩的游戏太男性向了导致从小到大没啥游戏上的好朋友，至少通过这些认识了一些同好。
权且纪念一下，但是，希望下一个希冀给我们带来的不是失望。
column9:
Back to reviewing it after so many years.
EA's account registration system is truly unfriendly.
The new game mode isn't unplayable, and it certainly has its highlights. But it's truly not! Good! Playable!
The graphics aren't a huge improvement over 3. At least Red 3 makes up for it in gameplay.
As for the story... I didn't really play it; I spent all my time leveling up in skirmishes, so I can't comment on it.
Most of the time, I don't want to play 4 when I have 3. Only after I get tired of 3 do I consider 4 for a change, and then I quickly regret it.
Because the games I played were so male-oriented, I didn't have many close gaming friends growing up. At least through this, I've met some like-minded people.
This is just a commemoration, but I hope the next hope doesn't bring disappointment.

column8: Начать можно с того, что это говно не работает корректно в стиме. Постоянно идет ошибка "general system error", на что жалуются и американцы, и ру комьюнити (откройте обсуждения к игре и сами все увидите). Из-за этой ошибки мне пришлось устанавливать Origin на свой пк. Создав там учетную запись, активировав ключ игры там (благо он подошел, некоторые жалуются что в стиме и ключ не правильный), скачав этот шлак уже с клиента ориджина, я наконец-то зашел в игру. И боже, я просто ахуел. Я не знаю, как можно было так просрать франшизу. Игра без тиберия просто бессмысленна. Раньше давали 10к тиберия (в среднем) в начале каждой миссии и ты знал, что либо ты обустроишь начальную базу и с помощью аванпоста захватишь еще хранилище, либо миссия проиграна. В этой же части игры просто райткликом клепаешь войска. Я всю компанию за ГДИ прошел одним классом, никакой стратегией в игре просто и не пахнет. Даже видеоролики после каждой миссии смотрятся как говно из жопы, если сравнивать с предыдущими частями франшизы. Минусы в игре можно продолжать перечислять до бесконечности. Простой совет: не покупайте сей шлак, особенно в стиме, где он даже не запускается стабильно. А если и хотите по играть несмотря на все отрицательные отзывы к игре, то ориджин вам в помощь, лучше купите игру там.
column9: Let's start with the fact that this piece of crap doesn't work properly on Steam. It keeps getting a "general system error," which both Americans and the Russian community are complaining about (open the game's discussions and you'll see for yourself). Because of this error, I had to install Origin on my PC. After creating an account, activating the game key there (thankfully it worked; some people are complaining that the Steam key is invalid), and downloading this piece of crap from the Origin client, I finally got into the game. And oh my god, I was just blown away. I don't know how they could screw up the franchise like this. A game without Tiberium is simply pointless. They used to give you 10,000 Tiberium (on average) at the start of each mission, and you knew that either you set up a starting base and use the outpost to capture another storage depot, or the mission was lost. In this part of the game, you just right-click to churn out troops. I played through the entire GDI campaign with just one class, and there's absolutely no strategy in the game. Even the cutscenes after each mission look like crap compared to previous installments in the franchise. The list of downsides is endless. Simple advice: don't buy this garbage, especially on Steam, where it doesn't even run reliably. And if you still want to play despite all the negative reviews, Origin is your friend; buy it there.

column9: Command & Conquer 4 Steam Activation: If you receive a General System Error when entering the verification code, download the Origin platform and redeem the serial number on the Origin platform. Then activate Tiberian Twilight. You don't need to download it. After activation, open the platform and open Steam again. This should work. As for the 503 error, it's a network issue. Please be lenient with those who leave negative reviews. If the gameplay isn't up to par, please refrain from leaving negative reviews.

column8:
Obwohl dieses Spiel so anders ist als die anderen Teile der C&C Reihe (nur auf PC bezogen) hat dieses Spiel doch etwas an sich dass man es nach ein paar Jahren wieder aus der Versenkung hervor holt und noch einmal Spielen möchte, währe da nicht eine gewisse zusätzliche Online Registrierung die, nachdem man sein Konto angelegt hat bzw. sich mit seinen alten Daten Eingeloggt hat, einen Registrierungsschlüssel verlangt der trotz mehrmaliger Eingabe nicht mehr Funktioniert.

Steam bietet in diesem Fall keine Hilfe und verweist auf den EA Kundensupport der den Support für genau dieses Game Eingestellt zu haben scheint, somit ist es nicht möglich dieses Game auf legalem weg zu Spielen, ein Keygenerator könnte hier vermutlich Abhilfe schaffen, aber da ich solche Programme nicht nutze bleibt dieses Spiel wohl für immer ausserhalb meiner Reichweite.

Edit: Habe das Problem mit dem nicht Funktionierendem Key gelöst, Ihr müsst euch über euren Browser in euer bereits bestehendes EA Konto Einloggen oder ein Konto eröffnen,          

Ihr klickt dann folgendes: Konto Verwalten ---> Code Einlösen, jetzt den Code hier Eintippen oder Reinkopieren,  Wiedeholt auf next klicken bis Key Akzeptiert wurde.

Steam Starten (wenn bereits aktiviert dann neustart machen), C&C4 starten und im folgenden EA Bildschirm normal Einloggen und dann spiel Starten ohne den Key erneut eingeben zu müssen, fertig ;)

Der Daumen bleibt aber trotzdem unten weil C&C4 für mich das schlechteste aus der ganzen Reihe ist, und es keinen Neutralen Daumen gibt :D
column9:
Although this game is so different from the other installments in the C&C series (only available on PC), there's something about it that makes you want to dig it out of the shadows after a few years and play it again, were it not for the additional online registration process that, after creating your account or logging in with your old credentials, requires a registration key that no longer works despite repeated entry.

Steam offers no help in this case and refers you to EA Customer Support, which seems to have discontinued support for this very game. Therefore, it's not possible to play this game legally. A key generator could probably help, but since I don't use such programs, this game will probably remain out of my reach forever.

Edit: I've solved the problem with the non-working key. You need to log in to your existing EA account via your browser or create a new one.

Then click on the following: Manage Account ---> Redeem Code. Now type or copy and paste the code here. Click Next repeatedly until the key is accepted.

Start Steam (if already activated, restart), start C&C4, and log in normally on the following EA screen. Then start the game without having to enter the key again. Done ;)

But the thumbs still stay down because C&C4 is the worst of the entire series for me, and there's no such thing as a neutral thumbs-up :D

column8:
I have encountered quite a lot of technical issues (even with click and drag, logging in issues) with this and am totally unimpressed with the the story line, which is unengaging to say the least. However, my greatest disappointment is with the gameplay.

1. Limited population - you can only build 6-7 medium units + 2-4 engineers for repairs. By no means are you able to fully balance out your units and deploy your strategy effectively and every battle becomes a micro management nightmare.

2. Lack of resouce management - to me part of the beauty of past C&C (or any RTS for that matter) is the effective use of limited resource. In this game, you are given unlimited resource to build any amount of units, only constraint being the miserable pop cap in point 1. Half the time in this game you are just spamming cheap cannon fodder units without a care to their surviveabilty.

3. MCV - 3 MCV types that you have to select at start of game and each with their specific units / buildings. For example, you can only build defensive structure if you select the defense MCV and only tank units if you select the offense MCV. To change MCV type mid game you have to basically deconstruct your existing MCV and select a new type. And you can only land it on specific zones! This is a major PITA for me, why can't we have the option to build up my base defense even if my strategy is tank based? 

4. Upgrade path - you can only gain access to certain units / abilities after leveling up and even at end game stage you will not have access to the best units / abilities, even after finishing all the side quests. While this by no means stops you from completing the game, it does not offer you the best experience (unless you are willing to replay completed missions to earn extra exp). The best example is perhaps the final mission for NOD, where you have to destroy a GDI battleship, which basically 2 hits all your basic units. I remember spamming the basic units till the miserable pop cap, watching them shave 4-5%  off the GDI battleship and then dying in less than 3 sec, and then repeat ad naseum.

Overall, this game seems to be a weak & sad attempt by EA to milk a dying cow and is an utter embarrassment to the original C&C.
column9:
I have encountered quite a lot of technical issues (even with click and drag, logging in issues) with this and am totally unimpressed with the the story line, which is unengaging to say the least. However, my greatest disappointment is with the gameplay.

1. Limited population - you can only build 6-7 medium units + 2-4 engineers for repairs. By no means are you able to fully balance out your units and deploy your strategy effectively and every battle becomes a micro management nightmare.

2. Lack of resouce management - to me part of the beauty of past C&C (or any RTS for that matter) is the effective use of limited resource. In this game, you are given unlimited resource to build any amount of units, only constraint being the miserable pop cap in point 1. Half the time in this game you are just spamming cheap cannon fodder units without a care to their surviveabilty.

3. MCV - 3 MCV types that you have to select at start of game and each with their specific units / buildings. For example, you can only build defensive structure if you select the defense MCV and only tank units if you select the offense MCV. To change MCV type mid game you have to basically deconstruct your existing MCV and select a new type. And you can only land it on specific zones! This is a major PITA for me, why can't we have the option to build up my base defense even if my strategy is tank based? 

4. Upgrade path - you can only gain access to certain units / abilities after leveling up and even at end game stage you will not have access to the best units / abilities, even after finishing all the side quests. While this by no means stops you from completing the game, it does not offer you the best experience (unless you are willing to replay completed missions to earn extra exp). The best example is perhaps the final mission for NOD, where you have to destroy a GDI battleship, which basically 2 hits all your basic units. I remember spamming the basic units till the miserable pop cap, watching them shave 4-5%  off the GDI battleship and then dying in less than 3 sec, and then repeat ad naseum.

Overall, this game seems to be a weak & sad attempt by EA to milk a dying cow and is an utter embarrassment to the original C&C.

column9:
It's a dull piece of crap. I tried to play it for free on a pirated copy when it first came out, and I couldn't finish the campaign. I just couldn't stomach that piece of crap.

Now, when the Command and Conquer collection was on sale, I bought it as a tribute to what I got back when I was playing pirated copies back then.

And now, after a long time, I finally mustered up the courage to try to complete the campaign of Part 4... and I didn't like it at all. It's the same dull piece of crap as before. If you play Part 3, for example. At least Kane's Wrath is gorgeous and well-made, it's still playable, and you can't replay it.

And this is garbage... it needs to be shoved up the development team's ass.

column8:
So, I remember when I was hyped for C&C4, and when I finally got to play it, I felt like I had Cloud's sword stabbed into my back. This isn't even worthy of being part of the series, like you choose out of 3 MCVs to start with and you have Offense, Support and Defence. Naturally I wanted to dive in so I chose Offense, and I felt just as confused as an illegal immigrant waking up in the middle of America. I didn't know anything about the units or base building, so I noticed I could create an engineer and so my first thought was "ok progress". No, they can't construct buildings, but they can repair units and use basic attacks to defend themselves. There's an upgrades tab that I didn't know how to unlock the technology to research passive abilities or even new units. 
After a while I began to feel like some sort of dictator trying to make shit work after it's too late. If anything I'd just stick with Kanes Wrath or Red Alert 3, in fact just play anything before them, don't touch that free browser shit or number 4, stick to the classics.

column8:
[h1]Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight[/h1]

To gra strategiczna, zaprojektowana przez EA Los Angeles i wydana przez Electronic Arts w 2010 roku. Opowiada o konflikcie na skale światową Bractwa Nod z GDI.

[b]Silnik gry[/b]

Jest mocną stroną gry. Nie posiada żadnych istotnych błędów, które warto byłoby wymienić. Jest bardzo dobrze dopracowany.

[b]Grafika[/b]

To kolejny gigantyczny plus. Grafika na najwyższych wymaganiach jest starannie dociągnięta do najdrobniejszych elementów, co daje wspaniały rezultat wizualny. Jednak wiadomo, że za idealną jakością tekstur idzie odpowieni sprzęt komputerowy.

[b]Muzyka[/b]

Zaprezentowane utwory w przedstawionym produkcie są dobrze dopasowane względem rozgrywki. Oczywiście utwory zmieniają się względem napięcia akcji, co idealnie nastraja gracza do tematyki wojennej przedstawionego tytułu.

[b]Rozgrywka[/b]

Niestety tutaj nie można powiedzieć, że to mocna strona gry. Jeżeli chodzi o porównanie do poprzednich wersji to po prostu będzie niepoprawne, gdyż Command & Conquer 4 jest nastawiony głównie na grę multiplayer. Z każdą napotkaną grą ów serii C&C rozgrywka była dość banalna - zbierasz surowce, które wymieniane są na fundusze, budujesz bazę, werbujesz jednostki piechoty, bądź produkujesz zmechanizowane i starasz się wyeliminować przeciwnika wszelkimi dostępnymi środkami. Natomiast ta część odstaje od normy, gdyż do dyspozycji mamy (nie ważne czy w GDI, czy w NOD) 3 rodzaje budynków głównych. Ofensywny - charakteryzuje się tworzeniem głównie jednostek zmechanizowanych naziemnych, Defensywny - gdzie do werbunku możemy podjąć piechote, oraz Wsparcia - uruchamiając produkcję głównie jednostek latających. Im więcej bitew online, bądź offline rozegramy tym bardziej rośnie poziom naszego awatara, dzięki czemu możemy odblokować różnego rodzaju nowe jednostki, bądź ulepszenia. Tutaj rozgrywka jest ograniczona głównie do nacierania na przeciwnika, bez rozbudowywania flanki defensywnej, bądź bazy. Nie zbiera się surowców, które zapewniają fundusze na produkcję wojska, po prostu wybieramy jeden z trzech rodzajów ruchomego budynku głównego, produkujemy (za darmo)  takie wojsko jakie uważamy za słuszne i rozpoczynamy jak najszybszy atak. Największą wadą jest brak zaawansowanego wiersza poleceń, który mocno ułatwiłby rozgrywkę.

[b]Fabuła[/b]

Kane stara się za wszelką cenę dostąpić wniebowstąpienia, za pomocą wieży pozostawionej przez kosmiczą rasę scrinów. GDI za wszelką cenę stara się stłumić zamieszki spowodowane wysłannikami bractwa NOD i nie ma zamiaru pozwolić Kane'owi na spełnienie swojego celu, czy uda im się powstrzymać fanatycznego przywódcę bractwa?

[b]Reasumując, do plusów gry możemy zaliczyć:[/b]
[list]
[*]poprawność w sferze fabularnej
[*]czas potrzebny do zakończenia wątku
[*]mocno intensywną akcję podczas rozgrywki
[*]wciągającą fabułę
[*]innowacyjny pomysł rozgrywki, który mocno różni się od każdej poprzedniej części serii C&C.
[/list]
[b]Natomiast do ewidentnych minusów trzeba zaliczyć:[/b]
[list]
[*]strasznie wygórowaną cenę względem tego co oferuje produkt
[*]brak zaawansowanego wiersza poleceń, który ułatwiłby w wielu sytuacjach rozgrywkę
[*]bardzo uproszczoną rozgrywkę.
[/list]
[b]Moim zdaniem[/b]

Zaprezentowany produkt Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight jest tytułem godnym polecenia i wartym uwagi, po mimo tego, że rozgrywka nie jest świetna to fabuła i efekty specjalne, jak również i tempo akcji zaprezentowane przez twórców przechylają szalę tej części z serii C&C na pozytywną stronę.

Pozdrawiam
Paweł

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1400599927

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1400599329

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1400595824

[RECENZJA DO POPRAWEK ORTOGRAFICZNYCH I STYLISTYCZNYCH]
column9:
[h1]Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight[/h1]

This is a strategy game designed by EA Los Angeles and published by Electronic Arts in 2010. It tells the story of the global conflict between the Brotherhood of Nod and GDI.

[b]Game Engine[/b]

It's the game's strong point. It doesn't have any significant bugs worth mentioning. It's very well-polished.

[b]Graphics[/b]

This is another huge plus. The graphics, set to the highest requirements, are meticulously refined down to the smallest detail, resulting in a stunning visual result. However, it's clear that excellent texture quality requires adequate computer hardware.

[b]Music[/b]

The songs featured in this product are well-matched to the gameplay. Naturally, the songs change depending on the tension of the action, perfectly emphasizing the player's war-themed gameplay.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

Unfortunately, this isn't the game's strong point. Comparing it to previous versions would be simply inaccurate, as Command & Conquer 4 is primarily focused on multiplayer. With every game in the C&C series I've encountered, the gameplay has been fairly straightforward – you gather resources, which are exchanged for funds, build a base, recruit infantry units, or produce mechanized units, and try to eliminate the enemy by any means necessary. However, this installment differs from the norm, as we have three main building types at our disposal (regardless of whether in GDI or NOD). Offensive – characterized by the creation of primarily mechanized ground units, Defensive – where we can recruit infantry, and Support – which initiates the production of primarily air units. The more battles we play online or offline, the higher our avatar's level increases, allowing us to unlock various new units and upgrades. Here, gameplay is limited primarily to attacking the enemy, without developing a defensive flank or base. There are no resources to gather, which provide funds for military production; we simply choose one of three types of mobile main building, produce (for free) the troops we deem appropriate, and launch an attack as quickly as possible. The biggest drawback is the lack of an advanced command line, which would greatly simplify gameplay.

[b]Story[/b]

Kane is desperately trying to achieve ascension, using a tower left by the alien race of scrins. GDI is desperately trying to quell the riots caused by agents of the Brotherhood of Nod and has no intention of allowing Kane to fulfill his goal. Will they be able to stop the brotherhood's fanatical leader?

[b]In summary, the game's advantages include:[/b]
[list]
[*]accurate storyline
[*]time needed to complete the story
[*]highly intense gameplay
[*]engrossing plot
[*]innovative gameplay concept that differs significantly from any previous installment in the C&C series.
[/list]
[b]However, the obvious disadvantages include:[/b]
[list]
[*]terribly excessive price compared to what the product offers
[*]lack of an advanced command line, which would make gameplay easier in many situations
[*]very simplified gameplay. [/list]
[b]In my opinion[/b]

The presented product, Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight, is a title worth recommending and considering. Although the gameplay isn't great, the story and special effects, as well as the pace of the action presented by the developers, tip the scales of this installment in the C&C series in the positive direction.

Best regards,
Paweł

column9:
Apart from anything else, can this game maintain a connection for more than an hour?

I personally don't mind the changes that eliminate the economic factor and turn real-time strategy into real-time tactics.

However, the full online setup and poor network connection make normal gameplay nearly impossible, ruining the experience.

Also, I'm not a big fan of the gameplay. A different name would be better. It's hard to give this game a good review under the name of Command & Conquer.

column8:
Очень сложно непредвзято оценить эту игру, являясь фанатом серии C&C (а не орать от увиденного матом на своего кота, потому что больше то и не на кого выместить всё негодование, но кот то и не при чем, и сидит он потом думает где же я опять нассал не так)

Главная фишка серии игр - живые видеоролики. С одной стороны, видеоролики в своём качестве стали на порядок выше, актёры начали по-настоящему играть, это уже больше не та клоунада как в порнушных роликах перед основным действом (вспомнить актёрскую игру из предыдущей части... Даже в убогих русских сериалах про ментов качество игры актёров лучше в гигалиарды раз). С другой стороны, совершенно ни капельки, ни грамулечки, ни песчиночки, ни ху яшечки не понятно что там вообще, мать того за ногу, происходит. Помимо этого, многие моменты настолько абсурдные и нелепые, что залезаешь в стим в поисках ДЛС к этой игре, по которому вам отсыпят немного дури, вкуренной в процессе написания сценария.

Может быть, это я такой придирчивый и невнимательный, допускаю, но я ни черта не понял сюжета, начиная с первого видеоролика, и заканчивая последним. Буду благодарен, если кто-то расскажет, что там на самом деле происходило.

Оценить геймплей в полной мере, возможно, мне помешает прохождение игры в одиночку. Как я понял, она рассчитана на кооп. Поэтому скажу только о своем опыте одиночной игры. [strike]ПОЛНОЕ ГОВ НИЩЕ[/strike] Геймплей довольно экспериментальный и необычный. Вместо типичной стратегии, к которой мы все привыкли, динамику боёв решили раскрутить, и лишили нас построек, базы, добычи ресурсов, штампования тысячного воинства и подобных плюшек, за которые мы любили C&C. Вместо этого, нам дали гигантскую черепашку, разрешили нон-стопом рожать из неё максимум 10-15 бойцов, которыми мы должны разруливать любой конфликт. Нет больше супер-оружия, нет масштабных боёв и харвестеров. Да и тиберий здесь нужен только чтобы его схватить, залететь с ним в руках в толпу врагов и подорваться. Сам по себе такой режим игры интересный, и к нему нет никаких претензий. Но игроки явно ожидали от C&C совсем не этого. Будь он каким-нибудь отдельным режимом игры, то проблем не было бы вообще никаких.

Дизайн. Графическая составляющая отступила на несколько шагов назад от предыдущей части. Юниты выглядят как игрушки из лего, сама графика стала более яркой и мультяшной (особенно спецэффекты), интерфейс стал максимально убогим, каким не был в этой серии игр вообще никогда. И если с ред алертом подобный дизайн игры прокатил, т.к. игра сама по себе является карикатурной и шутливой, то у серии тибериума совершенно другой посыл. Без шуток. Всё серьёзно. С игрушками из лего.

А вот саундтрек действительно порадовал. Многим не понравились "цыганские завывания" на фоне НОДов, а мне показалось это очень клёвым и уместным, учитывая, что эта группировка собралась как раз в этих странах. 

В итоге мы имеем игру среднего качества, которую загнала в могилу аббревиатура C&C. Не будь этой аббревиатуры, положительных обзоров было бы намного больше.
column9:
It's really hard to evaluate this game objectively as a C&C fan (and not yell obscenities at your cat after seeing it, because there's no one else to vent your anger on, and the cat has nothing to do with it, so he sits there wondering where I messed up again).

The main feature of the series is the lively cutscenes. On the one hand, the quality of the cutscenes has improved significantly, the actors have started to really act, it's no longer the clown act of pornographic videos before the main action (remember the acting in the previous game... Even in crappy Russian cop shows, the acting is far superior). On the other hand, it's completely unclear what the hell is going on there. Besides, many moments are so absurd and ridiculous that you'll find yourself browsing Steam looking for DLC for this game, only to be rewarded with some of the nonsense they've ingested while writing the script.

Maybe I'm just being picky and inattentive, I admit it, but I didn't understand a damn thing about the plot, from the first video to the last. I'd be grateful if someone could explain what actually happened.

Playing the game solo might prevent me from fully appreciating the gameplay. As far as I understand, it's designed for co-op. So, I'll only speak from my experience playing it solo. [strike]TOTAL GOSPEL[/strike] The gameplay is quite experimental and unusual. Instead of the typical strategy we're all accustomed to, they decided to ramp up the combat dynamics, depriving us of buildings, a base, resource extraction, churning out thousands of troops, and other perks that made us love C&C. Instead, we were given a giant turtle, allowed to constantly spawn a maximum of 10-15 fighters from it, with which we must resolve any conflict. There are no more super-weapons, no large-scale battles or harvesters. And the only thing you need Tiberium for here is to grab it, fly into a crowd of enemies, and blow yourself up. This game mode itself is interesting, and there are no complaints about it. But this is clearly not what players expected from C&C. If it had been a separate game mode, there would have been no problems at all.

Design. The graphics have taken a few steps back from the previous game. The units look like Lego toys, the graphics themselves have become brighter and more cartoonish (especially the special effects), and the interface has become the most shabby ever seen in this series. While this design worked with Red Alert, as the game itself is cartoonish and humorous, the Tiberium series has a completely different message. No jokes. Seriously. With Lego toys.

The soundtrack, however, was truly a delight. Many people disliked the "gypsy howls" in the background of the Nods, but I thought it was very cool and appropriate, considering that this group was gathered in these very countries.

The end result is a mediocre game, doomed by the acronym C&C. Without this acronym, there would have been many more positive reviews.

column8: Death of a great game series.  I think the fact that they rushed the game development; and then. announced that they wanted player input as how to make the next game better.  Then EA dissolves the development team.  C&C games are still being played by millions of gamers, and with the expansion of available MODS (recently ever more great ones!) the gamer base is growing.  C&C Generals Zero Hour seems really hot (many mod users playing on-line).  Maybe EA should hire the modders to make new games for them, or redesign the old ones and release them on their own.

column8:
A usual C&C games, for the oldies nostalgy.

The game introduce some new concepts though, with 3 different types of base 8offense, defense and support9m somehow forcing you to adapt to the battlefield conditions as each type can produce specific units.

The base are also mobile so it can bring another level to the fight.

Gameplay wise, apart from the above, it's quite the same as the old C&C but you don't gather tiberium anymore.

So you build your base, some units and you rush to the ennemy.

The scenario is quite classical, but still, it's fun to see some games running real videos with actors to move forward with the scenario.

Graphically speaking, it's quite ok, nothing fantastic but still nice to look at.

There are obviously nowadays better alternatives, but if you want to finish the C&C story, go for it.

column8:
extrêmement négatives, voici le genre de notation sur steam qui est rare pour ce genre de franchise.

Changer le gameplay, c’est  prendre un risque, surtout quand il est aussi intuitif que dans les précédent opus.
C’est passé de génial à mauvais.

Le Online obligatoire fait que l’on trouve toujours des gens en train de jouer mais que l’on ne peut pas jouer sans se connecter à son compte EA.

L’impossibilité de se faire rembourser est le coup final, car vous avez sûrement acheté le bundle.

PS : Une recommandation sur deux est ironique.
column9:
Extremely negative, this is the kind of Steam rating that's rare for this type of franchise.

Changing the gameplay is a risk, especially when it's as intuitive as in previous installments.

It went from great to bad.

The mandatory online feature means you can always find people playing, but you can't play without logging into your EA account.

The inability to get a refund is the final blow, because you probably bought the bundle.

PS: Every second recommendation is ironic.

column8:
Tags: RTS - Real Time Strategy
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Streamline-a-RTS formula that has you control checkpoints with mobile fast paced combat oriented squads with mobile buildings that spawn units. Could not get past DRM/EA account login. 

I believe I might have tried it for a very short time and did not like the new approach one bit. If anything I'd rather go the opposite direction and focus on basebuilding instead like Factoria proposes.

In any case I retested this year created a new EA account. They have not sent anything to my inbox and using the username and password I had just created said the password was invalid. 

At a loss at how to proceed forward but I have a lot of quality RTS. Factorio, Starcraft 2, Ashes of singularity to name a few. This botched attempt at changing an established formula will not be missed. Removed permanently into hidden library of titles for declutter.

column8:
[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
Познал самую отвратительную стратегию, что вообще видел, а видел я всякое.
[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
Познал самую отвратительную стратегию, что вообще видел, а видел я всякое.

Если серьёзно, из положительных моментов… ничего.

[b]Графика[/b] - как для детей до 7-ми лет.
[b]Музыка[/b] - невыносима. Вот эти цыганские песнопения, когда за NOD миссия завершается, это к чему вообще?
[b]Новая система развития\прокачки[/b] – просто забей. Кто придумал открывать юниты посредством XP? 
[b]Ролики[/b] – простенькие, бюджета на дорогих актеров не хватило.

C&C ли это? Нет.
Стратегия ли это? Сомнительно.
Одна из самых мерзких игр? Определенно.
column9:
[h1]Pros:[/h1]
I experienced the most disgusting strategy game I've ever seen, and I've seen all sorts.
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
I experienced the most disgusting strategy game I've ever seen, and I've seen all sorts.

Seriously, the positives... nothing.

[b]Graphics[/b] - like for kids under 7.
[b]Music[/b] - unbearable. What's the point of all that gypsy singing when you complete a mission for NOD?
[b]New development/leveling system[/b] - just forget it. Who came up with the idea of ​​unlocking units with XP?
[b]Cutscenes[/b] - simple; they didn't have the budget for expensive actors.

Is this a C&C? No.
Is this a strategy game? Doubtful. One of the most disgusting games? Definitely.

column8:
I kinda like it. 

Been playing C&C since 98. Tiberian Twilight since it came out. Glad to find it on steam. 

I don't have the time to game I used to. Short campaign with some interesting twists. Childish, A-Move to victory gameplay. Joe Kucan putting in work. It's all I need on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Or to co-op with friends. I come back to this more than any other C&C title.

But recommend it? EA didn't believe in this game and you can tell. Tiberium 3 and Red Alert 3 had Hollywood names. Full length campaigns. Polished multiplayer to rival StarCraft. An archive full of world lore. They were labours of love. By comparison, 4 was a paycheck. Why should I ask you to shell out money for it? Tib 3 & RA3 are on steam as well, selling for a third less I might add.

column8:
Horrible. Este juego no es un Command & Conquer. Tiene la complejidad de un juego de teléfono móvil. 
Lo han simplificado al máximo. No puedes construir bases. No hay cosechadoras. 

Como no hay bases, no hay planificación, así que todas las misiones se reducen a dos tipos: escoltar/proteger o  atacar con límite de tiempo.  

Como no hay cosechadoras, no hay gestión de recursos, así que le han puesto límite de unidades (unas 10 a la vez o así), de tal forma que siempre construyes gratis, pero no puedes pasar de tener un reducido número de unidades. El jugador del ordenador durante la campaña por supuesto no tiene límite y puede tener todas las que quiera.

Le han quitado todas las cosas que definían a la saga.Esto es como si al Mario le meten contenido para adultos. A saber en qué estaban pensando los desarrolladores al crear este engendro. Da la impresión de que intentaron copiarse del Company of Heroes y al final ni lo uno ni lo otro. Está tan mal hecho que no harían falta más excusas para despedir a todos los que hayan tomado las decisiones de hacerlo así.

Y para colmo te obliga a estar siempre conectado a internet. Este es otro juego más que pareciera como si lo hubieran querido sabotear desde dentro. El único sentido que tiene jugar a esto es que hayas jugado a todos los anteriores y quieras ver como termina la historia. Ponerlo en nivel fácil y pasarlo cuanto antes.
Aunque claro, también puedes verlo por youtube y te ahorras el tener que comprarlo.
column9:
Horrible. This game isn't Command & Conquer. It has the complexity of a mobile phone game.
They've simplified it to the max. You can't build bases. There are no harvesters.

Since there are no bases, there's no planning, so all missions are reduced to two types: escort/protect or attack with a time limit.

Since there are no harvesters, there's no resource management, so they've imposed a unit limit (about 10 at a time or so), so you always build for free, but you can't go beyond a small number of units. The computer player, of course, has no limit during the campaign and can have as many units as they want.

They've stripped out all the things that defined the series. This is like adding adult content to Mario. Who knows what the developers were thinking when they created this monstrosity. It feels like they were trying to copy Company of Heroes, but in the end, they didn't do either. It's so poorly done that no more excuses would be needed to fire everyone who made the decisions to do it this way.

And to top it all off, it forces you to be constantly connected to the internet. This is yet another game that feels like it's been sabotaged from within. The only point in playing this is if you've played all the previous ones and want to see how the story ends. Set it to easy and beat it as soon as possible.
Although, of course, you can also watch it on YouTube and save yourself the trouble of buying it.

column8:
8 years after the fact I know the meaning of futility.  

After installing and jumping through the account hoops to even play, then having an argument with windows firewall, I finally got into the game.

I chose to do a skirmish first as I hear the campaign is a testicular ache without a bit of grind first.  During said skirmish I got a disconnect message.  Tabbed out to see if it was my actual connection, it was not.

Now here's the thing, after a 40 minute slog it decided absolutely nothing I did counted.  About 600+ XP up in smoke.

Turns out it doesn't bother reconnecting itself.  In a MUST BE ONLINE TO SAVE game this is unforgivable.

Gameplay is done better by Relics Company of Heroes/ DoW 2 series.  Certainly not traditional C&C which I could forgive if it was good on it's own.  It's passable at best.

No idea on story as it's unlikely I'll be playing again.

Graphics are essentially upgraded C&C 3 visuals, they're passable.

Music is terrible.

This is the fastest fornicate this poop I've ever done in a videogame.  Well done EA.  This was a £2 purchase BTW.  I still feel ripped off.

Tl;dr review:  Several asterisks worth of less than complimentary language describe my feelings of about the game.

column8:
总体评价：一款生不逢时的游戏
如果这款游戏能等到2017年发售，想必不会是现在的差评如潮
如果这款游戏能冠以：“红色警戒3番外-泰伯利亚王者”  这个名字，而不是命令与征服4，亦或不会是现在的窘境。

放一个资源：这个地图能帮助你快速升到20级 https://pan.baidu.com/s/1dGHwNbb
先说优化：游戏优化很好，最高画质一个小时，电脑风扇声音依旧很小

断断续续玩了一段时间，一直没有明白这款游戏到底是在做什么，然而偶尔玩了一把王者荣耀，不禁感慨，这游戏真的是出的太早了，当时的人们无法理解这个游戏的玩法，而把他简单的认为像以往的命令与征服一样，造一堆部队推过去就赢了。

基地传送时间=“敌军还有十秒到达战场”，
选择MCV类型 攻击，防御，辅助=“战士，法师，团控”，
请登陆EA账户=“召唤师，请先登陆”
20级解锁科技=XX级解锁治疗，XX级解锁奔跑，25级解锁闪现
不能碾压=我没听说关羽可以碾压
有人口限制=我没听说王者荣耀可以控制多个英雄
占领泰伯利亚网络中心获得点数=摧毁水晶获得胜利
5v5=5v5
收集泰伯利亚获得科技升级=打野升级出装

这款游戏与王者荣耀百分之60的相似度，为什么不好玩，是因为，亲爱的指挥官，你用命令与征服传统的视角去看这款游戏
这款游戏的画风和红色警戒3一样
这款游戏不叫命令与征服4，它叫：红色警戒3番外-泰伯利亚王者
提醒：不要玩剧情，直接5V5开黑吧
游戏现状：官网没有鬼服，延迟比较低
column9:
Overall Review: A game born at the wrong time.

If this game had waited until 2017 for its release, it probably wouldn't have received the overwhelmingly negative reviews it has today.

If it had been titled "Red Alert 3 Extra - Tiberium Kings" instead of "Command & Conquer 4," it might not be in its current predicament.

Here's a resource: This map can help you quickly reach level 20. https://pan.baidu.com/s/1dGHwNbb

First, let's talk about optimization: The game is very well optimized. Even after an hour at highest settings, my computer fan remains very quiet.

I played it on and off for a while, never quite understanding what this game was all about. However, when I occasionally played a game of Honor of Kings, I couldn't help but sigh: This game was truly released too early. People at the time didn't understand the gameplay and simply assumed it was like the old Command & Conquer games: just build a bunch of troops and push forward to win.

Base teleport time = "Enemy troops have ten seconds to arrive at the battlefield."
Select MCV type: Attack, Defense, Support = "Warrior, Mage, Crowd Control."
Please log in to your EA account = "Summoner, please log in first."
Technology unlocked at level 20 = Healing unlocked at level XX, Run unlocked at level XX, Flash unlocked at level 25
Cannot crush = I've never heard of Guan Yu being able to crush
Population limit = I've never heard of King of Glory being able to control multiple heroes
Capture Tiberium Network Center to gain points = Destroy the crystal to win
5v5 = 5v5
Collect Tiberium to gain technology upgrades = Upgrade your jungler's equipment

This game is 60% similar to King of Glory. Why isn't it fun? Because, dear Commander, you're viewing it through the lens of traditional Command & Conquer.
The graphics are the same as Red Alert 3.
This game isn't called Command & Conquer 4, it's called: Red Alert 3 Extra - Tiberium Kings
Reminder: Don't play the story, just play 5v5.
Game status: There are no ghost servers on the official website, and the latency is relatively low.

column8:
Ich habe mich auf das Spiel gefreut, da es auf den Bildern anders aussieht, als die typischen alten C&C-Teile. Die Bilder haben nicht gelogen und es sieht wirklich so aus, jetzt kommt aber der springende Punkt weshalb ich eine Rückerstattung meines Geldes (Bundle mit C&C 3) beantragt habe: Es macht überhaupt keinen Spaß!

Ich versuche das etwas näher zu erläutern. Und zwar gibt es bei dem Spiel nun drei verschiedene MBFs (Offensiv, Defensiv und Unterstützung) die alle unterschiedliche Fähigkeiten, Einheiten und Gebäude haben.
Die ersten paar Minuten waren sehr verwirrend und ich wusste nicht mal wie ich nun ein Gebäude platziere. Nach wenigen Minuten habe ich das nun auch herausgefunden, aber der Spielspaß blieb erheblich auf der Strecke durch das geswitche von offensiven zu defensive zu unterstützendem MBF.

Ich bin echt enttäuscht von dem Spiel und nicht nur wegen dem Spiel selber, sondern man muss sich bei EA (Origin) anmelden um das Spiel zu spielen.
column9:
I was looking forward to the game because the pictures made it look different from the typical old C&C games. The pictures didn't lie, and it really does look like that, but now comes the crux of the matter, which is why I requested a refund of my money (bundled with C&C 3): It's not fun at all!

I'll try to explain this in a little more detail. The game now has three different MBFs (Offensive, Defensive, and Support), each with different abilities, units, and buildings.
The first few minutes were very confusing, and I didn't even know how to place a building. After a few minutes, I figured it out, but the fun of the game was significantly diminished by switching from offensive to defensive to support MBF.

I'm really disappointed with the game, and not just because of the game itself, but because you have to sign up with EA (Origin) to play the game.

column8: Думаю написать обзор по этой части Command & Conquer 4 Tiberian Twilight будет не просто так как игра вызвала спорное мнение. С одной стороны игра имеет новые вид в отличии от старых частей, постепенный доступ к технологиям. Но с другой ограничение от 3-х до 2 сторон конфликта и выбора только из 2-х 1 сторону на которой вы будите(нельзя играть против GDI за GDI или Nod против Nod) сложи все положительные и отрицательные стороны она ходит по краю пропасти. В итоге я ставлю игре 5 краулеров из 10.
column9: I think writing a review of this part of Command & Conquer 4 Tiberian Twilight won't be easy, as the game has sparked controversy. On the one hand, the game has a new look compared to the older games, with gradual access to technology. But on the other hand, the limitation of three to two sides of the conflict and the choice of which side you'll be on (you can't play against GDI as GDI or Nod against Nod) leaves the game teetering on the edge of a cliff. Overall, I give the game a 5 out of 10 crawler rating.

column8:
Однажды зайдя в магазин я наткнулся на хорошую акцию на серию игр C&C 3 и меня захватило чувство ностальгии по данному шедевру игровой индустрии. Не долго думая я решил приобрести все игры C&C 3. Оказалось, что EA выпустило продолжение этой саги - C&C 4: Tiberian Twilight и я решил, что и её тоже необходимо приобрести, но когда перешёл на страницу с отзывами - я начал сомневаться в целесообразности данной покупки, т.к. отзывы были крайне негативные. Почитал их. Ну, думаю, куплю всё-равно, благо если покупать комплектом все игры данной серии, то скидка покрывала большую часть стоимости 4й части. Всё же хотелось верить в то, что фанатам просто не понравилась новая механика, я же не был столь строгим консерватором и решил дать игре шанс. Каково же было моё разочарование когда я начал в неё играть, предварительно пройдя C&C 3... Такой скучной и неинтересной стратегии-кликера мне ещё не попадалось... Даже Кейн не смог хоть сколько-нибудь сгладить негативного впечатления от этой поделки. Сюжет ни о чём, ролики унылые и неинтересные, миссии скучные, а иногда и нудные когда нужно кругами бегать за вражескими краулерами. Проходил на высоком уровне сложности, может быть это добавило дополнительного негатива - не знаю, но в C&C 3 это только усиливало положительные эмоции! Ну да, а тут, выходит, усиливало отрицательные... В общем я не советую фанатам играть в эту игру, уж лучше прочтите на Википедии или ещё где-нибудь сюжет и надейтесь на выход когда-нибудь в светлом будущем адекватной 5й части.

P.S.: чтобы поиграть в игру нужно зарегистрироваться на сайте EA и потом при каждом запуске игры вводить логин и пароль от этой учётки. Столько телодвижений для игры такого уровня?? В общем имейте ввиду.
column9:
One day, while shopping, I stumbled upon a great deal on the C&C 3 series, and I was overcome with nostalgia for this masterpiece of gaming. Without much thought, I decided to buy all the C&C 3 games. It turned out that EA had released a sequel to this saga, C&C 4: Tiberian Twilight, and I decided I had to get it too. But when I went to the reviews page, I began to doubt the wisdom of this purchase, as the reviews were extremely negative. I read them. Well, I figured I'd buy it anyway, since if you buy all the games in the series together, the discount covers most of the cost of the fourth game. I still wanted to believe that fans simply didn't like the new mechanics, but I wasn't such a strict conservative and decided to give the game a chance. Imagine my disappointment when I started playing it after finishing C&C 3... I've never encountered such a boring and uninteresting clicker strategy game... Even Kane couldn't even slightly smooth over the negative impression I got from this piece of junk. The plot is worthless, the cutscenes are dull and uninteresting, the missions are boring, and sometimes even tedious when you have to run around in circles chasing enemy crawlers. I played it on the hard difficulty level, and maybe that added to the negative emotions—I don't know, but in C&C 3 it only intensified the positive emotions! Well, yes, but here, it seems, it intensified the negative ones... Overall, I don't recommend this game to fans; it's better to read the plot on Wikipedia or somewhere else and hope for a proper 5th installment to be released someday in the bright future.

P.S.: To play the game, you need to register on the EA website and then enter your username and password for that account every time you launch the game. So much body movement for a game of this level?? Just keep that in mind.

column8:
Now... The reason I bought it in the first place? 
I actually played it when it came out, well played a pirated copy lol, and I actually enjoyed it! I played Command and Conquer Red Alert and Command and Conquer 3, both of em, so I understood the "basics" of this series. So I was a bit shocked seeing the gameplay go from base builder to something like Homeworld.

However, I must say that Tiberium Twilight, if we ignore the campaign, isn't so bad! It just feels... unfinished at times in comparison to CnC 3.
What sucks is that I can't get past the in game login screen with the disconnected pop up always preventing me from getting into the game. 

So if  there is a way to have this "disconnecting" issue resolved I would appreciate that! Thank you.

EDIT:
Managed to make it work and, after playing some more, I can definitely say: the gameplay is still as fun as I remember! My issue though is that the games are either too slow or too fast. Sometimes you can't even reach Tier 3 and other times you're fully upgraded, 70/70 supply, and just juggling units until one side reaches the higher number.

To conclude: The game is aight. If you like Homeworld this could make you feel a bit at home with the gameplay, but if you're looking for a base builder akin to old CnC, this ain't it. I'd recommend getting this when it's on sale for around $10 or $15.

A solid 6.9/10. Grind and then forget... and then come back just to screw around lol.

column9:
>Positive (305)
>Negative (1,303)
What kind of animals left 1,303 negative reviews? The game supports co-op, which is not supported in the other games. They added autosave, which I personally have been waiting for in all the games. The story is so-so, of course, but it was crap in both Tiberium Wars and Kane's Wrath, so there's no point in criticizing it. The only thing that's unusual is the new mechanics, but they're not bad. They're just different.

I also didn't quite understand how GDI became GDI and why Kane was hanging out with the traffic cops.
[h1] I'll give this game 8 Kane out of 10, to spite the haters! [/h1]

column8:
Leider das schlechteste C&C das es gibt .

Bei C&C 3 konnte man schon sehen wohin es geht . Rush , nach 15 Minuten hat man entweder gewonnen oder verlohren . Man spielt gezielt auf eine Einheit , und davon möglichst viele hin . Keine Taktik , keine Strategie ist mehr gefragt , sondern nur mehr Geschwindigkeit . Und  zu allem kommt noch die Basis die keine mehr ist . Sie ist beweglich und ist eigendlich eine weiter Einheit im Spiel geworden . Schade !!!
C&C Generals , und noch mehr C&C Generals - Zero Hour sind bei weiten die besten Strategiespiele die EA je gemacht hat .
Leider brigt EA seit jahren nur noch Schrot und schlechte Abcash-Aufgüsse ehemals sehr guter Spiele
column9:
Unfortunately, the worst C&C there is.

In C&C 3, you could already see where it was headed. Rush, after 15 minutes you've either won or lost. You play specifically for one unit, and as many of them as possible. No tactics, no strategy is required anymore, just more speed. And on top of all that, there's the base, which isn't a base anymore. It's mobile and has essentially become another unit in the game. What a shame!!!
C&C Generals, and even more C&C Generals - Zero Hour are by far the best strategy games EA has ever made.
Unfortunately, for years now, EA has been producing nothing but junk and poor cash-in rehashes of formerly excellent games.

column8:
很想写不推荐和负评，但是，摸着自己的良心要给个中立，所以就只好写推荐了。

CNC4就如同HOMM4，如果你能接受英雄无敌4之于英雄无敌3、5的差距，也就可能可以接受CNC4之于CNC2、3甚至RA的差距。
CNC4确实做到了非常高度的平衡性和竞技性，以致于整个游戏几乎变成了dead game，几乎毫无娱乐性可言，但这确实是一个了不起的设想，把即时战略和策略糅合在一起，只不过就如同英雄无敌4一样，游戏在还有润色空间的情况下就发布了........
剧情，甚至都不如西木时代，好吧，其实只是和CNC3的断代过于显著了，Kane的人设变动以及塔西图斯的设定变动，让剧情变得不知所云，加上两大阵营最后几章的过场电影，scrin塔里白白的一片，和那个非常突兀的传送门............想想西木，想想CNC3.......

在我心目中EA确实毁了CNC系列，CNC4也是蛇尾之作，而且也不会再有CNC5，加上非常愚蠢和某碧有得一拼的高级土豆服务器，形同虚设极其愚蠢的指挥官经验值系统（这是个收集养成类卡牌游戏没错），以及愚蠢的让你想要删游戏的敌我AI差距，这确实是一部极其糟糕的CNC。
但是
但是
他给我们打开了一扇通往新的CNC世界的大门，只是，这扇门摇摇欲坠，也并不美观，于是，谁也不想再走过去了。

对，EA甚至都不想高清重置CNC1、2和RA1、2。

最后的最后，极其不推荐单买，哪怕是打折...........因为就算科学上网也解决不了EA账号的问题=- =

但是看到泰坦 看到乳齿象 看到长毛象 看到科迪亚克 看到cyborg 看到火焰坦克 诶 还是算了吧 毕竟以后再也看不到了~
column9:
I'm tempted to write a negative review and not recommend it, but I have to give it a neutral rating, so I'll just give it a recommendation.

CNC4 is like HOMM4. If you can accept the difference between Heroes of Might and Magic 4 and Heroes of Might and Magic 3 and 5, you can probably also accept the difference between CNC4 and CNC2, 3, and even Raid.
CNC4 truly achieves a very high level of balance and competitive play, to the point where the entire game is practically dead. The game is practically unentertaining, but it's a brilliant concept, blending real-time strategy and strategy. Just like Heroes of Might and Magic IV, it was released before it even had room for polish...

The plot isn't even as good as the Westwood era. Okay, really, it's just that the gap between it and Clash of Clans 3 is too significant. The changes to Kane's character and Tacitus's setting make the plot incoherent. Add to that the cinematic sequences in the final chapters between the two factions, the blank expanse of the Scrin Tower, and that utterly abrupt portal... Think Westwood, think Clash of Clans 3...

In my opinion, EA has truly ruined the Clash of Clans series. Clash of Clans 4 was a flop, and there won't be a Clash of Clans 5. Add to that the incredibly stupid, high-level potato servers that rival those of a certain Pixar, the ineffective and incredibly stupid Commander XP system (this is a collectible card game, yes), and the ridiculously disparate AI between the enemy and your friends that makes you want to quit the game, and this is truly a truly terrible Clash of Clans. But… but… He opened the door to a new world of CNC, albeit one that was shaky and unsightly, so no one wanted to go through it again.

Yes, EA doesn't even want to remaster CNC1 and 2 and RA1 and 2 in HD.

Finally, I strongly recommend against buying them individually, even on sale… because even a simple internet connection won't solve the EA account issue. =-=

But seeing the Titan, the Mastodon, the Mammoth, the Kodiak, the Cyborg, and the Flame Tank… well, forget it. After all, I'll never see them again.

column8:
This is a Command & Conquer game undeserving the name. Forget whatever gameplay you are used to from Command & Conquer, it has reduced to building units. No buildings, no tech tree, etc. Campaign cutscenes and story seems to be bad too. Actors do a pretty bad job. In addition you have to register an account and login each time before launching the game. If you do not have an internet connection you can not play and if you have a connection problem while playing the game annoys you with some warning that your progess may not be saved. Ah and I almost forgot: you can only have about 9 units at a time.

Don't buy this! No even for a reduced price of 2 $.

A decent game that killed an entire franchise.

>Campaign consists of seven missions for both GDI and Nod(GDI gets three extra missions for the tutorial levels)
>The story feels rushed
>There's an unnecessary grind to unlock all the units

GDI

>Unlikeable commanding officer. A sad attempt at making a sympathetic character.
>Whole campaign felt pointless(What was I fighting for!!!).
>Pulled the steel talons out of the recycle bin and gave them lazers.
>Shoved anti-armor cannon on top of APC and called it a tank.
>Deprived zone troopers of their Rail guns in order to mass produce them
>Mammoth tank is so afraid of lazers, that it hides behind other units to avoid them.
>Mammoth mk.II sucessor is even more afraid of them than it switched it's occupation from frontline to artillery.

NOD[The good guys?]

>Kane is nice to his tool
>You are said tool
>It is a proven fact that NOD is addicted to infighting
>The ascended love their sweet suits.
>Kane wasn't lying when he said the Tacitus told him of flying ships
>Cyborg Commado gets lazer, becomes legless, channels his inner Chameleon spy and can go full hijacker on a mammoth tank

Scrin[ABSENT]
>Tower is still invincible
>No tiberian Harvest, No invasion force.
>Foreman 371 died on his way back to Ichor Hub

CD keys are tied to Origin/EA accounts. Make an account on origin then use the CD key on that account, then log into this game, then you can play.

Did I mention there's no base building?

column8:
This game is utter crap. Beside the fact that you [b]must[/b] register with EA and that you [b]must[/b] be online each time you want to play, the whole gameplay and atmosphere has been destroyed by the responsible team lead and developers at EA side. I wouldn't recommend this game even for the 2,49 EUR it costs today at the time I'm writing this review... If you want to play RTS and you like C&C, go ahead with Kane's Wrath and you'll maybe much more happy with it.

C&C 4 Tiberian Twilight is a unworthy end of an epic series of games. EA has put a lot of effort to finally destroy this series and to maximize annoyance to fans of the series.

Just remember: You [b]must[/b] register at EA and you [b]must[/b] be online each time you want to play... EA know when you play, how long you play, how you play, your IP address and therefore usually your location, maybe details about your computer and - if you have provided real data - your name and a working email address. It is obvious that you pay with your data for a game that's not worth it... There is no offline mode. 

Even the gameplay is boring and has not too much to do with former C&C parts - it's just the rough story line and the mediocre graphics engine. 

[b]If you want to have a recommendation: Do not buy this game.[/b] It's utter crap. If you want to play C&C, buy Kanes Wrath. It's still not as good as older parts - but it's close enough and ensures some hours of fun.

column8: If you liked all the previous games in this series, then I think you will dislike this final installment. Everything you know about the game has changed... no more base building, no more resource gathering. You need to be fast to win this game. Oh, and you need to log in to play this damn game too. For me, I had to log in twice each time just to play. Pretty pointless. If you like playing with others, then it might be fun. But even still a bit confusing. It starts off slow, and kind of boring, then quickly becomes fast after 3 missions. Fast meaning, you need to move quickly in the battles so you don't lose. About the only things I liked about this game was the return of several units from previous games that were only in certain games. So that was cool. Other than that... not much good to say on my part. I am just one person though. So maybe there are several other reviews that are all positive.

column8:
Command & Conquer is the franchise everyone should recall. After this one I'm sure that anyone does.

I have played through all the previous ones... unfortunately also this one.

Command & Conquer had its unique feeling (something weird is going on, what is this Tiberium?). Red Alert continued with a different way but still it was almost at least intriguing. Maybe more with its own way.

To skip what happened after C&C, C&C Tiberian Sun etc. This game is simply horrific... it looks worse than the Tiberium Wars. The actual gameplay is again... horrific? There is a rock–paper–scissors system that is fucked up totally. The seven meter tall giants only tickle the infantry and the opposite. 

The unit restrictions are ridiculous, you can't do a shit with it. Missions are pretty much fatigue combats that never seem to end. The game also crashed a tons of times in online games. At this point I'm done with the shitty features because the are no good ones.

Summary & Rating

+ 

- Graphically weaker than its predecessor.
- Totally failed rock–paper–scissors system.
- Unit restrictions.
- Crashing online game.

🌗🌑🌑🌑🌑

column8:
Жаль что великая серия закончилась на таком полном говне...

Из плюсов разве что:

- Оборонительные башенки и некоторые постройки смотрятся достаточно красиво

- Ну и ввиду применения движка с Red Alert 3 масовки стали выглядеть чуть более красочно чем в 3 части

- Заставочки вроде все так же хороши как и в предыдущей игре

- Не плохо сделаны карты в какой-то степени (на мой взгляд), хотя они и создают ощущение "скованности"
 
  На этом пожалуй плюсы заканчиваются...

Из минусов:

- Отсутствие базы как таковой, приходтся ходить альтернативной версией АТ-АТ и "рожать" себе юнитов, которые кстати впервые за все время ограничены...

- Новый движок с Red Alert 3, движок не спорю не плох, НО ОН НЕЛОХ ДЛЯ RED ALERT ИСТОРИИ, А НЕ ДЛЯ ТИБЕРИЯ, ввиду этого после 3 части кажется что зашел в какой-то жалкий плагиат на замечательную серию...

- Возможно я сейчас жутко предираюсь, НО в развед информации в прошлой игре говорилось что ГСБ ПОЧТИ ПОЛНОСТЬЮ ОТКАЗАЛАСЬ ОТ ШАГАЮЩЕЙ ТЕХНИКИ ПОСЛЕ ВТОРОЙ ВОЙНЫ ЗА ТЕБЕРИЙ, не считая джагернаута, а что тут??? ШАГАЮЩАЯ ТЕХНИКА ВЕЗДЕ НАХЕР, как по мне это довольно нелепо...

- Ретекстурирование танка "Скорпион".... я когда впервые его увидел меня почти сразу же вывернуло, настолько мне показалось это высером... так же как и ретекстурирование танка "Призрак"... 

- ХМ...ЧТО ЭТО? СЕРИЯ ИГР ЗАВЯЗАННАЯ НА ДОБЫЧЕ ТИБЕРИЯ?? А ДАВАЙТЕ УБЕРЕМ ВОЗМОЖНОСТЬ ЕГО ДОБЫВАТЬ, ВОТ ВЕСЕЛО БУДЕТ И ОСТАВЛЯТЬ БУДЕМ ПО НЕСКОЛЬКО КУСОЧКОВ НА УРОВЕНЬ, ДА И ПОХЕР ЧТО ОН ПОЧТИ ПОЛНОСТЬЮ ЗАРАЗИЛ И ОТРАВИЛ ЗЕМЛЮ И РАСТЕТ ВЕЗДЕ И ПРОИЗВОДИТ ТОКСИНЫ ОБРАЩАЮЩИЕ ЛЮДЕЙ В МУТАНТОВ...ХМ...МУТАНТЫ?....НЕ, НАХЕР И ИХ ОТСЮДА....ТАК ШО ТУТ ИНТЕРФЕЙС ПРИЯТНЫЙ БЫЛ В ПРЕДЫДУЩЕЙ ЧАСТИ ГОВОРИТЕ, ХОРОШО, МЫ ЕГО ДОПИЛИМ...ТАК ЭТО НАХЕР...ЭТО ТОЖЕ...А? ЧЕ? ПЛАНЕТА? А В ЖОПУ ПЛАНЕТУ ОСТАВЬТЕ ПРОСТО КНОПКИ НА СИНЕМ ФОНЕ, ВОТ ЗАЕБИСЬ ШЕДЕВР.... А? ЧТО ЭТО? СРАЖЕНИЯ ДА? ХМ... ПРИКОЛЬНО...А НАХЕР ИХ ОТСЮДА...

А по итогу могу сказать - вы можете купить этот шлак по скидочке если вы все таки хотите узнать что там осталось от легендарной серии игр...ИБО ЕА ПРОСТО СДЕЛАЛА ЭТУ ХЕРНЮ СПЛАВИВ ГОВНО С КАРТОНОМ СИДЯ В ТУАЛЕТЕ И ИСПОЛЬЗУЯ КЛОЧОК ТУАЛЕТНОЙ БУМАГИ ДЛЯ НАПИСАНИЯ ПЛАНА РАЗРАБОТКИ....
column9:
It's a shame that such a great series ended on such a complete and utter crap...

On the plus side:

- The defensive turrets and some buildings look quite nice.

- And thanks to the use of the engine from Red Alert 3, the crowd scenes now look a little more colorful than in Part 3.

- The cutscenes seem to be just as good as in the previous game.

- The maps are not badly designed, to some extent (in my opinion), although they do create a feeling of "constraint."

That's where the pluses end, I think...

On the minuses:

- The lack of a base as such, you have to use an alternative version of the AT-AT and "give birth" to your own units, which, by the way, are limited for the first time ever...

- The new engine from Red Alert 3, I admit, is not bad, BUT IT'S NOT GOOD FOR THE RED ALERT STORY, NOT FOR TIBERIUS. Because of this, after Part 3, it feels like a pathetic rip-off of a wonderful game. series...

- Maybe I'm being terribly picky right now, BUT the intelligence in the last game said that GDI ALMOST COMPLETELY ABOLISHED WALKING VEHICLES AFTER THE SECOND TIBERIUM WAR, not counting the Juggernaut, so what's going on here??? WALKING VEHICLES EVERYWHERE, that's pretty ridiculous to me...

- The retexturing of the Scorpion tank... when I first saw it, I was almost immediately disgusted, it seemed so bullshit to me... just like the retexturing of the Ghost tank...

- HM... WHAT IS THIS? A GAME SERIES ABOUT TIBERIUM MINING?? LET'S REMOVE THE POSSIBILITY OF MINING IT, IT WILL BE FUN AND WE'LL LEAVE A FEW PIECES PER LEVEL, AND I DON'T CARE THAT IT HAS ALMOST COMPLETELY INFECTED AND POISONED THE EARTH AND IS GROWING EVERYWHERE AND PRODUCING TOXINS THAT TURN PEOPLE INTO MUTANTS... HM... MUTANTS?... NO, FUCK GET THEM OUT OF HERE TOO... SO THE INTERFACE HERE WAS NICE IN THE PREVIOUS PART, SAY, OKAY, WE'LL FINISH IT... SO FUCK THAT... THIS TOO... HUH? WHAT? PLANET? AND FUCK THE PLANET, JUST LEAVE THE BUTTONS ON A BLUE BACKGROUND, THAT'S A FUCKING MASTERPIECE... HUH? WHAT'S THAT? BATTLES, RIGHT? Hmm... COOL... WHY THE FUCK DO WE GET THEM OUT OF HERE...

And in the end, I can say – you can buy this garbage at a discount if you still want to see what's left of the legendary game series... BECAUSE EA JUST MADE THIS SHIT BY MIXING SHIT WITH CARDBOARD WHILE SITTING ON THE TOILET AND USING A SCRAP OF TOILET PAPER TO WRITE A DEVELOPMENT PLAN...

column8: I bough this game a long long time ago, around when it was new I think, and being a big fan of C&C I was very excited for it, so I bought the game. Recently I decided to reinstall the game, give it a try, maybe see it in a new light now that I'm older, but to my suprise, the game decided to kick me right in the balls, it was asking for a CD key even though I've already activated it a long time ago, so my CD key is already used, so I literally can't play a game I bought even if I wanted to or not which made me really really angry and hate this game even more.

column8:
TL;DR - EA tried to administer unnecessary CPR but used Fart Gas instead of air, and killed the game and series horrifically.

I have been and I still am an avid C&C fan from the very begining. Unfortunately, I can say with absolute certainty that to me this game is as follows: 
"The most horrifyingly, rage coma inducing, 3 week old, mouldy, explosive diarrhea covered, mental and physical 'porrige-made-with-off-milk' projectile vomit inducing, nigh aneurism causing, puss-leaking tumourous growth, in the worlds worst medical waste facility, then mutated and mutilated, into something too nightmarish to even form thoughts and words for, at the sadistic and masochistic hands of EA" 
That I've ever seen and shudder to say 'played' in my entire life to date. (Review written on 2/12/2017, after returning to a C&C binge due to crap games of late)

I feel so sorry for the outstanding actors and actresses, the voice tallents and the graphics devs that put so much work into it, only to be let down by EA's pathetic attempt to "Breathe New Life" into an already outstanding game series, that  DID NOT NEED AN OVERHAUL! It was perfect with C&C 3 and RA3. WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT TO A LEGENDARY SERIES?!

I feel that I speak for most, if not all of the Command & Conquer community when I say: I DEMAND A COMPLETELY REBUILT C&C 4 WITH COMPLETE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT IN IT'S DEVELOPEMENT!!!

Or at the very least, make the game open to re-developement by the community.

EDIT: I want a refund.

column8:
This game doesn't come close to the previous Command&Conquer games. From the gameplay it is unrecognizable. I played most of the previous titles and this plays like some other franchise. I like playing the singleplayer campaing of most games in one sitting, with this game I wont even finish it after the first couple missions, it's not fun to play.

My main problem with the game is that there are no resources to gather so you pretty much just spam units until you reach the unit limit which is pretty fast and try to kill the enemy in a human wave like attack. For me choosing a Defensive, Offensive, etc starting HQ is redundant in a singleplayer game.
