column8:
Démonstration de la mise à mort instantanée d'une série mythique... Kane n'est pas mort mais démenbré (au niveau du gameplay) et courrir sans jambes (scénario campagne solo) ni bras (pas de macro, construction de base, moissanage, ...) ce ne pouvait pas bien finir...
Si vous souhaitez jouer à un C&C, prenez n'importe lequel mais surtout pas celui-ci!  (même dune 2 l'ancêtre est mieux!)
column9:
A demonstration of the instant kill from a legendary series... Kane isn't dead, but dismembered (gameplay-wise), and running around without legs (single-player campaign scenario) or arms (no macros, base building, harvesting, etc.) couldn't end well...
If you want to play a C&C, pick any game, but definitely not this one! (Even Dune 2, the ancestor, is better!)

column8:
I couldn't force myself to play this game further as a couple of missions, that's how bad this game is. Don't buy this, it's not worth your wallet and your time!!! Watch the ending sequence on YouTube instead!

- Can't play offline, because EA 
- The game menu looks like sh.it, that's where I first realised how bad it will be.
- Cartoony / bad graphics
- Cartoony units (how should I command my army if they don't even look serious?)
- Horrible combat system (army capacity limits)
- No base building (MCV and couple of turrets, seriously?)
- No refineries / recources (just produce your units for free, generate them out of the oxygen I guess)
- Capture and hold your points on the map to win (Why put it in a C&C game, EA?)
- Missions that don't make sence
- The story is very poorly represented
- In comparison to "Joseph David Kucan" (Kane) all the other characters look just pathetic. Too unprofessional, too young, too ug.ly. 
- The ending sequence is poorly represented.
- The main character (you) dies (Nod) Ending, who gives a sh.it?

竞技系统不错，可惜他叫命令与征服，别他妈整天说王八竞技场的差，看看他的好行不行，至少现在还没有关服，如果出个完全平衡模式就好了，等级取平均等级就完美了，还有画质就比cnc3好一点点，还不如隔壁红警3，兵种经常挤在一起，后排不火很蛋疼，导航系统相当的差，毕竟人家刚开始不是打算做成命令与征服4的，可惜EA太急了，逼死了这个系列。为命令与征服默哀三秒钟
——————————————————————————————————————————
好评太多了刻意改个差评，这可是steam垫底的前五名
column9:
The competitive system is good, but it's a shame it's called Command & Conquer. Stop blaming Turtle Arena all the time and see if this one is any better. At least it hasn't shut down yet. A fully balanced mode would be great, with an average level. The graphics are only slightly better than CNC3, but worse than Red Alert 3. Units are often crammed together, and it's a pain in the ass if the back row doesn't fire. The navigation system is terrible. They didn't intend to make a Command & Conquer 4, after all. It's a shame EA was too impatient and killed the series. A three-second silence for Command & Conquer.
——————————————————————————————————————————
There are so many good reviews, so I intentionally changed this review to a bad one. This is one of the bottom five on Steam.

column8:
整体感觉6.5分：制作精良的实时过场动画，简便的聊天系统。游戏情节有些匆忙，战役模式比较令人失望。解锁系统在某些方面限制了游戏的表现。

　　画面表现8.5分：平滑又独具特色的画面融合了大量的华丽特效和酷炫的单位动画。

　　声效表现8.5分：强大的管弦乐队演绎出了高质量的音效。

　　上手体验7.5分：得分系统和可移动的基地是个有趣的变化，但是似乎并不是进步，而是原地打转。

　　耐玩性7.0分：加入5V5在线游戏确实能让你忙活一阵，如果你想解锁GDI和Nod的全部单位的话，那更是有的玩了。

　　总评：7.4分

　　整体评价：

　　看到开发组和发行商冒着危险继续推出已经多少有些过时的游戏题材，这样的感觉还不错。《命令与征服》传统的游戏机制相信大家已经非常熟悉了。如果他们继续，就必须要做出一些改变。EA洛杉矶这次并没有仅仅对画面和其他内容进行精加工，而是彻底重写了游戏的规则，让大家体会到了颠覆性的感觉。《命令与征服4》据称是泰伯利亚题材的最后一部。在游戏中你将体验到节奏飞快的基于不同兵种的实时策略战斗。  基地是可移动的，而Tiberium矿产也消失了，而获得分数是你的主要目标。游戏节奏飞快，十分混乱，因此说在线团队游戏一定非常有趣。可惜，游戏的战役模式设置不合理，想法不错但是又根本没有必要的解锁系统限制了游戏的整体表现。

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

　　众媒体点评：

　　gamingxp：87/100，优异

　　“作为一款历史悠久的知名系列的完结作，《命令与征服4》的表现恰如其分，一个老故事传奇般的结束以及注入大量新鲜的元素……最让我感到印象深刻的是，游戏营造的战场氛围，这方面表现极其成功，这得益于高质量的视频效果以及一个令人深思的故事安排，这让玩家有很强的代入感，并且能立刻沉浸在战场上。玩家可以看到破败或壮观的城市，包含大量细节的，代表市民文化的东西，比如广告牌，电线杆或者汽车，当然，这些事物对游戏本身并没有直接的影响，但长久以来，正是这种良好的氛围才塑造了命令与征服今日的地位。”


　　gamepro：80/100，不错

　　“排除了恼人的DRM签名管理问题，命令与征服4的游戏体验无疑是令人愉快的，当然，铁杆玩家或许不能接受爬行者以及不能采矿的改变，但是想法开放的玩家应该给游戏一个机会，开发者试图为游戏开辟一个崭新的发展方向，而这一劳动成果显然值得我们去体验！”

　　“总的来说，爬行者系统运转良好，多人游戏表现稳定，持续性的升级和解锁设置，很容易让玩家沉迷于此，此外，游戏的故事，显然可以让老玩家感到满意……当然，游戏的缺点也清晰可见，需要时刻接入互联网，并且一些地图上，会出现一些导致不平衡现象的发生。”


　　pcgamer：73/100

　　“公平的说，如果这款游戏的名字中没有包含“4”，那一定会是一个皆大欢喜的结果，因为玩家总是对所谓的终结之作抱有极高的期待，而这款游戏的表现显然达不到这种程度。我们认为游戏中的很多探索，设计初衷应该是一款网络游戏……不过考虑到这款游戏即便是单人任务，都需要接入EA的服务器，我们希望玩家谨慎对待，不要忘记发售还不到两年的雇佣兵2，刚刚被EA停服，我们不能够买一款心仪的产品，还要担心网络服务是否能持续很久。没错，游戏的多人部分非常出彩，但是我们头顶上悬着的达摩克利斯之剑也令人担忧！”
column9:
Overall Rating: 6.5: Well-made real-time cutscenes, simple chat system. The plot feels a bit rushed, and the campaign mode is disappointing. The unlock system limits the game's performance in some areas.

Graphics: 8.5: Smooth and distinctive graphics are complemented by a wealth of gorgeous special effects and cool unit animations.

Sound: 8.5: The powerful orchestra delivers high-quality sound effects.

Playability: 7.5: The scoring system and movable bases are interesting changes, but they feel more like going in circles than progress.

Playability: 7.0: The addition of 5v5 online play does keep you busy for a while, and unlocking all the units of GDI and Nod is even more rewarding.

Overall Rating: 7.4

Overall Review:

It's nice to see the developer and publisher taking the risk of continuing to release a game genre that's become somewhat outdated. The traditional Command & Conquer gameplay is familiar to everyone. If they continue, they'll have to make some changes. EA Los Angeles didn't just polish the graphics and other elements this time; they completely rewrote the rules of the game, delivering a truly groundbreaking experience. Command & Conquer 4 is purportedly the final installment in the Tiberium series. It features fast-paced, real-time strategy combat with different classes. Bases are mobile, Tiberium deposits are gone, and scoring is your primary goal. The game's fast-paced and chaotic pace promises to be incredibly engaging in online team play. Unfortunately, the campaign mode is poorly designed, with a well-thought-out but unnecessary unlock system that limits the overall performance.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Media Reviews:

GamingXP: 87/100, Excellent

"As the finale of a long-standing and renowned series, Command & Conquer 4 delivers a fittingly stellar performance, delivering a legendary conclusion to an old story while injecting a wealth of fresh elements... What impressed me most was the game's ability to create a truly atmospheric battlefield. This aspect is incredibly successful, thanks to high-quality visuals and a thoughtful storyline, which creates a strong sense of immersion and allows players to instantly immerse themselves in the battlefield. Players can see cities, both dilapidated and magnificent, with richly detailed representations of civic culture, like billboards, telephone poles, and cars. While these elements don't directly impact the game itself, it's this atmosphere that has long shaped Command & Conquer's standing."

GamePro: 80/100, Good

"Aside from the annoying DRM signature management issues, Command & Conquer 4 is an undeniably enjoyable gaming experience. Of course, hardcore gamers might not be thrilled with the changes to creepers and the inability to mine. But open-minded players should give the game a chance. The developers are trying to forge a new direction for the game, and the fruits of their labor are clearly worth experiencing!"

"Overall, the crawler system works well, the multiplayer performance is stable, and the continuous upgrades and unlocks make it easy to get addicted. Moreover, the game's story will clearly satisfy veteran players... Of course, the game's shortcomings are also obvious. It requires a constant internet connection, and some maps have some unbalanced effects."

pcgamer: 73/100

"To be fair, if this game didn't have the "" in its name, it would be... Including "4" would have been a happy ending, as players always have extremely high expectations for so-called final games, and this game clearly doesn't live up to that standard. We believe that many of the explorations in the game were originally designed as an online game... However, considering that even single-player missions require access to EA's servers, we urge players to proceed with caution. Remember, Mercenaries 2, which was released less than two years ago and was recently shut down by EA, can't just buy a product we love and worry about the long-term sustainability of the network service. Yes, the multiplayer aspects of the game are excellent, but the Sword of Damocles hanging over our heads is also worrying!

Please don't buy this. Don't even download it illegally. Say no kids.


Edit- 
imacatusee most reviews are personal opinion. And you are correct I did not go into any detail with mechanics etc. But I played this game a long time ago. Like 6+ years ago. I was maybe 24 years old at most. I did not play the game long. After I found out how bad it was I stopped playing right away. I then went and read various reviews like I should have before buying the game! I learnt that I was right to stop playing as the game only gets worse not better! column8:
I am a huge fan of the Command & Conquer series. CnC Generals is still regarded as one of my favorite games of all time. This game, however, is nothing like the other CnC games. At least while I played it. There was no base building, just pick your MRV or whatever and pop out units like a chicken on crack. Then, if you start losing and it dies, no worries, another will respawn down for you. 

Command & Conquer was always a base building, army building, thrash your enemies kind of game in each iteration that I've played. This is not like that at all.  It would have been better to just call it something else. On top of that, you have the always online, which made it so I couldn't even play it on my laptop till I hit WiFi spots while traveling. If I hadn't already went over the refund hours on it, I would have refunded it long ago.

column8:
Nem szoktam szentírásnak venni a játékosok értékeléseit, be kell látnom, teljesen jogos a csalódottság, és a felháborodás.

A C&C 4 nem olyan játék, mint amit megszokhattak a játékosok az előző részeknél. Itt nincs begyűjtés, jelentősebb építkezés sem, csupán elfoglalható létesítméynek. Mindennek ellenére nem lenne olyan rossz a játék, ha a küldetéseket lehetne egyjátékos módban játszani. Sajnos mint utóbb kiderült, a negyedik küldetés lehetetlen egyjátékos módban, mivel akkora az ellenség túlereje, hogy egyedül induló játékost lenyomja a gép mint a csikket. "Solo" lehetőség félrevezetés! Limit van minden játékosnál, ami 50-es. Akkor lenne esély a győzelemre, ha ez nem lenne. Limittel pedig képtelenség elég egységet vezényelni az óriás hajó elpusztítására. (NOD)
GDI kampányt ki sem próbáltam, gyanítom ott is csak az első 2-3 küldetés játszható egyjátékosban, azután a túlerő megekasztja a sztorit. nagyon valószínű, hogy a kampány előrehaladtával a párban induló játékosok összhadereje is kevés lenne, mivel alapból három féle bázis választható ki: Védekezés, támadás, támogatás. Egyik sem alkalmas a küldetések megoldására emberhiányban. Öszintén szólva biztos voltam benne, hogy mivel solo kületés módban vagyok, leskálázódik az ellenséges haderő, de nem. Nem segít az alacsonyabb nehézségi szint választása sem. El kell fogadni, hogy ez egy kizárólag többjátékos kaland.

A zene fasza mint mindíg, de ez nem nyújt vígaszt.
Kár érte, talán ha lesz valamikor C&C 5, az majd nem lesz ekkora baklövés.

The game is great. Yea sure there are limits to unit caps and such. Sure theres a limit to everything you do. So what? It makes the game more interesting! Leveling up to use better units/upgrades/powers is an awesome feature. Why have everything given to you at the start? You should earn your ranks before you can operate more powerful units and upgrades. Think of CoD MW Series Multiplayer, you level up in ranks to earn better gear, this is basicly the same thing but for units and upgrades. If you don't play, you wont earn anything. I say give this a chance, complete story mode, and atleast play a few AI/Player matches before you decide to rate this game anyworse than people have already made it. I give the game 10/10 its awesome, great graphics, movie-like cutscreens, leveling system, capture points OR deathmatch gamemodes, etc. I would recommend this game to my friends, just so we can play together. Have fun on the game, thx for reading!

column8: 作为命令与征服的狂热玩家，我觉得这个游戏的对战方式更不错。难道我们就喜欢一味的建造么，这游戏体验的是部队之间的战斗，而不是以前那样造来造去的。我身边的朋友大多不喜欢命令与征服玩这款游戏就是因为它需要建造。而命令与征服4只需要一个mcv就可以了。虽然这款游戏已经被抛弃了，但我觉得命令与征服系列还是最出色的！
column9: As a Command & Conquer avid player, I think this game's combat is superior. Do we just enjoy building? This game is about unit-on-unit combat, not the usual building-and-building. Most of my friends disliked Command & Conquer and played it simply because it required building. Command & Conquer 4, on the other hand, only requires an MCV. Even though this game has been abandoned, I still think the Command & Conquer series is still the best!

column8:
So Id like to go on a extreamly long rant on how they ruined this great series but ill just give you the simple facts. There are three major reasons why this game is an awful buy, I believe it was a waste of money due to how horrible the three things are.
1) the RTS from the original games allowed for full unit usage. What I mean is you where not limited to what you could play with depending on the structure you choose durring a deploy phase. Yep you are limited in your units as to which of three main stuctures you choose. While this was a great idea you can only deploy one crawler at a time where enmies in the main story can deploy more. This makes the game play fustratingly difficult.
2) The severly limited pop cap, Ok population caps are important but in the game the pop cap is 50.... units beyond basic crap units are 6 or higher. This is awlful considering how limited and how long it takes to produce said units. In pvp this can be a fustrating experance. In story mode it is even more so due to the fact each crawler of an opponate has its own cap of 50.
3) You do not build.... Ok bar the previous two issues this is my main problem with this game command and conquer is a paced building war machine... this means you start a map with little and you slowly conquer it with a play style that suits your personal abilities. In this game pushing with a large force not happening you cant build multiple development buldings. Want to tower it up? fuck no if your not in the defence crawler, oh and btw these towers blow ass. No i mean seriously they take shit loads of damage from units and do little to no damage to units that they dont directly counter.
Please if you plan to buy this... crap that came out of some programers ass reconsider you will most likely end up regreting the purchuse as i have.

column8:
Всегда что-то новое воприниматеся скиптически, я стараюсь положительно относится к новинкам. Но не в этом случае, я играл в эту игру ранее, в этот раз она была в сборнике который я купил, установил и вспомнил что это конец этой замечательной серии Тибериума. Причем лучше уйти на пике популярности. А тут мало того что ушли, так еще и растоптали последней частью всю линейку. 
Ужасная часть. EA, как обычно, умудрилась все испортить поменяв всю механику игры, ведь для меня механика серии Command & Conquer была самой лучшей из всех стратегий начиная с Generals! 
Обидно... обидно, когда такую историю загубили жаждой денег!
column9:
I always approach new releases with a grain of salt; I try to be positive about new releases. But not in this case. I'd played this game before, and this time it was in a collection that I bought, installed, and then remembered it was the end of this wonderful Tiberium series. It's better to quit at the peak of popularity. But not only did they quit, but they also trampled the entire line with the latest installment.
Terrible. EA, as usual, managed to ruin everything by changing the entire game mechanics, because for me, the mechanics of the Command & Conquer series were the best of all strategy games since Generals!
It's a shame... it's a shame when such a story was ruined by money-grubbing!

column8:
Wow! Here we go; this crappy game review. You know, I went into this game knowing it was terrible beyond belief, but nothing would've predicted this monstrosity! Well, matter as well start off with the positives if there were any:

Pros:
-Kane
-New Tactics
-Kane
-Forgiving game with mistakes
-Uninstallation button
-Did I mention Kane?

Truth be told, there isn't a lot of good things about this game! I played it for as long as I could before I just told myself no! I can't play this anymore! My goal was to play it to see what happened at the end of the game, and for $5, it seems reasonable to waste your money on something so cheap. However, even going into this game KNOWING it's trash, I still couldn't finish it! It was that bad! If you're curious about the ending, just look up the campaign cutscenes through YouTube or something. Do yourself a favor and keep that $5. 

But for the few positive things I did say about it, it is true that Kane (Joseph Kucan) is the only set in stone thing that's worth the buy here. The man's entire life is based on this gaming franchise, and every CaC fan should pay respect to this man's future in this game considering it went downhill for CaC after this game's release. The game also offers new tactics with the Crawler unit that you have to protect now. 

So instead of base building (you know, the thing that made the Command and Conquer gaming franchise famous), you now have this Crawler, and the missions are now turned to escort missions rather than destroying your enemy base! But nevertheless, if you lose a Crawler in battle, do not fret! You get to respawn a new Crawler in a designated area that the AI doesn't know about and you don't have to start over the mission! Yay! All the Crawler does is turn itself into a construction yard and build units to defend it, that's all! No buildings, no Tiberium, no fun! All the player could do with the Crawler is choose between 3 classes, Offence, Defense, and Support. And even though the tutorial gives you all the classes special abilities and whatnot, you have to earn experience points to unlock the simplest abilities! So you're forced to go back and play the same damn missions again and again! 

Ugh! If you look up the interview the developers had once the CaC4 was released, they talked about how RTS games are getting tedious, and how they thought this new change would help it. The problem there is that you don't simply change the entire gameplay that the franchise was founded on. Other games like the Red Alert trilogy, CaC3, CaC General Zero Hour, CaC Tiberium Sun and many others continued to show off the wonderful RTS experience that CaC4 completely killed! You can't do that under the CaC name, you just can't. EA forever killed this franchise, so have fun with their last game if you're still very interested in it. But for the market value of $20, don't even think of purchasing it! It's not worth it! 

If you want to know the negatives, here you go:
Cons:
-Tedious gameplay
-Boring campaign
-Multiplayer servers are down
-Useless units
-No Tiberium collection
-Always have to sign into EA when you start up the game
-No base building
-Last CaC game ever
-Crawler unit
-Cap amount on units made
-Experience system for the simplest abilities
-Acting was mediocre
-Killed CaC franchise
-Too expensive at retail price
-No other known actors
-No cool looking costumes
-Graphics are meh
-Having to review such a good franchise dead
-No one likes the game
-No one will play with you
-Screw you developers, you suck
-Don't
-Buy
-This
-Game
-It
-Sucks
-Balls
-And
-Ass!

column8: I have a mixed feeling, mostly game has +, like Joseph Kucan, who is in my opinion Iconic face of Tiberian series. New mechanic makes you to use more tactic, more thinking, but some old units have been changed, or reworked (Avatar, Buggy, etc.). Gameplay is more forgiving when you lose units, since you dont need tiberium to spawn them, but game can sometimes be cruel if you make solid mistake, costing even in Crawler. It's only one C&C I played when I had to save often.

column8:
我十分喜爱RTS，包括CNC4，尽管它令我十分失望
  CNC4的名字取得好，泰伯利亚的黄昏，也是这个系列的黄昏。
  我并不是一个铁杆的CNC粉，我最早接触的RTS是星际，所以反而CNC4的有上限游戏模式是我比较能接受的。但是不得不说CNC4的缺陷太大了，红警3是复制西木的产物，而泰伯利亚的黄昏则是不想复制西木的产物，比起以前的CNC系列甚至是RTS，CNC4几乎成了四不像，甚至连采集资源都没有。对一个长期扎根于帝国时代和星际里面的玩家来说，这是无法接受的地方，一切就只凸显在队伍安排与微操（换弹夹）上面，游戏性非常差。剧情也有很大的缺陷，接不上三代的剧情。所以说，CNC4只是西木过后EA洛杉矶对RTS一次笨拙的尝试。
  我希望EA吸取教训，在CNC5里面（希望会出）走上一条大部分玩家都喜欢的道路，勉勉强强给个好评
column9:
I absolutely love RTS games, including Clash of Clans 4, though it left me deeply disappointed.

Clash of Clans 4's name is well-placed: Tiberian Twilight, the twilight of the series itself.

I'm not a die-hard Clash of Clans fan. My first RTS was StarCraft, so Clash of Clans 4's capped game mode is more palatable to me. However, I have to admit that Clash of Clans 4 is deeply flawed. Red Alert 3 was a Westwood clone, while Tiberian Twilight was an attempt to avoid copying Westwood. Compared to previous Clash of Clans series, and even RTS games, Clash of Clans 4 is a complete mess. It doesn't even offer resource gathering. For a longtime player steeped in Age of Empires and StarCraft, this is unacceptable. Everything revolves around team composition and micromanagement (reloading magazines), resulting in a very poor gameplay experience. The storyline is also deeply flawed, failing to connect with the narrative of the three previous games. So, Clash of Clans 4 is just a clumsy attempt by EA Los Angeles at an RTS after Westwood.

I hope EA learns from this and takes a path that most players will enjoy with Clash of Clans 5 (which I hope will come out). I can barely give it a positive review.

column8:
The final entry in a series that had gone downhill over half a decade. This title will ever be remembered as the entry in the series that completely killed the series.

A total revamp of the CnC formula, seemingly in an attempt to "modernize" the series. However despite massive backlash and concerns pre-release EA went ahead and released the game anyway. And the rest is history.

column8: что ж....я прошёл много стратегий,поэтому сильно уж не огорчился от изменений(быстро адаптировался) в геймплее C&C4.Жаль,что нельзя стало базу строить,создавать огромную армию,от которой FPS страшно проседало.Однако,если раньше можно было собрать орду и долбать по базе врага пока то просто не исчерпает запас "прочности",то в этой игре приходится думать,ибо класически затоптать врага количеством уже нельзя.Здесь просто нужно уметь играть.Игра мне понравилась,но я всё же фанат 3-ей части игры.Вообщем,играть можно,одобряю....7 из 10
column9: Well... I've played a lot of strategy games, so I wasn't too upset by the changes (I adapted quickly) to the gameplay in C&C4. It's a shame you can't build a base or create a huge army, which drastically lowered the FPS. However, while before you could gather a horde and pound the enemy base until it simply ran out of "durability," in this game you have to think, because you can't just overwhelm the enemy with numbers. You just need to know how to play. I liked the game, but I'm still a fan of the third game. Overall, it's playable, I approve.... 7 out of 10

EA, be ashamed of yourselves for still charging for this!!!

column8:
This game isn't even an RTS, it's a squad moba where your "heroes" shit out creeps that you can control. They tried to copy dawn of war 2 but failed in an epic way. This isn't new for Electronic Arts, it seems the format for this company is to pump out a hot piece of crap within 3 months then charge people 80 dollars for it.

This game single handedly killed the franchise, which was weakening after Red Alert 3. EA got almost everything right with Tiberian sun and Generals, but who ever took over the leadership after that is obviously a junky or a retard of some sort.

Pros:
-It's cheap
-multiplayer still works
-story

Cons:
-No base building
-Still using the extremely dated generals engine
-Not balanced at all
-Population is extremely small
-Killed the franchise

It would be different if EA revisted the series and corrected all their mistakes, but instead they doubled down and made a free to play browser game that does not resemble the series at all, which was called Tiberian/Tiberium Alliances.

If you are reading this, don't bother buying this hunk of shit. Visit cnc online and just download the older games, patch them with the cnc online patch and you will be able to play multiplayer again. And for the love of god stop giving EA money.

column8:
I'm very glad that I bought the C&C Bundle because of Red Alert 3 and Tiberium Wars but most definately not because of Tiberian Twilight. I'm astonished EA published this. I have no idea what is going on with this game. The menus are barely there. There are few options when you start a (pseudo-)"skirmish" and with most of those I can't imagine what they do most of the time. The crucial option in a FACTION-based RTS is being able to change said faction but I couldn't figure out how to do that. On top of that it's predecessors look amazing...this does not.

Not to mention the gameplay. To be fair I did not look into the campaign (and I probably won't in the near future) but when I go into a skirmish in an RTS and I can't figure out what's going on in front of me then I don't want to play that game anymore. C&C is not about spawning some random units and then pillow-fighting over some random control-node but thats how it feels here.

In conclusion: Save yourself the time and money and don't buy this. I would't have bought it myself but I was gonna buy C&C 3 and Red Alert 3 (on sale at the moment I bought the bundle) anyway and in the "Command & Conquer Pack" bundle basically got Tiberian Twilight "for free".

column9: This game truly deserves all the bad reviews. If you're disconnected while playing single-player, your save is automatically saved, but your game doesn't count. If you don't log back in, your game is effectively wasted. This is a crappy game that's forced to make a single-player game into an online one, and it can only be played by one person.

column8:
Foreward: Time listed played for this title does not reflect full play-time w/ game, have completed both campaigns.

Its painful to even be on this storepage writing this review. I can honestly feel a tiny twinge of a headache coming on so i'll get to my points.

Command & Conquer, as a series, is one of the grandfathers of all modern base-building RTS games up there with Warcraft as well. While the series saw a few minor adjustments to the lore here 'n there it was always a very solid setting whose factions i'll cover briefly:

The Brotherhood of Nod is/was a paramilitary organization with ties to just about every major country that isn't afflicted w/ Tiberium or the first world "Blue zones". It's ranks are comprised not JUST of hundreds of millions of loyal militia but also extremely well-trained and well organized black ops infiltrators and die-hard fantical soldiers. Lead by "Kane", while it was never openly announced, it was highly alluded to that he was in fact the mythical brother of Abel from the bible, thus meaning he has existed since almost the literal dawn of time. While Kane was always viewed as EXTREMELY charismatic, he was also astoundingly cunning and a survivor above all, surviving not one but 2 seperate attacks from WMD-scale orbital weapons platforms despite being at the ground-zero of both attacks.

In C&C 4 this appears to have all been retconned and it now alludes that Kane is an alien seeking to go home.

The Global Defense Initiative (or GDI) is effectively the UN/NATO and every other western first-world 3 or 4 letter organization all smashed into one giant organization. GDI are essentially "The good guys", the Free world all gathered together to try and stomp out The Brotherhood of Nod and stop Tiberium from spreading across the globe, the highly toxic green crystal has turned much of the planet into an uninhabitable hellscape labled "Red Zones" and semi-infested zones (Yellow zones) both of which Nod operates out of predominantly.

Now, as mentioned previously, base-building was extremely important in previous games because your resources were rarely directly inside your base and could deplete rapidly, creating a NEED to control the map's terrain to move to new fields while the expended ones slooooowly regenerated. There was also the matter that air units had to return to the structure that created them to resupply, even the very use of your minimap was a feature given by one of your buildings.

Here, thats no longer the case, base building has been entirely removed and replaced with different 'styles' of command structure, restricting access to what units you can produce. It takes away a huge aspect of the game for the sake of trying to make the game more 'user friendly' but instead only takes away from the experience.

On top of this, C&C 4 was the ending to the story of Kane as far as we were told, it is the conclusion......and it's endings answers precisely zero plot questions despite more and more cropping up as the series progressed. Theres also the matter that the game tries to shoe-horn in a Co-Op experience, something none of the previous games did and while good on paper, it fails to make up for the rest of the game's failures.

In short, C&C 4 neutered a major part of what made the earlier games unique, failed to deliver any note-worthy answers to questions that'd existed since the series began over a decade ago and left most (if not all) of it's fans (as is probably apparent by the reviews) with a very very sour taste in our mouths.

column8:
The final stunning conclusion to the Tiberium Wars series this game could have been... but ultimately it wasn't. It is still fun to play provided you ignore the previous 15+ years of lore. I liked the game inspite of wanting to hate it.

The biggest issue is EA's attempt to "introduce a multitude of innovations to the classic fast and fluid Command & Conquer gameplay". BIG MISTAKE! A bit of fine tuning or maybe a single change would have been fine and accepted by the masses but attempting to turn the entire RTS genre on it's head from it's root origins way back in Dune 2: Battle for Arrakis/Building a Dynasty (yep I owned both and argued with friends about the title) was a bad idea that wasn't play tested enough and then when executed signaled the death bell of this otherwise Glorious Franchaise.

Audio/Sound: 10/10. The sound engineering and audio in the game is freaking brilliant. The music is absoluting amazing and soulful with each battle/mission. The menu music almost makes you feel like you're in some form of command centre and the troops are awaiting your orders to throw themselves into the fray. It's very thematic and is done well, even the FMV have an excellent tone to them.

Video: 8/10. The visuals are fantastic. The FMV have always been top notch (ignoring Tiberium Dawn's blue-screen era) and they don't disappoint. But while in game I can't help but feel the visuals got a severe downgrade from the E3 trailers and previews. Not sure if it was a QA or coding issue that changed this but it was a bit of a disappointment. But still the game looks great compred to some of the RTS clones out there.

Gameplay: 4/10. Sadly this is where it all goes to hell. It is C&C. But it's not the RTS we want. Or the one we deserve. Mobile fluid command structures aren't anything new. Dark Reign, Supreme Commander and a few others have done this before and always to a varying degree of failure when it comes to reception of the players. Why they decided to follow this course is a mystery... maybe they did want the franchaise to end and die? Why? No idea.

To non-C&C fans of RTS games I must suggest that you avoid this. To the C&C fans whom want to see an ending... well I'm a hardcore fan and played them all back to back(even Renegade) before getting to this game and for me it was worth it to get an ending. If you're not that keen but want to see an ending then I suggest youtube'ing the FMV cinematics but you probably won't get the same impact.

I will say this having an end boss fight was unexpected and a nice twist and the GDI bring the pain with their ultimate super-heavy vehicle (no spoilers I promise) but holy heck it kicks butt and took me 26 minutes to bring down... yep it's that tough but then again I like to play on stupidly hard cause I'm a sucker for pain... hrm maybe that's why I liked the game.

Game on!

column8:
Got this for less than $5 in a sale and in a bundle.. effectively making it pretty much free after the bundling. I still regret it.
The deep discount doesn't change my disgust with the route EA took the franchise. This is like an entirely different game. 
This is NOT Command & Conquer. I'm not sure what it is trying to be.. but they missed the mark so hard it's a different genre. When you need several levels of tutorials to explain just how different it is.. you F*%@ED UP! 
C&C should be intuitive enough to rts players without that need. Sorely disappointed. Deleted.

column8:
I've played every Command & Conquer game since 1995. Every release kept me going on for hours. As most others probably were, was glad beyond believe that the fourth and final installment in the long lasting Tiberium series was coming, but when I finally got the game... well simply enough this isn't Command & Conquer, It's a horrid waste of money and time with practically nothing in common with past installments and answers almost none of the questions we were told it would answer and as such this "Epic conclusion of the Tiberium saga" as EA calls it, doesn't deserve to be honored with the title of Command & Conquer 4. 

In short Command & Conquer 4 is atrocious, end of story. Despite the inclusion of several new features, Command & Conquer 4 is an unenjoyable and easily forgettable experience.

One of the first games i played on PC was C&C.

I tried this game and threw up a little.

C&C was a masterpiece, it could've been copy pasted with new graphics and bigger maps and they could've taken more of my money. As it stands, I won't be buying anything from this title again, and I will certainly not be recommending it to anyone i know.

You went to far from the origional to be successful, now you ave a title that has no definable game structure, well done.

column8:
I "played" via ""Origin"" mostly so my time shown here doesn't represent the time I've put into the game but.. 
Heres a video version of this.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuWXHvvoOiA

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/RebusForeverReviews#curation

A Mini 'Rebview'!!

Do you like real-time strategy games?
Did you while away hours, just playing skirmish maps  throughout the C&C franchise ?
Did you marvel at the hammy acting and silly stories in the campaign and test friendships in vs battles?
Did you enjoy managing your base and slowly wresting control of the map from your opponents, all the while protecting your harvesters and amassing your forces for that planned overwhelming assault? 
Is Command and Conquer 4 the game for you?
Nope, probably not. 

Thanks for reading, check my other reviews.

What!!?

What do you mean that's not good enough? 

Okay then, second time's a charm....
Do you hate previous Command and Conquer games and wish they never existed? 
Did you play level 7 of Dune 2 as a child and decide if you can't have a base nobody should?
Do you think innovation within a franchise should automatically mean a complete and utter deviation from that franchise's core mechanics? 
Do you get a sense of inner fulfillment when EA takes over other studios and then homogenizes and dumbs their properties down?
Then this might be the game for you..... 
You monster. 

Firstly, sorry to the live action actors, they acted their little hearts out.
And now the dirty work.... 
The game itself 'features' a perspective limited to about 3ft off the ground.
Replacing bases and harvesters is a crawler mechanic done better elsewhere.
The crawler acts as a mobile HQ that can deploy sort of acting like a base, but not.
Limited unit selection is improved slightly as each of the 3 crawlers for the two factions has a selection of unique abilities and units - providing a thin façade of choice - so long as your choice doesn't involve wanting to play a Command and Conquer game!

The game does look good for its age and still had a bunch of people playing it online, but based on my time with the game I'm forced to assume they get some sort of masochistic thrill from sticking with it, but far be it from me to kink shame.

The units may look acceptable but the tiny unit cap in the missions I played was not, the game may have merits when considered as its own thing, but as a long time fan of the franchise and Westwood's work it pains me to see the Command and Conquer title connected to this game.

C&C 4 is a compelling Asylum B movie, tethered to a game forged by an exact and precise series of awful decision; like an entire solar system whose planets orbit comes into alignment once every billion years and unleashes some dark force, Command and Conquer 4 came into being- spawned from a heady mix of EA's contempt for the franchise and a desire for accessibility that seemingly took precedence at every stage of designing the games mechanics.  

If you are new to the franchise or enjoyed Homeworld Deserts of Karak it might be worth playing but as a Command and Conquer fan I'd be honoured to recomend that nobody play this game, ever, not even for nostalgia.... 

Thanks for the read and if you enjoyed this feedback is always appreciated.
If you checked out the video review lemme know you came from Steam.

column8:
The worst disgrace EA has ever published. Take a 20 year old strategy series with countless great games, grind it to dust, remove key elements of the entire genre, make it pseudo-coop-multiplayer-online-only and watch it all burn to the ground.

Worst company decision of EA, ever. I wish Westwood wouldn't have gone bankrupt and they would have made C&C Generals 2.

Stay away from this. Even as a gift, you should remove this from your library. You should never pay a single cent for it. Never.

column8:
Lorsque j'ai commencé je ne me doutais pas à quel point le bashing sur ce jeu était vrai, non seulement il est très court, mais la gestion des unités est passez moi l'expression "à chié", fini le développement stratgique via les centrales, plus de centrales plus deconstruction, non là on est cantonné la majeur partie du temps à 50, pas 50 unités, mais un chiffre random de 50 quelque fois moins quelque fois plus, sachant qu'n principe les unités coûte 3 ou 6 points les 50 sont vite atteind !

J'ai déjà fini avec le NOD là je fait les GDI mais c'est jsute par ce que je l'ai acheté, pas par plaisir,

ce jeu n'a RIEN à voir avec la license, c'est de la DAUBE !

LE pire du pire reste les scrins, dans le 3 sublime, ici rien d'autre qu'une bestiole sortie de spore, sur 3 pattes, on aurait pas pu faire pire
column9:
When I started, I had no idea how much the bashing of this game was real. Not only is it very short, but the unit management is, pardon the expression, "crappy." No more strategic development via power stations, no more power stations, no more construction. No, we're limited most of the time to 50 units, not 50, but a random number of 50, sometimes less, sometimes more. Knowing that units usually cost 3 or 6 points, the 50 is quickly reached!

I've already finished NOD, now I'm playing GDI, but that's just because I bought it, not for fun.

This game has NOTHING to do with the license, it's CRAP!

The worst of the worst remains the Scrins. In the sublime 3, here, nothing but a creature hatched from a spore, on three legs. We couldn't have done worse.

column8:
It's taken me a while (Like 2 years I think) but I'd finally like to come around to say that this game is garbage. Having been a huge fan of the series since childhood, to see it become something so simplistic and yet so convoluted is painful. I've played better RTS on my tablet. This game is a steaming pile of garbage, and barely lives up to even being called an RTS. On top of that, running it is a pain. Constant FPS drops making it unplayable, and it's just generally not a good time.

0/10, would rather play C&C64

column8: Четвёртая часть очень отстаёт от 3ей. Управление плохое, прорисовка ужасная. Игра в корне отличается от предыдущей версии.  Если вы хотите поиграть в стратегию, то скачайте любую другую версию C&C кроме данной. 4ая часть не стоит своих денег
column9: The fourth game is far behind the third. The controls are bad, the graphics are terrible. The game is fundamentally different from the previous version. If you want to play a strategy game, download any other version of C&C except this one. The fourth game isn't worth the money.

If they'd named the game something else, it would have been a hit. Like Command & Conquer (anything).

column8:
It made me cry. I first got a hold of Command and Conquer with Red Alert Retaliation on the PSX when my dad came home from Bosnia. When I asked him if I could play it, he said it would just make me mad. I was maybe 6. I didn't know what to do. I learned how to select and grab units by holding down the X button and moving the directional buttons. I selected all my units and would move them about. I didn't know that big ass fucking truck could turn into a structure that built more structures. Boy, was I fucking excited then! I used to leave my playstation on in the morning and come back after school to continue with my skirmishes. I'd like to play "Peacekeeper" where I'd prevent the cpu's from killing each other off. Then I got the Firestorm pack. Fast Forward to about maybe 9 years later and I had a pc in my room. One of those prebuilt ones your mom and dad give you when they get a new one. 

I bought the Pack that contained Red Alert 2. Red Alert 2 Yuris Revenge. Renegade. Tiberian Sun. and Firestorm. It was with Renegade that I got on the internet and found out about Gamespy. Fuck I miss the ol days. It was great. I was ignorant and didn't know about the greed of companies yet. Then eventually CnC3 came out. I was HYPED! I thought I was for GDI. But then Kane's Wrath came out. Now Im a Noddie fer lyfe! 

Then.... Then IT came out. The abomination called CNC4. I bought it of course. I kept telling myself that it had to have base building in it. Why would they do that?! Why would they turn it into a cash grab?! Don't they care about us? I never played the campaign. I didn't want to. 

Until today. March 24th 2017. I will face the campaign and deal with it. Because I know EA will never part with the IP. They suck companies dry and then throw them in the pit of the dead and move on to the next ones. 

RIP Westwood and my childhood innocence. 

Goodluck to Petroglyph.

And may EA and every Executive there burn in hell.

At 4:44 AM on March 25th. I finished the NoD campaign. I feel sick to my stomach.

column8:
A kick in the teeth to the Command and Conquer: Tiberium Wars series. If there was an actual story at all, it was more bland than a box of uncooked rice. The pvp system is absolute crap, and you will find yourself needing to be carried to even begin to be able to fight with one specific class of army at a time. Because to hell with unit diversity.

This was a bastardization of the RTS genre, and frankly I want to set my copy on fire, but since it's digital, I guess a giant thumbs down works.

column8:
Le jeu est joli mais on passe d'un jeu où on commandait une armée à un jeu où on dirige quelques unités (16 petites unités à 3 pts, ou quelques grosses unités à 10 pts). Au lieu d'avoir une base, on a le choix entre 3 crawlers.

Les scénarii ressemblent plus à de petites énigmes, à résoudre : choisir le bon crawler, produire les bonnes unités pour résoudre le scénario.
Plus de ressource à récolter. Il y a quelques cristaux sur la map, qui servent à acheter des boost.

Bref, ça n'est plus le Command & Conquer du passé. C'est très différent, parfois frustrant, parfois novateur.
column9:
The game is pretty, but it goes from a game where you command an army to one where you command a few units (16 small units at 3 points, or a few large units at 10 points). Instead of having a base, you have a choice of three crawlers.

The scenarios are more like small puzzles to solve: choose the right crawler, produce the right units to solve the scenario.
No more resources to harvest. There are a few crystals on the map, which are used to buy boosts.

In short, this is no longer the Command & Conquer of the past. It's very different, sometimes frustrating, sometimes innovative.

column8:
As a big fan of the C&C series I had big hopes for this game based on the previous episodes. It's a complete disappointment, it's absolutely different than the previous games, they took everything from it that made it C&C, no base building, no money, lack of story and proper game modes... The only thing I can mention as positive is the graphics.

If you are thinking about buying it, let me give you an advice: Do NOT buy it!

column8:
(SUMMARY OF THIS REVIEW: DON'T BUY THIS GAME. EA KILLED CNC WITH THIS GAME)

With this game, Command and Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight, electronic arts put forth their single greatest INSULT to the gaming community, and ultimately one of the dumbest business decisions in gaming history. In a pathetic, short sighted attempt at trying to push the highly coveted Command And Conquer brand onto a new generation of gamer, they have destroyed everything CNC has stood for.

In order to appeal to a NEW playerbase of (GUESSTIMATE) 50 000-80 000 players from a NEW generation of gamers, they have created a fast paced RTS that is so heavily disconnected from the ENTIRE CNC genre up to this point, it is unrecognizeable as an actual command and conquer title, and more closely resembles a next-gen mobile-tower defense game.

In doing so, EA Games made its BIGGEST mistake. In order to appeal to a NEW small audience, they ALIENATED the older audience which comprises over two MILLION players, probably more. From both a lore standpoint and shockingly a business standpoint, CNC4 was a BIG mistake.

While CNC 4 is in itself a good game for what it is, not a true RTS but more an RTS based mobile tower defense game. Good graphics, good gameplay, good story, brilliant unit balancing, as always to be expected from a CNC title. But, the game is NOT command and conquer. The original CNC games were base building, calling on MASSIVE armies of PC shattering numbers of units into HUGE, tiny or small battlefields.

THAT is what the players of the CNC series grew up with. Thats what they fell in love with. THAT gameplay mechanic of building a fortress and a massve army was what drove CNC fans down its very long history to make it one of if not THE greatest RTS-defining franchises in gaming history.

Command and Conquer universe - with the exception of CNC Renegade (an FPS based in the tiberium universe) - has been defined by base building, resource management, resource collection, base defense, tactical decisions and heavy strategy that have molded playstyles that have blown away other RTS games, and even set the precedent on what to beat for the entire RTS gaming industry.

Command and Conquer Generals and its extension Zero Hour, STILL have a loyal fan base, online community and very extensive modding community that, years on, is still loyally playing a game they've had for ages, completely ignoring anything NEW you try to produce. Most true CNC fans will buy CNC4 because its command and conquer, but will NEVER play it after the first few times logging in.

But, for now i shall leave you with the following review of CNC4 Tib Twilight:

For what it is, it's a good, fun game.

Good Graphics.
Good gameplay.
Good story.
Good skirmish modes.
Challenging AI.

But these do not excuse it. It is NOT command and conquer, and for this reason

I DO NOT CONSIDER THIS GAME, CNC4 TIBERIAN TWILIGHT, TO BE CANON TO THE CNC FRANCHISE.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

column8: 客观来说这作为RTS游戏不是很差，但是剧情方面实在对不起CNC的老玩家。有些剧情还算连贯但是到后面的剧情只能说草草了结，单位也是有前几代的还原这点我觉得不错，总结来说游戏不值这个价.
column9: Objectively speaking, this isn't a bad RTS game, but the storyline really disappoints veteran CNC players. Some of the plot is coherent, but the later parts feel abruptly concluded. I think the units are somewhat recreated from previous games, which is good. Overall, the game isn't worth the price.

column8:
Ever since this game has launched, back when even win7 used to be non existant, 64 bit users have been crying about crash issues with this game, well, here i am on win 10 64 bit 7 years after the game was launched and the old issues still refuse to be fixed. In my case the game launched fine with 800/600 or something resolution, the lowest possible on a i7 4790k cpu with gtx 980 and 16 gb ram, it crashed as soon as i changed the resolution to 2560/1440.
A big thumbs down to a game i was so eagerly looking forward to play, coming from a guy who played all cc games

column8:
Greetings!  I’m going to say something that doesn’t seem the norm based off the reviews of this game.  I liked this game.  I’ve always been a fan of Command & Conquer and although this game definitely isn’t my favorite it does seem to hold up pretty well.

Graphics:  No, these graphics aren’t amazing but they do hold up from when the game first came out.  I can’t really complain as they were pretty amazing when the game first came out, they hold up pretty well.  Battle damage is still present and the particle effects are still pretty good. I’d love to see more RTS do battle damage and such.

Mechanics:  I have to compare this to a modern product and with that said the mechanics do hold up tolerably but I keep going back to the gold standard of controls for RTS:  StarCraft 2.  I wish RTS would just look at the standard SC2 has set and make that their minimum.  Yes, you need innovation but you should start at least with the core.  I did find the unit selection double press feature very useful (on press you select all combat units, double and you select all units).  If I was rating this completely on mechanics I’d probably be more in the not recommend as the controls have not kept up in the world of precision, to many times I couldn’t move a unit too close to something or his pathing would lead him somewhere completely opposite of where I wanted him to go.  And…one game type for skirmish?  Really? Sigh.

RPG:  I wish more games would include some of the leveling features that this game has, I’d love to see a mode where you level up and unlock new units, or include veterancy.  Yes, I know these aren’t very ‘competitive’ features, so maybe make them toggled or their own game type.  In fact, the core design of this game (the mobile base building and focus on less units and more action) would be an amazing game type for RTS but kind of falls flat as the core component.  Ultimately, I would have loved to see this game take off more so if nothing else these game types would have continued on.

Story:  Unfortunately, this story felt the most forgettable over all the other C&C games.  I know I beat this when it first came out but for the life of me didn’t remember any of the story, I actually remember the story of most of the C&C world but this one slipped me.  I’m not sure if they weren’t trying but it actually felt more like a game copying the C&C world than a C&C game.

Ultimately, I am cycling between a positive or negative review.  I look at everything and see more negative thoughts than positive, but this game is 6 years old and I just replayed the campaign and overall enjoyed it… but I love C&C.  Should you buy this?  Eh, if you like C&C yes, if you are just looking for a good RTS I’d look elsewhere or go back in time 6 years and play it when it comes out.

column8:
If you are looking for a large scale RTS, this game is NOT for you.

If you want to control air, land, AND sea, this game is not for you.

If you want limited variety in troop type and faction, this game IS for you.


In other words, as an RTS, this game is horrible.  As a grand strategy involving massive amounts of units and big-picture tactics, this game as failed.  

I would only reccomend this game if you prefer to manage a small number (no more than 20 or 30) of each type of unit.

column8:
This version of CnC got quite a lot of flack from various thing. Listing some:
1.) This version of CnC greatly move in a different gameplay of RTS compare to other CnC. SO DIFFERENT. I pretty much understand those who say that the classic CnC gameplay is much  better since it was the one that they got to play since their childhood (Nostalgia factor is a plus). This version greatly rewarded those who knows a little bit of micro-managing (Especially those who are good in that matter). New gameplay, new strategies, new tactics.

2.) EA launch this game in Steam via 3rd party software, which you have to make an account with EA to play it. I got no problem doing that as I have a lot of games doing that in my Steam library, however the create new account link in launch program is broken, so you have to go directly to the site (minor inconvinience). Other thing, creating new account is pretty much a pain in the neck depending on your location, so I have to activate my VPN (Germany) to successfully make a new account. This could make those who are kinda not informed what VPN is lose interest in playing this game.

3.) You can not play this without internet connection, as you have to login everytime you launch this game. Big minus point.

I played this game until I finished GDI and NOD Brotherhood path. I quite say that I got the game mechanic and game play after few games (due to the fact that compare to other CnC, this version is like entirely another game). If you'll give it some time, it's enjoying. Hard and rewarding. Although the campaign was so short that if you have no other friend to play with, this gonna go lame very fast.

Oh, and a lot of people are rampantly cheating coz of weak-ass anti-cheat system of EA.

I recommend only getting this in bundle with the rest of CnC in Steam. Buying it alone is truly not worth the money.

column8:
DONT BOTHER!!!!

I cannot play this game. EA requires you to create an account with them to even run the game app. However, when you click on the Create Account button on the log in screen, you are taken to a 404 error, a webpage that no longer exists.

So I tried troubleshooting that for about 14 hours because I can be kind of a techie and try to solve my own problems. During that time, I kept closing and reopening the app or leaving that login screen up while I went to research the issue, attempt get tech support, poop, what have you. Now that the play time exceeds 2 hours as far as steam is concerned, STEAM WILL NOT GIVE ME A REFUND.

So I guess I paid 20 bucks to be able to see the game listed in my library. Huzzah. I really should have read the comments before buying.

column8: Absolutely, under no circumstances, should you buy this game. Its a shit quasi-MOBA that tried to steal too much at once. The other C&C games are a completely diffent genre than this abomination. If you're looking for this kind of playstyle, go log onto Heroes of the Storm and play as Abathur. Its literally the same thing, only with better servers and support. I had high hopes for a command and conquer sequel, but EA decided to take the hopes and dreams of its fanbase, coat it in human feces and set it on fire. On a scale of one to ten, this game is gof*ckyourself/10.

column8: Я в шоке как можно было запороть такую игру. Эта была одна из первых игр в которые я поиграл и впервые я поиграл в C&C 3 Tiberium Wars потом начал в Red alert играть и так далее потом вышла Ярость Кейна и мне ужасно понравилось новый вид бытвы добавили и всё такое жаль что компании за ГСБ не было но не суть. После всех частей пройденных мной а я прошел все игры серии C&C это нечто ужасное и скучное. Я даже проходить его не хотел, я просто хотел посмотреть концовку, я прошел 1 раз за Гди и 1 раз за Нод а остальные концовки посмотрел в инете. В общем не советую эту игру в ней нет ни постройки базы ни нормальных войск ни нормального геймплея как в предшествниках, действительно "Зачем нужна эта построй базы это же так сложно". Они этим убили всю игру и дерьмово закончили серию Tiberum wars. Я лудше другие часи в 100 раз перепроходить буду чем играть в это.
column9: I'm shocked how they could screw up such a game. This was one of the first games I played, and my first was C&C 3, Tiberium Wars, then I started playing Red Alert, and so on. Then Kane's Wrath came out, and I really loved the new mode of life they added and all that. It's a shame there wasn't a GDI campaign, but that's beside the point. After all the parts I've played through, and I've played through all the C&C games, this is something awful and boring. I didn't even want to play it, I just wanted to see the ending. I played through it once as GDI and once as Nod, and looked up the other endings online. Overall, I don't recommend this game. It has no base building, no decent troops, and no decent gameplay like its predecessors. It's really like, "Why do you need this base building? It's so hard." They ruined the entire game with this and ended the Tiberium Wars series in a terrible way. I'd rather replay other games a hundred times than play this.

column8:
Basically EA does what it does best and ruins the game franchise "to open it to new players"

the simplified everything

infantry are singular units you can only get with defense mcv's
ground vehicles are offense mcv's
air is support mcv's

the amount of units that exist has been cut down to a huge extent, theres an at guy, anti infantry guy and anti air guy which pretty much sms up the rest of em

no heavy or light no special units oh no

to be quite blun this thing is a cartoonish caracature of what command and conquer should be.

The only good thing about this game is Kane but the writing for him is obviously lazy and you can tell, its really unfortunate.

Do not buy this game, i only got it as  a bundle in a sale

Fuck you EA, just fuck you

column8:
打过RA3的童鞋们应该看得出来，这代和RA3用的应该是一个引擎……
然而却远不如RA3好玩儿……（也许是我不太会微操把……）
为什么把RTS传统的造兵模式取消了……只留下一个令人蛋疼的主基地，和人口限制……
我很想说：“我需要更多的补给站……“
“不好意思我们没有补给站可以给你用……”
“我需要泰伯伦矿，或是晶体矿，哪怕是横在城市道路中央的矿井都可以！”
“不好意思，泰伯伦控制网络不让您采矿了，那些残余的晶体是您升级用的“
画面过得去，剧情没看完……
你问我为什么没看完？操作太蛋疼，单位经常犯傻站一边儿啥事儿不干还挡路。搞死别人的基地都要搞半天，断别人经济这一招也用不上了，多矿点工作用经济和兵力碾压对手也用不上了，这不是我要的RTS！
想玩SC2，CNC3甚至是RA3的那种即时战略的孩子们别想了，这不是你想要的东西！
column9:
Anyone who's played RA3 should be able to tell that this game uses the same engine...

However, it's nowhere near as fun as RA3... (Maybe I'm just not very good at micromanaging...)

Why did they remove the traditional RTS unit-building system... leaving only a frustrating main base and population limits...

I really want to say, "I need more supply stations..."

"Sorry, we don't have any supply stations for you..."

"I need Tiberium or crystals, even if they're just mines in the middle of a city road!"

"Sorry, the Tiberium control network won't let you mine. Those remaining crystals are for your upgrades."

The graphics are okay, but I haven't finished the story...

Why haven't I finished it? The controls are terrible. Units often just stand around doing nothing and blocking the way. It takes ages to destroy the enemy's base. Cutting off their economy is useless, and using more mines to crush the enemy with both economy and troops is useless. This isn't my RTS!

For those of you who want to play real-time strategy games like SC2, CNC3, or even RA3, forget it! This isn't what you want!

It's just that now, for fans and enthusiasts, the fourth installment is associated with the end of their favorite strategy game.

column8:
Что ж, игра конечно неплохая, но я ожидал большего...
Да, всё в новинку, да всё красочно, НО:
1. Появилась такая ненужная и непонятная вещь, как Уровень, а это значит, что все юниты и постройки недоступны пока не достигнешь этого уровня (ЗАЧЕМ?!).
2. По сравнению с Red alert 3 интерфэйс сделали как бы удобнее (но нет), убрали возможность вынужденной атаки (она в принципе и не нужна была, но жалко), и опять-таки УРОВНИ не дают насладиться игрой.
3. По-видимому игру старались заточить под мультиплеер (И да, в ней есть люди, около 30 человек точно играют).
4. Кампания как-бы есть, но её как таковой НЕТ. Где красивые заставки как в Red Alert 3?!
В общем, я думал если меня КэК Red Alert 3 удивил, то эта игра тем более, как я ошибался... Хотя 224Р на неё не особо жалко... Игра сделала не революционный шаг вперёд, а скорей, споткнулась и откатилась на пару метров назад(Нет, я не наркоман). Она стала каким-то Star Craft-ом 2...
Крч 6/10.
column9:
Well, the game is certainly not bad, but I expected more...
Yes, everything is new, and everything is colorful, BUT:
1. There's this unnecessary and confusing feature called "Level," which means all units and buildings are unavailable until you reach that level (WHY?!).
2. Compared to Red Alert 3, the interface has been made more user-friendly (but it hasn't), the forced attack feature has been removed (it wasn't really needed, but it's a shame), and again, the LEVELS make the game difficult to enjoy.
3. Apparently, they tried to optimize the game for multiplayer (And yes, there are people playing, definitely around 30).
4. There's a campaign, but it's NOT a campaign. Where are the beautiful intros like in Red Alert 3?!
So, I thought if Red Alert 3 surprised me, this game would be even more so. How wrong I was... Although I don't really mind spending 224P on it... The game didn't take a revolutionary step forward, but rather stumbled and rolled back a few meters (no, I'm not a drug addict). It became some kind of StarCraft 2...
Krch 6/10.

column8:
Le plus mauvais C&C de tous les temps.

Je préfère même rejouer aux premiers de la série tant celui-ci propose un gameplay totalement aux antipodes des C&C comme on les aime ! 

Niveau graphisme ce jeu est limite, niveau gameplay c'est du cap & win en spammant les unités comme un abruti, pas de constructions possibles de batiments, progression de niveau global qui permet de créer seulement 1/3 des unités au début du jeu, se débloque par faction (donc nécessite la même stupide jauge à remplir pour les deux factions), seulement 2 factions jouables, le mode en ligne est impossible sans avoir tout débloqué car les autres joueurs vous feront les fesses...

Ce jeu est à éviter, je l'ai acheté dans le bundle en promo de C&C et très honnêtement je regrette sincèrement de l'avoir eu dedans, j'aurais préféré ne pas l'obtenir et passer à coté de cet étron tellement la désillusion est grande...

Même en promotion ce jeu ne mérite pas d'être acheté, l'intérêt d'un tel jeu est strictement réservé aux personnes qui aiment ce genre de jeux, certainement pas à ceux qui aiment C&C... Il s'agit bien la d'un jeu totalement différent, je le rappelle...
column9:
The worst C&C of all time.

I'd even rather replay the first games in the series, as this one offers gameplay that's completely different from the C&C games we love!

Graphically, this game is limited. Gameplay-wise, it's a cap & win game, spamming units like an idiot. No building construction is possible. Global level progression only allows you to create 1/3 of the units at the start of the game. It's unlocked by faction (so you need the same stupid gauge to fill for both factions). There are only two playable factions. Online mode is impossible without unlocking everything because other players will give you a hard time...

This game is to be avoided. I bought it in the C&C discount bundle, and quite honestly, I sincerely regret having included it. I would have preferred not to get it and pass up this turd, the disappointment is so great...

Even on sale, this game isn't worth buying. The appeal of such a game is strictly reserved for people who like this kind of game, certainly not for those who like C&C... This is a completely different game, I repeat...

column8: A once proud RTS series, reduced to a pathetic game of rock-paper scissors, with no tactics other then what counters what, and no resource management or base building. The only thing Tiberian Twilight has in common with the earlier entries in the series, even with the third game, is the presence of Joe Kucan as Kane- and the dead, empty look in his eyes tells you what you need to know. Avoid this game at all costs.

column8:
不推荐。10分满分的话，我打5分（里边情怀占1分）。

18年的CNC也是结束了，从小玩红警长大，对这个系列感情很深，将军2胎死腹中之后，CNC4注定是系列的终点了，还真的没想到最终作是这么个奇行种……（虽然我断断续续好几年才把战役通了）

首先来说这个游戏的成品质量：
　　剧情基本烂片，制作完全没有3代的水准；地图非常糊弄，程序相当偷懒（地形与单位碰撞检测无语得想砸键盘，各种单位空气墙），大家都能看出来这款“正统续作”根本就不算是亲生的，不论哪一方面都在透露着低成本赶工骗情怀的嘴脸。

再来具体谈谈这游戏的玩法设计：
　　本作对系列前作来说都是颠覆性的变革——简化建造部分，极度控制人口（不禁想到了某些RTS探路失败作）。这一设计也是有一些优点的，那就是再也没有人海战术和后期一波推的路线，从而迫使玩家更加关注策略。
　　但这种看似新颖的玩火设计显然非常不成熟。
　　1.三种基地的选择更像是为了设计而设计，并没有完全突出三选一能带来的优势特点。选择路线后反而固定了套路，发展缺乏多样化，也失去了随时根据战局调整的可控性（虽然可以重新选择路线，不过只能在出生点降落的设计很让人绝望）。
　　2.在建筑直接砍掉的前提下，为了弥补游戏元素过少的不足，设计了并不精简的大量冗余兵种。兵种虽多，但由于人口的限制，游戏可控单位数量极少，以至于每个单位的兵种血量逆天，再加上极端的兵种克制，1个步兵被5辆坦克群殴10秒不死有时还能反杀的情况也是时常发生，不禁怀疑数值策划是不是在报复社会……

步子迈得太大容易扯到胯……大家RTS都玩微创新，不是没有道理，20多年积累下来的模式不是能轻易改变的。创新可以有，但在正统续作上实验，只能说胆识过人，但有勇无谋吧；市场和口碑的双重滑铁卢足以说明这是一次完全失败的冒险。

最后：怀念西木头。
（P.S. 光头的故事就这么随便结束了？不甘心！！！太TM糊弄事了吧！！！）
column9:
Not recommended. Out of 10, I'd give it a 5 (1 point for nostalgia).

The 2018 CNC series is over. I grew up playing Red Alert and have a deep affection for the series. After General 2's stillbirth, CNC 4 was destined to be the end of the series. I never expected the final game to be such a freak... (even though it took me years to complete the campaign).

First, let's talk about the quality of the finished game:

The plot is basically a piece of shit, and the production is nowhere near the level of the third game. The maps are awful, and the programming is incredibly sloppy (the terrain and unit collision detection is so annoying it makes me want to smash my keyboard, and there are all these air walls). Everyone can see that this "legitimate sequel" is anything but a genuine one. Every aspect reveals a low-budget rush job designed to fudge the nostalgia.

Now let's talk about the gameplay design:

This game is a radical departure from the previous games in the series—simplified construction and extreme population control (reminds me of some failed RTS exploration games). This design does have some advantages, namely, eliminating the need for massive crowds and late-game pushes, forcing players to focus more on strategy.

However, this seemingly novel, yet futile design is clearly immature.

1. The three base options seem designed for design's sake, failing to fully highlight the advantages of choosing one of the three. Choosing a base instead fixes the game's strategy, lacking in variety and controllability to adapt to the current situation (although you can re-select a new base, the design of being restricted to your spawn point is frustrating).

2. While buildings were eliminated, a large number of redundant units were added to compensate for the lack of gameplay elements. Despite the abundance of troop types, the limited population limits limit the number of controllable units in the game, resulting in incredibly high health pools for each unit. Coupled with the extreme class counterplay, it's not uncommon for a single infantryman to survive a 10-second assault by five tanks, sometimes even counter-killing them. I can't help but wonder if the numerical planners are taking revenge on society...

Taking too big a step can easily backfire... RTS games are all about micro-innovation, and for good reason. A formula built over 20 years can't be easily changed. Innovation is welcome, but experimenting with a sequel to a classic is bold but foolhardy. The dual failures in both market share and reputation clearly demonstrate that this venture was a complete failure.

Finally: I miss Westwood.
(P.S. Is Baldy's story ending so casually? I'm not happy with that! That's such a bummer!)

column8:
I really wanted to like this game.  

I enjoyed the other games in the C&C Tiberium universe, and the setting feels like a good continuation of that... but I just cannot get past the gameplay.  Screenshots and videos might be staged to make this look like it plays like other C&C games, but it really does not.  There is a big focus on small unit tactics, limited armies, micro-management, and territory control.  In truth, this would not make a bad PvP skirmish game, with short session times and persistant leveling to build an army.  Sadly, this model does not fit well with a single player campaign game, particularly if one expects a more traditional C&C experience.  

I might recommend this if you just wanted a skirmish game, but odds are anyone who wants that experience will go looking for something more dedicated to that purpose.  Anyone who comes to this looking for a traditional C&C game will come away disappointed.  I cannot recommend this title without major, major caveats.

column8:
When i was young i played C&C and seeing it on steam made me remember those times way back when...
Games back then were made to keep you there and were well crafted to give the player a feeling of accomplishment after you beat each level.

-breaths in
THIS P.O.S. REMINDS ME OF HOW BAD GAMES GET AFTER A BEATIFUL SERIES GOES UNDER!

what happened to building your base up and and having to mine for resorces while being gunned down by your enimies. what happened to kane being the coolest vilian ever in C&C. what happened to the stratagy that was suppose to be in this game. why do i hvae to level up to use my whole arsenal. why did they disable wasd as the camera controls, using the mouse and having to use shortcuts without having a place to start from on the keyboard sucks. the graphics are cool but why would developers EVER put graphics befor the story or game play.

this game is a flop and should just be buried along with E.T. in a big landfill.

this game is a horrible sequal to a grand series.

this game is the killer of the C&C Series.

the only way out is to make another red alert and the third one was pushing it. besides we are tired of red alert and ww2 based games; or at least i am.

good bye C&C this game just ended our relationship.

column9: I recommend it with reservations. Forget all the games in the franchise. It takes time to learn the new system, and even if you do, you might not enjoy it. It's a different game, with good graphics. It shouldn't be called Command Conquer. Only buy it if it's cheap; I paid 8 reais. The regular price of 30 reais isn't worth it. But if you want to see the end of the story like I did, be happy and go in with an open mind to new experiences. If you're a purist, stay away and go for RED Alert 3.

column8:
Einfach mies,

so was schelchtes hab ich schon lange nicht mehr gespielt, ansich is das gameplay ja ganz lustig, aber es kommt einfach nicht richtig motivation zusammen.
das die einheiten aufsteigen, ist ja ganz schön, jedach merkt man so gut wie nichts davon, das sie irgendwie stärker werden oder sonstige verbesserungen.
für mich ist allerdrings das schlimmste, das man von den crawlern(gebäude zu einheiten bau) jeweils nur einen bauen kann, sprich off, def und supp, dadruch auch andere einheiten bauen kann/muss, man könnte den crawler wechseln während des spieles, was aber schwachsinn ist weil nur off was bringt, dazu schwankt der schwierigkeitsgrad von missionen so sehr das man meint, man hat was falsch eingestellt.
für mich ist das spiel leider ne große enttäuschung und was mich zu diesem review veranlasst hat war eigentlich nur eine einheit die dermaßen geärgert hat, das mir der kragen geplatzt ist.
wie kann man denn nen trupp ins spiel einbauen, wohlgemerkt fußeinheit, die einfach deine panzer übernimmt obwohl fast 10 panzer auf ihn schießen und während er dir dann das teil klaut is er einfach nich down zu kriegen, so nimmt er sich stück für stück und du schießt eigene einheiten kaputt, ich flüchte doch nicht über die halbe karte mit panzern vor "einer" verdammten einheit, unfassbar.
wobei 10 panzer auch übertrieben is man kann ja nur 50-60 einheiten bauen und kein trup flug oder fahrzeug kostet weniger als 3 größere sogar 6, da kommt also nich viel zusammen zudem braucht man immer genügend rep einheiten.
naja glücklicherweise hat's mich nur 2,50€ gekostet.
column9:
Simply awful.

I haven't played anything this bad in a long time. The gameplay itself is quite fun, but it just doesn't really motivate me.
The fact that the units level up is nice, but you hardly notice them getting stronger or any other improvements.
For me, the worst thing is that you can only build one of the crawlers (buildings for units), i.e., off, defense, and support, which means you can/have to build other units. You could change crawlers during the game, but that's nonsense because only off is useful. On top of that, the difficulty of missions fluctuates so much that you think you've set something wrong.
Unfortunately, the game is a huge disappointment for me, and what prompted me to write this review was actually just one unit that annoyed me so much that I lost my temper. How can you integrate a squad into the game, mind you, a foot unit, that simply takes over your tanks even though almost 10 tanks are firing at it. And while it's stealing your tank, it's simply impossible to take down. It takes it piece by piece, and you destroy your own units. I'm not going to flee halfway across the map with tanks from "one" damn unit, unbelievable.
Although 10 tanks is also excessive. You can only build 50-60 units, and no squad, aircraft, or vehicles, costs less than 3, or even 6, so that doesn't add up to much. Plus, you always need enough rep units.
Well, luckily it only cost me €2.50.

column8:
Also: die ursprünglichen CnC waren rts und das lief super.
CnC4 ist im Skirmish eher ein erobern und halten, wie man es von anderen capture the flag her kennt. 

Ein CnC ist kein CnC nur weil CnC drauf steht. 

Mein Fazit (nach 2 Spielen im 2 gegen 2):
Wer Erobern und halten (ausschließlich) mag für den ist CnC4 eine alternative.
Für alle eingefleischten CnC Spieler ist CnC4 nicht das richtige. 

Siehe die anderen Kommentare.
column9:
So: the original CnCs were RTS, and they worked great.
CnC4 is more of a capture and hold game in skirmish, like other capture-the-flag games.

A CnC isn't a CnC just because it says CnC on it.

My conclusion (after two 2v2 games):
If you like capture and hold (exclusively), CnC4 is an alternative.

For all die-hard CnC players, CnC4 is not the right choice.

See the other comments.

Я раньше писал что игра полная параша и не стоит брать. Так вот я полностью согласен с самим собой (а вы думали что-то измениться?)
Можно сказать что данная игра создана для ачивки "Потрачено" - (уже много подобных ачивок).

В граф плане довольно неплохо, а вот в GAYплейной части... предыдущие части были лучше и даже один человек написал:
 "Посмотри на третью часть и поменяешь своё мнение." - Terrifying_Metal 
Если тройки нет на аке это не значит что я в нее не играл и не знаю что там с ней.
Я в третью много наиграл времени и очень... СВЕРХ точно скажу "Она раком нагнет эту часть" по всем параметрам.

Стоит брать?
Скажу сразу и без.. ох посмотрите в окно! Там люди ходят.... так... 
А! Игру не трогайте, даже палкой опасно касаться... лучше обойдите этот мертвый вонючий кусок Г.
column9:
I previously wrote that the game is complete crap and not worth picking up. Well, I completely agree with myself (did you think anything would change?)
You could say this game was made for the "Wasted" achievement (there are already many similar achievements).

Graphically, it's pretty good, but in terms of GAYplay... the previous games were better, and one person even wrote:
"Watch the third game and you'll change your mind." - Terrifying_Metal
Just because I don't have a "3" on my account doesn't mean I haven't played it and don't know what's up with it.
I've played the third game for a long time and I can absolutely say "It'll crush this game" in every way.

Is it worth picking up?
I'll tell you right now and without... oh, look out the window! There are people walking around... so...
Ah! Don't touch the game, it's dangerous even to touch it with a stick... better to walk around this dead, stinking piece of crap.

column8:
Okay, it's a good game, I like it, but if it's the Command & Conquer series you're hoping to find playing this, you're going to be disappointed.
I love the concept of having a support/defence/offense mobile bases.
You have to collect tiberium by simply picking it up, which is weird. You have an insanely low limit of units and defense if you're playing with someone, even if alone.
I like the game, but it shouldn't have been a part of the C&C series

column8:
Убить нахуй башкой об стену тех, кто бездумно заминусовал игру. Да, изменена концепция игры, сделан упор на микро-контроль, что весьма не плохо. Конечно отсутствие строительства распугало псевдо "фанов" C&C. Эти любители C&C 3 кукарекующие про легкость новой части, сами в большинстве своем не смогли пройти и пару уровней кампании. Эти любители C&C 3 даже не играли в Tiberium Dawn или Tiberium sun. Эти люди еще пытаются что то писать. Большинство плохих обзоров написано в 2010, эти аутисты еще не готовы были узнать, каким говном будет Generals 2(зато по пожеланиям тех самых любителей С&С 3). Хейт идиотов не готовых к новым концепциям положил конец C&C как таковому, разрабы уже бояться что то делать из-за хейта. Я сама олдфаг, и знаю все о C&C. Почему меня так не бомбит на новою концепцию, и почему ауты так дрочат на упрощенный C&C 3, где нет половины механики, что есть в Tiberium Sun. ХЕЙТ-НАХУЙ, игра годная, ауты не смогли в микро-контроль и ноют. Посмотрел бы я на них, и как бы они сосали в Tiberium Dawn.
P.S. В игре отличная оптимизация, это вам не релиз в 25 фпс в раннем доступе стима. В свое время игра запускалась на довольно допотопных "корчах".
P.P.S. Люди пишущие про примитивность смотрят за передвижениями "кучек" в SC2. Шутка про F2.
column9:
I'll slam my head against the wall of those who mindlessly downvoted the game. Yes, the game's concept has changed, with an emphasis on micro-control, which is quite good. Of course, the lack of building has scared off the pseudo-fans of C&C. These C&C 3 fans crowing about how easy the new game is, for the most part, couldn't even get through a couple of campaign levels. These C&C 3 fans haven't even played Tiberium Dawn or Tiberium Sun. These people are still trying to write. Most of the bad reviews were written in 2010; these autists weren't yet ready to find out what a piece of crap Generals 2 would be (but it was made according to the wishes of those same C&C 3 fans). The hate from idiots unprepared for new concepts has put an end to C&C as such; the developers are now afraid to do anything because of the hate. I'm an oldfag myself, and I know everything about C&C. Why am I so unimpressed by the new concept, and why are the outcasts so obsessed with the simplified C&C 3, which lacks half the mechanics of Tiberium Sun? HATE! The game is decent, the outcasts couldn't handle micro-control and are whining. I'd love to see them suck at Tiberium Dawn.
P.S. The game is highly optimized; this isn't a 25 FPS release on Steam Early Access. Back in the day, the game ran on pretty outdated hardware.
P.S. People writing about it being too primitive are watching the "group" movements in SC2. Just kidding about F2.
