column8:
It would be hard to say whether this game shall be recommended or not, I will say 5/10. BUT DO NOT WASTE MONEY ON IT. 

Pros:
-Fun new units and elements to test and greater visuals comparing to CC3. The plot may be too short but is reasonable. Blue tiberium core upgrades are fun to try out. 
-Great, epic music.

Cons:
-Cartoonish visual effects, an unpleasant retrogress to the realistic CC3 feeling.
-Very short campaign length. The only bonus campaign require preorder, but it was 6 years ago and unable to download or purchase via DLC. 
-Scrins did not come back as it was assumed, which disappointed many players. 
-Gaming balance is totally destroyed. Weapon types have be significantly simplified and units turned out to be lot harder to kill, which require lesser micros and strategies for good matches. 
-Need no resource to produce units. It is a very controversial change, as it makes no sense.
-Require online network for gaming, but afaik EA is going to shut it down someday nevertheless.

Personally I do not disagree with this new yet controversial building quenes applied in this game, but producing units without the need of resources simply won't make sence for gaming balance and result in lot of TR vs. TR

Guess EA won't continue on CC anymore.

column8:
So I am a massive fan of the Command and conquer games and I heard about this game and simply had to try it, something i regret. First off this is not a sequal to an amazing game this is barley even command and conquer. There is no base building, no resource gathering, the community is dead, and this game is SO over priced its not even worth your time as a F2P game, and im one of the suckers that got tricked into buying it for 20 bucks, yeah i feel real stupid, please please please do not buy this game take that 20 dollars and buy one of the previous games in the series that is a true command and conquer game this is not CnC this is EAs attempt to squeeze as much money out of a game as they possibly can. And wtf is wrong with the Super dedicated Rock Paper Sissors style of units? it would be fine if they had COUNTER UNITS that could take on 2 diffrent types at once but there isn't its all just one unit ment to counter another no versatility and that breaks the game it means you just wasted alot of time building one type of unit to counter what you thought the enemy had only to realize he changed his army and before you say OH JUST BUILD A BUNCH OF DIFFRENT UNITS that won't work because you really do need an army of one type of unit to have any impact on the enemy, you could use that stratigy like i tried to but it simply fell apart and i was fighting bots at the time, the class system was interesting for 2 minutes till i found out aggressive support or campy defense is the best way to win. Here are my pros and cons

Pros (the few the proud)
Its a newer take on a stratigy game.

It adds new units to the game.

Works well enough with friends.

I had no lag issues and minimal game crashs.

Fast unistall.

Cons (here we go)
Nothing like any of the other CnC games so I simply can't label it as CnC.

There are no counter units meaning you just have to guess what the enemy is building and build units accordingly.

No base building and no resource gathering which is the corner stone of the CnC universe in terms of gameplay.

Some units are either broken op or so underwelming its just stupid (like the commandos that used to be badass).

Its way over priced.

Gameplay is increadably repetative.

Graphics are subpar to say the least.

The story is the weakest the CnC series has ever had.

If you do play with people its either a steam rolling support that focuses damage or rushing assault. 

There is no balancing in my opinion between the classes. 

No more fight the enemy to the death its now just who can get the most points by capturing points of intrest around the map ( the very limited amounts of maps).

Slow install.

Summary
EA once again found a series everyone loved and worrshipped and decided to destroy is for the sake of money the game is simply not fun its over priced its not CnC, I understand a game needs to evolve but you do need to keep those core elements in the game that make it that game something the devs don't understand and btw at this point in time the game is hacker central so if you do for some reason decide to buy this game have fun with that. 2/10 DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

column8:
Kane ist tot - Kane lebt - leider ist er der einzige, der noch etwas mit Command & Conquer zu tun hat.

Nach vielen Jahren habe ich mir für 5 EUR dieses letzte Puzzlestück zu der tollen Tiberium-Reihe gekönnt, allen Unkenrufen zum Trotz... War ich seit Alarmstufe Rot völlig begeistert und habe seit den späten 90er Jahren alle C&C samt Addons regelmäßig gerne gespielt - sowohl die Missionen, als auch im Mehrspieler-Geplänkel.

RA 1 +2Addons - strategisch eines der besten
RA 2 +1Addon - das witzigste und einfachste zu "Modden" und mit FA2 zu "mappen"
RA 3 +1Addon - hier schlägt es schon eine seltsame Richtung ein, allerdings gibt es eine super Mod, die Alarmstufe Rot 1 quasi auf die neue Engine portiert - top.
TD +1Addon - muss ich sagen, hat mich nie so begeistert, die Mechanik in RA war besser. Storytechnisch aber auch gut.
TS +1Addon - sowohl TiberianSun, als auch Firestorm sind meine absolute Favoriten, da strategisch mehr niemals mehr geboten wurde. Ver#nderbares Terrain, Untergrundeinheiten etc. Geiles Spiel - auch heute noch.
TW +1Addon - Meiner Meinung nach ist das der letzte Teil, der Tiberium-Saga, sowohl Storymäßig als auch grafisch und von der Mechanik. Die Dystopie aus TS/FS fehlt leider manchmal, aber dennoch ein sehr gutes Spiel.
Renegade und Generals lasse ich mal außen vor, da erstes ein FPS und zweites ein relativ realistisches gutes RTS-Game ist, aber mit CnC ebenfalls nicht wirklich etwas gemein hat.

=== Command & Conquer IV - Tiberian Twilight ===

Nach drei Stunden bereuhe ich den Kauf und möchte nicht mehr alles wiederholen, was bereits x Mal geschrieben wurde....

Kurzum:
Alles(!) was Command & Conquer ausgemacht hat, fehlt hier. Zwar wurde das seinerzeit zu Generals auch gesagt, doch Generals war ein echtes RTS - was man von TiberianTwilight nicht mal behaupten kann. Drei Produktionsstätten und irgendein mit XP-Punkten versehende Logik um Einheiten (begrenzt) bauen zu können. Wäre kein Joe C. "Kane" anwesend, in den wenigen Sequenzen, wüsste man nicht, dass man ein CnC in Händen hält.

Dämlich, nicht mal 5 EUR wert. Traurig, dass der gute Name von den Westwood Studios für dieses Machwerk missbraucht wurde. Wo CnC nun steht, wissen wir - im Regal bzw. als billiger Abklatsch als Free-To-Play-Variante...
column9:
Kane is dead - Kane lives - unfortunately, he's the only one still involved with Command & Conquer.

After many years, I managed to get this final piece of the puzzle of the great Tiberium series for €5, despite all the doom and gloom... I've been completely enthralled since Red Alert and have regularly enjoyed playing all Command & Conquer and its add-ons since the late 90s - both the missions and the multiplayer skirmishes.

RA 1 +2 add-ons - strategically one of the best
RA 2 +1 add-on - the funniest and easiest to "mod" and "map" with FA2
RA 3 +1 add-on - this is taking a rather strange direction, but there's a great mod that essentially ports Red Alert 1 to the new engine - top notch.
TD +1 add-on - I have to say, I was never that impressed; the mechanics in RA were better. Story-wise, though, it's also good.
TS +1 Add-on - Both Tiberian Sun and Firestorm are my absolute favorites, as they've never offered more strategically. Transformable terrain, underground units, etc. Awesome game - even today.
TW +1 Add-on - In my opinion, this is the final installment of the Tiberium saga, both in terms of story, graphics, and mechanics. The dystopia from TS/FS is unfortunately lacking at times, but it's still a very good game.
I'm leaving Renegade and Generals out of the equation, as the former is an FPS and the latter is a relatively realistic, good RTS game, but doesn't really have anything in common with Command & Conquer either.

=== Command & Conquer IV - Tiberian Twilight ===

After three hours, I regret the purchase and don't want to repeat everything that's already been written countless times....

In short:
Everything(!) that made Command & Conquer what it was is missing here. While that was said about Generals back then, Generals was a true RTS – something you can't even say about Tiberian Twilight. Three production sites and some kind of XP-based logic for building (limited) units. If Joe C. "Kane" weren't present in the few sequences, you wouldn't know you were holding a CnC in your hands.

Stupid, not even worth €5. It's sad that Westwood Studios abused its good name for this piece of work. We know where CnC stands now – on the shelves or as a cheap, free-to-play copy...

Before I bought it, I knew this game was utter rubbish.

I was mentally prepared for the nightmarish combat, but

I didn't expect it to be even worse than I imagined—the game's all-important experience point system is completely ineffective?!

I thought the first-level tutorial wouldn't give any, and after completing the second level, I still get zero experience points?!

Oh no... I'll never believe everyone's negative reviews again.

column8:
Comprei porque sou Fã da franquia C&C desde PS1

De todos os C&Cs que já lançaram e que eu já joguei esse é de longe o único que não tem nada haver com a franquia, alias não devia nem ter o titulo de C&C, o modo skirmish que era tão foda de ficar batalhando entre as A.I para tentar derrotar todas e controlar o mapa todo agora virou um modo estilo Conquest, não tem coleta de recurso igual seus antecessores, o sistema de upgrade é uma Me#$% foge completamente do contesto de um jogo RTS na qual somente upando de level que você consegue liberar tropas e tecnologias, você pode escolher entre 3 classes(defense, support e offense) para jogar e com diferentes unidades cada classe, necessário estar online sempre e caso a conexão cair você perde todo o progesso, fico triste ao saber que uma franquia tão memorável como C&C acabou tomando o rumo errado e teve esse fim completamente decepcionante .

Essa é minha opinião, fique livre para criticar e opinar.

Às vezes fico pensando se tal rumo não tivesse sido tomado quantos C&Cs já teriam sido lançados e quais seriam seus títulos tipo ex: C&C: Origins of Scrin, C&C: The Battle for Earth, C&C: The other race.
column9:
I bought it because I've been a fan of the C&C franchise since the PS1.

Of all the C&C games I've ever played, this is by far the only one that has nothing to do with the franchise. In fact, it shouldn't even be called C&C. The skirmish mode, which was so awesome, where you battled AIs to defeat them all and control the entire map, has now become a Conquest-style mode. There's no resource gathering like its predecessors. The upgrade system is a complete mess, completely out of keeping with the context of an RTS game, where you can only unlock troops and technologies by leveling up. You can choose between three classes (defense, support, and offense) to play, with different units for each class. You need to be online constantly, and if your connection drops, you lose all your progress. I'm sad to hear that such a memorable franchise as C&C ended up taking the wrong path and having such a disappointing ending.

This is my opinion; feel free to criticize and share your opinion.

Sometimes I wonder if this direction hadn't been taken, how many C&Cs would have already been released and what their titles would be, e.g.: C&C: Origins of Scrin, C&C: The Battle for Earth, C&C: The other race.

column8:
Why fix what ain't broken? Seriously. EA killed the series. 

Cons: 
1. No base building/ tiberium harvesting= loss of the rts feel. What I mean by this is that 4 is more for the starcraft spam multiplayer than anyone else. Without base building or real tiberium harvesting where every purchase is much more impacting in the long meta of a mission, everything here becomes a rock paper scissors contest of what you can deploy to counter 1 to 2 enemy crawlers. Without base building the story also seems totally rushed.
2. The story is terrible. Either way you end up really lossing and with the worst cliff hanger that implies EA not progressing the story past this game. Its like we began with Turtledove, rich in universe detail and description with Tiberium Dawn thru tiberium sun while forgoing character development. then in 3 we hit an SM Stirling kind of narrative with really indepth background about the universe, annecdotes about characters like Havoc from Renegade, and crazy battlefields like red zones and yellow. Then we hit this...this slop. If you are here for the story I suggest you find it elsewhere for Tiberium Twilight will make you hate yourself. 
3. Multiplayer is stupid unbalanced due to unit unlocks versus experience. If you're a new player online prepare to have your first majority of battles to be like Dark Souls; lots of death and much frustration as you have tier I and maybe tier II while your opponent has tier III and more. It's going to be a bad time. hint just rush support. Air OP. 
4. Still too expensive for how bad it is. 

Pros: 
1. Kane is back. Kane backstabs GDI. 
2. Scrin towers actually are explained.
3. Missions are generally quick.

column8: So i've loved Command & Conquer for years, since i was just a kid, but after playing a good hour of this i realized how much the original makers had to sacrifice to give what they could in this final installment. Every new game should have things that make you feel like it's new, and they've gotten feedback, worked with ideas, and have dished out the best they could come up with. This game, saddly, feels like an RTS rendition of a game from the early 2000's. I really wish those who worked on the game had the money and/or cared enough to make this last installment a great success, and a game that would leave a good lasting memory from a series that was the foundation of the childhoods of severl individuals. Fuck EA. I'm so enraged that i care little to look over my comment for any errors.

column8:
Si vous êtes fan de la série C&C, n'acheter pas cet opus, car vous allez être aussi triste que si on vous dit que vos parents sont morts. Le plus gros problème selon moi est l'absense total d'un vrai gameplay de C&C comme on aime.

Premièrement, les unités ne vienne pas de la même façon que les autres opus. Dans cette merde, vous devez montez votre niveau global du jeu pour avoir les meilleurs unités et améliorations d'unités. Donc si vous êtes nouveau à ce jeu et que vous jouez en ligne contre un joueur niveau max, vous allez en chier une bonne. En plus, votre niveau ''global'' n'est pas vraiment global, car votre lvl augmente seulement dans la faction dont vous jouez. C'est à dire que si vous jouez avec le GDI, le Nod va rester à son niveau actuel. 

Deuxièmement, vous n'avez QU'UNE SEULE structure. Vous ne pouvez pas construire par exemple des centrales pour votre énergie parce que vous en avez pas besoin. Les seules structure qu'on peut fabriquer sont les tourelles et autres défenses. Autrement dit, tout ce fait avec votre unique base (appelé Crawler) : création d'unité, amélioration, etc... et sérieusement, je trouve cela vraiment médiocre.

Finalement, le truc qu'on a tous besoin dans tous les RTS est bien sûr la gestion des ressources. Dans ce jeu, il n'y en a pas. Le tiberium, seule ressource du jeu, n'existe plus. D'accord j'avoue qu'il en a encore dans le jeux, mais ça sert seulement à faire avancé vos amélioration plus rapidement. les parties ressemblent plus à du spam de création d'unité. La stratégie n'existe plus dans C&C 4.

Pour conclure, ce jeu est mauvais. Il y a d'autre chose que je n'ai pas parlé comme la sorte de classe que vous pouvez prendre: attaque, défense et soutien. Je trouve cette idée vraiment nulle, parce que vous n'avez pas toutes les variations d'unité (exemple : pour avoir des unités aériennes il faut être soutien). Franchement, j'avais acheté cet opus seulement pour connaître le reste de l'histoire, mais j'ai pas réussi à le finir à cause du gameplay pourri qui me dégoûte. Même en rabais je le déconseille. Ce jeu est la définition même de la déception.
column9:
If you're a fan of the C&C series, don't buy this game, because you'll be as sad as if someone told you your parents died. The biggest problem, in my opinion, is the complete lack of true C&C gameplay, the way we love it.

First, units don't come in the same way as in other games. In this game, you have to raise your overall game level to get the best units and unit upgrades. So if you're new to this game and you're playing online against a max-level player, you're going to have a hard time. Furthermore, your "overall" level isn't really global, because your level only increases in the faction you play as. Meaning, if you play with GDI, Nod will stay at its current level.

Second, you only have ONE structure. You can't build power plants, for example, because you don't need them. The only structures you can build are turrets and other defenses. In other words, everything is done with your single base (called a Crawler): unit creation, upgrades, etc., and seriously, I find it really mediocre.

Ultimately, the thing we all need in all RTS games is, of course, resource management. In this game, there isn't any. Tiberium, the game's only resource, no longer exists. Okay, I admit it's still in the game, but it only serves to speed up your upgrades. Games feel more like unit creation spam. Strategy no longer exists in C&C 4.

In conclusion, this game is bad. There's something else I didn't mention, like the type of class you can take: offense, defense, and support. I find this idea really bad, because you don't have all the unit variations (for example, to have air units, you have to be a support). Honestly, I bought this game just to experience the rest of the story, but I couldn't finish it because of the crappy gameplay that disgusted me. Even on sale, I wouldn't recommend it. This game is the very definition of disappointment.

column9: Rare crap, fortunately it was included. I finally decided to play through the 4th game, watch some tasty cutscenes, and enjoy the strategy gameplay... and what did I see? A piece of shit on legs moving around the map and crafting a limited number of units. And you can't even build a proper base because you're given a choice of three huts on chicken legs (like a base), which in turn specialize in one thing, and you spend hours wanking away moving the base and units. Dota fans will love it. For C&C fans, don't buy it, you'll be instantly disappointed. I've never seen a worse game...

column8:
Глупое и дешевое во всем начиная с главного меню, и заканчивая фирменными роликами с живыми актерами надругательство над великой классикой, которое позиционирует себя как "Эпичной завершение серии"
Плохо все: пятикопеечные анимации, наркоманский дизайн юнитов, невменяемая механика. Термины "баланс" и "глубина" тут даже рядом не валялись. Музыка  - алхай-малхай, алалэй, и монотонная оркестровая тоска. Сюжет и ролики отвратительны.

Надеюсь когда серию решат воскресить, про это позорище забудут.
P.S.
Бедный Джо Кукан.
column9:
A stupid and cheap mockery of a great classic, from the main menu to the signature live-action cutscenes, that bills itself as "The Epic Conclusion to the Series."
Everything is bad: cheap animations, drug-ridden unit design, and insane mechanics. The terms "balance" and "depth" don't even come close. The music is abysmal, a monotonous orchestral dreariness. The plot and cutscenes are disgusting.

I hope when they decide to resurrect the series, they'll forget about this disgrace.
P.S.
Poor Joe Kukan.

column8: "Эпилог". Часть, похоронившая серию. Ммм, эти тупые кардинальные изменения в геймплее, уничтожившие весь игровой процесс, к которому шла серия. Но это только вершина айсберга. Вершина бреда - сюжет игры. Какие-то сопли. Кейн, некогда водивший за нос всё ГСБ (вспомнить хотя бы 3-ю тибериевую войну, применение ионных орудий, ставка на Бойла, подрыв Главного Храма и т.д.), теперь творит какую-то дичь. Легион пропал куда-то. Его больше Нет. Куда делись Избранники? Кто такой Кейн? Что стало с миром Скринов? И многие другие вопросы задавали поклонники серии, а Electronic Arts сказали: "Ребята, идите нaxep! Вы получите сопливую мелодраму с бредовым сюжетом и таким же бредовым геймплеем, не ответившую ни на один вопрос." Вот так работают EA. Я удивлён, что не было хреналион платных дополнений, микротранзакций, цены на игру 5000 и т.п.
column9: "Epilogue." The part that buried the series. Mmm, these stupid, radical changes to the gameplay that destroyed the entire gameplay experience the series had been building towards. But that's just the tip of the iceberg. The top of the nonsense is the game's plot. It's just sappy. Kane, who once fooled the entire GDI (remember at least the Third Tiberium War, the use of ion cannons, the bet on Boyle, the bombing of the Main Temple, etc.), is now doing something crazy. The Legion has disappeared somewhere. It no longer exists. Where did the Chosen Ones go? Who is Kane? What happened to the world of Scrin? Fans of the series asked many other questions, and Electronic Arts said, "Guys, screw you! You'll get a sentimental melodrama with a bullshit plot and equally bullshit gameplay that doesn't answer a single question." That's how EA works. I'm surprised there weren't a zillion paid add-ons, microtransactions, a game price of 5000, etc.

column8:
Bordel, je suis déçu ... mais genre, ils ont enterré le titre Command and Conquer ...

Je suis fan de la saga, j'ai eu le premier du nom sur playstation vers 1997 ...

Mais là, non, déjà, la durée de vie ... ouh la vache, t'en as pas pour ton fric, vraiment pas. Limite, ça vaut 5€ ...

Le jeu dure à peine 7h, j'ai voulu tester le multi, c'est aussi vide que les paroles d'un ministre ...

Tu es content de voir Kane sur la belle cinématique (d'ailleurs, il n'y a que ça de beau à vrai dire) ...

Le RTS qu'était Command and Conquer vient de se prendre un lifting complètement à côté de la plaque, à 6 années lumières de ce que doit être command and conquer: un jeu de stratégie en temps réel, où la conception d'unités est aussi importante que la conception de la base, la gestion des ressources ...

Ici, vous avez ... 3 mega-méca que vous pouvez appeler un à la fois (c'est votre véhicule de construction mobile), chacun a sa propre spécialisation, donc ses propres unités ... donc c'est mort, c'est nul, putain rendez-nous les canons à Ions, les bombes atomiques, les unités lance-flammes, les commandos avec leur phrase fun genre "Tiens, j'ai un petit cadeau pour toi".

Merde, non

Je retourne me calmer sur Command and Conquer Generals, je vais aller construire 300 chars juste pour les voirs s'éparpiller sur la carte et tirer sur ce qu'ils peuvent.

Puis je construirai une douzaine de canon à Ions et je vais faire des dessins sur la face de mes ennemis.

Non, n'achetez pas cet opus ... vous serez déçu ...
column9:
Damn, I'm disappointed... like, they buried the Command and Conquer title...

I'm a fan of the series, I got the first one on PlayStation around 1997...

But no, the lifespan... oh my, you don't get your money's worth, really not. It's worth €5...

The game barely lasts 7 hours. I wanted to try the multiplayer, but it's as empty as a minister's words...

You're happy to see Kane in the beautiful cutscene (besides, that's the only thing that's beautiful, to be honest)...

The RTS that was Command and Conquer has just received a completely off-the-wall facelift, six light years away from what Command and Conquer should be: a real-time strategy game, where unit design is as important as base design, resource management...

Here, you have... 3 mega-mechs that you can call one at a time (they're your mobile construction vehicle), each with its own specialization, therefore its own units... so it's dead, it's rubbish, damn it, give us back the ion cannons, the atomic bombs, the flamethrower units, the commandos with their funny line like "Hey, I have a little gift for you."

Shit, no.

I'm going back to calming down with Command and Conquer Generals. I'm going to build 300 tanks just to watch them spread out across the map and shoot whatever they can.

Then I'll build a dozen ion cannons and draw pictures on my enemies' faces.

No, don't buy this game... you'll be disappointed...

column8:
This is not your typical C&C by any means, the rumors say that this was EA's attempt to push C&C to eSports, but because market was overwhelmed by MOBAs and other quality RTS games, they decided to slap 4 and ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE story on it to lure in loyal C&C fans, and the final product we have now does look and play exactly like it was initially planned to be. The only reason i give this game a positive rating is because i had a tons of fun and positive memories playing it with my friends in coop/compstomp and just skirmish with AI. If you play this game without thinking about past C&C games, it's actually fine, runs great, plays great, looks great. Let's do a breakdown :

Reasons to buy it [b][i]( only if it's on huge sale[strike] and you are desperate[/strike] )[/i][/b] :

 - Tons of fun in COOP with friends or vs AI alone.
 - Very pretty environmental/map design.
 - Sometimes it's very challenging.
 - Visuals.
 - 5v5 players possible.

Reasons to avoid it and tell me that i am stupid for giving it a positive rating :

 - Abysmal plot written by a madman in a few hours. Probably taken from DeviantArt fanfiction section.
 - Questionable units design.
 - Horrible FMV actors performance.
 - There is almost no way to beat campaign alone, it's designed to be beaten in COOP.
 - Unit cap.
 - Has almost nothing to do with C&C, hence no base building or tiberium harvesting.
 - The ending cutscene ( which is the finale of whole C&C series presumably ) is so horrible that you might want to kys after it.
 - Most of the super/special weapons feel weak.
 - You need to unlock units in order to use them.


If reasons to avoid it don't scare you + it's on a huge sale and you have a friend to play it with - then you might want to get it just for collection and full playthrough with people you know. If you're looking for extra content for it - don't. Game doesn't have mod support, but it does have few custom maps.

But if you want some more good old C&C - don't get it, it's not C&C, it won't be fun for you, infact it might leave you with few dead brain cells, just like me.

column8:
DO NOT BUY! GAME IS NO LONGER PLAYABLE!

EA have since discontinued support of this trash game meaning that the CD registration servers and account registration servers for the Always online DRM no longer exist. Therefore you will not be able to launch the game beyond the pregame start up screen.

You're lucky though, This game was the trash that brute forced EA's patented studio/game series killing nails into the sweet price C&Cs coffin.

column8:
My original review in Jan 2016 was very negative due to the game simply not working and so I got a full refund from steam.
In Nov 2017, I paid 63 cent for the game in a sale and it worked fine once I'd input the game key, created a profile at EA games and logged in and played for a couple of hours... here's what I found:

The UI is a thing of nightmares and so full of glitches, you'd need Yuri Prime's psychic ability to directly access the developers mind on how it works.
The game perspective is so near, with a zoom so limited, that you can only go from viewing nasal hair, out to the blackheads covering the nose of a particularly grubby Zone-trooper.
Not that viewing the game is necessary as only being able to produce a handful of units, buildings, etc. due to the tiny resource caps, that you may as well keep the mouse button constantly clicking to make new units as the old ones get destroyed as soon as they emerge.
As for unit capabilities, you can go from nerf to fluffy kitten in a single bound, rendering the entire enterprise as challenging as going for a poo having eaten six buckets of yogurt.
Not that you should bother playing the game at all, as the concept of game-play seems to have eluded the developers who must have been so high on LSD they thought a table leg was interesting.
Thinking on it, I'm embarrassed for the video actors, some of who were in previous C&C incarnations and acted their hearts out in this one, only for it to be a total disgrace.
Oh and by the way – I WANT MY 63 CENT BACK!
column9:
My original review in Jan 2016 was very negative due to the game simply not working and so I got a full refund from steam.
In Nov 2017, I paid 63 cent for the game in a sale and it worked fine once I'd input the game key, created a profile at EA games and logged in and played for a couple of hours... here's what I found:

The UI is a thing of nightmares and so full of glitches, you'd need Yuri Prime's psychic ability to directly access the developers mind on how it works.
The game perspective is so near, with a zoom so limited, that you can only go from viewing nasal hair, out to the blackheads covering the nose of a particularly grubby Zone-trooper.
Not that viewing the game is necessary as only being able to produce a handful of units, buildings, etc. due to the tiny resource caps, that you may as well keep the mouse button constantly clicking to make new units as the old ones get destroyed as soon as they emerge.
As for unit capabilities, you can go from nerf to fluffy kitten in a single bound, rendering the entire enterprise as challenging as going for a poo having eaten six buckets of yogurt.
Not that you should bother playing the game at all, as the concept of game-play seems to have eluded the developers who must have been so high on LSD they thought a table leg was interesting.
Thinking on it, I'm embarrassed for the video actors, some of who were in previous C&C incarnations and acted their hearts out in this one, only for it to be a total disgrace.
Oh and by the way – I WANT MY 63 CENT BACK!

column8:
Having played this game before, I personally would not suggest this game to a Command & Conquer fan because the game is way too different, for example, there's no more base building anymore, the game could be good if it would at least have that.
The Scrins were In my opinion, a nice addition to the Command & Conquer Tiberian series but they decided not to add it on this game which is pretty dumb In my opinion.
You should buy this game only if you tell yourself that this game is NOT a Command & Conquer and if you you don't care about this game not being complexe, the game's pretty easy actually unlike the previous games.
It could have been great but It is not, It feels like they've rushed everything about this game.
4/10
Hopefully we'll see some new Command & Conquer games that are good and much more like the previous ones and hopefully no online DRM or Origin crap...
But wait... It won't happen so I'd simply suggest you to play the older Command & Conquer games that are unfortunately only on Origin (except for Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wrath, Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath, Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3 and Command & Conquer Red Alert 3 - Uprising.
Not counting this one because this game is NOT a Command & Conquer game.
Command & Conquer 3: Red Alert was not as great as the previous ones but they are still fun unlike this, you're not too sure what to do with it after having finishing it at least once.

column8:
If ur expecting a game similar to the older ones, this will fuck u.
U have ur small base, trops and stuff, there is three types of bases u can choose (And switch to in game)
Attack - Attack units (Tanks)
Defence - Footsoldiers, for bunkers and attack. and towers/bunkers.
Suport - Units, mostly repair/heal. some attack. Powers - repair, clocking and stuff (global)

There is a lvl system, so to play with others prepair to grind your way to lvl 20.
They dont even let u join costum games if youre low lvl.

Campain is kinda stupid.
Do this task - get constantly attacked.
You are overrun constantly by shit, and as far as i can tell, GDI campain seems easier than Nods.
Difference between Easy and normal aint that big.
Its practikaly the same, One map there spawned one few less mega tanks to attack me.
Another there spawned few less air suport for a target.

Not saying im bad, well might be true to thou. But ur so limited.

Sure whould be fun to play costom, but theres so few games and they dont let u join. (since i havent grinded enugh and not finished the boring campain yet)

Dont recomend it. If it aint broke dont fix it, and they broke the game. Loved the old RTS games.

column8:
That is a sad truth that both players and the C&C series itself have been stripped off of its well deserved proper ending. EA created a chimera (apparently trying to take likeness of the other RTS titles) forgetting that this game has been an icon and should not be so awfully transformed. Thus dies C&C from house Westwood.

Adding injury to insult the new hybrid of a game is not even enjoyable to play. Tactics and strategy were limited to just positioning your mobile base and produce produce produce units. No money means just keeping the number of units at maximum and trying to utilize their not so useful abilities to win a mini skirmish after another in hope of reaching the mobile (sic!) enemy base to destroy it. The process gets boring after an hour of gameplay. On easy, the AI is practically dormant. On normal, computer produces units all the time that it becomes overwhelming.

I won't rate multiplayer as I dont care about it. I wanted a good and fitting story to end a legendary plot. What did we get? A slap in the face. They might as well just put the credits at the beginning and be done with it. A MAJOR disappointment. I hope someone picks up the torch where C&C 3 left it. Kane WILL be back.

column8:
Если вы хотите раз и навсегда разочароваться в RTS 
Если вы страдаете от своей любви к стратегиям и не можете играть в шутеры или любые другие жанры игр
Если вас привлекает БДСМ но всегда боялись попробовать
Если вам нравится аутичный стиль игры 
Если ваш ребенок увлекся компьютерными играми и забросил учебу  
Если вы окончательно разочаровались в человечестве и ищите дно и глубину его падения
ЭТА ИГРА ДЛЯ ВАС

Плюсы:

Завершение истории не смотря на кучу оставшихся вопросов

Наличие мозга не обязательно

Лысина Кейна

Панацея от игровой зависимости

Незабываемый опыт  - ДА игра действительна вызывает эмоции. Боль, гнев, чувство бесконечного осознания собственной ничтожности и важности твоего мнения как потребителя для злобных корпораций. Всю прелесть космических путешествий,изучения и познания нашей вселенной на личном транспортном средстве - горящая жо"па. Действительно не то что ты мог ожидать от развлекательной продукции, но хей по крайней мере это не бездушный трипл А а игра дарящая эмоции. 

Что бы зайти в игру нужно конкретно потрудится с регистрациями итд итп в случае переустановки еще и проблема с повторной активацией продукта казалось огромный минус и не удобство НО я верю что компания ЕА заботится о вашем здоровье и всячески усложняет вам доступ к этому продукту потому записываю в плюс

Возможность скипнуть заставку ЕА

Минусы:

Не игра - ЭТО прошло контроль качества кампании EA что очень пугает меня даже спустя 5 лет

Нет экономики - да во многих играх ее нет но там хоть есть игра

Краулеры - Есть 3 вида атакующий и 2 бесполезных

Разделение шагалок - кроме бесполезности всего кроме атакующего нет возможности комбинировать войска каждая шагалка рожает только один род войск тоесть по факту у вас даже не передвижная база а ТОЛЬКО военный завод\казарма\аэродром

Армия - Лимит юнитов смехотворен и странное чувство что в 95 я мог построить больше юнитов чем в 2010 не давало покоя.

Геймплей - вся игра сводится к тому что нужно дойти до места и родить юнитов, в случае если задача уничтожить врага нужно сесть своей хреновиной рядом с вражеской и смотреть как две херовины рожают юнитов в жалких попытках уничтожить друг друга

Динамичность - поймите меня правильно смотреть как два юнита стреляют друг в друга по 2 минуты не то что бы увлекательное действие 

Вторичность - в каждой серии игры так или иначе был виден технологический прогресс человечества за время нашего отсутствия но видимо в ЕА решили что "нет игры - нет прогресса" и юниты не то что бы изменились с момента 3 части большенство из них стали даже хуже. Видимо с момента последней войны все малость подзабили на тех обслуживание или типа того) нет конечно же некоторые юниты кочуют по играм серии с первой части но даже в них чувствуется развитие технологий. Тут нам предлогают все тоже самое + штучную пехоту( что на мой взгляд конкретный шаг назад на фоне 3 части)
Так же и замут с протоганистом искуственным интелектом как то в этот раз не зашел.
А глядя на полоски захвата стратегических пунктов упорно пытаешься найти значки Альянса и Орды
Однообразные задачи на протяжении всей игры которые прекрасно дополняют однообразный геймплей

Дегродация качества  - У нас в 3 части был в полне приличный перевод даже названия GDI(ГСБ)Глобальный Совет Безопасности и вообще качество работы Актеров озвучки на весьма приличном уровне. Актерам озвучки видимо давали сначало демо версию игры ибо желания работать (а может быть даже и жить) в их творчестве не чувствуется. В этой  поделке видимо даже локализаторы прошли контроль качества EA(Вместе со сценаристами, и тем человеком который решил отказатсья от основ C&C и переработать из стратегии в говно И мужик который накурил всех паленым красным тиберием...и секретарша которая не дала босу и он решил отомстить человечеству создав ЭТО в волнующем приходе от красного) - ибо только им одним ведомо как то же самое GDI(ГДИ) расшифровать адекватному русскоязычному человеку. Выдать говно за игру. Раскрутить ее так что люди это купят. И впервые в жизни не соврать с названием - это действительно закат....

Знаком с предыдущими продуктами серии - без коментариев просто плачу о покинувшей нас серии 

Стоимость - они хотят денег за то что убили великую RTS  и в итоге превратили ее в ср"ную браузерку

Оценка: Сотрите мне память из 10
column9:
If you want to be completely disillusioned with RTS

If you're suffering from your love of strategy games and can't play shooters or any other game genre
If you're drawn to BDSM but have always been afraid to try
If you enjoy an autistic style of play
If your child has become addicted to computer games and dropped out of school
If you're completely disillusioned with humanity and are searching for the bottom and depth of its decline
THIS GAME IS FOR YOU

Pros:

Completion of the story despite a mountain of unanswered questions

A brain isn't necessary

Kane's Bald Head

A cure for gaming addiction

An unforgettable experience - YES, the game really does evoke emotions. Pain, anger, a feeling of endless awareness of your own insignificance and the importance of your opinion as a consumer to evil corporations. The whole charm of space travel, exploring and understanding our universe in a personal vehicle, is a total pain. It's really not what you'd expect from an entertainment product, but hey, at least it's not a soulless Triple A, but a game that gives you emotions.

To access the game, you have to really work with registrations, etc., etc. In case of reinstallation, the problem with reactivating the product seemed like a huge drawback and inconvenience. BUT, I believe EA cares about your health and makes it difficult for you to access this product in every possible way, so I consider it a plus.

Ability to skip the EA intro.

Cons:

It's not a game - THIS has passed EA's quality control, which still scares me even after 5 years.

No economy - many games don't have one, but at least there's a game.

Crawlers - There are 3 types, attacking and 2 useless.

Separation of walkers - there's no option for anything other than attacking, which is useless. Combining troops: Each walker produces only one type of troops, meaning you don't even have a mobile base, but ONLY a military factory/barracks/airfield.

Army - The unit limit is ridiculous, and the strange feeling that in 1995 I could build more units than in 2010 haunted me.

Gameplay - The whole game boils down to getting to a location and generating units. If the goal is to destroy the enemy, you have to sit your thing next to the enemy's and watch as the two things generate units in a pathetic attempt to destroy each other.

Dynamism - Don't get me wrong, watching two units shoot at each other for two minutes isn't exactly engaging.

Repetition - Each game series has, in one way or another, demonstrated humanity's technological progress during our absence, but apparently EA decided that "no game, no progress," and the units haven't really changed. Since Part 3, most of them have even gotten worse. Apparently, since the last war, everyone has been a bit lax about maintenance or something. Of course, some units have been reused from the first game in the series, but even in them, technological advancement is felt. Here, we're offered the same old stuff, plus individual infantry (which, in my opinion, is a definite step backwards compared to Part 3).
Also, the idea of ​​the AI-powered Protoganist somehow didn't work this time around.
And looking at the strategic point capture bars, you stubbornly try to find the Alliance and Horde icons.
Repetitive tasks throughout the game, which perfectly complement the monotonous gameplay.

Degradation of quality - In Part 3, we even had a perfectly decent translation of the name GDI (Global Security Council), and the overall quality of the voice actors' work is quite decent. The voice actors were apparently given a demo version of the game first, because they didn't want to work (and maybe even live) in their work. It doesn't feel right. Apparently, even the localizers passed EA's quality control in this piece of crap (along with the writers, and the guy who decided to abandon the foundations of C&C and turn it from a strategy game into crap, and the guy who got everyone high on red Tiberium... and the secretary who didn't let her boss have it, so he decided to take revenge on humanity by creating THIS in a thrilling high from red) - because only they know how to decipher that same GDI for a reasonable Russian-speaking person. Pass off crap as a game. Promote it so people will buy it. And for the first time in their life, they can't lie about the title - this is truly the end...

I'm familiar with the previous products in the series - without comment, I'm just crying about the series that's gone.

Price - they want money for killing a great RTS and ultimately turning it into a shitty browser game.

Rating: Erase my memory out of 10

column8: While I love all C&C games, this one kind of bites the bullet...the game play is more mobile than any of the previous ones, there is no base building, there are no super weapons. You have a central mobile base that builds units and are capped based on how many/what type of units you currently have active. If you are new to the C&C universe, DO NOT start here. Go with one of the more classic ones.

column8:
[h1]TL;DR? See Conclusion[/h1]

[h1]NOTE: Related Content[/h1]
Also see my:
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars Review[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/miyumiayase/recommended/24810]Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath Review[/url]

[h1]INTRODUCTION:[/h1]
Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight is a real-time strategy game developed and published by Electronic Arts. This title serves as the official sequel to the critically acclaimed C&C 3: Tiberium Wars  and acts as the final chapter in the decade and a half long Command & Conquer Tiberian franchise.

[h1]PLOT (No Spoilers):[/h1]
The story picks up 15 years after the end of Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath. The Scrin has been defeated, Kane has successfully recovered the Tacitus and the Brotherhood of NOD is merely a shadow of its former self. Despite the Scrin's failed invasion, all is not well as Tiberium now spreads in an ever more rapid rate and human extinction is almost inevitable. The game starts with Kane offering the remaining world leaders a solution to this problem.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ Return of live action cinematics but...(See CON #1)
+ Good sound effects and voice acting
+ Interesting veterancy system with visual upgrade changes for each level of veterancy
+ Good special effects and graphics (but average art style)
+ Interesting new units

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=522954423]Poor costume quality for the live action cutscenes[/url]
- No base building
- No resource gathering
- DRM Stacking (Always Online + Log-in requirement every time you start the game)
- Unlock and account level up system that ruins the game's unit availability: (meaning you can't jump to multiplayer immediately because half of your units are locked.)
- Population Cap
- The game is lore deficient, with a rushed and confusing story
- Poorly written and poorly executed attempt to establish “emotional depth” by giving the Commander a wife that most players won't care about.
- Lack of mission variety and the fun stealth missions were completely removed
- No side bar like the old games; the entire UI looks bad as a whole
- Too much deviation from the C&C source material meaning it neither look nor feel like a C&C game
- Ridiculously low damage and high HP for every unit that results in...(See next CON)
- VERY slow paced action
- Pathfinding problems
- Severe balance issues
- Very short campaign time
- Small and poorly designed campaign maps
- The game as a whole feels rushed and cheap

[h1]NEUTRAL:[/h1]
+/- The 'Crawler / MCV' unit building system is an interesting idea but it shouldn't have been implemented on an already existing franchise such as C&C because it already has an established (and working) formula.

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
A [b]VERY BAD[/b] sequel which stands as an insult to the fans of a 15 year old franchise. In EA's attempt to “innovate,” they failed to see what made the Command and Conquer games fun for a lot of people.

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
[b]NO,[/b] the game is not worth it. I would [b]not recommend[/b] this game to anyone even on a sale, specially if you're a fan of the old games. You're better off buying the previous titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars[/url] and its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24810/]expansion[/url].

[h1]FINAL NOTES:[/h1]
I would have been kinder in my criticism of this game if it did not have the Command and Conquer name on it. Tiberian Twilight would have sold better and would have been received better by the community if it was merely a spin-off rather than the finale of the franchise.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFXJaYY0TOs]This video[/url] expresses clearly what I feel about this game.

--------------------------------------------------------- 
[h1]Like my Reviews? Follow my Curator's Page:[/h1]

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]

The Scrin has been defeated, Kane has successfully recovered the Tacitus and the Brotherhood of NOD is merely a shadow of its former self. Despite the Scrin's failed invasion, all is not well as Tiberium now spreads in an ever more rapid rate and human extinction is almost inevitable. The game starts with Kane offering the remaining world leaders a solution to this problem.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ Return of live action cinematics but...(See CON #1)
+ Good sound effects and voice acting
+ Interesting veterancy system with visual upgrade changes for each level of veterancy
+ Good special effects and graphics (but average art style)
+ Interesting new units

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=522954423]Poor costume quality for the live action cutscenes[/url]
- No base building
- No resource gathering
- DRM Stacking (Always Online + Log-in requirement every time you start the game)
- Unlock and account level up system that ruins the game's unit availability: (meaning you can't jump to multiplayer immediately because half of your units are locked.)
- Population Cap
- The game is lore deficient, with a rushed and confusing story
- Poorly written and poorly executed attempt to establish “emotional depth” by giving the Commander a wife that most players won't care about.
- Lack of mission variety and the fun stealth missions were completely removed
- No side bar like the old games; the entire UI looks bad as a whole
- Too much deviation from the C&C source material meaning it neither look nor feel like a C&C game
- Ridiculously low damage and high HP for every unit that results in...(See next CON)
- VERY slow paced action
- Pathfinding problems
- Severe balance issues
- Very short campaign time
- Small and poorly designed campaign maps
- The game as a whole feels rushed and cheap

[h1]NEUTRAL:[/h1]
+/- The 'Crawler / MCV' unit building system is an interesting idea but it shouldn't have been implemented on an already existing franchise such as C&C because it already has an established (and working) formula.

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
A [b]VERY BAD[/b] sequel which stands as an insult to the fans of a 15 year old franchise. In EA's attempt to “innovate,” they failed to see what made the Command and Conquer games fun for a lot of people.

[h1]WORTH IT?[/h1]
[b]NO,[/b] the game is not worth it. I would [b]not recommend[/b] this game to anyone even on a sale, specially if you're a fan of the old games. You're better off buying the previous titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24790/]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars[/url] and its [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/24810/]expansion[/url].

[h1]FINAL NOTES:[/h1]
I would have been kinder in my criticism of this game if it did not have the Command and Conquer name on it. Tiberian Twilight would have sold better and would have been received better by the community if it was merely a spin-off rather than the finale of the franchise.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFXJaYY0TOs]This video[/url] expresses clearly what I feel about this game.

---------------------------------------------------------

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861651-Miyumi%27s-Review-Corner/]Miyumi's Review Corner (MIRECO)[/url]

column8:
As a child... I played starcraft. I got rekked repeatedly. Shrek couldn't have rekked me better. It was awesome.
Then I played Age of Empires. I was maybe 7, and didn't have to use cheats to win finally.
Then Civilization came, and I finally started to understand strategy.
Then I started playing C&C... I got really good, and my computer could just barely run it and life was great.

I noticed this game on here, and thought.. "Hey, why not give a nod to my childhood and play another rts, I even liked the console one a little, so this should be great!"
I tried.
I really really tried. That was just...
I. Have. No. Words.
I opened a skirmish to learn ( Screw tutorials), and just... What have they done. There were no buildings. You literally make engineers, move your giant walking building spider thingy to the objective... And then crap out a ton more people.
This made me sad. This is the worst thing I have ever seen as far as "rts" goes.

CoD has more strategy to it than this. You disgust me EA.

column9:
This installment isn't like that. Command & Conquer requires you to build bases, collect minerals, and build anything and everything, without limits. But this installment has very limited capacity.
The game is incredibly fast. If it's a little slow, they'll beat you.
Plus, you have to play until your in-game level reaches its maximum to get all the units. You also have to be connected to the internet at all times. If you disconnect, you have to log back in. Plus, you won't be able to level up after the game disconnects.
I played this game for a bit before it disconnected. It took forever to reach my level. The end!

光头说我想回家，GDI不批准，于是打打打打打，后来光头一琢磨还是回家好了，于是就回家了。
以上是扯淡，接下来是评测。
这游戏玩法很新颖啊，简直不像是CNC系列的了，资源抢夺抢点，猜我想起了什么？没错，QQ堂的抢包子！
作为一个十多年的CNC死粉，你要说RA3是CNC系列的败笔，那CNC4简直就是把CNC系列踢入地狱的最后一句斯巴达。多了不说了，伤心了。
column9:
Baldy said he wanted to go home, but GDI wouldn't allow it. So he fought and fought, and then he decided he'd better go home, and so he did.

That's all nonsense. Now for the review.

This gameplay is so novel, it doesn't feel like the CNC series at all. Grabbing resources and grabbing points... guess what reminds me of that? That's right, the QQ Hall bun grabbing game!

As a die-hard CNC fan for over a decade, if you say RA3 was the CNC series's downfall, then CNC4 is the final Spartan that sent the series to hell. No more words, it's heartbreaking.

Le nouveau gameplay est innovant mais il aurait été préférable de le dévoiler avec une autre/nouvelle franchise et

Campagne pauvre, fade et sans réel challenge.
C'est vraiment dommage d'achever l'histoire de cette manière, on a vraiment l'impression que c'est baclé.

Bof bof, à faire pour savoir comment se termine l'histoire du tibérium.
column9:
A sad conclusion to the Tiberium saga.

The new gameplay is innovative, but it would have been better to unveil it with another/new franchise and keep the good old C&C style.

The campaign is poor, bland, and lacking any real challenge.
It's a real shame to end the story this way; it really feels rushed.

Meh, I'll have to do it to find out how the Tiberium story ends.

column8:
Command and Conquer was a classic in the RTS genre. You build a base, expand, create troops, etc...then strategically move to take out your opponents.

If you love Command and Conquer, RTS games, or...games in general, I guess, then stay away from C&C4. It's not even a game, it's a joke. It's so far from the rest of the series, it's mind-boggling, and not only because it plays nothing like them, but because the other games are great and this one is practically unplayable.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this game.

column8: I have been a fan of strategy games for a very long time.  Im a casual player and stick to single player vs ai and campaign themes games.  I was hugely impressed by C&C 3 and enjoyed the Red Alert Series and Generals.  Sadly C&C 4 is a terrible addition to the series.  It adds a confusing system of a mobile base with the ability to generate units on the fly but the system itself is flawed and the game play and visuals are poorly executed.  The campaign missions are confusing and later levels are extremely frustrating because the AI knows what units to utilize and what works while you are trying to get units to work.  Then you have vehicle units that have an ability that requires you to manually reload their weapon so instead of unleashing them and leaving them alone to focus on other events you need to babysit them to make them reload and its not like they have a large cash of ammo but like 30 or so rounds tops and can go through that almost instantly.  Do not get this unless you wish to suffer through the incompetent gameplay to finish the Tiberium storyline, because even i couldnt.

column8:
Après avoir vue différents point de vue, je décide de revenir sur mon évaluation, qui j'admets était trop agressive :)

Je ne suis pas un grand joueur de STR, je joue plus pour le fun que pour la compétition, je n'ai pas joué aux autres Command and conquer, mais je connais les personnages et 
les factions.

[b] Le jeu:[/b]

C'est un STR, avec une toute nouvelle forme de gameplay qui a déplu à la majorité de la communauté, les Crawlers.
Des machines mobiles servant de QG, elle permet de générer différentes unités, de gérer des améliorations, et des constructions pour les crawlers défensifs.
Donc plus de bâtiment, (sauf pour le crawler défensif).

La gameplay est assez simpliste, chaque unité à une unité de faiblesse qui est indiqué sur sa petite "fiche de présentation" en jeu, avec les hp.

Cependant, malgrès que j'apprécie ce jeu, il à beaucoup de mauvais aspect de mon point de vue pour le gameplay:

-La récupération de tibérium, affreusement DURE, qui encourage les joueurs à build des petites unité à bas coup et rapide pour aller embêter les autres joueurs dans
cette récupération, essentielle pour la late game. Systéme de récupération qui a d'ailleurs aussi changé par rapport aux autres Command and Conquer.

-Systéme de snowball trop présent, un mauvais coup et pour remonter bonne chance.

-Trop peu d'unité total sur le terrain à mon goût, 4 juges même pas tous remplies de Devot.

Les mécaniques ont beaucoup changé par rapport aux autres Command and Conquer, cependant j'apprécie les cinématiques, la bande son, les voix en Français, les personnages.

Peut-être que je suis resté bloqué sur ça, que pour moi le seul fait de voir des personnages que j'apprécie dans un jeu qu'il soit bon ou mauvais me suffit à l'apprécier.

J'ai une bonne expérience sur ce jeu auquel j'ai joué un moment avec un ami, l'univers m'a plu, mais je comprends tout à fait qu'il n'ait pas satisfait les anciens joueurs de 
Command and Conquer, étant moi même très sceptique aux changements.

En éspérant encore et toujours une suite. :)
column9:
After considering different points of view, I decided to reconsider my assessment, which I admit was too aggressive :)

I'm not a big RTS player; I play more for fun than for competition. I haven't played the other Command & Conquer games, but I know the characters and
the factions.

[b]The Game:[/b]

It's an RTS, with a completely new form of gameplay that displeased the majority of the community: the Crawlers.
Mobile machines serving as headquarters allow you to generate different units, manage upgrades, and build buildings for the defensive crawlers.
So, no more buildings (except for the defensive crawler).

The gameplay is quite simplistic; each unit has a weakness, which is indicated on its little "presentation sheet" in the game, along with its HP.

However, despite my enjoyment of this game, it has many negative aspects from my perspective in terms of gameplay:

-Tiberium recovery is horribly HARD, encouraging players to build small, fast, low-impact units to annoy other players in this recovery, essential for the late game. The recovery system has also changed compared to other Command & Conquer games.

-Snowball system is too prevalent; one bad hit and good luck getting back on track.

-Too few units on the field for my taste; not even all four judges are full of Devotees.

The mechanics have changed a lot compared to other Command & Conquer games, but I appreciate the cutscenes, the soundtrack, the French voices, and the characters.

Maybe I've gotten stuck on that, that for me, just seeing characters I like in a game, whether good or bad, is enough to make me enjoy it.

I had a good experience with this game, which I played for a while with a friend. I liked the setting, but I completely understand why it didn't satisfy former Command and Conquer players, being myself very skeptical of changes.

Still hoping for a sequel. :)

column8:
I did see that EA made this sequel to the brutal C&C saga and I was sceptic at first, but said why not. After the first 5 minutes of gameplay and visiting the armory (yes, you do have to level up to gain access to units, upgrades, etc) I was even more sceptic. Spent another 5 minutes on the "tutorial" mission and I was utterly surprised. It's magical to see EA ruin yet another game which came, as I said, from a brutal saga in which I enjoyed all the other titles. GJ EA and keep up the good work, not gonna buy any game with your signature on it!

P.S. Windows 8.1 users have fun setting up the game with the graphic settings, took me around 20 minutes for it since it crashed all the time while changing settings (which was less than adequate with options). Oh and I do run GTA V and Witcher 3 on max graphics so my PC isn't an issue for this bit.

I'd rather play the original from 1995.

column8:
这款游戏如果作为一个单独的游戏我觉得还是过得去的，但是作为cnc的续作来说我感觉简直就是坑爹！那奇葩的AI总在一些莫名其妙的地方卡住，大波单位行走更是容易挤成一团然后互相卡位，移动的流畅度感觉上还不如3代，至少3代很少出现单位间互卡出不去的状况……为什么我感觉这AI还不如好几年前的魔兽3？
 最蛋疼的还是结尾，你确定这不是天朝生产的垃圾电视剧？一片空白的场景配上一个感觉就像是拿泡沫糊起来的传送门我第一感觉就是你特么在逗我？
向来都说育碧服务器烂，我只想说EA这游戏的服务器更烂！至少我黑名单和英雄无敌6从来没碰上1个小时断线3次，登陆半个小时各种上不去的情况
买之前我就知道这游戏风评不好，但我依然买了，并不是因为游戏，我只是来看大光头的！
column9:
As a standalone game, I think this is passable, but as a sequel to CNC, I feel it's a complete bummer! The bizarre AI keeps freezing in inexplicable places, and large waves of units tend to get stuck together and block each other's paths. The smoothness of movement feels worse than Warcraft III. At least in Warcraft III, units rarely got stuck in each other's paths... Why do I feel like this AI is worse than Warcraft III from years ago?

The most annoying part is the ending. Are you sure this isn't a rubbish Chinese TV show? A blank scene with a portal that looks like it's made of foam. My first thought was, are you kidding me?

People always say Ubisoft's servers are terrible, but I just want to say EA's servers are even worse! At least in Blacklist and Heroes of Might and Magic VI, I've never experienced three disconnections in an hour or logging in for half an hour without being able to log in.

I knew the game had bad reviews before I bought it, but I bought it anyway. Not because of the game, but because of the big bald guy!

column8:
Okay so i have been a fan of C&C for about 20 years now and I can safely say this is THE most disapointing title I have ever played.

I'll start with a positive though I did like the asthetic, It wasn't half bad, The nod didn't look quite how I'd expect them to but overall it was okay. However that is the only positive I have about the game and not a very strong one at that, now for the negatives.

Lets start with the most glaringly obvious one which i think everyone feels the same and that's the campaign... This had to be written by some emotionless, imbecilic monkey. It literally starts off going THIS NAMELESS CHARACTER IS YOUR WIFE CARE ABOUT HER!!!! (uhhh okay???) Okay seriously why would I care about this character, I've literally never seen them before but the game just expects you to care about her and really really obnoxiously tries shove it down your throat it's insane because aboviously they're going to use her as a plot device. I think a bloody 5 year old can figure that out.
The campaign is insanely short as well I completed the whole thing in about 2.5 hours, that's it... the whole thing.. and like an hour of it is a tutorial. It ends so suddenly as well I was like wait is that it. I just did like 4 missions after the tutorial crap and then poof, done, over. I can only imagine that they were planning on bringing out a tonne of garbage DLC for this just to unlock more campaign missions.

Now for the Gameplay... 
It's terrible just flat out terrible, it's watered down from other games and lacks any sort of depth or strategy.
This is literally it it, You start off with your main "structure" called a Crawler, now you move your crawler to whatever objective you have which is either one of 3 things: Capture thing, kill thing or Defend thing. (defending thing being the most annoying since you have no control over said thing it will generally just run into things and get itself killed, it's like "Hay you know what would be a fun idea, lets walk face first into that big horde of enemies over there. I'm sure things will be completely fine!"). Now as I was saying here's what the gameplay is: Move Crawler to objective, Deploy Crawler, Throw shit at problem until it goes away, move to next objective. That's it, that's all I did, I didn't have to care about what units I built since all i had to do is build the spider tanks with the big ass tesla coil and throw them at the enemy, I didn't even have to worry about them dying since if you build like 3 or 4 engineers everything you have is pretty much immortal anyway. i didn't even have to worry about my base since there's no base building to worry about and the base came with me anyway so screw defenses. Oh and for tech it's literally hay see that red crystal over there? yeah pic that up like 1 or 2 of them and you can INSTANTLY unlock every single bit of tech you want.

So that's it that's C&C 4 in all it's terribleness. The only way I could possibly recommend this game is to play it just to see how bad it is.

column8:
ich habe zwar nur bischen über 2 stunden gespielt aber mir reicht es! Ich habe die schnauze voll von diesen "game".

Jeder der C&C liebt sollte sich diesen teil nicht kaufen weil es einfach kein C&C ist.

Einheiten limit - seit wann das? Das geht gar nicht !!!!!
Taktik - brauchst du keine, man muss nur darauf achten das immer einheiten gebaut werden.
Grafik - war schon viel besser (achtung, Augenkrebsgefahr :-/ ).
Musik - die musik ist einfach eine endlosschleife die gefühlt 10 sekunden sich zu wiederholen scheint.
Sounds - war schon viel besser
Interface - viele Schaltflächen die man erst benutzen darf wenn man weiter ist.
Die Einheiten - Quantität statt Qualität so sieht ein futuristischer Krieg sicher nicht aus (nicht vergessen 50 Einheiten limit, 5 Panzer und schluss). Meiner meinung viel zu viele verschiedene Typen die alle irgendwie nix drauf haben. Übergroße mega Kanonen haben sie alle die minmal schaden machen (soll das witzig sein?)
Baubare Gebäude - gibt es eigentlich keine.
Gameplay - Einheiten bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen bauen und das beste sie kosten nicht mal was weil sowas wie einen Sammler braucht man nicht weil es gar nix zu sammeln gibt!

Ne mal ganz im ernst.
Wenn ich gewusst hätte wie sch***** (sry) der Teil von C&C ist und ich nicht so voreilig auf das Angebot reingefallen wäre, dann hätte ich das game nie gekauft.

Command and Conquer R.I.P.
column9:
I've only played for a little over two hours, but I've had enough! I'm fed up with this "game."

Anyone who loves C&C shouldn't buy this because it simply isn't C&C.

Unit limit - since when? That's not possible!!!!!
Tactics - you don't need them, you just have to make sure units are always being built.
Graphics - were much better (warning, risk of eye cancer :-/ ).
Music - the music is just an endless loop that seems to repeat for what feels like 10 seconds.
Sounds - were much better.
Interface - lots of buttons that you can only use once you've progressed.
The units - quantity over quality - that's certainly not what a futuristic war looks like (don't forget the 50 unit limit, 5 tanks, and that's it). In my opinion, there are far too many different types that somehow don't have any skills. They all have oversized mega cannons that do minimal damage (is that supposed to be funny?)
Buildable buildings - there aren't actually any.
Gameplay - units build build build build build build build and the best part is, they don't even cost anything because you don't need something like a collector because there's nothing to collect!

No, seriously.
If I'd known how crap (sorry) that part of C&C was and hadn't been so quick to fall for the offer, I would never have bought the game.

Command and Conquer R.I.P.

column8: I would not insist on buying this game, with all due respect to EA. This game is nothing alike to C&C3 and is gravely disappointing. The entire layout of the game itself is different and suffers without the classic base-defense. I was hoping that the story would lift off after C&C3: Kane's Wrath, but it seemed to stray from the storyline itself. C&C3 is my top favorite C&C. I am happy that I bought this game for a real cheap ~4$ during this year's Summer sale. I would be furious if I wasted 20$ on this game. I would hope EA would develop a C&C5, but the "fans" insist that they don't even try and let the series die with dignity due to the horrid C&C4. If they are to make a new C&C, it would be like the classic and traditional C&C.

column8:
Игра так себе. Но я предостерегаю вас:
Вы купили игру, зарегались в мухосранском ориджине, активировали ключ и теперь играйте. И если вдруг вам стукнет в голову удалить игру - не делайте этого!!! После очередной установки он попросит у вас заного ключ. Но он уже активирован т.к. прошлый раз вы активировали и 2-й раз нельзя (вот это поворот). А пропустить это нельзя. Если у вас много времени и нервов - можите попробывать написать в саппрот, да и то могут послать.

А еще можно поступить проще - не покупать игру.
column9:
The game is so-so. But I'll warn you:
You bought the game, registered in the backwater Origin, activated the key, and now play. And if you suddenly get the urge to delete the game, don't do it!!! After the next installation, it will ask you for a new key. But it's already activated because you activated it last time, and you can't do it a second time (what a twist). And you can't skip this. If you have a lot of time and nerves, you can try contacting support, but even then they might tell you to leave.

Also, you can do something simpler: don't buy the game.

column9: The game do not match what the C&C games sould be for me.

column8:
Ich war nie ein ausgemachter Fan der C&C-Reihe, aber in C&C 1 oder RA mal ein paar Tanks spammen und Gegner niederballern hat schon immer Spaß gemacht. Die Story war auch ganz witzig, das Technoflair stimmig, und alles in allem ein wirklich hübsches Spiel.

Tja, jetzt war Teil 4 im Sale, und ich dachte mir, schau Dir mal an, wie C&C heute so in modern aussieht. Aber gleich vorweg - was auch immer EA aus C&C gemacht hat, es ist nicht mehr C&C...

Es gibt ein Einheitenlimit, und man kann keine Basis/Gebäude bauen - man platziert einfach sein MBF irgendwo auf einer vordefinierten Fläche, gibt ihm eine von drei taktischen Ausrichtungen (offensiv/defensiv/Unterstützung), und spamt dann nur noch Einheiten. Eine richtig schöne Masse wie bei den alten Teilen kommt dank des strengen Einheitenlimits aber trotzdem nicht zusammen, und so wird einem das Leben künstlich schwer gemacht. Taktikverständnis wird im Prinzip nicht gebraucht, es ist mehr wie ein modernes Clickergame.

Ich hatte gelesen, dass die Kampagne sehr kurz sein soll (es sind wohl 2x7 Missionen), und dachte noch, das halte ich durch. Habe jetzt bei Mission 5 aufgehört und werde stattdessen eine Wand streichen gehen. Der Farbe beim Trocknen zuzusehen macht nämlich viel mehr Spaß als C&C 4...

Bleibt nur noch anzufügen: Schade um den Klassiker. EA ist ein echter Sensenmann der Spielkultur...
column9:
I was never a big fan of the C&C series, but spamming a few tanks and blasting enemies in C&C 1 or RA was always fun. The story was also quite funny, the techno flair was fitting, and all in all, a really nice game.

Well, part 4 was on sale, and I thought, let's see what C&C looks like today in a modern version. But first of all – whatever EA has done with C&C, it's not C&C anymore...

There's a unit limit, and you can't build a base/building – you simply place your MBF somewhere on a predefined area, give it one of three tactical orientations (offensive/defensive/support), and then just spam units. However, thanks to the strict unit limit, you still can't build a really nice crowd like in the old games, and so life is artificially made difficult. Tactical understanding is basically not required; it's more like a modern clicker game.

I'd read that the campaign was supposed to be very short (it's apparently 2x7 missions), and I thought I could handle it. I've stopped at mission 5 and am going to paint a wall instead. Watching the paint dry is way more fun than C&C 4...

All that remains to be said is: What a pity for this classic. EA is a true grim reaper of gaming culture...

column8:
……虽然看了这么多差评但还是凭着对C&C的信仰入了……结果一开始就卡在登陆界面怎么都连不上服务器，想玩个战役而已都不行，ae你特么逗我，游戏内容是好是坏我还没资格评价，但这么一个渣服务器还要每次都联网验证我真特么没法忍。
………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………

……玩过大概20H,明白为什么叫它WTF了，怒删都难以发泄我现在的心情。.蛋疼的人口和等级设定,本来就不想玩久只想速通战役还要在遭遇战上花几个小时刷等级。ai上NOD支援只会出眼镜蛇，对上GDI支援就算是凶残打简单也是被吊打。还有就是万年不变的网络链接问题，连不上服务器意味着游戏也玩不了，好歹你设一个离线模式不行么。最后我想吐槽剧情，朋友说4代剧情渣得要死，个人感觉剧情主线还可以，但就是糟糕的叙事硬-生-生把一个本来至少可称优秀的剧情给毁-掉-了。其他要吐槽的地方我都记不清了。只想说一句——把我的C&C还给我！
      最后客观说一句，这游戏概念和质量其实还是不错的，错就错在他的名字是C&C。要是你喜欢魔兽什么的微操，或者说今年那个灰蛊的小规模战斗，那么这游戏还是适合你。但如果你是因为它是C&C而来，恐怕你要失望了，不建议入，否则会颠覆你的世界观的。当然你说信仰喜+1什么的我也阻止不了你，就像我当时瞎了眼没有管下面一大波红色评价并阻止自己剁手一样。
column9:
Despite reading so many negative reviews, I still bought into C&C out of faith... I got stuck at the login screen from the start, unable to connect to the server. I couldn't even play the campaign. "AE, you're fucking kidding me!" I'm not in a position to judge the game's content, but having to connect to such a crappy server every time is unbearable.

…… ... Finally, I want to complain about the plot. A friend said the plot of the fourth game was terrible. Personally, I think the main storyline was okay, but the poor narrative ruined what could have been at least a good story. I can't remember anything else I wanted to complain about. All I can say is—give me back my C&C!

Finally, objectively speaking, the concept and quality of this game are actually quite good. The only problem is the name C&C. If you like micromanagement like in World of Warcraft, or the small-scale battles of this year's Grey Goo, then this game is for you. But if you came for C&C, I'm afraid you'll be disappointed. I don't recommend it; it will completely shatter your worldview. Of course, I can't stop you from saying +1 Faith, just like I was blindly ignoring the flood of red reviews below and stopped myself from buying it.

column8:
I actually quite enjoyed playing this despite the bad publicity it has. Yes, EA do what they typically do and use a name to sell a game that's completely different from what is expected of it. It probably should have been an offshoot instead of a sequel. If you can ignore that then it's not that bad of a game and has no serious technical problems.

The game is basically just dumbed down and casualised RTS that's good for playing for 30 minutes. All the more complex aspects such as base and resource management are thrown away leaving you with the job of looking after 1 master unit, the Crawler. You collect Tiberium crystals to receive upgrade points and when the Crawler is destroyed it respawns at a drop off point. The Defense type can construct buildings but only buildings such as the Obelisk and Nuke/Ion Cannon which require the Crawler to be alive to operate. Support buildings can also be captured but cannot be destroyed.

I completed the campaign and played some skirmishes. The skirmish mode is a little shallow and some extra customization would have made it much better such as increasing the unit limit for games with more players. I'm going to give it a thumbs up for that at least. If you want or expect a traditional C&C experience then don't get it and stick to C&C 3 or the older games.

column8:
Do not buy this game.

Many people gave this game a bad review because the many changes in the game formula. Is fair to say that this is not a sequel to Command & Conquer, It is much more like a action strategy spin-off. 

That is not the reason why this game is bad, but here are some reasons why you should not buy it:

- Permanent online connection require to play. In the middle of the campaign EA servers went down and now i simply can't play until they decide to go back up. Now i am here, angry, writing a review.

- Requires you to login and input your password every time you start the game.

- Unskippable cutscenes

- Lack of mission variety, is most of the time build troops and walk around the map destroying everything in empty skirmishers style maps. Is really hard to believe that this game was released in the same year that Starcraft 2 came out.

- The new mechanics are really average, there is not much do to. They cut out resource collection, all you do is choose the appropriate MCV to the situation and walk with your troops.

- Units are ultra resilient. It may take minutes of firing to kill an enemy armada. Combat is not fun.

Edit: You also lost the mission progress when the game lose connection.

column8:
I played and loved Command & Conquer since the very first hour on this ol'good 486 PC. It was the early 90's.
A beloved time period. The time of Dune 2 where it was impossible to select groups, only a single unit at a time,

Westwood Studios gave birth to a new kind of gameplay called Real Time Strategy with a game whose name became legendary: Command & Conquer. The war in real time with boobs and rock music. God that was good. That... WAS... Q_Q

Came EA who made this shitty robbery called C&C4. Watched without comparison it may be an interesting game... BUT I can't watch it without comparison because of its name: COMMAND & CONQUER.

EA killed Command & Conquer and give the corpse to be raped by anyone who is clumsy enough to hope the final chapter the C&C franchise deserved. Sorry for being badly disposed like this but I was clumsy enough to believe EA would give (sell) me the C&C4 of my dreams. Instead I had a stinky cadaver wearing a "I'm with stupid -->" T-shirt.

SCREW YOU EA.
RIP Westwood Studios.

PS Excuse my probable mistakes in English which isn't my first language.

column8: Úgy érzékeli elég sok embernek, hogy a CD kulcs már használatban van. Ne vegyétek meg.

This. This is what you get when you have a Command and Conquer game...but remove everything that [b]IS[/b] a Command and Conquer game. Absolute total tosh.

No base building, no resource gathering, no huge army, you [b]HAVE[/b] to have an internet connection at all times even if you're only playing single player, small variety of units that you need to level up to gain access to in the first place...and well, you get the idea.

I tried to get into the game, I really did, but an hour is all I could manage before I made up my mind.

I've played C&C ever since RA95 and loved every other C&C game upto Kanes Wrath. RA3 wasn't [i]too[/i] bad, but it isn't really great either, Uprising again, wasn't [i]too[/i] bad, but not great.

This is just the final nail in the coffin for this franchise...or I guess in EA's terms, this game was the final check on their list of "[b]Excellent Game Franchise's to ABSOLUTELY destroy[/b]"

NotEvenWorthARating/10, as it's just that bad. Kane is [i]very[/i] disappointed.

A fantastic franchise ruined by EA's terrible decision making. Avoid this game at all costs, it honestly isn't worth the money and craps all over the C&C franchise (not just the tiberian universe). 

Terrible story, terrible graphics, terrible controls, no proper base building, no real strategy, cartoon style graphics, no  atmosphere, poor level design... just... overwhelmingly terrible.

Listen to the reviews, it is not worth it. Youtube the custscene videos if you want to know they how butchered the story and endings.

column8: I really liked other games in the C&C series, but this one took half the game out of the equation. There is no economy, no macro game. It's all microed combat. No building, no resources. I really don't like the tech system. Campaign play is a little grindy and recycled, but if the game stayed the same but included bases and resource gathering and an econ long-game, that would be fine, but it doesn't, and I'd give it a 3/10.
