column9: Well, what can I say about the game... Overall, Part 3 was awesome, and I expected the same in Part 4. What I saw was sad. There's no more Tiberium to mine, which is the local currency. And that's the most annoying and horrible thing: in all normal strategy games, you have to do that, but here it's not. And five tanks aren't enough to kill a person; everyone dies for a very long time. Still, I'm a fan of the game and I quite liked it. The graphics, music, and story were a bit lacking. But it's beautifully executed. Overall, 7^3/10

column8:
En el 2012, me acuerdo cuando en el blog de una cosplayer de España había debatído sobre el final de Mass Effect 3, el cual le parecía injusto que el final decepcionara tanto. Yo le había respondido "Si eso es lo único que te ha decepcionado de EA, es porque no has visto el final de Command & Conquer 4. Eso SI que es una verdadera decepcion". Si despues de eso, no ha jugado a esto, espero haberle hecho de alguna forma un favor invirtiendo su tiempo mejor en otra cosa mas interesante, como mirar un muro, por ejemplo xD.

Lo que voy a contar lo digo desde el punto de vista de fan de la saga. Aquella franquicia que me hizo fan de PC por excelencia (mucho antes de Starcraft, Max Payne, KotOR, Medal of Honor, etc) fue, sin duda, Command & Conquer (C&C), mas o menos la 1era instancia para MS-DOS allá por el 1995. Asi que me voy a tomar un tiempo en explicar el drama que aqueja a semejante monstruo que es esto.

Durante la franquicia, su antigua desarrolladora (Westwood Studios, el cual a fines de 1999 fue absorvida por EA) había generado 2 lineas temporales: la 1era basada en la guerra fria entre las potencias occidentales Vs. La Unión Sovietica (URSS) y la 2da en la que se basaba originariamente C&C:  El universo de Tiberium.

 Para hacerlo breve: en la decada del 90 en Europa del Este cae un meteorito con un mineral verde llamado Tiberium el cual empieza a esparcirse por todo el continente, y que consume los recursos y minerales de la Tierra, no obstante, su letalidad con todo ente biótico con que entre en contacto tambien es consumido por el cristal, lo que genera una amenaza grave para la sociedad mundial. Es entonces cuando surge del anonimato una sociedad secreta que adoraba al cristal, conocido como la Hermandad de Nod, liderada por un sujeto megalómano conocido como Kane (el cual se lo considera el mesias, había predicado la nueva era de tiberium para la humanidad, etc. No muere realmente en casi ningun juego). la ONU, para contrarestar a esta organización de que asimilen para ellos solos el cristal, genera una división militar internacional contra el terrorismo conocido como la GDI o Global Defense Initiative. Posterior a esto, entre estas facciónes se generan 3 guerras mundiales (que vendrían a hacer cada C&C de Tiberium) en el que la cantidad de muertos se cuentan por millones, mientras el tiberium casi consume todo el planeta, destruyendo ecosistemas y extinguiendo al ser humano a la par de los conflictos bélicos.

Y es aquí en el que entra la descripcion de este juego. en el 2062, casi 15 años despues de Tiberium Wars. El mundo esta casi totalmente devastado por tiberium, y la extinción de la especie humana es casi inminente... pero un día Kane, se levanta de su siesta, escuchando Joan Manuel Serrat al canto de "Hoy puede ser un gran día", va  a hacer una visita a los directivos de la GDI y les plantea un plan para salvar al mundo del cristal verde y que sean todos hippies, y así salvar la humanidad....

... tiene sentido? por supuesto que no. Pero bueno, sacando el sarcasmo, esto es lo que pasó realmente en este juego. Aparentemente un lider como Kane, el cual declaró la guerra a GDI, y fue participe de genocidios masivos, como hacer desaparecer casi toda europa con una bomba de tiberio liquido, de repente quiere aliarse contra sus peores enemigos con los cuales hizo guerras durante 80 años, para reparar el mundo (¿?) cuando él mismo quería que el planeta sea consumida por él....
Si no tiene sentido, está el guionista del juego, un tal Sam Bass, que se merece una patada en el trasero por esto. Supuestamente ESTE iba a ser el ULTIMO juego del universo de Tiberium... y así lo dejó.

 Que desastre... y otros se quejaban del final de Mass Effect 3...

Ok, con respecto al juego, que tenga el titulo de C&C no implica que se sienta como uno. Este juego es el intento de EA de hacer novedad en la franquicia, generando un MOBA, pero destruye lo que hizo clásico al C&C, poniendo limite de población, y sacando la construcción de bases, y NO HAY TIBERIUM (hay algun cristalito por allí en los mapas para mejorar poderes, pero no hay lo mas importante del juego!) por ende, no hay recolección de recursos. La idea es hacer un edificio móvil (Crawler) que permite la construcción de unidades de forma inmediata. Las conquistas de los mapas, se tratan de capturar diversos puntos estrategicos hasta que se alcance el limite de puntos, en multiplayer. Aunque llevado a la práctica, el juego es divertido y los mapas estan bien realizados a la par de que los combates no se detienen por nada, aquí no hay casi referencia a nada de command & conquer que lo hiciera famoso. Además para aquellos que se hayan comprado el juego, 1ero tienen que jugar la campaña para luego entrar al multiplayer, porque tiene un sistema de progresión de arsenal que se comparte tanto en single como en multi, por ende muchos se aprobechaban de esto y destrozaban a noobs por este tema. A pesar de esto, reconozco que el gameplay es bastante entretenido y divertido, pero se siente muy parecido a un Dawn of War 2, versión 2.1 en lugar de que se sienta como un C&C

Para aquel que sea casual, este juego le va a resultar interesante, porque su gameplay es frenético y las unidades son bien variadas, pero para el fan hardcore, sabiendo que este sería el final de 15 años de C&C, esto es un disparo a quemarropa al corazón (EA no piensa volver a este universo, solo utiliza un juego de Facebook horrendo en su lugar), así de simple ... al menos que seas capaz de dejar eso de lado y disfrutar el juego simplemente por lo que es y pensar de que  la historia de Kane pudo haber concluido mejor de lo que tristemente fue.
column9:
Back in 2012, I remember a Spanish cosplayer discussing the ending of Mass Effect 3 on her blog, and she thought it was unfair that it was such a disappointment. I responded, "If that's the only thing that disappointed you about EA, it's because you haven't seen the ending of Command & Conquer 4. That's a real disappointment." If you haven't played this game since then, I hope I've done you a favor by spending your time doing something more interesting, like staring at a wall, for example. xD

I'm telling you what I'm about to say from the perspective of a fan of the series. The franchise that made me a PC fan par excellence (long before Starcraft, Max Payne, KotOR, Medal of Honor, etc.) was, without a doubt, Command & Conquer (C&C), more or less the first instance for MS-DOS back in 1995. So I'm going to take a moment to explain the drama that plagues such a monster.

During the franchise's run, its former developer (Westwood Studios, which was acquired by EA in late 1999) had generated two timelines: the first based on the Cold War between the Western powers and the Soviet Union (USSR), and the second, on which C&C was originally based: The Universe of Tiberium.

To put it briefly: in the 90s, a meteorite with a green mineral called Tiberium falls in Eastern Europe, which begins to spread throughout the continent, consuming the Earth's resources and minerals. However, its lethality with any biotic entity with which it comes into contact is also consumed by the crystal, which poses a serious threat to global society. It is then that a secret society that worships the crystal, known as the Brotherhood of Nod, emerges from anonymity. It is led by a megalomaniac subject known as Kane (who considers himself the messiah, had preached the new era of tiberium for humanity, etc. He doesn't actually die in almost any game). The UN, to counteract this organization from assimilating the crystal for themselves, creates an international military division against terrorism known as the GDI or Global Defense Initiative. After this, three world wars erupt between these factions (which would be the basis of each Tiberium C&C) in which the death toll numbers in the millions, while tiberium nearly consumes the entire planet, destroying ecosystems and extinguishing humankind alongside armed conflicts.

And this is where the description of this game comes in. It takes place in 2062, almost 15 years after Tiberium Wars. The world is almost completely devastated by tiberium, and the extinction of the human species is almost imminent... but one day, Kane wakes up from his nap, listening to Joan Manuel Serrat singing "Today Can Be a Great Day," and goes to pay a visit to the GDI executives and proposes a plan to save the world from the green crystal and for everyone to become hippies, thus saving humanity...

... does that make sense? Of course not. But anyway, sarcasm aside, this is what really happened in this game. Apparently, a leader like Kane, who declared war on GDI and participated in mass genocide, such as wiping out almost all of Europe with a liquid tiberium bomb, suddenly wants to ally himself against his worst enemies, with whom he waged wars for 80 years, to repair the world (?), when he himself wanted the planet to be consumed by him...
If that doesn't make sense, there's the game's scriptwriter, a certain Sam Bass, who deserves a kick in the ass for this. Supposedly, THIS was going to be the LAST game in the Tiberium universe... and he left it at that.

What a mess... and others were complaining about the ending of Mass Effect 3...

Okay, regarding the game, just because it's called C&C doesn't mean it feels like one. This game is EA's attempt to make the franchise unique by creating a MOBA, but it destroys what made C&C classic by imposing a population limit and removing base building. THERE IS NO TIBERIUM (there are some crystals around the maps to upgrade powers, but the most important part of the game is missing!), therefore, there is no resource gathering. The idea is to make a mobile building (Crawler) that allows the immediate construction of units. Conquering the maps involves capturing various strategic points until the point limit is reached, in multiplayer. Although in practice, the game is fun and the maps are well done, while the combats never stop for anything, there is almost no reference here to anything from Command & Conquer that made it famous. Also, for those who have already purchased the game, you first have to play the campaign before entering multiplayer, as it has an arsenal progression system that is shared in both single and multiplayer, so many took advantage of this and destroyed noobs for this reason. Despite this, I recognize that the gameplay is quite entertaining and fun, but it feels very similar to Dawn of War 2, version 2.1 instead of a C&C.

For the casual, this game will be interesting because its gameplay is frenetic and the units are quite varied. But for the hardcore fan, knowing that this would be the end of 15 years of C&C, this is a point-blank shot to the heart (EA isn't planning on returning to this universe, just using a horrendous Facebook game instead), simple as that... unless you're able to put that aside and enjoy the game simply for what it is and consider that Kane's story could have ended better than it sadly did.

column8:
I am 28. I experienced most Westwood titles (c&c 1 / ra 1 ...) and this is by far, the worst in the serie but not only that, it manages to be THE biggest disappointment in the RTS history:
Gradually when went like => C&C 3/ Kanes Wrath (great) => Red Alert 3 (average) => RA3: Uprising (horrible) => C&C 4 (TERRIBLE).
In short: No more base building, Joe Kucan (Kane) doesn't act that well anymore and is an hero (... after being the anti-hero for 15 years...), no defensive strategies (you need to capture points and thus need to go all-on offensive else you lose)...
So many failures in such a great franchise.
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

column8:
Its a fine game. Its not as fun as the old command and conquers but it gets more right then wrong...kind of. it has good graphics,fun multiplayer, decent combat but suffers from some problems like how every unit is a tank, the awful rock paper system, the story is....just the worse and there are just most units that are there just to fill a requirement rather than bring fun new tatics. The game also has the best units in the game locked behind a level wall buuuttt the leveling was made me play for as long as i did and the voice acting is nice tooo. 

Oh the game also has drm which means it can't be a classic like its predecessor's.
Its ok but very underrated.

5/10 average

column8:
EA continue to kill the most famous RTS franchise ever made.  Main annoyance with this game is the camera is zoomed in too close on units - so even at high resolution you have a very limited view of the action.  The game's innovations (selecting one of three tech types before starting the match; mobile base building; RPG experience system) are cumbersome and bring very little to the table.

Waste of money - consider RUSE / Sins of a Solar Empire:  Rebellion instead.

I've played my time now, so here are my thoughts:

positive:
-interesting storyline
-new gameplay
-easy to learn
-balanced to some extend

negative
-just 11 Level one has to get as Commander
-short story
-depending on how you play, multiplayer games might end onesided

So if you enjoy the multiplayer mode of RTS games, you should buy this one. If you are a fan of storylines, 10€ are too much.

column8:
This is a vast departure from Command and Conquer. There is no base building, uninspired and somewhat lackluster units, and a weird leveling system (you unlock units as you gain levels so someone with level 10 units could join your campaign and breeze you through it hilariously). The multiplayer is not much better. 

The story is forgettable and the acting is mediocre. This game can be avoided altogether.

column8:
If you are contemplating buying this because of your history with C&C. Don't waste your time. A monkey could shit better game design. Do yourself a favor and keep your eyes off this one. I bought it on a whim thinking C&C? All the rest were good, why not this one? Immediately put-off by the no base/resource management system. Pick your class? When....when do you choose your class at all throughout this or Red Alert's game series'. What made them think this was a great idea? Innovation? CREATE A DIFFERENT SERIES! Everyone was expecting C&C, instead what we got was the pointy end of the sword that was shoved through the Tiberian series' back. Covered in straight up shit. 

(1)"This whole [i]franchise[/i] is in danger of being covered in a huge cloud of.....sshhhhhit!" 
(2)"Huge cloud of shit?! Wooowww! I think I smell it, come on! Let's go! Come on [i]Red Alert,Tiberian Sun[/i]!!............Hey everybody there's a shit cloud comin'! Run for your lives!"

*Original quotes taken from the movie "Kingpin", [i]1996[/i]. Actors (1) Woody Harrelson and (2) Randy Quaid.

column8:
I would recommend this game for a few reasons only. First off the gameplay is NOTHING like any other C&C game, there is no base building, no resource collection, and no big strategy.  This game does have a good story line to it, I’ll give them that, and that's why I recommend this game.  Most people love games not for the gameplay or graphics, but for the story line, and this game has a good story line.  This game may be nothing like any other C&C game, and that’s another reason why I would recommend it, it's new, not just a knockoff of the other games, it's different, and some may hate that, I don't like it but I respect that they tried something new.

Now if you’re new to Command and Conquer let me say I would not recommend this game to you, if you want to get into this franchise then try out C&C Generals, or if you looking for something on Steam, then try Command and Conquer 3 Tiberium Wars.

This is the ruination of a legacy the likes of which is only matched by the Highlander: the Source, the prequel Star Wars films and Spiderman: One More Day. They destroyed everything that made the games great, turned it into some kind of DotA rip-off, which is ironic in itself and produced a story twist that makes literally NO FUCKING SENSE.

I keep coming back to this as an example of how completely a franchise can be ruined. Don't buy this game, don't even download it illegally. If you have to know what happens, look it up on the wiki and make sure you're not drinking anything.

column9:
So first of all, yes, it's not C&C in the true sense of the word... I just don't think the reviews are justified. Sure, 16 hours on hard isn't exactly a lot of time for a single-player mode...

As for the story, it's unimaginative and relatively pointless... namely Nod vs. Nod, GDI vs. GDI, and Nod vs. GDI... without the aliens.

However, looking at the gameplay purely objectively (independent of C&C), I just think it's a bit new, and once you get used to it, it's quite fun to play. Personally, I miss an offline or dedicated mode at LAN parties... but it's fine with a bit of internet access...

Positives:
-Easy-to-learn gameplay
-Simple leveling, which makes it easier for beginners to get started
-A nice way to pass the time in between
Negatives:
-No comparison to C&C (no matter which game)
-No need to build a base
-Stupid AI

column8:
Took me almost half an hour to start this up because the required registration page wouldn´t allow me to create an account. (Support also requires you to be logged in already, I bet the guys at EA find that hilareous)

The point where I could not go on because it was so ultimately boring was about an hour into the game.
Until then I really suffered through the bad interface and the annoyingly low zoom out possibility.

There are other RTS franchises out there already that are a lot closer to what a good C&C used to be. 
Have a look for them instead, your money is not only invested much better, they also actually deserve the support. 

I had this in my library for quite some time since it was part of a bundle. 
This was a good reminder for me why I stay clear from EA titles as much as I can.

column8: started playing command and conquer since it came out in '95. this one is HORRIBLE. i was so jazzed up to see what would come next in the story after tiberium wars and kane's wrath and i was left with the utmost feeling of dissatisfaction. videos are cheezy and look poorly filmed. previous cnc games' vids felt almost like a movie. no base building? no harvesting? ea took a giant shit on this franchise and totally used the name of command and conquer to sell this turd under false pretenses. this is the worst thing to come out of ea; even worse than origin (which is saying something). i don't normally write reviews for games but this one was so crappy that it compelled me to tell people to stay away. STAY AWAY. erase this game from the saga just like indiana jones 4. 0/10.

column9:
That was the last EA game I ever bought. Unfortunately, they have a knack for constantly messing up all the purchased brands and putting their own stamp on them.

The game doesn't have much in common with the original anymore. I can only agree with most of the players' comments.
I grew up with the series and can still remember the first time I held the DOS version in my hands and was proud to be able to play it on my 80486 100 MHz DX2.

It's a shame the series had to end like this, and I wasn't able to find out more about the game and would have been spared such disappointment.

Good bye C & C, rest in peace!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

column8:
Они говорят нам: Мы очень старались. Игра отличная. Игрокам надо просто не подходить предвзято к новому геймплею.

Ок. Не подхожу. Игра - шлак. Игра в жанре, на секундочку, стратегии, в которой стратегия редуцирована до таскания краулера за войсками по полю боя, а тактика - к определению по принципу "камень-ножницы-бумага" нужного рода войск для текущей ситуации и накликиванию их необходимого количества в панели заказов.
Отстройка базы? Добыча ресурсов? Планирование развития? О чём вы - всего этого больше нет.

Что осталось на том же уровне - это сюжет и видеовставки. Первый логично завершает историю (хотя, сколько раз уже казалось, что она завершена), а вторые - традиционно отыгрывают это событие с выдающимся пафосом и мастерством актёра театра самодеятельности химкомбината. Разумеется, это нисколько ни умаляет игру, поскольку является её, своего рода, визитной карточкой. Умаляет её то, что чтобы получить "тот самый" сюжет на "тех самых" роликах приходится продираться через уже помянутый всуе чудовищный геймплей.

Что в итоге? В итоге ничего. Игры нет. Остался какой-то обрубок расчитанный на некую абстрактную "новую аудиторию", которая должна, внезапно, появиться в старом сеттинге. Что до меня - если бы была возможность сдать игру назад и получить назад свои деньги - сделал бы это незадумываясь. В конце концов, если бы я хотел поиграть спинным мозгом, запустил бы CoD, Crysis или FarCry.
column9:
They tell us: We tried really hard. The game is great. Players just need to be open-minded about the new gameplay.

Okay. I don't qualify. The game is garbage. It's a strategy game, mind you, where strategy is reduced to dragging a crawler after troops across the battlefield, and tactics are reduced to determining the right type of troops for the current situation using the "rock-paper-scissors" principle and clicking the required number in the order panel.
Base construction? Resource extraction? Development planning? What are you talking about—all that's gone.

What remains is the same: the plot and cutscenes. The former logically concludes the story (though how many times has it seemed like it was over), while the latter, as usual, play out this event with outstanding pathos and the skill of an amateur theater actor at a chemical plant. Of course, this doesn't detract from the game in the least, as it's its calling card. What detracts from it is that to get "that" storyline in "those" cutscenes, you have to wade through the aforementioned monstrous gameplay.

The end result? There's nothing. There's no game. What's left is some stump designed for some abstract "new audience" that's supposed to suddenly appear in the same old setting. As for me, if I had the chance to return the game and get my money back, I'd do it in a heartbeat. After all, if I wanted to play with my brain, I'd fire up CoD, Crysis, or FarCry.

column8:
ABSOLUT GRAUENVOLL
Nachdem in den Vorgängern so viele Möglichkeiten gegeben wurden ein packendes und spannendes Finale aufzubauen, macht dieses Machwerk im Grunde alles zu Nichte für was Command & Conquer steht. Basisbau und das Sammeln von Tiberium flogen raus, stattdessen Einheiten auskotzen und nerviges Mikromanagement. Eigentlich ist das Spiel unwürdig den Schriftzug C&C im Namen zu haben, denn für die Kampagne muss man sich wirklich schämen. Kane hat so viel Stil und Klasse verloren. Immerhin macht der Multiplayer einigermaßen Spaß, obwohl es schon fast Richtung MOBA geht. Schade.
column9:
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE
After the previous games offered so many opportunities to build a gripping and exciting finale, this piece of work essentially undermines everything Command & Conquer stands for. Base building and collecting Tiberium were eliminated, replaced by puking up units and annoying micromanagement. The game is actually unworthy of having C&C in its name, because the campaign is truly a shame. Kane has lost so much style and class. At least the multiplayer is somewhat fun, even though it's almost MOBA-like. What a shame.

column8:
Sooooo............. C&C 4: Tiberian Twilight..........
I've have been a C&C fan since I was 4, aka from 1998. The first game was perhaps the first game I have ever got and was the series that got me into both gaming and real time strategy games. So as you can see, when I heard abotu C&C 4, I was prepared to enbark on a good bye party for my beloved franchise. However, I had to scrap it when a leaked beta information on the gameplay changes the game was gonna make. Therefore I avoided the game like the plague. Once the game was finally released, did I feel guilty of having to abandon the party?
Apparently not cause not only did the reviews show little discouragement but 98% of all the C&C fans like me cryout in anger for the series. Obviously this game recommendation from me was Hell no (and I'll repeat it again at the end for those who are too lazy to read this and skips to the end. 
So why is the game bad? Well the first problem is the gameplay. The gameplay in terms of C&C gameplay felt like it was design by satan. Rather than traditional gameplay where you would collect resources and build both a base and an army to conquer your enemies, the game went Moba like based game with a unusual population limit (which drew me away from the game) and a requirement of playing from other people. Another thing that the game is known to have been hated on is the story. Now I haven't played the campaign but from what I heard, it's a cluster f*(k. 
So is there one thing I like about the game? well......... I do actually enjoy the music which is actually pretty good.
In conclusion, if it wasn't for C&C being in the game, it could have been ok, but the C&C is a perminate damage to the game for I have to say I do not recommend the game

For people who want to skip to the conclusion on whether to own the game or not, the answer is HELL NO.

column8:
My review is based on my personal experiences and with the background of having played and enjoyed Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars right before purchasing this game. It is to be said that this game and its dynamics, even the approach to it all, differ fundementally from the previous installment. The game is rather based on having mobile bases, not only encouraging of establishing only temporary bases, but even forcing you to hastly settle down only to for the most urgent actions and to move on in a giant caravan of units and your mobile command/construction building in order to survive. In the sense that [spoilers!] the planet is a Tiberian wasteland invaded by an Alien species in this installment, it gives off this nomadic post-apocalyptic feeling, which might be quite matching but hurt the gameplay experience in my opinion. Everything feels less permanent, rather like an action-packed campaign mission where your goal is not to build up a base and start offensives from there, but to utilize the little you have to outsmart your (in this case, also) mobile enemy.
I personally love building up a base and having the responsibility of using terrains to defend its chokepoints and entrances. I was surprised and rather disappointed after playing the third installment just before this one. The graphics are less realistic and although this might have been the intention of the developers to return to the 'semi-comic'-feel, it felt sloppy and like being let down after CnC 3: Tiberium Wars.
column9:
My review is based on my personal experiences and with the background of having played and enjoyed Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars right before purchasing this game. It is to be said that this game and its dynamics, even the approach to it all, differ fundementally from the previous installment. The game is rather based on having mobile bases, not only encouraging of establishing only temporary bases, but even forcing you to hastly settle down only to for the most urgent actions and to move on in a giant caravan of units and your mobile command/construction building in order to survive. In the sense that [spoilers!] the planet is a Tiberian wasteland invaded by an Alien species in this installment, it gives off this nomadic post-apocalyptic feeling, which might be quite matching but hurt the gameplay experience in my opinion. Everything feels less permanent, rather like an action-packed campaign mission where your goal is not to build up a base and start offensives from there, but to utilize the little you have to outsmart your (in this case, also) mobile enemy.
I personally love building up a base and having the responsibility of using terrains to defend its chokepoints and entrances. I was surprised and rather disappointed after playing the third installment just before this one. The graphics are less realistic and although this might have been the intention of the developers to return to the 'semi-comic'-feel, it felt sloppy and like being let down after CnC 3: Tiberium Wars.

column8:
Make sure you come in to this with some background reaserch under your belt, This is nothing like the command and conquer franchise you have played before. admitidlly they have tried something new but it hasnt worked. to much has been taken away from the core gameplay of a real time stratagy to make it worth your time.
Always online DRM
No base building
No rersource managment
Low unit cap
No tactical advantage to any units
its boring repetitive and wont make you thing the way this genre of game is supposed to. if I could give it back I would

column8:
Ссанина. Печальный конец истории о тибериуме. Совершенно не хватило сил освоить идиотскую новую систему управления. Да, теперь вам не датут строить базу, а вынудят управлять гигантской ходячей постройкой - Краулером. Все то, за что я любил С&C: строительство базы и её развитие, гибкое управление, интересный дизайн юнитов... всё здесь похоронено. Теперь вам придётся гонять этот краулер по всей карте вместе с лимитированным количеством юнитов-близнецов.

НИРИКАМИНДУЮ КАТЕГОРИЧЕСКИ. 299 рублей, в своё время заплаченных за неё, жалко.
column9:
Ssanina. A sad ending to the Tiberium story. I completely failed to master the idiotic new control system. Yeah, now you're not supposed to build a base, but are forced to control a giant walking structure – a Crawler. Everything I loved about C&C: base building and development, flexible controls, interesting unit design... it's all gone. Now you'll have to drive this crawler all over the map with a limited number of twin units.

I ABSOLUTELY DON'T. The 299 rubles I paid for it back then are a waste.

column8:
It is not often that I am disappointed and depressed by a video game but unfortunately C&C4 has got to be one of the most awful games I have ever had the misfortune to have played.  Before I start the criticism of the game, I feel that it would be fair to mention the one redeeming feature because there is only one and that is Joe Kucan reprising his role as Kane, about the only thing satisfying for a long time fan of the series such as myself.  Now on to the downsides.

1. The complete lack of base building and resource gathering.  How you can even label this game as an RTS without these core elements is beyond me, instead of the staples of the RTS genre, units cost a certain amount of "Command Points" and that's it.  No tiberium, nothing to be gathered or collected or used tactically, just a limit placed on you at the start of the game and boom click a button, create units up to the limit and that's it, that's the extent of resources in the game.  And as for base building, much the same applies, you have a power limit so you place down a certain number of defensive turrets up to the limit and that's really all there is to it - on both fronts a complete lack of anything in-depth, evidence of a second rate game aimed at a minor market being shoe-horned into something much bigger than it actually is intended to be.

2. The units/maps/graphics.  The units provided at the start of the game are weak and ineffectual so in order to obtain more units you level up and then unlock them which sounds like a fairly simple concept, that is until you realise that exp. for leveling up is difficult to come by.  The lack of exp. becomes apparent after still not being awarded any after completion of the third mission in the story meaning that in order to progress your tech, hours of play time is required to unlock even just mostly mid-range units.  The weakness of initial units isn't alleviated by the fact that you can make large numbers as the Command Point limit applies so you are restricted to small squads of units, not the massive armies you expect from an RTS game.  To go with the theme of a small number of units, the maps which battles are conducted on are best summed up as tiny, cramped arenas with very little room for manouvere meaning it's goodbye to any tactical thinking and hello to comabt which feels scripted and unintelligent.  As if the unit/map situation was not already bad enough, this steaming mass of disappointment is served up in a graphical style more akin to a comic book setting, gone is the sleek, futuristic, powerful look of C&C3, it is instead replaced by  out of place, chunky, Megablocks style units, which completly destroys any sort of serious mood the game intends to create.  The graphical style of C&C4's units is so far removed from C&C3's that they're not even in the same universe, nevermind the same page.

3. The story.  It's fairly obvious that the story is terrible from pretty much the word go as one of the first scenes has you, as commander, greeted by your wife.  Yep, that's right, your wife because that's just what an RTS story needs, a bullshit love interest forced into the game.  From then on the story goes rapidly downhill, not aided by the dire acting of all those involved (with the exception of Joe Kucan) and then ends with the equivalent of "And they all rode off into the sunset and lived happily ever after."  Seriously? After having fought now at this time 4 Tiberium Wars, having battled across the globe and faced all manner of foes whilst still wondering about the mystery of Nod and Kane and what the ultimate goal could be, it ends with "Kane and all of Nod travel through the alien tower and leave GDI behind on a tiberium-free Earth having left them peacefully".  I have to wonder what it is with EA and their amazing ability to consistently screw up epic storylines and disappoint faithful fans of a beloved genre because that ending is just utter horseshit and reeks of a rushed writing crew being forced to pull something out of their asses.

So to conclude, C&C4 fails to deliver on all fronts: from dreadful mechanics and weak units, to poor acting and a storyline that could arugably have been concieved by a 5 year old, C&C4 smacks of poor quality, despiration and coporate greed.  A truly disappointing end to a great series, something that should not have come to pass.  I cannot urge you strongly enough, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

Oh and one last thing... EA please if you would kindly go fuck yourselves bloody with a rusty sword that would be greatly appreiciated, you cunts.

column8:
Un jeu qui n'est pas digne de son prédécesseur. L'histoire est incompréhensible, le gameplay est novateur mais démoli par un système de grade inutile pour débloquer les unités en multijoueur. 

Niveau graphisme, c'est pas une claque mais il est correcte. Honnètement, ce jeu part d'une bonne initiative d'inovation mais on sent très vite une répétitivité qui s'installe en multijoueur et un scénario beaucoup trop pauvre en mission. 

J'ai fini la campagne du Nod en coop en moins de 4h et sans comprendre le début et la fin. 

Si vous voulez débuter cette série, passer votre chemin, le 3 est bien meilleur ! Tout est à jeté sur celui-ci.
column9:
A game that doesn't live up to its predecessor. The story is incomprehensible, the gameplay is innovative but undermined by a useless rank system for unlocking units in multiplayer.

Graphically speaking, it's not a blast, but it's decent. Honestly, this game starts off with a good innovation, but you quickly feel repetitiveness in multiplayer and a story that's far too weak in missions.

I finished the Nod campaign in co-op in less than 4 hours without understanding the beginning and the end.

If you're looking to start this series, move on; the third one is much better! This one is worth throwing away everything.

column9:
As a fan of the C&C series, I couldn't help but jump into the latest installment!
What a disappointment: they've removed base building and Tiberium harvesting. In short, a complete overhaul of the series' gameplay.
Not to mention that it'll only take you 10 hours to complete the game...

I can only recommend this title to fans of the series!

column8:
Dieses Spiel ist eine Frechheit! Wenn ich gewusst hätte wie schlecht dieses Spiel ist, hätte ich es mir nicht gekauft. Lustigerweise sieht man während des Sales nur positve Wertungen...EA ist ein echter Dreckskonzern geworden der seine Franchises melkt ohne Ende. Wenn Ihr ein RTS haben wollt aus der C&C Serie mit GDI und NOD, dann kauft euch C&C 3.

Sowohl Menüführung als auch Ingamesteuerung sind sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig, eher unübersichtlich(ich hab zuviele RTS gespielt als das ich mit Steuerungen nicht zurecht käme)
Das Erfahrungssystem ist möchtegern innovativ und unzureichend erklärt, wegen fehlender Top-Down-Struktur(besser bekannt als Talentbäume, weil gibt keine)
Zudem sieht die Grafik wie von nem Konsolenport aus, alá PS2(Ultra-Hoch eingestellte Grafik ist akzeptabel, wenn wir 2006 gehabt hätten)
Es fühlt sich wie huschhusch-aufn-Markt-damit an.
Kauft es nicht, nichtmal im Sale, nichtmal geschenkt, supportet EA einfach nicht mehr solange bis die wieder anfangen Games zu machen die Spass machen.
column9:
This game is a disgrace! If I'd known how bad this game was, I wouldn't have bought it. Funnily enough, you only see positive reviews during the sale... EA has become a truly shitty corporation that milks its franchises endlessly. If you want an RTS from the C&C series with GDI and NOD, then buy C&C 3.

Both the menu navigation and the in-game controls take some getting used to, rather confusing (I've played too many RTS games to be able to handle the controls).
The experience system is pretending to be innovative and poorly explained due to the lack of a top-down structure (better known as talent trees, because there aren't any).
Plus, the graphics look like they're from a console port, a la PS2 (Ultra-high graphics would have been acceptable if it had been 2006).
It feels like it was rushed to market.
Don't buy it, not even on sale, not even for free, just stop supporting EA until they start making games that are fun again.

column8:
Also wer C&C kennt vom 1. Teil an, ein SUPER Strategiespiel mit guter Story... zumindest bis zu diesem Teil. Selbst C&C Renegade was total den Vorgängern entsprechend als FPS released wurde war noch 1000 mal besser als dieser Teil der C&C Serie. Wer hier auf einen Classiker der C&C Reihe, wie man es kennt, hofft, irrt sich hier leider in jeder hinsicht. Vergleicht man dies zu den "alten" Teilen (Ja ich weiß allles war früher besser etc. etc. pp.) ist dies der größte Griff ins Klo den ich je von C&C erlebt habe.

Nur als Info für euch ich fand C&C bis zum heutigen Tage eines der (für meinen Geschmack) BESTEN RTS Games die es gab.
Seit heute werde ich wahrscheinlich jeden weiteren C&C Teil meiden.

Klare NICHT-Kauf Empfehlung. Auch nicht im Sale/SuperSale und als Geschenk wäre es von euren Freunden eher ein Gack weil diese zu viel Geld haben um euch ein bisschen zu necken.

Liebe Grüße

Ein enttäuschter G4rd1u5
column9:
So, if you've known C&C since the first installment, it's a SUPER strategy game with a good story... at least up until this installment. Even C&C Renegade, which was released as an FPS, completely in keeping with its predecessors, was 1000 times better than this installment in the C&C series. Anyone hoping for a classic of the C&C series as we know it is sadly mistaken in every respect. Compared to the "old" installments (yes, I know everything was better back then, etc., etc.), this is the biggest flop I've ever experienced with C&C.

Just to let you know, I found C&C to be one of the (in my opinion) BEST RTS games ever.
From now on, I'll probably avoid every future C&C installment.

A clear NO-BUY recommendation. Not even during the sale/super sale, and as a gift, it would be more of a gimmick from your friends because they have too much money to tease you a little.

Best regards

A disappointed G4rd1u5

column8: Купив эту игру я надеялся увидеть продолжение игр серии C&C, но к ОЧЕНЬ большому сожалению это не так. Единственное что мне тут понравилось- это возможность прокачиваться и более-менее кампания. Режим сражения убил меня своей унылостью захватывать вышки и набирать очки надоедает очень быстро. Возможно я просто не любитель таких игр, но мне правда больше нравится что-то типа старых игр серии C&C. Графика также особо не блещет. Кампания тоже особо не затягивает, но как говорится 'Видели и похуже'. Я бы никому не рекомендовал бы покупать и играть в эту игру, если вы конечно не любитель таких игр.
column9: When I bought this game, I was hoping for a continuation of the C&C series, but unfortunately, it wasn't. The only things I liked were the ability to level up and the more or less solid campaign. The skirmish mode killed me with its tedious nature of capturing towers and racking up points; it gets old really quickly. Maybe I'm just not a fan of these types of games, but I really prefer something more like the older C&C games. The graphics aren't particularly impressive either. The campaign isn't particularly engaging, but as they say, 'We've seen worse.' I wouldn't recommend anyone buy or play this game unless they're a fan of these types of games.

column8: Disliked. Big fan of the Command and Conquer series but this one was meh. 4/10
column9: Disliked. Big fan of the Command and Conquer series but this one was meh. 4/10

column8:
I do not like writing negative reviews but sometimes it has to be done I guess.
If you know your C&C games, one of the first things that will come to mind is usually building a base. Unfortunately this game does not really have it. In my eyes, it just doesn't quite stand up to any other C&C game. Though I didn't put too many hours into it so maybe I didn't give it a good enough chance?

Put simply, this would have been a much better game if the name "Command and Conquer" was not part of its title. Since it is not like the other games in its series, it isn't what people expect to get when they pay.

column8: Ох, как же я ошибся. Много прошло времени с момента релиза игры и негатив, почерпнутый в 2010 году из обзорных статей, практически развеялся. И решил я взять игру на летней распродаже в стим, чтобы узнать как завершилась история Кейна. Короче, это самая ужасная игра, в которую я когда либо играл. Она невероятно, чудовищно скучна: однообразные юниты, отсутствие тактики, получасовое добление одного здания противника, ужасная графика, картонно-кислотный дизайн юнитов и их кривая анимация. Даже ролики - фикушку серии - умудрились испоганить и лысина харизматичного Джо Кукана не спасает ситуацию. Не повторяйте моей ошибки - не покупайте и не играйте в ЭТО, а сюжет можно узнать на youtub.
column9: Oh, how wrong I was. Much time has passed since the game's release, and the negativity gleaned from the 2010 reviews has largely dissipated. So I decided to pick it up during the Steam summer sale to find out how Kane's story ended. In short, it's the most terrible game I've ever played. It's incredibly, monstrously boring: monotonous units, a lack of tactics, half an hour of destroying a single enemy building, terrible graphics, cardboard-like unit designs, and clunky animation. They even managed to ruin the cutscenes—the hallmark of the series—and the bald head of the charismatic Joe Kukan doesn't save the situation. Don't make my mistake—don't buy or play THIS, and you can find the plot on YouTube.

column8:
Behold disciples of Nod, for the end is soon upon us. Electronic Arts’ award-winning and best-selling Tiberium saga is coming to a powerful conclusion with Command & Conquer 4, which will introduce a multitude of innovations to the classic fast and fluid Command & Conquer gameplay, while retaining the core compulsions that fans have come to love over the series’ history.

It is the year 2062 and humanity is at the brink of extinction. Tiberium, the mysterious, alien crystalline structure that has infested Earth for decades and served as the primary reason for years of relentless conflict between the Global Defense Initiative (GDI) and the Brotherhood of Nod, is close to rendering the planet uninhabitable. Mankind is on the verge of extinction when Kane, Nod’s prophetic leader, emerges from seclusion to deliver GDI the message that he has developed a system that could control Tiberium and harness its power. But he cannot build this "Tiberium Control Network" without GDI’s cooperation. Thus, the two opposing factions – GDI and Nod – inevitably find themselves in desperation for the same cause: to stop Tiberium from extinguishing mankind.

After 15 years, the network is nearly complete, Tiberium is under strict control and our revitalized, newly terraformed planet is on the cusp of a new age of prosperity and progress. It is then that the world’s citizens begin to seriously ponder why Kane chose to help, and what will he want in return. These questions and more lead to the dramatic final act of the Tiberium saga.

With a multitude of innovative new features to the fast and fluid C&C gameplay, Command & Conquer 4 offers players an entirely new way to play C&C. An all-in-one mobile base, persistent player progression across all game modes that is constantly updated in a real-time online profile, a 3-class system for each of the two factions, co-operative play, and a 5v5 objective-based multiplayer mode that promotes teamwork and social interaction, make Command & Conquer 4 unlike any other C&C experience.

column8:
I have so many mixed emotions about this game.

One of my biggest beefs with this game is that it's just plain short.  There are only 7 GDI missions,  7 NOD missions, and 3 common missions.  I finished it all in 14 hours.  Not much room in there for story.  The story they did have, and the cutscenes, seem very low budget and thrown together.  No Hollywood actors this time around.  The final cutscene in each campaign is literally the actors standing in front of a white sheet with a drawn picture.  If they had doubled the number of missions, I would be recommending this game.  It seems like they're trying to bring a lot of focus onto multiplayer, but I'm only interested in the single player aspect.

One thing that took a little while to get used to is that they changed the gameplay style.  Previous C&C games have had the formula of building/defending/expanding a base, managing your economy and power, and trying to push out as many units as you can.  In this game, you have a fixed number of points that can be redeemed for units, another set of points for structures, and third set for skill upgrades and expanding your tech tree.  There are no power plants, harvesters, etc.  And if a unit is killed or a structure is lost, you get your points refunded, and can build it again.  A key strategy is to continually move your MCV forward, towards the goal.  This makes most of the maps very linear.  Once you can get past the dramatic difference in play style, the game actually gets enjoyable.  Though some of the time, it just feels like you're filling up your build queue so you can spam the enemy.

With the new all-in-one MCV style, they added something that I thought was not well executed.  Instead of just one kind of MCV, they now have three:  offensive, defensive, and support.  Offensive is mostly for making units.  Defensive is for setting up structures like cannons and bunkers.  Support was totally useless to me, as it's for making repairs and setting up airstrikes.  The reason why this wasn't well executed is that you could only have one MCV at a time.  So you can't be defending a structure and attacking the enemy's MCV at the same time.

column8: another terrible rendition of what was an awesome game. i dont think there has been good one in a long time. retalition was defo the best one for me. Generals was not bad either. holding command posts, and unit caps that are far to law cripple this game. just a couple of missions in where you have to ensure the safety of a civ convoy, although one or two slip through until completion of the level, the entire thing feels like a losing battle until you "win" all because of an overwhelming amount of enemy units against your measly 10 units. i miss the days of having massive armies of tanks and men. unit caps has ruined these games for me.

column8: WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING. If you have actually played ANY Command & Conquer game in the past, this is a WARNING to you. This game is completely different from any other Command & Conquer game. If you played any other C&C and you enjoyed the way it flowed, loved the way it played, and loved the concept, you most likely will not like this game at all. This game 100% resembles an old mobile game that was only on phones that had a SLIDING KEYBOARD. Think about that. THIS GAME IS BASICALLY JUST A PORT FROM A MOBILE GAME FROM SLIDING KEYBOARD PHONES. And how do i know that this is true? Because i had one of those phones and i bought the mobile game. even for $4.99, the mobile game wasn't worth it. i only slightly enjoyed it because i literally had NOTHING BETTER TO DO, and you can believe me when i say that i am a die hard C&C fan and lover. Ive played every single C&C game to date, and for once, this is a C&C game i regretted playing and wasting $20 on. So i will repeat. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME UNLESS YOU ARE 200% OPEN MINDED TO SHITTY IDEAS. THIS GAME IS COMPLETE AND UTTER CRAP. DO NOT BUY.

column8:
This game is just a grind.  You have to work to permanently unlock things that you would generally unlock and upgrade every game in previous installments of the game, so if you play online you're guarenteed to get steamrolled by someone who has played longer.

The game offers different spawn ships that only allow certain units to be built with each and are supposed to follow certain playstyles but ultimately just end up limiting the game and the amount of fun it could have offered.

I love the C&C series, but this game has had some horrible decisions go into it.  If you want an RTS, I'd reccomend picking up either C&C Tiberium Wars 3: Kane's Wrath, or C&C Red Alert 3, as both are top notch games from the same series, and infinitely better than this waste of code.

column8:
Rinnovare un gioco porta quasi sempre dei benefici, ma anche molti rischi.
Farlo in una saga così importante e nel suo capitolo conclusivo, inoltre, non è stata la scelta vincente.
Togliere completamente la gestione della costruzione della base ed eliminare la raccolta delle risorse in favore di un maggior dinamismo, poteva essere un buon punto di partenza, ma visto il risultato troppo approssimativo, questo quarto capitolo farà storcere il naso anche ai fan meno incalliti.
In Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight l'attenzione del giocatore non è più rivolta verso la fortificazione di un luogo sicuro da cui far partire i propri attacchi, ma viene diretta verso la gestione di poche unità e di una base mobile andando così a cambiare radicalmente il modo di giocare rispetto al passato.
Il fatto di non doversi più preoccupare di perdere la propria base principale ha portato pesanti modifiche anche nel sistema del gioco online lasciando così spazio a modalità più vicine alla freneticità degli sparatutto piuttosto che agli strategici, portando così il giocatore a lanciarsi negli scontri con il proprio arsenale spianato, anziché a ragionare e attendere il momento giusto per evitare di vanificare i preziosi momenti passati ad accumulare risorse e soldati come avveniva in passato.
Per fortuna non tutto è andato perduto; i video di intermezzo mantengono il carisma che da sempre caratterizza la saga del tiberium e la storia vi stupirà con diversi colpi di scena.
Interessante anche il fatto di poter giocare la campagna in modalità cooperativa nonostante questa sia di scarsa durata. Discorso a sé per il multiplayer che a causa dei livelli di esperienza e di alcune combinazioni di unità aeree dei GDI inarrestabili, si rivela un’esperienza online troppo sbilanciata.
In conclusione questo era un prodotto con le potenzialità per divenire un must, se solo si fosse limitato a essere Command & Conquer e non un titolo che ne mantiene solo il nome sulla copertina ma che ne modifica profondamente lo stile di gioco, non ottenendo i risultati desiderati
column9:
Revamping a game almost always brings benefits, but also many risks.
Doing so in such an important saga and in its final chapter, moreover, wasn't the right choice.
Removing base construction management and resource gathering entirely in favor of greater dynamism could have been a good starting point, but given the rather sketchy result, this fourth installment will turn off even the most die-hard fans.
In Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight, the player's focus is no longer on fortifying a safe location from which to launch attacks, but instead on managing a few units and a mobile base, radically changing the gameplay compared to the past.
No longer having to worry about losing your main base has led to significant changes to the online gameplay system, making way for modes more akin to the frenetic pace of shooters rather than strategy games. This forces players to dive into battle with their arsenal at the ready, rather than thinking and waiting for the right moment to avoid squandering precious time spent accumulating resources and soldiers, as was the case in the past.
Fortunately, not all is lost; the cutscenes retain the charisma that has always characterized the Tiberium saga, and the story will surprise you with several twists.
Also interesting is the ability to play the campaign in cooperative mode, despite its short duration. Multiplayer is a different story, as due to the experience levels and some combinations of unstoppable GDI air units, it proves to be an unbalanced online experience.
In conclusion, this was a product with the potential to become a must-have, if only it had limited itself to being Command & Conquer and not a title that only keeps the name on the cover but profoundly changes the gameplay style, not achieving the desired results.

column8:
I can only recommend this if your a true fan of the sries and want to see the last of the Tiberium Saga.  While its not a bad game in its own right it defies a lot of typical conventions that C&C has had since its inception in 1995.    

However if we forget that this is a C&C game and judge it on its own merits.  I'll say this, first its a fast paced game and unlike  previous C&C games it requires you to think about using your units right as each unit now has a strength/weakness mechanic more so in this title.

Graphics wise its visual fideltiy is pretty impressive for an RTS game and even though the ammount of units you can have is limited the battles do in fact feel big, which is a plus.  

As this is a C&C game you can expect well acted real time cutscenes and these are the most impressive I'vse seen so far.

Now for problems.  

One of the major issues is that players can level up outside multiplayer and then take that rank/level into multiplayer, meaning there's no sense of progression and someonne can just anhilate you in multiplayer because you've not unlocked all the units/upgrades.

Bottom line this can be a fun title if you can forget it has anything to do with Command and Conquer, but it also appeals to true fans.  Generic RTS fans may want to avoid this title.  Which is the only reason I can recommend this title.

column8:
如果我说命令与征服3是命令与征服系列复活的一点预兆的话，那么命令与征服4就是EA把命令与征服系列推上绞架恨不得立刻将其绞死，之后再将尸体拉出来让人们凭吊（亦或是唾骂）——没错，命令与征服4就是这么一“坨”被糟蹋的差不多的尸体。

命令与征服4首先最不能容忍的就是将延续下来的，以资源转化为单位的传统RTS即时战略改成了以指挥点数为资源的即时战术游戏，——命令与征服作为RTS鼻祖之一最后落得必须更改为即时战术游戏，作为游戏标志的泰伯伦矿居然变成了升级用道具，难怪公布时玩家会大喊“还我大片大片可以收割的泰伯伦矿！”一款没有泰伯伦的命令与征服，这简直就是对命令与征服系列的亵渎。

至于游戏的在线模式完全就是在和同期的星海争霸2的模仿，仿效SC2一样采用与网络平台合体，强制联机的方式，将游戏的单机内容完全捆绑在在线模式之上，可是万万没想到的是，命令与征服4没有提供离线单机体验模式，很多人想打剧情，就只能连接上连线质量并不怎么好的EA服务器。并且还得注册一个EA账号（即后来origin账户），

另一方面，可能是对命令与征服3系列忽视命令与征服2的风格的一点“补偿”，本作矫枉过正的打造了一个满屏太空服士兵和机甲的战斗场面，但是这些机甲与命令与征服2的风格完全不搭界，三种机甲主基地的外观被斥之为“春卷”和“乌龟盖”，可以说明显就是画虎不成反类犬的一个体现。

至于剧情，在将Westwood硕果仅存的几个成员干掉之后，新的编剧Samuel Bass大展自己胡编乱造的能力，将原有“泰伯伦黄昏”的剧本完全无视，秉承着迫不及待将剧本写死的态度写出了一个漏洞百出的大结局，并且十分幼稚的秉承”只要把GDI写坏，把NOD洗白就好”的简单思维，把原本GDI虽代表正义但是内部腐化，NOD表面邪恶却拥有宗教一般的反派魅力的两种风格给彻底的黑白分明化，并且将其安插在一个犹如肥皂剧一般的剧本中，最终肯恩更是莫名其妙的离开地球了。

至此可以看出，这个剧本，就是为了判命令与征服本传系列死刑而写的，他自始至终就传达着一个意思：C&C——DIE！

在EA LA饱受摧残之后，命令与征服4成为了LA改组前的遗作，刚刚度过红色警报3的磨合期，整个命令与征服系列的标签从Westwood到EA LA，第二代CNC的风格崛起这一系列蒸蒸日上的迹象之后，EA LA又因为命令与征服4步了Westwood的后尘，于是我们看到了一个不伦不类的命令与征服4，以及其代表的真正的“泰伯伦黄昏”——属于命令与征服的黄昏。
column9:
If Command & Conquer 3 was a harbinger of the Command & Conquer series' resurgence, then Command & Conquer 4 was EA putting the series on the gallows, eager to hang it immediately, and then pulling out the corpse for people to mourn (or perhaps curse)—yes, Command & Conquer 4 is just such a "heap" of ruined corpses.

The most intolerable thing about Command & Conquer 4 is that it changes the traditional real-time strategy game, which converts resources into units, into a real-time tactical game, where command points are the resources. Command & Conquer, one of the original RTS games, ultimately had to be changed into a real-time tactical game. The game's iconic Tiberium ore was even turned into an upgrade item. No wonder when it was announced, players cried out, "Give me back the vast expanses of Tiberium to harvest!" A Command & Conquer without Tiberium is a sheer blasphemy against the Command & Conquer series.

As for the game's online mode, it's a stark imitation of StarCraft 2, a contemporary game. Like StarCraft 2, it integrates with online platforms and enforces online play, completely tying the game's single-player content to the online mode. However, Command & Conquer 4 surprisingly lacks an offline single-player experience. Many who want to play the story are forced to connect to EA servers with subpar connection quality. This requires registering an EA account (later known as an Origin account).

On the other hand, perhaps as a way to "compensate" for the series' neglect of the style of Command & Conquer 2, this game goes overboard with a battle scene filled with spacesuit soldiers and mechs. However, these mechs bear no resemblance to the style of Command & Conquer 2. The appearance of the three mech main bases has been criticized as "spring rolls" and "turtle shells," a clear example of a case of trying to achieve the wrong result.

As for the plot, after eliminating Westwood's few remaining members, new screenwriter Samuel Bass unleashed his uncanny ability to fabricate stories. He completely disregarded the original "Tiberium Twilight" script and, in his eagerness to finish the story, crafted a flawed finale. He also naively followed the simplistic "just make GDI look bad and NOD look good" mentality. He completely skewered the two villainous characters of GDI (who represented justice but was internally corrupt) and NOD (who appeared evil but possessed a religious-like allure) and placed them in a soap opera-like scenario. Finally, Kane inexplicably departed Earth.

It's clear that this script was written to sentence the original Command & Conquer series to death. Its message from beginning to end is: C&C—DIE!

After EA LA suffered a lot of damage, Command & Conquer 4 became the last work before LA's reorganization. Just after the running-in period of Red Alert 3, the label of the entire Command & Conquer series was transferred from Westwood to EA LA, and the second-generation CNC style rose. After this series of signs of prosperity, EA LA followed in Westwood's footsteps with Command & Conquer 4, so we saw a weird Command & Conquer 4 and the real "Tiberium Twilight" it represented - the twilight of Command & Conquer.

column8:
Shocking that this can even be called a Command & Conquer game. I heard about how bad it was, but decided to buy it since it was on sale for $5. It is atrocious. All the base building aspects are gone, instead you are given a "crawler" which you can set up and produce certain units and structures/abilities depending on if you chose offense, defense or support. I only suggest buying this if you hated previous C&C games since this is the complete opposite of past games. I plan on finishing the campaign, on easy to get it done with faster, and to never play it again.

EDIT: You may enjoy the game if you liked World in Conflict's multiplayer aspect. The whole game plays like it, where you are forced to pick a strategy and stick with it. However, it is more limited because in World in Conflict you could still make most units, however in this game you are forced to only make what your strategy allows. There is no overlap at all.

column8: A disgrace to the C&C series. Do not buy it! Even if they offer if for a free weekend, the price is too high for its worth. What made this game so crappy? The gameplay, the story, and the idea of taking away the concept of base building and resource gathering. Every fan knows the story of GDI vs NOD. GDI's purpose is to contain the Tiberium and stop NOD from using it as a tool. NOD wants the tiberium to claim it as the next step in human evolution while informing the world that GDI are a bunch of fascists that care for the rich and abandon the sick and poor. BUT C&C4 throws that all away when Kane uses the Tacitus, the item that the 2 factions fought so hard to obtain and unlock the secrets of it, to ally with GDI and destroy the Tiberium that infested the earth. I bought it because i love C&C from the start of playing red alert. After Westwood was gone, it all went down the drain. C&C3 was good, but aliens?! blah! I would have loved to see CABAL come back, but EA made up for it with Kane's Wrath. But this...this is like a giant middle finger to all the C&C fans from EA.

column8: The first... IDK.. Dozen or so games were great.  Red Alert was the first game I ever played all the way through as a kid. But the franchise lost something in the last... well since RA2, whenever that was, that was the first C&C I got bored with before the end.  And this one... Trying to turn it into some sort of mmo hybrid?  Why does every game have to me open to be played with the world now, needing help from strangers to make progress?  I suppose this game could be fun to play as a LAN party, but I don't see any other way to make this game remotely fun.

column8:
My first C&C game was tiberian sun. With that I followed the C&C series closely and have played every single one ever made including the ones that were on console. This...this is the worst C&C to ever be created in the history of mankind. all the years following the story, all the years of playing, all the years that I put into this game and waiting to finally see the ending chapter to the Tiberium wars, And this is what we get? EA has taken the game and twisted into something so horrible that words are incapable of ever describing the disust I feel.

This isn't a C&C game. This is utter garbage and other words so foul that they don't even exist. There are no words that exist that can describe how utterly putrid this "thing" they call a game is. Do not buy this. Under any circumstances, do not buy this. Do not even pirate this game. It is a waste of your life and you will thank me later.

The AI is pathetic, the story doesnt really seem to fit along with all of the other tiberium related Command & Conquer games, and dont forget about the DRM on this game to, the game has you unlock units by leveling up, no you cant go to skirmish and have access to all units, you have to play a metric crap ton of skirmish and the campaign to unlock all the units, and even then you can only use a third at a time due to the fact you have to pick one of the three types of "Crawlers". This game is so terrible it almost isnt worth writing the review for it.

column8: As a long time fan of the series, I have to say that this is the most disappointing game in the series. Sure the unit are very creative and the soundtrack are awesome but those are the only bright spots in this game. Otherwise, the story is confusing and seemed to be rushed, the unit cap is frustrating, and the resource gathering system is both alien and laborious. IMAO, this game will never touch Red Alert 3's level..unless it is returned to the RTS roots that made hte series famous Keep the level of technology, I love it.

column8:
I tried really hard to like this game, as it's the final C&C game that it looks like we're getting in a long time - could even be the last the way EA is heading with their BS. This game shows a fantastic idea, a fantastic concept, something that could have worked out great - IF IT DIDN'T HAVE THE LABEL AS A FULL ON SEQUEL TO THE TIBERIUM UNIVERSE C&C GAMES. As a spinoff, this game would have been mediocre, but as the official sequel and ending to the C&C storyline, this game is abysmal in every way possible.

Not a single thing feels C&C about this game - theres a tiny population cap, there's no base building, there's no resource collection, maps are small, the campaign is abysmal with a terrible storyline and cutscenes that don't just look bad - they are legitimately stuff someone likely recorded with their iphone camera and slapped into the game! Just watch any sections that involve the "public" speaking rather than paid actors. The only saving grace in the storyline is Joe Kucan, who as always takes the role of Kane and makes an extremely badass villain until a terrible ending that's the same regardless of which faction you go with - AN ENDING THAT'S THE SAME REGARDLESS OF WHICH FACTION YOU GO WITH. Let that sink in.

The progression system is terrible - yes, there's a progression system. This game revolves around collecting tiberium crystals INDIVIDUALLY and using them to upgrade your MCV to higher tiers to unlock better units and such. However, when you start, you are level 1 and have access to absolutely NOTHING. Only after you level up several times will you unlock the 2nd tier of technology which at first is completely worthless without a single thing used for it. Everything has to be unlocked through progression and this BLATANTLY makes anyone who's a higher level than you stronger than you with no workarounds based on how good of a player you are or anything, PERIOD. For example, you have to pick a class - offensive, defensive, or support. If you go defensive, at the beginning of the progression scale you only have access to 3 infantry units. No vehicles of any sort, period. While these infantry units CAN be used to counter other infantry, vehicles, or aircraft, they're all infantry and can be MUCH MORE EASILY COUNTERED by a diverse enemy army.

This is a game that again, has a fantastic concept that was soiled by something that clearly had the goal of being made with the least amount of funding possible, the least motivation possible, and the smallest amount of time necessary to produce it - probably so EA wouldn't have to pay people to work on this game any longer than they would have to before it was BARELY functional as a game and could be pushed out the door, which is exactly what they did.

And what sucks is, if everyone is maximum level on progression, the multiplayer can actually potentially be fun. It feels like the game was designed for that, but it was just unfinished, so to pad the length of the game and make people play it longer, they slapped progression in to make you grind to be level 20 (the cap).

Do not buy this game. If you want a good C&C game from recent times, go with Red Alert 3. Just don't expect any multiplayer options since this is the ONLY C&C GAME to not run on Gamespy and the gamespy servers are going to tank here in a month.

column8: 내 게임 인생 통틀어 최고의 뒤통수를 날린 게임.. 난 본디 스타크래프트로 RTS에 입문했다. 그러다가 컴퍼니 오브 히어로즈와 C&C3에서의 분대단위의 유닛 구성을 보고 스타와는 다른  매력을 느꼈는데, 이번 게임에서 나는 최고급유닛에서 일반 유닛으로 추락한 존트루퍼에 실망했고 분대단위로 구성되어 정말 장군처럼 지휘하는 느낌을 받았던 그 충족감을 전혀 느낄 수가 없었다. 만약 나 처럼 분대단위 유닛을 떠올리고 이 게임을 바라보는 사람들이 있다면 진심으로 말리고 싶다. 세일이라지만 이 게임을 산 돈이 매우 아깝고 다운로드하고 설치에 걸린 시간도 매우 아깝다.
column9: The game that hit me hardest in my entire gaming life... I originally got into RTS with StarCraft. Then, I saw the squad-based unit composition in Company of Heroes and C&C3 and felt a different charm from StarCraft. In this game, I was disappointed with the Zone Trooper, which was demoted from a top-tier unit to a common unit, and I couldn't feel the satisfaction of commanding a squad like a general. If there are people who look at this game with squad-based units in mind like I did, I sincerely want to advise them against it. Even though it was on sale, I regret the money I spent on this game, and I also regret the time it took to download and install it.

column8: As a fan of the original Tiberian Sun C&C game I expected this remake to be at least as good as the original.  It is TERRIBLE!!!!  The fun in C&C games, because they seem not to have understood it,  is to be able to build strong defenses and large bases, outposts and a solid economy ?!? With the machanics of this version, it is absolutly IMPOSSIBLE to accomplish, at all!!!  This thing with the crystals to gain access to slight advantages absolutly sucks. From my point of view, they would rather keep the unit layouts and apply the game mechanics of the provious version...  At least it would be playable.  What a rubbish!!!  DO NOT BUY THAT, unless 1-2$, very frustrating game!!!

column8:
Words cannot describe how much this game is terrible.

I could forgive the All-in-One base thing they were doing with the Crawlers because the Concept was cool, but THIS is not how to do it. It would've worked with World in Conflict if they made a Futuristic Sequel...and if it had better controls.
I wish that it was C&C 3 that ended the Tiberium Saga, That was how it was intended at first...then EA's Unquenchable Greed fucked it in the ass without lube.

But, its EA, What do you expect. I am surprised that this game did not come with a DLC that allows you to have better units, units that would be essential to win the game and units that you'd HAVE to have in order to win the game.
